Description: THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO IDENTIFY AND ESTABLISH TWO NEAR-ROAD NITROGEN DIOXIDE (NO2) MONITORING SITES.  THIS SPECIFIC AWARD SUPPORTS ESTABLISHING A SITE IN PIMA COUNTY.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $200,000.  PRE-AWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO FEBRUARY 1, 2020.

THE SONORA ENVIRONMENTAL RESEARCH INSTITUTE, INC (SERI) WILL TRAIN PROMOTORAS (COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKERS) ON HEALTHY HOMES AND ASTHMA TRIGGERS, WHO WILL THEN EDUCATE COMMUNITY MEMBERS DURING HOME VISITS IN SANTA CRUZ COUNTY, ARIZONA WHICH IS LOCATED IN THE U.S.-MEXICO BORDER REGION.  SERI WILL ENHANCE THEIR HEALTHY HOME VISITS TO INCLUDE ASTHMA TRIGGER ASSESSMENTS. SERI WILL CONDUCT PRE- AND POST-TESTS VIA FOLLOW-UP VISITS AND/OR PHONE CALLS AFTER THEY CONDUCT THE EVALUATIONS TO DETERMINE WHICH HEALTH HOME CONCEPTS HAVE BEEN IMPLEMENTED AND NOTE ANY BEHAVIOR CHANGES TIED TO ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $16,500.  PRE-AWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO JULY 1, 2019.

THE REGIONAL CENTER FOR BORDER HEALTH'S GOAL OF THE YUMA COUNTY ASTHMA CAMP NOT-A-CHOO IS TO EDUCATE CHILDREN WITH MODERATE TO SEVERE ASTHMA THE SELF-MANAGEMENT TECHNIQUES THAT WILL HELP THEM CONTROL THEIR ASTHMA IN A FUN AND EXCITING CAMP SETTING. CAMP PARTICIPANTS WILL LEARN ABOUT ASTHMA SELF-MANAGEMENT THROUGH A GROUP OF HEALTH PROFESSIONAL SERVICES WHICH INCLUDE: HEALTH EDUCATORS AND OTHER HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS.  THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $5,000.  PREAWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 12/1/2018.

TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO MONITOR FINE PARTICULATE MATTER WITH A DIAMETER EQUAL TO OR SMALLER THAN 2.5 MICROMETERS (PM 2.5) IN ORDER TO DETERMINE COMPLIANCE WITH THE PM 2.5 NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS AND DETERMINE REDUCTIONS IN AIR EMISSIONS.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $14,000.    PRE-AWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO APRIL 1, 2018.

THE PROGRAM PROVIDES IN-HOME ASTHMA AND ENVIRONMENTAL ASTHMA TRIGGER MANAGEMENT EDUCATION TO AT LEAST 50-70 FAMILIES OF ASTHMATIC CHILDREN THAT HAVE A HIGH AND MODERATE RISK SCORE FOR MEDICAL CARE ENVIRONMENTAL, SMOKING, CHILD WELL-BEING AND AND/OR ALLERGY FACTORS ON THE CHILD ASTHMA RISK ASSESSMENT TOOL (CARAT) RESULTS. THE EDUCATIONAL COMPONENT WILL ALSO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS THAT WILL AID THE FAMILY IN MAINTAING AN ASTHMA FRIENDLY HOME ENVIRONMENT.  THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $17,000.  PREAWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 12/1/2017.

THIS GRANT ENABLES THE BAY AREA AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT DISTRICT (BAAQMD) IN COOPERATION WITH THE CITY OF RICHMOND TO MONITOR EMISSIONS AND ANALYZE DATA COLLECTED FROM THE CHERVON RICHMOND REFINERY.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES THE FEDERAL FUNDING AMOUNT OF $321,000.00.  PRE-AWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO 1/1/18.

THE GRANTEE WILL LOCATE CHILDREN IN COUNTIES WITH HIGH ASTHMA RATES VIA A MOBILE ASTHMA CLINIC TO INCREASE ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE TO REDUCE ASTHMA DISPARITIES IN LOW INCOME CHILDREN BY THOROUGHLY EVALUATING, TREATING AND EDUCATING PATIENTS AND FAMILIES ABOUT ASTHMA, ASTHMA TRIGGERS AND OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS AFFECTING THEM.  THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $8,000.

THE OBJECTIVE IS TO PROVIDE TRAINING AS WELL AS POLICY AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO THE 15 WESTERN STATES.  THE FUNDING WILL FURTHER THE SPECIFIC INTERESTS OF THE MEMBER STATES BY PROVIDING A FORUM FOR SHARING INFORMATION, IDENTIFYING AIR QUALITY ISSUES, FOCUSING RESOURCES ON COMMON GOALS, COORDINATING RESEARCH, DELIVERING TRAINING PROGRAMS, AND DEVELOPING POLICY.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,466,289 TO SUPPORT YEAR 1 OF A THREE YEAR GRANT FUNDING PERIOD THROUGH 12/31/2020.  THEREFORE, ANY ADDITIONAL FEDERAL FUNDS ARE CONTINGENT UPON FEDERAL APPROPRIATIONS.   PRE-AWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 09/01/2017.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOK COUNTY GRANT IS TO MAINTAIN FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) MONITORING NETWORKS.  THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED DATA ON AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF PM2.5 AS WELL AS CHEMICAL COMPOSITION AND PRECURSORS. DATA WILL BE USED FOR: (1) PROVIDING AIR POLLUTION DATA TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN A TIMELY MANNER, (2) PM2.5 NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) COMPARISONS, (3) DEVELOPMENT AND TRACKING OF IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, (4) ASSESSMENTS OF REGIONAL HAZE, AND (5) ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH STUDIES AND OTHER AMBIENT AEROSOL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. THE PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORK DESIGN ADDRESSES THESE FOUR PROGRAM OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMBINATION OF SITING AND INSTRUMENTATION STRATEGIES.  
ACTIVITIES:
COOK COUNTY WILL COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND SUBMIT RESULTS TO IEPA.
OUTCOMES:
THE ANTICIPATED SHORT-TERM OUTCOME FOR THIS PROJECT IS AN INCREASE IN THE KNOWLEDGE REGARDING THE CHARACTER AND EXTENT OF PM2.5 IN THE AMBIENT AIR. THE LONG-TERM OUTCOME, THROUGH THE EVENTUAL DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THE STATE'S IMPLEMENTATION PLAN, IS REDUCED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH THE PM2.5 NAAQS AS SET FORTH IN THE CLEAN AIR ACT.  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COOK COUNTY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS. 
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

THE COOK COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND SUSTAINABILITY (CCDES) WILL OPERATE AND MAINTAIN A LARGE PORTION OF THE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM) 2.5 MONITORING NETWORK, COLLECT SAMPLES AT THE SITES AND PERFORM ANALYSIS TO DETERMINE PM2.5 LEVELS IN COOK COUNTY, ILLINOIS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE PECHANGA TRIBE.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ENHANCE KNOWLEDGE OF AIR QUALITY, IDENTIFY POTENTIAL SOURCES OF POLLUTION, AND IDENTIFY APPROPRIATE MEASURES TO SAFEGUARD THE WELL-BEING OF THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY, WHICH HAVE A HIGHER INCIDENCE OF RESPIRATORY ISSUES. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL ACCOMPLISH THIS BY MONITORING PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) LEVELS THROUGH THE PURCHASE OF A CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR (T640) AND SUPPORT EQUIPMENT THAT INCLUDES A SHELTER, MODEM, DATALOGGER, AND OTHER AUXILIARY COMPONENTS. 

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $67,869.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MONITORING PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) LEVELS THROUGH THE PURCHASE OF A CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR (T640) AND SUPPORT EQUIPMENT THAT INCLUDES A SHELTER, MODEM, DATALOGGER, AND OTHER AUXILIARY COMPONENTS. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASE OF A CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR (T640) AND SUPPORT EQUIPMENT THAT INCLUDES A SHELTER, MODEM, DATALOGGER, AND OTHER AUXILIARY COMPONENTS. 

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF AIR QUALITY IN THE PECHANGA TRIBAL COMMUNITY.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE PECHANGA TRIBAL COMMUNITY.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT PIMA COUNTY'S AIR PROGRAM BY PURCHASING EQUIPMENT TO ENHANCE FIELD COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS.  SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PURCHASE AN OPTICAL GAS IMAGING CAMERA FOR USE DURING FIELD COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS AT FACILITIES WITH POTENTIAL GAS EMISSIONS.  

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $76,258.  PRE-AWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 7/1/2023.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE PURCHASE OF AN OPTICAL GAS IMAGING CAMERA FOR USE DURING FIELD COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS, TRAINING FOR FIELD STAFF, ENSURING EQUIPMENT PERFORMS ACCORDING TO MANUFACTURER'S SPECIFICATIONS AND DEVELOPING PROCEDURES FOR USE OF THE CAMERA.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE PURCHASE OF AN OPTICAL GAS IMAGING CAMERA, STAFF TRAINING AND PROCEDURES FOR USE OF THE EQUIPMENT. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE AIR COMPLIANCE STAFF TRAINED FOR USE OF THE EQUIPMENT AND IMPLEMENTING EQUIPMENT IN THE FIELD WHICH WILL ENHANCE THE COUNTY'S FIELD COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS AND ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH AIR QUALITY PERMITS. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE ALL RESIDENTS OF PIMA COUNTY, ARIZONA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE NAVAJO NATION.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IS TO ENHANCE MONITORING OF SULFUR DIOXIDE (SO2) AND OZONE (O3)  IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS.  SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING  GASEOUS ANALYZERS AT THE SHIPROCK SITE AND TO THE MOBILE AMBIENT AIR MONITORING UNIT WHICH WILL BE USED IN ANETH UTAH.  

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $67,869.
ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL REVIEW AND COMPARE EPA PROPOSED EQUIPMENT FOR PURCHASE AND DETERMINE IF ANY ADJUSTMENTS NEED TO BE MADE ON ENHANCEMENTS AT VARIOUS AIR MONITORING SITES BASED ON CURRENT NEEDS. CONSULT WITH EPA ABOUT PROPOSED CHANGES/UPDATES. 2. PREPARE AND INITIATE PROCUREMENT REQUEST(S) FOR EQUIPMENT PURCHASE(S). 3. PURCHASE EQUIPMENT. 4. TAKE DELIVERY OF EQUIPMENT UPON VERIFICATION OF FUNCTIONALITY OF EQUIPMENT AND MOVE FORWARD WITH PAYMENT OF VENDOR INVOICES. 5. PLAN FOR TIMELY SET-UP AND INSTALLATION OF EQUIPMENT CONSISTENT WITH THE GOAL OF ENHANCING AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES 6. SUBMIT SEMI-ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS ELECTRONICALLY TO EPA PROJECT OFFICER WITHIN 30 DAYS OF END OF REPORTING PERIOD. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: REPORTING OF EXPENDITURES OF IRA FUNDS VIA COMPLETION OF PROCUREMENT OR TAKING DELIVERY OF AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT FOR ENHANCING AMBIENT AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES OF SO2 AND O3 POLLUTANTS CONSISTENT WITH STATED GOALS AND OBJECTIVES FOR THE USE OF INFLATION REDUCTION ACT  FUNDING. REPORTING OF STATUS OF SETTING UP AND INSTALLING OF EQUIPMENT TO BEGIN USE OF ACTUAL EQUIPMENT AS PART AIR MONITORING NETWORK SITES. REPORTING OF DRAW DOWN OF FEDERAL FUNDS UPON DELIVERY AND ACCEPTANCE OF IRA FUNDED EQUIPMENT.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE OPERATION OF SO2 AND O3 AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE COMMUNITIES OF THE NAVAJO NATION.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE MORONGO BAND OF MISSION INDIANS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO INCREASE CAPACITY FOR THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION DEPARTMENT #8208; TRIBAL AIR PROGRAM (TAP). SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL DEVELOP STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES (SOPS), PURCHASE NEW EQUIPMENT, TRAIN STAFF, AND REPORT PROGRESS.  

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $67,869.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF AN OZONE PRIMARY STANDARD ANALYZER (THERMO INSTRUMENTS 49IQPS) TO REPLACE EXISTING BACKUP OZONE ANALYZER. BACK UP ANALYZER IS USED TO ENSURE CONTINUOUS DATA COLLECTION WHEN THE PRIMARY ANALYZER IS DOWN FOR REPAIRS, MAINTENANCE, OR CALIBRATION. THE CURRENT BACK UP ANALYZER IS NO LONGER SERVICED BY THERMO INSTRUMENTS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE NEW SOPS, NEW OZONE, PM AND WEATHER EQUIPMENT, TRAINING FOR STAFF AND REPORTING OF PROGRESS.
THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A STRONGER, MORE LEGALLY DEFENSIBLE DATA, TRAINED STAFF TO HANDLE THE DATA, SOPS FOR ACCURACY AND STANDARDS.
THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE MORONGO BAND OF MISSION INDIANS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE BAY AREA AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT DISTRICT (BAAQMD). THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IS TO HELP THE BAAQMD TO BETTER CHARACTERIZE VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS, NITROGEN OXIDES, AND PARTICULATE MATTER ON A LOCAL SCALE IN OVERBURDENED COMMUNITIES TO SUPPORT SOURCE IDENTIFICATION, ENFORCEMENT MEASURES, AND EMISSION REDUCTIONS. 

THIS GRANT AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $209,530.00.

ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE USE OF MOBILE (IN-MOTION) AND PORTABLE (SHORT-TERM, RELOCATABLE) MONITORING TO CHARACTERIZE CONCENTRATIONS OF TOXIC AIR POLLUTANTS IN COMMUNITIES, TO PROVIDE DATA FOR UNDERSTANDING SOURCES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO THE POLLUTION, AND TO INFORM FOLLOW-UP INVESTIGATION AND ACTIONS TO REDUCE EMISSIONS IN COMMUNITIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS WORK IS INVESTIGATING AIR QUALITY IN THE SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA'S OVERBURDENED COMMUNITIES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PROCURING FOUR AIR QUALITY MONITORS AND ALL ASSOCIATED COSTS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A BETTER UNDERSTAND OF LOCALIZED AIR POLLUTION. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS IN THE SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE SAN JOAQUIN VALLEY UNIFIED AIR POLLUTION CONTROL DISTRICT (SJVUAPCD).  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT THE CLEAN AIR ACT 103. SPECIFICALLY, THE GRANT WILL COVER THE COST OF STAFFING RESOURCES REQUIRED TO OPERATE AND MAINTAIN THE EXTENSIVE AIR MONITORING NETWORK THROUGHOUT THE SAN JOAQUIN VALLEY. 

THIS GRANT AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $283,005.00. PRE-AWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 7/1/23.

ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COVERING THE COST OF STAFFING RESOURCES REQUIRED TO OPERATE AND MAINTAIN EXTENSIVE AIR MONITORING NETWORK THROUGHOUT THE SJVUAPCD. THE STAFF TASKS WILL INCLUDE THE ONGOING MAINTENANCE OF PARTICULATE MATTER AND GASEOUS AIR MONITORING INSTRUMENTATION, REGULAR CLEANING, REPAIR, CALIBRATION, AND THE REVIEW AND VALIDATION OF THE COLLECTED DATA.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE ADOPTION OF STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES AND REPORTING TO EPA, CONTINUED COLLECTION OF ACCURATE DATA, SUBMITTAL OF EPA'S AIR QUALITY SYSTEM (AQS), AND ANALYSIS REPORTS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF AIR POLLUTION IN THE COMMUNITIES WHERE TECHNOLOGIES ARE DEPLOYED. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE RESIDENTS LOCATED IN SAN JOAQUIN VALLEY, AIR BASIN.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO MONTEREY BAY UNIFIED AIR POLLUTION CONTROL DISTRICT (MBARD). SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PURCHASE TWO NEW OZONE TRANSFER STANDARDS TO REPLACE OLDER EQUIPMENT.  

THIS GRANT AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $42,079.00.

ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PURCHASING TWO NEW OZONE TRANSFER STANDARDS TO USE TO CALIBRATE ALL THE OZONE MONITORS IN MBARD'S AIR MONITORING NETWORK. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE CALIFORNIA AIR RESOURCES BOARD.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PURCHASE AIR SAMPLING AND ANALYSIS TECHNOLOGIES AND TRAIN STAFF IN OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE TECHNOLOGIES. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PURCHASE AND UTILIZE ON A PILOT BASIS, NEW IN-SITU SAMPLING AND ANALYSIS TECHNOLOGIES TO HELP GUIDE AIR MONITORING DECISIONS IN THE DECADE TO COME AND ASSESS THE PERFORMANCE AND FEASIBILITY OF THE USE OF SIMILAR EQUIPMENT IN THE FIELD.

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $923,447.  PRE-AWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO JULY 1, 2023.

ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PURCHASING INSTRUMENTATION, TRAINING STAFF, DEVELOPING STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES (SOPS), COLLECTING DATA, CONDUCTING ANALYSIS AND PREPARING REPORTS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE ADOPTED SOPS AND REPORTS TO EPA, CONTINUED COLLECTION OF ACCURATE DATA THAT IS REVIEWED, AND SUBMITTED TO EPA'S AIR QUALITY SYSTEM (AQS), AND ANALYSIS REPORTS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF AIR POLLUTION IN THE COMMUNITIES WHERE TECHNOLOGIES ARE DEPLOYED. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE RESIDENTS LOCATED IN NORTHERN, CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THIS PROJECT WILL ESTABLISH COMMUNITY AIR QUALITY MONITORING, DATA COLLECTION AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT IN AN EFFORT TO ASSESS AND MITIGATE IMPACTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE AND WILDFIRE SMOKE, ON THE TULE RIVER INDIAN RESERVATION. A COLLABORATIVE EFFORT WILL BE INITIATED WITH TECHNICAL PARTNERS AND TRIBAL REPRESENTATIVES TO CREATE AWARENESS, BEGIN RESPONSIVE ACTIONS, AND ULTIMATELY ESTABLISH A PERMANENT AIR QUALITY MONITORING STATION FOR THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY. THE INTENT FOR THIS PROJECT IS TO ADDRESS CLIMATE CHANGE, SPECIFICALLY INCREASED WILDFIRE SMOKE IMPACTS, THROUGH COMMUNITY TEAM BUILDING AND PROFESSIONAL PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT AND COLLABORATION. 

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $500,000.  PREAWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 6/1/2023.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL:
ACTIVITY 1 - DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT LONGITUDINAL AMBIENT AQ MONITORING: 
THIS ACTIVITY IS TO LONGITUDINALLY MONITOR AMBIENT AIR QUALITY OF PM2.5, GASEOUS POLLUTANTS, AND HEAT DURING A TWO YEAR MONITORING PERIOD, INCLUDING TWO WILDFIRE SEASONS. THE PROJECT TEAM WILL UTILIZE A LOW-COST SENSORS NETWORK WITH PREVIOUSLY VALIDATED SENSORS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY TO COLLECT DATA OF REAL-TIME PM2.5 AND ITS CHEMICAL SPECIES, INCLUDING BLACK CARBON, UV ABSORBING PM, AND OXIDATIVE POTENTIAL; AND GASEOUS POLLUTANTS, INCLUDING NO2 AND O3. PURPLEAIR II SENSORS WILL MEASURE PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS. RTI MICROPEMS WILL BE COLLOCATED AND COLLECT INTEGRATES FILTER (PTFE) SAMPLES FOR CHEMICAL SPECIFICATION WHILE MEASURING REAL-TIME PM CONCENTRATIONS, TEMPERATURE, AND RELATIVE HUMIDITY. NO2 AND O3 WILL BE MONITORED USING OGAWA PASSIVE MONITORS. 
STEP 1) PILOT STUDY PLANNING
STEP 2) PILOT STUDY EXECUTION 
STEP 3) FULL SCALE LONGITUDINAL STUDY
STEP 4) AIR SAMPLE ANALYSES
STEP 5) DATA ANALYSIS AND REPORTING 
STEP 6) TRANSITION PHASE
STEP 7) CONDUCT AN OVERALL ANALYSIS TO IDENTIFY LESSONS LEARNED 

ACTIVITY 2 - SOCIALIZE SIGNIFICANCE, IMPORTANCE AND VALIDITY OF AIR QUALITY DATA TO TRIBAL COMMUNITY:
THIS ACTIVITY WILL BE MET BY STEPS ORGANIZED BY THE TULE RIVER ENVIRONMENTAL DEPARTMENT, PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENT, CALIFORNIA RURAL INDIAN HEALTH BOARD, AND EXPERTS AT STANFORD UNIVERSITY. 
STEP 1) DEVELOP COMMUNITY FOCUS GROUPS
STEP 2) COMMUNITY SURVEYS
STEP 3)THINK ALOUD EXERCISES
STEP 4) COMMUNITY PRESENTATIONS

ACTIVITY 3 - DEVELOP LONG-TERM SUSTAINABILITY PLAN FOR AIR QUALITY MONITORING ON TULE RIVER RESERVATION:
STEPS TOWARD THIS ACTIVITY WILL BUILD ON THOSE IN ACTIVITY ONE, REGARDING ESTABLISHING A MONITORING SYSTEM. 
STEP 1) RTI WILL WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH TRIBAL DEPARTMENT OF EPA TO ENSURE ALL PROCEDURAL REQUIREMENTS ARE MET, SUCH AS A QUALITY ASSURANCE AND DATA SECURITY PLANS. WE WILL WORK TOGETHER TO DEVELOP AND DOCUMENT FRAMEWORK TO GUIDE FUTURE AIR QUALITY MONITORING ON THE RESERVATION.
STEP 2) PROJECT PARTNERS WILL WORK COLLECTIVITY TO NETWORK AND BUILD RELATIONSHIPS WITH APPLICABLE COOPERATORS SUCH AS: SAN JOAQUIN VALLEY AIR POLLUTION CONTROL DISTRICT, CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH ENVIRONMENTAL DEPARTMENT.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ACTIVITY 1 - DEVELOP AND IMPL

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO MARICOPA COUNTY AIR QUALITY DEPARTMENT (MCAQD). AIR MONITORING TECHNICIANS WILL RECEIVE AND CALIBRATE THE EQUIPMENT AND PREPARE THE UNITS FOR DEPLOYMENT IN THE FIELD.  ADDITIONALLY, MCAQD WILL OPERATE THE MONITORS AND CONTINUE TO COLLECT AND REPORT QUALITY ASSURED AIR DATA.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING TWO THERMO FISHER SCIENTIFIC 1405-DF PM2.5 UNITS AND SIX ESC 8864 DATA LOGGERS, PERFORMING INSTRUMENT CALIBRATION AND DATA CERTIFICATION, AND PROVIDING STAFF TRAINING ON PROPER OPERATION, CALIBRATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THERMO SCIENTIFIC UNITS.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVEMENT IN AIR QUALITY THROUGH THE MAINTENANCE AND MONITORING OR AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT, INCLUDING A VARIETY OF SPECIALIZED METEOROLOGICAL, AND RECORDING INSTRUMENTATION TESTING FOR THE DETECTION OF ATMOSPHERIC POLLUTANTS.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE ALL COMMUNITY RESIDENTS MARICOPA COUNTY, AZ.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO ARIZONA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (ADEQ). THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT ADEQ IN MANAGING IRA GRANT FUNDED OPPORTUNITIES AND OTHER RELATED AIR QUALITY IMPROVEMENT AND CLIMATE POLLUTION REDUCTION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $499,278. PRE-AWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 7/1/2023.

THESE ACTIVITIES WILL RANGE FROM PROJECT INITIATION AND PLANNING THROUGH DELIVERY AND FINAL REPORTING. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF ARIZONA.

DESCRIPTION:THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS SITE (NATTS) MONITORING PROGRAM WAS DEVELOPED IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE NATIONAL AIR MONITORING STRATEGY, TO MONITOR THE AMBIENT CONCENTRATION OF AIR TOXIC COMPOUNDS AND ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THE AMBIENT AIR MONITORING COMMUNITY. INTENDED BENEFICIARY IS THE SOUTH COAST AIR BASIN RESIDENTS AND OCCUPANTS, BOTH PERMANENT AND TEMPORARY.

THE RADIO STATION PROJECTS REACHING 20,000 SPANISH-SPEAKING COMMUNITY MEMBERS, TARGETING FARMWORKERS AND THEIR FAMILIES IN YUMA COUNTY, ARIZONA AND ADJACENT US-MX BORDER AREA RESIDENTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED GRANT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. TRIBAL CITIZENS ON THE FORT MCDERMITT INDIAN RESERVATION ARE EXPOSED TO AIR EMISSIONS FROM HISTORIC MINE WASTE EMISSIONS, TRANSPORTATION, AREA AGRICULTURE, WILDFIRES, AND ANTICIPATED EMISSIONS FROM THE PENDING THACKER PASS LITHIUM MINE. THE AWARD WOULD FUND THE FIRST PUBLIC AIR QUALITY MONITORING SYSTEM IN THE COUNTY.

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $493,802. PREAWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 6/1/2023.
ACTIVITIES:THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PURCHASE AND INSTALL AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT, TRAIN AND BUILD STAFF CAPACITY, AND COLLECT AND ANALYZE AIR MONITORING DATA. THEY WILL USE THE AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT TO GATHER DATA ABOUT AIR POLLUTANTS FROM KNOWN SOURCES, INCLUDING MINING, WILDFIRES, AGRICULTURE, AND VEHICLES, PLUS PLANNED AND CURRENTLY PERMITTED MINING IN THE QUINN RIVER VALLEY AIRSHED. THE FORT MCDERMITT PAIUTE AND SHOSHONE TRIBE WILL COORDINATE AND EXCHANGE DATA WITH THE NEVADA DIVISION OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AND THE OREGON DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY, AND WILL PROVIDE METEOROLOGICAL DATA TO SUPPORT THE TRIBE'S ONGOING WATER RESOURCES ASSESSMENT. ACTIVITIES ALSO INCLUDE A COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT EFFORT TO INFORM AND EDUCATE TRIBAL CITIZENS ABOUT AIR QUALITY CONDITIONS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE HIRING OF AN AIR QUALITY COORDINATOR; QUARTERLY, INTERIM AND FINAL REPORTS; AN AIR EMISSIONS INVENTORY; UPDATED QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLANS; THE PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF TWO METEOROLOGICAL STATIONS; COLLECTION OF METEOROLOGICAL AND AIR QUALITY DATA; AND INSTALLATION OF COMMUNITY-BASED FLAG SYSTEM AND ASSOCIATED COMMUNITY OUTREACH.

THE EXPECTED SHORT-TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF AIR POLLUTION BY PROVIDING UPDATES AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES, QUANTIFICATION OF CURRENT AIR POLLUTION TO IDENTIFY RISK, AND IMPROVEMENTS IN THE CAPACITY OF THE TRIBAL GOVERNMENT TO MEASURE AIR POLLUTION. INTERMEDIATE OUTCOMES INCLUDE AN ABILITY TO COORDINATE WITH STATE AGENCIES REGULATING MINING AND OTHER AIR POLLUTION SOURCES THAT IMPACT TRIBAL PROPERTY. THIS DATA COULD INFORM REGULATION OF EMITTING FACILITIES AND TRANSPORTATION SOURCES AND HELP PRIORITIZE WILDFIRE PREVENTION, AS WELL AS INFORM POSSIBLE RESIDENTIAL WOOD BURNING RESTRICTIONS. LONG-TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE REDUCING OVERALL EXPOSURE TO AIR POLLUTION.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE TRIBAL CITIZENS OF THE FORT MCDERMITT PAIUTE AND SHOSHONE TRIBES OF THE FORT MCDERMITT INDIAN RESERVATION, A FEDERALLY-RECOGNIZED TRIBE. IT HAS APPROXIMATELY 1,500 ENROLLED MEMBERS WITH OVER 300 PEOPLE LIVING ON THE RESERVATION. THE LARGER COMMUNITY IN THE NEARBY TOWNS OF MCDERMITT AND ORVADA AND THROUGHOUT THE QUINN RIVER VALLEY WILL ALSO BENEFIT FROM INCREASED DATA ABOUT AND ANALYSES OF THEIR SHARED AIRSHED'S AIR QUALITY.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO MAINTAIN FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) MONITORING NETWORKS. THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED DATA ON AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF PM2.5 AS WELL AS CHEMICAL COMPOSITION AND PRECURSORS. DATA WILL BE USED FOR: (1) PROVIDING AIR POLLUTION DATA TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN A TIMELY MANNER, (2) PM2.5 NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) COMPARISONS, (3) DEVELOPMENT AND TRACKING OF IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, (4) ASSESSMENTS OF REGIONAL HAZE, AND (5) ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH STUDIES AND OTHER AMBIENT AEROSOL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. THE PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORK DESIGN ADDRESSES THESE FOUR PROGRAM OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMBINATION OF SITING AND INSTRUMENTATION STRATEGIES.

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $696,964 WHICH INCLUDES $100,360 SET-ASIDE FOR EPA IN-KIND SERVICES.  PREWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO APRIL 1, 2023.  SEE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND SUBMIT RESULTS TO EPA'S NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED SHORT-TERM OUTCOME FOR THIS PROJECT IS AN INCREASE IN THE KNOWLEDGE REGARDING THE CHARACTER AND EXTENT OF PM2.5 IN THE AMBIENT AIR. THE LONG-TERM OUTCOME, THROUGH THE EVENTUAL DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THE STATE'S IMPLEMENTATION PLAN, IS REDUCED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH THE PM2.5 NAAQS AS SET FORTH IN THE CLEAN AIR ACT. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE STATE OF CALIFORNIA RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

SEE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL: PROVIDE EDUCATION, REAL-TIME INDOOR AND OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY INFORMATION AT STUDY LOCATIONS, ACCESS TO THE FREE AIRVISUAL APP TO MONITOR AIR QUALITY, AND INDOOR AIR QUALITY MITIGATION AS APPROPRIATE AT YMCA FACILITIES TO FURTHER IMPROVE COMMUNITY HEALTH OUTCOMES.SUBRECIPIENT:FIVE YMCAS WILL RECEIVE SUBAWARDS OF $10,000 EACH TO DO TRAINING AN OUTREACH RELATED TO THE PROJECT.OUTCOMES:PROJECT DELIVERABLES INCLUDE OUTDOOR AND INDOOR AIR QUALITY MONITORING DATA AND ANALYSIS IN DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES THAT FALL IN AIR QUALITY MONITORING GAPS.  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO INSTALL FILTRATION DEVICES IN HVAC SYSTEMS TO CREATE CLEAN-AIR SAFE HAVENS DURING SMOKE EVENTS AND OTHER HIGH POLLUTANT DAYS.  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO PROVIDE COMMUNMITY EDUCATION AND ACCESS TO REAL-TIME MONITORING DATA.  

OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED KNOWLEDGE ACQUISITION BY COMMUNITY MEMBERS, RESULTING IN IMPROVED HEALTH OUTCOMES FOR INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE ABLE TO ACCESS FILTERED AIR DURING SMOKE SEASON.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE APPLICANT AND PARTNERS WILL LEVERAGE RELATIONSHIPS WITH MULTIPLE SCHOOL DISTRICTS THROUGHOUT PIMA COUNTY TO DEPLOY AND OPERATE ADDITIONAL LOW-COST OUTDOOR AIR POLLUTION SENSORS IMPROVING EXPOSURE MEASUREMENTS OF SELECTED AIR POLLUTANTS FOR THE ENTIRE POPULATION, ESPECIALLY IDENTIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE LOCATIONS. BASED ON DATA COLLECTED BY THESE SENSORS, PROJECT PARTNERS WILL DEVELOP MODELS TO PREDICT AIR POLLUTION LEVELS ACROSS THE COUNTY AND DEVELOP ACTION PLANS. FINALLY, THE PARTNERS WILL USE THE DATA TO DEVELOP MODULES TO EDUCATE STUDENTS FOR COMMUNITY SCIENCE EFFORTS, SUCH AS EDUCATION SESSIONS ON AIR POLLUTION AND RELATED HEALTH EFFECTS AND THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN DATA AND LOCALIZED ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE ISSUES IDENTIFIED BY THE STUDENTS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $488,210.00. PREAWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 7/1/2023.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL:  ESTABLISH A NETWORK OF LOW-COST SENSORS MEASURING PARTICULATE MATTER AND GASEOUS POLLUTANTS IN TUCSON AREA SCHOOLS; CONSTRUCT SPATIOTEMPORAL MODELS APPLYING LAND USE REGRESSION AND MACHINE LEARNING APPROACHES TO PREDICT AIR POLLUTION LEVELS ACROSS PIMA COUNTY; AND DEVELOP COMMUNITY SCIENCE EDUCATION PLANS AT SCHOOLS TO EDUCATE STUDENTS.SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARD TO UNIVERSITY OF ARIZONA FOR PROJECT SENSOR PLACEMENT, DATA ANALYSIS, MODELING, CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT, IMPLEMENTATION AND PROJECT COORDINATION.
THE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO ISSUE SUBAWARD AGREEMENTS TO ITS PARTNERS IN COMPLIANCE WITH APPENDIX A OF EPA'S SUBAWARD POLICY.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: RECRUITING SCHOOLS AND OBTAINING SCHOOL APPROVAL; HIRING AND TRAINING STAFF; PURCHASING AIR SENSORS; CO-LOCATING SENSORS WITH REGULATORY MONITORS; INSTALLING AIR SENSORS IN 30 SCHOOLS; MONITORING AIR QUALITY AND OBTAINING DATA; CONSULTING WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS; IMPLEMENTING SCHOOL-BASED, STUDENT-LED SCIENCE PROGRAM IN PARTICIPATING HIGH SCHOOLS; CREATING AN EDUCATIONAL TOOLKIT AND TRAINING VIDEO; CREATING AN ONLINE DOWNLOAD, ANALYSIS, AND VISUALIZATION PORTAL; DATA MODELING, CLEANING AND ANALYSIS; GENERATING MANUSCRIPTS AND REPORTS.
EXPECTING OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE: GENERATION OF A SUMMARY REPORT; DEPLOYMENT OF SENSORS AT PIMA COUNTY SCHOOLS; INCREASED PROBLEM IDENTIFICATION; INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS; MEASURING STUDENT PARTICIPATION; STUDENT KNOWLEDGE; STUDENT LEADERSHIP SKILLS, TEACHER KNOWLEDGE AND PARTICIPATION OF UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENT INTERNS; PRE- AND POST-EVALUATION SURVEYS; A POST-PROGRAM EVALUATION.
INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE PIMA COUNTY COMMUNITY STUDENTS AND RESIDENTS WHO HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, AS WELL AS THE GENERAL PUBLIC.

DATA WILL BE USED FOR: (1) PROVIDING AIR POLLUTION DATA TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN A TIMELY MANNER, (2) PM2.5 NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) COMPARISONS, (3) DEVELOPMENT AND TRACKING OF IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, (4) ASSESSMENTS OF REGIONAL HAZE, AND (5) ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH STUDIES AND OTHER AMBIENT AEROSOL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. THE PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORK DESIGN ADDRESSES THESE FOUR PROGRAM OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMBINATION OF SITING AND INSTRUMENTATION STRATEGIES.

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $574,481, OF WHICH $38,000 IS SET ASIDE FOR EPA IN-KIND SERVICES.  PRE-AWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 4/1/2023.ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL PASSTHROUGH FUNDING TO COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND SUBMIT RESULTS TO EPA'S NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE. IN ADDITION, THIS GRANT INCLUDES FUNDING FOR SMALLER DISTRICTS TO ATTEND THE 2024 PRIMARY QUALITY ASSURANCE ORGANIZATION (PQAO) TRAINING CONDUCTED BY THE CALIFORNIA AIR RESOURCES BOARD.SUBRECIPIENT:CALIFORNIA AIR POLLUTION CONTROL OFFICERS ASSOCIATION (CAPCOA) WILL PASSTHROUGH FUNDING TO SMALL AIR DISTRICTS TO IMPLEMENT AIR POLLUTION CONTROL PROGRAMS IN THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA. OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED SHORT-TERM OUTCOME FOR THIS PROJECT IS AN INCREASE IN THE KNOWLEDGE REGARDING THE CHARACTER AND EXTENT OF PM2.5 IN THE AMBIENT AIR. THE LONG-TERM OUTCOME, THROUGH THE EVENTUAL DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THE STATE'S IMPLEMENTATION PLAN, IS REDUCED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH THE PM2.5 NAAQS AS SET FORTH IN THE CLEAN AIR ACT.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE STATE RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THIS PROJECT WILL ESTABLISH THE KLAMATH REGION COMMUNITY AIR MONITORING NETWORK - A COMMUNITY OPERATED NETWORK OF REAL-TIME PARTICULATE MATTER SENSORS (PM) WITH SUPPORTING CALIBRATION AND DATA MANAGEMENT INFRASTRUCTURE TO SERVE COMMUNITIES IN THE KLAMATH REGION OF NORTHERN CALIFORNIA HEAVILY AFFECTED BY WILDFIRES AND INDUSTRIAL EMISSIONS.

 THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $500,000.00. PRE-AWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO 6/01/2023.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. THE PROJECT BUILDS ON COLLABORATIONS BETWEEN THREE GROUPS LOCATED IN THE REGION (SCHATZ ENERGY RESEARCH CENTER , THE KARUK TRIBE, AND THE BLUE LAKE RANCHERIA TRIBE) TO DEPLOY 100 LOW-COST PM SENSORS IN OUTDOOR AND INDOOR LOCATIONS , NEAR-REFERENCE AND REFERENCE METHOD PM2.5 MONITORS, AND BLACK CARBON MONITORS TO ASSESS AIR QUALITY IN THE REGION. THE PROJECT INCLUDES ACTIVITIES THAT ENGAGE COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN UNDERSTANDING HOW DATA FROM THE NETWORK CAN BE INCORPORATED INTO COMMUNITY-SPECIFIC PROGRAM DECISION MAKING, TOOLS AND RESOURCES TO ENSURE THE QUALITY OF DATA AND AIR MONITOR PERFORMANCE, AND CAPACITY-BUILDING RESOURCES AND KNOWLEDGE SHARING INFRASTRUCTURE TO FOSTER PARTNERSHIP AND SUSTAIN THE USEFULNESS OF THE AIR NETWORK INTO THE FUTURE. 
SUBRECIPIENT:THE KARUK TRIBE DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (KDNR) WILL SERVE AS THE PRIMARY COMMUNITY PARTNER FOR THE KARUK TRIBE, AND THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS DEPARTMENT WILL SERVE AS THE PRIMARY COMMUNITY PARTNER AT BLR. COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDER MEETINGS FACILITATED BY PARTNERS WILL IDENTIFY USE CASES AND NEEDS WITH RESPECT TO AIR SENSOR DATA AND HELP REFINE NETWORK DEPLOYMENT STRATEGY AND DATA DASHBOARDS/RESOURCES. DEPLOYMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF THE SENSOR NETWORKS WILL BE PERFORMED JOINTLY BY KDNR, BLR, AND SCHATZ CENTER OVER THE ENTIRE TWO-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD. SCHATZ CENTER WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR DEVELOPING TRAINING MATERIALS FOR SENSORS/INSTRUMENTS IN THE NETWORK, BUT BOTH COMMUNITY PARTNERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO DESIGN AND REVIEW OF CURRICULUM OUTPUT. SCHATZ CENTER'S EXPERTISE IN AIR MONITORING AND IN LONG-TERM TECHNICAL ADVISORY ROLES IS INTENDED - THROUGH PROJECT ACTIVITIES - TO BOLSTER TECHNICAL CAPACITY WITHIN THE NETWORK, EXTENDING BEYOND THE PROJECT PERIOD. THESE ACTIVITIES ARE DESIGNED TO BE AN UPFRONT INVESTMENT THAT IN THE FUTURE WILL ENABLE COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO MAINTAIN CONTINUITY IN TECHNICAL MONITORING CAPACITY AND IMPROVE EFFICIENCY TO ALLOW MORE RESOURCES TO FLOW TO USING DATA TO SERVE COMMUNITIES AND FOR FUNDRAISING (AS OPPOSED TO MANAGING DATA, FIXING SENSORS, ETC.). OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES TO EPA INCLUDE A QUARTERLY AND FINAL REPORT DETAILING PARTNER AND PARTICIPANT MEETINGS, PROCUREMENT AND DEPLOYMENT OF AIR QUALITY MONITORS, COLLOCATION AND CALIBRATION OF LOW-COST PM SENSORS, AND TRAINING OF PARTNERS ON AIR POLLUTION EQUIPMENT. 

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: 1) REAL-TIME MONITORING OF PM2. CONCENTRATIONS ACROSS THE KLAMATH REGION; 2) COMMUNITY-SPECIFIC ASSESSMENTS OF AIR POLLUTION DATA; 3) DEPLOYMENT OF EQUIPMENT TO CONDUCT AIR QUALITY MONITORING; 4) PARTNERSHIP BUILDING AND KNOWLEDGE SHARING; 5) COMMUNITY SPECIFIC MONITORING CAPACITY RESILIENCE.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED GRANT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE PROJECT WILL MEASURE AND MONITOR POSSIBLE COMMUNITY EXPOSURE TO HEXAVALENT CHROMIUM (CR(VI)) AND ENSURE METAL RELATED BUSINESSES WHO PRODUCE CR(VI) EMISSIONS ARE NOT EMITTING POLLUTANTS AT HARMFUL LEVELS (MORE THAN 0.06 NANOGRAMS).

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $319,754.00.  PRE-AWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 04/01/2023.
ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL HIRE A CONTRACTOR TO PROVIDE TWO FULL YEARS OF SAMPLE COLLECTION ON A 1:6-DAY SCHEDULE (61 SAMPLE DAYS X FIVE SAMPLERS).  FILTERS WILL BE COLLECTED ON THE FIRST DAY FOLLOWING THE COMPLETION OF THE SAMPLING PERIOD, AND PACKAGED AND SHIPPED IMMEDIATELY OVERNIGHT TO THE LABORATORY IN COOLERS CONTAINING BLUE ICE.  IN THE EVENT THAT WEEKEND OR HOLIDAY SCHEDULES IMPACT DELIVERY, SAMPLES WILL BE STORED IN A FREEZER UNTIL SHIPPING IS POSSIBLE.  THE ROUTINE 6-DAY VISITS TO THE SITES WILL INCLUDE VISUAL SITE INSPECTIONS, DIAGNOSIS AND REPAIR OF EQUIPMENT PROBLEMS, VERIFY SAMPLER CLOCK ACCURACY AND SAMPLE RUNTIMES, REPLACEMENT OF SENSORS, IF NECESSARY, ROUTINE OPERATIONAL MAINTENANCE OF MONITORING EQUIPMENT, AND DOCUMENTATION AND REPORTING OF ALL PROBLEMS AND RESOLUTIONS TO PROJECT MANAGEMENT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES: TWO YEARS OF HEXAVALENT CHROMIUM (CR(VI)) DATA COLLECTED SAMPLE COLLECTION, REPORTS ON DESCRIPTIONS OF THE DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS EFFORTS, AND STUDY DESIGNS THAT INCLUDE CURRENT AND HISTORIC DATA THAT MEASURES COMMUNITY EXPOSURE.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PROJECT INTENDED TO MEASURE AND MONITOR POSSIBLE COMMUNITY EXPOSURE TO HEXAVALENT CHROMIUM (CR(VI)) AND ENSURE METAL RELATED BUSINESSES WHO PRODUCE CR(VI) EMISSIONS ARE NOT EMITTING POLLUTANTS AT HARMFUL LEVELS (MORE THAN 0.06 NANOGRAMS).  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED GRANT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE PROPOSED PROJECT AIMS AT ENHANCING THE MONITORING OF PM2.5 AND ITS CHEMICAL COMPONENTS (INCLUDING SEVERAL HAPS) AND PHYSICAL PROPERTIES IN WILMINGTON, CALIFORNIA (A COMMUNITY THAT HAS BEEN DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED BY AIR POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC) USING A SUITE OF ADVANCED FAST-RESPONSE INSTRUMENTS. THIS PROJECT WILL BUILD ON AN EXISTING PARTNERSHIP WITH COMMUNITY REPRESENTATIVES, AND THE RESULTS OF THIS STUDY WILL PROVIDE NEW INFORMATION ON MAJOR SOURCES OF AIR POLLUTION SUCH AS SHIP EMISSIONS, PORTS ACTIVITIES, AND GOODS MOVEMENT AND THEIR RELATIVE CONTRIBUTION TO AIR QUALITY IN WILMINGTON AND THE SURROUNDING AREAS. 

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $500,000. PRE-AWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 05/01/2023.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL: PURCHASE AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT, PREPARE AN EXISTING PORTABLE TRAILER FOR DEPLOYMENT, TEST EQUIPMENT PRIOR TO DEPLOYMENT, INSTALL MONITORING EQUIPMENT IN THE PORTABLE TRAILER, CONDUCT CONTINUOUS NEAR REA-TIME MONITORING, DEVELOP SOPS FOR EQUIPMENT, CONDUCT ADVANCE ANALYSIS AND SOURCE APPORTIONMENT MODELING AND PUBLIC OUTREACH.SUBRECIPIENT:THE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO ISSUE A SUBAWARD AGREEMENT TO ITS PARTNER IN COMPLIANCE WITH APPENDIX A OF EPA'S SUBAWARD POLICY.  

SCAQMD WILL ISSUE A SUBAWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,000 TO UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA, RIVERSIDE TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE AND CONSULTATION IN OPERATION AND INTERPRETATION OF THE DATA FROM THE ACSM IN THIS STUDY. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: IMPROVED COMMUNITY AWARENESS ABOUT THE LEVELS, COMPOSITION, AND SOURCES OF AMBIENT PM2.5 IN WILMINGTON, INCLUDING PM2.5-BOUND HAPS; INCREASED COMMUNITY ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND TOOLS THAT IMPROVE UNDERSTANDING OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND HUMAN HEALTH RISKS, PROVIDING THE DATA COLLECTED IN THIS PROJECT FOR IMPROVED EXPOSURE AND RISK ASSESSMENT STUDIES AND OTHER RESEARCH PROJECTS; APPLICATION OF THE DEVELOPED PORTABLE TRAILER, QUALITY ASSURANCE GUIDELINES, AND DATA VALIDATIONS PROCEDURES DEVELOPED IN THIS PROJECT IN OTHER EJ COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE SCAB (SOUTH COAST AIR BASIN) AS WELL AS B

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED GRANT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THIS PROJECT AIMS TO ENHANCE AIR MONITORING IN SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES BY LEVERAGING COMMUNITY/GOVERNMENT/ACADEMIC PARTNERSHIPS TO DEPLOY AIR QUALITY SENSORS, EQUIPPED TO COLLECT HIGH QUALITY DATA ACCORDING TO A PLAN THAT REFLECTS COMMUNITY CONCERNS.  THE COLLECTED DATA WILL INFORM COMMUNITY LED ACTION TO REDUCE POLLUTANT EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURES AT THE LOCAL LEVEL, THEREBY HELPING TO REDUCE EXISTING DISPARITIES IN HEALTH OUTCOMES.  SOLIDIFYING THE EFFORTS OF THIS WORK, SOUTH COAST AQMD'S EXISTING PILOT SENSOR LIBRARY PROGRAM WILL BE ENHANCED AND EXPANDED TO SERVE RESIDENTS BY FACILITATING INCREASED MONITORING IN COMMUNITIES BEYOND THE PROJECT PERIOD.

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $499,900. PREAWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 05/01/2023.

ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL EXPAND AND ENHANCE ITS EXISTING LIBRARY PROGRAM TO DEVELOP AND 'ONE-STOP-SHOP' FOR MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC INTERESTED IN LEARNING ABOUT THEIR QUALITY, AS IT WILL INCLUDE NO-COST AIR QUALITY SENSOR LOANS, DATA ANALYSIS AND VISUALIZATION CAPABILITIES, EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT.  THE PROPOSED WORK WILL INVOLVE PURCHASING ADDITIONAL SENSORS AQS AND RELATED ACCESSORIES, IMPLEMENTING QC AND CALIBRATION PROCEDURES, AND FINALIZING LOAN DOCUMENTS. THE PILOT LIBRARY PROGRAM CURRENTLY INCLUDES 51 SENSORS AQS OF 7 TYPES, WHICH OFFER BORROWERS A RANGE OF TOOLS TO SUPPORT DIFFERENT INTERESTS, FROM AMBIENT TO INDOOR AND STATIONARY TO MOBILE MONITORING. SENSORS AQS PURCHASED WILL TARGET ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING AIR POLLUTANTS: PM2.5, PM10, O3, OR NO2.  SUBRECIPIENT:THE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO ISSUE SUBAWARD AGREEMENTS TO ITS PARTNERS IN COMPLIANCE WITH APPENDIX A OF EPA'S SUBAWARD POLICY.  THERE ARE SIX SUBAWARDS TOTALING $218,000 AND THE ACTIVITIES TO BE IMPLEMENTED ARE DESCRIBED IN THE ATTACHED FINAL PROJECT NARRATIVE DATED 4.18.23 (PP 10-12) IN SECTION M.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE:  PURCHASING ADDITIONAL SENSORS AQS AND RELATED ACCESSORIES; DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING QC AND CALIBRATION PROCEDURES; EXPANDING THE EXISTING LIBRARY PROGRAM WHICH PROVIDES THE PUBLIC WITH NO-COST AIR QUALITY SENSOR LOANS AND EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES; AND MAKING REAL-TIME PROCESSED (QC'D) AIR QUALITY DATA ACCESSIBLE THROUGH SCAQMD'S PUBLIC-FACING DASHBOARDS.

EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT EXPANDS AIR MONITORING IN EJ COMMUNITIES, ESTABLISHES A MECHANISM FOR BUILDING COMMUNITY/AQMD RELATIONSHIPS, INCREASES ROBUSTNESS OF OTHER LIBRARY AND LOAN PROGRAMS, INCREASES ACCESS TO REAL-TIME DATA AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT FOR AIR QUALITY SENSORS BY THE AQMD, AND INTEGRATES WORK WITH EJ COMMUNITIES, INCLUDING STUDENTS, INTO FUTURE CAREERS AND SUCCESSFUL ENGAGEMENT IN MULTI-INSTITUTIONAL PARTNERSHIPS.  OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS WILL LEAD TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. 

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:#8239;#8239;DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE#8239;COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE#8239;DECREASED RISK OF A

THE INTENDED DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT IS SAN JOAQUIN VALLEY.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO MAINTAIN FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) MONITORING NETWORKS. THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED DATA ON AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF PM2.5 AS WELL AS CHEMICAL COMPOSITION AND PRECURSORS. DATA WILL BE USED FOR: (1) PROVIDING AIR POLLUTION DATA TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN A TIMELY MANNER, (2) PM2.5 NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) COMPARISONS, (3) DEVELOPMENT AND TRACKING OF IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, (4) ASSESSMENTS OF REGIONAL HAZE, AND (5) ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH STUDIES AND OTHER AMBIENT AEROSOL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. THE PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORK DESIGN ADDRESSES THESE FOUR PROGRAM OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMBINATION OF SITING AND INSTRUMENTATION STRATEGIES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED GRANT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE MANZANITA ENHANCED AIR QUALITY MONITORING PROJECT WILL IMPLEMENT A CONTINUOUS AIR MONITORING NETWORK TO DETECT LEVELS OF PM 2.5, PM 10, OZONE, AND NITROGEN DIOXIDE THROUGHOUT THE MANZANITA RESERVATION. A WEBSITE AND EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS WILL BE PROVIDED TO INFORM THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY HOW TO REDUCE EXPOSURE TO HARMFUL AIR POLLUTANTS. THROUGH THIS PROJECT, THE MANZANITA ENVIRONMENTAL AND NATURAL RESOURCES DEPARTMENT WILL GAIN TECHNICAL CAPACITY TO IMPROVE ITS AIR QUALITY MONITORING CAPABILITIES AND BOLSTER RESILIENCY FOR THE MANZANITA COMMUNITY.  ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE MANZANITA ENVIRONMENTAL AND NATURAL RESOURCE DEPARTMENT WILL ESTABLISH THE MANZANITA ENHANCED AIR QUALITY MONITORING PROJECT INVOLVING THE IMPLEMENTATION OF A REAL-TIME AIR MONITORING NETWORK. THIS NETWORK WOULD DEPLOY MONITORS THAT CONTAIN VARIOUS SENSORS THAT DETECT OZONE, NITROGEN DIOXIDE, PM2.5, AND PM10 CONCENTRATIONS, AS WELL AS AMBIENT TEMPERATURE, RELATIVE HUMIDITY, ATMOSPHERIC PRESSURE, AND WIND SPEED AND DIRECTION. AS PART OF THIS PROJECT, TRAINING, CAPACITY BUILDING, DATA ANALYSIS, AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT WILL BE CONDUCTED.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:MANZANITA WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR UPDATING THE EPA ON PROJECT PROGRESS AND SUBMITTING THE NECESSARY QUARTERLY REPORTS AND FINAL REPORT DURING THE GRANT PERFORMANCE PERIOD. THESE REPORTS WILL INCLUDE SUMMARIZING RELEVANT PROJECT TASKS THAT HAVE BEEN COMPLETED TO DATE, WHEN NECESSARY. DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED GRANT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE PALA TRIBAL COMMUNITY AIR MONITORING COLLABORATIVE INVOLVES THE REESTABLISHMENT OF A REAL-TIME AIR MONITORING NETWORK ON THE PALA RESERVATION. THIS MONITORING NETWORK WAS FIRST ESTABLISHED IN 2019 AND THE SENSORS UTILIZED IN THIS PROJECT HAVE REACHED END-OF-LIFE. THE PROJECT WILL LEVERAGE ELEMENTS OF THE SYSTEM PREVIOUSLY DEVELOPED TO EFFICIENTLY AND COST-EFFECTIVELY IMPLEMENT A CONTINUOUS AND REAL-TIME AIR MONITORING NETWORK THAT DETECTS OZONE, NITROGEN DIOXIDE, PM2.5, AND PM10 CONCENTRATIONS, AS WELL AS AMBIENT TEMPERATURE, RELATIVE HUMIDITY, ATMOSPHERIC PRESSURE, WIND SPEED AND WIND DIRECTION. ENGAGING AND EDUCATING THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY WILL BE EMPHASIZED THROUGH VARIOUS APPROACHES TO PROVIDE AWARENESS AND FOSTER RESILIENCY TO AIR QUALITY IMPACTS. THE PALA ENVIRONMENTAL DEPARTMENT WILL COLLABORATE WITH NEIGHBORING TRIBES TO SUPPORT IMPROVED TECHNICAL CAPACITY AND EDUCATION IN TRIBAL COMMUNITIES ALONG THE SAN LUIS REY RIVER VALLEY.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $232,367. REFER TO TERMS AND CONDITIONS.
ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THE PALA BAND'S OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL: UPDATE THEIR EXISTING QAPP, PURCHASE 5 AIR QUALITY MONITORS, UPGRADE THEIR EXISTING WEBSITE, USE THE NEW MONITORS THROUGHOUT THE RESERVATION TO IDENTIFY LEVELS OF AIR POLLUTION, ENGAGE THE COMMUNITY WITH THE RESULTS AND INCLUDE NEIGHBORING TRIBES TO COLLABORATE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES:
-	IDENTIFICATION OF AIR POLLUTION LEVELS FOR PM 2.5, PM 10, OZONE, AND NITROGEN DIOXIDE
-	TWO COMMUNITY-SPECIFIC ASSESSMENTS OF AIR POLLUTION DATA
-	DEPLOYMENT OF EQUIPMENT TO CONDUCT AIR QUALITY MONITORING ON THE PALA RESERVATION (AN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITY)
-	DEVELOP A WEBSITE THAT DISPLAYS NEAR REAL-TIME AIR QUALITY DATA THAT IS AVAILABLE FOR THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY
-	DEVELOP EDUCATIONAL CONTENT THAT COMMUNITY MEMBERS CAN USE TO REDUCE EXPOSURE TO HARMFUL AIR POLLUTANTS
-	PROMOTION OF PARTNERSHIPS AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT 
EXPECTED OUTCOMES:
-	IDENTIFYING AIR POLLUTION LEVELS ON THE RESERVATION
-	INCREASING COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND EDUCATION
-	INCREASING ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND TOOLS THAT INCREASE UNDERSTANDING AND REDUCTION OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND HUMAN HEALTH RISKS
-	COMMUNITY ACTION TO MITIGATE POLLUTANT EXPOSURE
-	REDUCTION OF HUMAN EXPOSURE TO AIR POLLUTANTS
INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE COMMUNITY MEMBERS AT THE PALA RESERVATION.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED GRANT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $213,204. PRE-AWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO 05/01/2023. THIS PROJECT WILL ESTABLISH A NEW SLAMS MONITOR IN THE WESTERN PORTION OF RENO, NV TO FILL A SPATIAL GAP IN THE EXISTING AMBIENT AIR MONITORING NETWORK.  THIS AREA IS UNDERSERVED BY THE EXISTING NETWORK AND TYPICALLY EXPERIENCES THE HIGHEST PM CONCENTRATIONS IN WASHOE COUNTY DURING INTERSTATE TRANSPORT WILDFIRE SMOKE EPISODES.  THE POLLUTANT SCOPE OF THIS MONITOR WILL BE PM (CONTINUOUS PM2.5, PM10 AND PM10-2.5) AND OZONE.  THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO COLLECT VALUABLE AIR POLLUTION AND METEOROLOGICAL DATA.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND.  SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL: SECURE A SITE LOCATION, PREPARE THE MONITORING STATION STRUCTURE AND INSTRUMENTATION AND COMMENCE MONITORING ACTIVITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A NEW AMBIENT AIR MONITORING STATION IN THE SOUTHWEST PORTION OF WASHOE COUNTY, NV IN THE COMMUNITY OF VERDI. THE VERDI SITE WILL MONITOR FOR PM (CONTINUOUS PM2.5, PM10 AND PM10-2.5), OZONE AND METEOROLOGY (AMBIENT TEMPERATURE, WIND SPEED, WIND DIRECTION).

EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A NEW MONITORING STATION IN VERDI, NV WILL STRENGTHEN COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS AND IMPROVE AIR QUALITY AND METEOROLOGICAL INFORMATION AND FORECASTING CAPABILITIES FOR THE ENTIRE REGION.  INSTRUMENTATION SELECTION WILL BE CONSISTENT WITH THE EXISTING ANALYZERS AND SENSORS IN THE AQMD NETWORK AND WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES AIR QUALITY DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. OPERATION OF THIS NEW MONITORING SITE IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS WILL LEAD TO THE COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. 

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:#8239;#8239;DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE#8239;COMMUNITY RESIDENTS IN SOUTHWEST WASHOE COUNTY WHICH IS A HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED COMMUNITY (DESIGNATED AS A QUALIFIED CENSUS TRACK BY THE US SECRETARY OF HOUSING AND URBAN DEVELOPMENT).

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IMPROVE IMPERIAL COUNTY'S AIR QUALITY CONDITIONS AND TO DEVELOP STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS AIR QUALITY ISSUES. THE RECIPIENT WILL CONTINUE STRATEGIC PLANNING AND EVALUATION, COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE, MONITORING AIR EMISSIONS, RULEMAKING, AND OTHER PROGRAM ACTIVITIES TO IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN IMPERIAL COUNTY'S AIR QUALITY. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO CONDUCT WORK ON THE BORDER TO SUPPORT CLEAN AIR INITIATIVES, INCLUDING A MEDIA CAMPAIGN IN MEXICALI, AIR QUALITY INDEX (AQI) MEDIA ADVERTISEMENT IN SPANISH AND ENGLISH, AQI INFORMATION AT IMPERIAL COUNTY'S LARGEST MALL AND PRIORITY EXPANSION OF DUST CAMERA MONITORING FOR THE MEXICALI-IMPERIAL VALLEY REGION.

INCREASE PUBLIC AWARENESS OF AQI AND HEALTH IMPACTS. POST HEALTH IS ON MALL MARQUEE IN EL CENTRO. EXPAND RECORDING OF EVENTS THAT IMPACT THE AIR QUALITY OF THE MEXICALI-IMPERIAL VALLEY REGION TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE CAUSES AND EFFECTS THEY HAVE ON POPULATION.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE A YEAR ROUND MEDIA CAMPAIGN IN MEXICALI IMPROVING AWARENESS OF THE CONSEQUENCES OF OPEN BURNING. DESCRIPTION:THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES $125,000 OF FEDERAL FUNDING.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.   PREAWARD COSTS APPROVED BACK TO 8/1/2022. ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ADDRESS PRIORITIES IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PURCHASE TWO NEW PM2.5 MONITORS AND A NITROGEN OXIDE PLUS HYDROGEN SULFIDE MONITOR TO ESTABLISH UPGRADE ONE MONITORING SITE AND ESTABLISH TWO NEW MONITORING SITES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR(S) TO REPLACE FILTER-BASED PM2.5 MONITOR(S). EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

ACTIVITIES: THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS.  SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL: 
1. REVIEW AND COMPARE EPA PROPOSED EQUIPMENT FOR PURCHASE AND DETERMINE IF ANY ADJUSTMENTS NEED TO BE MADE ON ENHANCEMENTS AT VARIOUS AIR MONITORING SITES BASED ON CURRENT NEEDS. CONSULT WITH EPA ABOUT PROPOSED CHANGES/UPDATES.
2. PREPARE AND INITIATE PROCUREMENT REQUEST(S) FOR EQUIPMENT PURCHASE(S).
3. PURCHASE EQUIPMENT.
4.TAKE DELIVERY OF EQUIPMENT UPON VERIFICATION OF FUNCTIONALITY OF EQUIPMENT AND MOVE FORWARD WITH PAYMENT OF VENDOR INVOICES.
5. PLAN FOR TIMELY SET-UP AND INSTALLATION OF EQUIPMENT CONSISTENT WITH THE GOAL OF ENHANCING AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES IN EJ AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.
6. REPORT AND PROVIDE NEW OR REVISED QAPPS INCLUDING NEW OR REVISED SOPS.
7. PASS FUNDING THROUGH TO PINAL COUNTY AND DOCUMENT THEIR COMPLETION OF 1-6 ABOVE.SUBRECIPIENT:THE SUBAWARD IS TO THE PINAL COUNTY AIR QUALITY DEPARTMENT TO PURCHASE AIR QUALITY MONITORING EQUIPMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE REPORTING OF EXPENDITURES ON EQUIPMENT PURCHASE, REPORTING ON STATUS OF EQUIPMENT INSTALLATION, REPORTING OF NEW OR REVISED QAPPS.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO MAINTAIN FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) MONITORING NETWORKS.  THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED DATA ON AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF PM2.5 AS WELL AS CHEMICAL COMPOSITION AND PRECURSORS. DATA WILL BE USED FOR: (1) PROVIDING AIR POLLUTION DATA TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN A TIMELY MANNER, (2) PM2.5 NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) COMPARISONS, (3) DEVELOPMENT AND TRACKING OF IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, (4) ASSESSMENTS OF REGIONAL HAZE, AND (5) ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH STUDIES AND OTHER AMBIENT AEROSOL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES.
ACTIVITIES:
THE RECIPIENT WILL COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND WILL WORK WITH THE STATE AIR PROGRAM TO SUBMIT RESULTS TO EPA'S NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE. 
OUTCOMES:
THE ANTICIPATED SHORT-TERM OUTCOME OF THIS PROJECT IS AN INCREASE IN KNOWLEDGE REGARDING THE CHARACTER AND EXTENT OF PM2.5 IN THE AMBIENT AIR. THE LONG-TERM OUTCOME, THROUGH THE EVENTUAL DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THE STATE'S IMPLEMENTATION PLAN, IS REDUCED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH THE PM2.5 NAAQS AS SET FORTH IN THE CLEAN AIR ACT. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE THE COUNTY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.  
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DATA WILL BE USED FOR: (1) PROVIDING AIR POLLUTION DATA TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN A TIMELY MANNER, (2) PM2.5 NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) COMPARISONS, (3) DEVELOPMENT AND TRACKING OF IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, (4) ASSESSMENTS OF REGIONAL HAZE, AND (5) ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH STUDIES AND OTHER AMBIENT AEROSOL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES.  THE PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORK DESIGN ADDRESSES THESE FOUR PROGRAM OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMBINATION OF SITING AND INSTRUMENTATION STRATEGIES.   
ACTIVITIES:
THE RECIPIENT WILL COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND SUBMIT RESULTS TO EPA'S NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE.  
OUTCOMES:
THE ANTICIPATED SHORT-TERM OUTCOME FOR THIS PROJECT IS AN INCREASE IN THE KNOWLEDGE REGARDING THE CHARACTER AND EXTENT OF PM2.5 IN THE AMBIENT AIR.  THE LONG-TERM OUTCOME, THROUGH THE EVENTUAL DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THE STATE'S IMPLEMENTATION PLAN, IS REDUCED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH THE PM2.5 NAAQS AS SET FORTH IN THE CLEAN AIR ACT.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES; DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE STATE RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS STATIONS (NATTS) NETWORK DEVELOPMENT AND OPERATION: CONDUCT COMPREHENSIVE AMBIENT AIR TOXICS MONITORING; DEVELOP AND REFIN

THERE ARE CURRENTLY 187 HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS, OR AIR TOXICS, REGULATED UNDER THE CLEAN AIR ACT THAT HAVE BEEN ASSOCIATED WITH A WIDE VARIETY OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS. THESE AIR TOXICS ARE EMITTED FROM MULTIPLE SOURCES, INCLUDING MAJOR STATIONARY, AREA AND MOBILE SOURCES, RESULTING IN POPULATION EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS. THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS STATION PROGRAM WAS DEVELOPED TO FULFILL THE NEED FOR LONG-TERM HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTION MONITORING DATA OF CONSISTENT QUALITY. THIS GRAND JUNCTION, COLORADO SITE IS A PART OF A 27-SITE NATIONAL NETWORK OF AIR TOXICS MONITORING STATIONS. THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS STATION NETWORK IS TRACKING TRENDS IN AMBIENT AIR TOXICS LEVELS TO FACILITATE MEASURING PROGRESS TOWARD EMISSION AND RISK REDUCTION GOALS. THE MONITORING NETWORK IS INTENDED, OVER A MULTI-YEAR PERIOD, TO BE ABLE TO DETECT A 15% DIFFERENCE (TREND)  BETWEEN TWO SUCCESSIVE 3-YEAR ANNUAL MEAN CONCENTRATION WITHIN ACCEPTABLE LEVELS OF DETECTION ERROR

THERE ARE CURRENTLY 187 HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS, OR AIR TOXICS, REGULATED UNDER THE CLEAN AIR ACT THAT HAVE BEEN ASSOCIATED WITH A WIDE VARIETY OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS. THESE AIR TOXICS ARE EMITTED FROM MULTIPLE SOURCES, INCLUDING MAJOR STATIONARY, AREA AND MOBILE SOURCES, RESULTING IN POPULATION EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS. THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS STATION PROGRAM WAS DEVELOPED TO FULFILL THE NEED FOR LONG-TERM HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTION MONITORING DATA OF CONSISTENT QUALITY. THIS BOUNTIFUL, UTAH SITE IS A PART OF A 27-SITE NATIONAL NETWORK OF AIR TOXICS MONITORING STATIONS. THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS STATION NETWORK IS TRACKING TRENDS IN AMBIENT AIR TOXICS LEVELS TO FACILITATE MEASURING PROGRESS TOWARD EMISSION AND RISK REDUCTION GOALS. THE MONITORING NETWORK IS INTENDED, OVER A MULTI-YEAR PERIOD, TO BE ABLE TO DETECT A 15% DIFFERENCE (TREND) BETWEEN TWO SUCCESSIVE 3-YEAR ANNUAL MEAN CONCENTRATION WITHIN ACCEPTABLE LEVELS OF DETECTION ERROR.

WITH THIS PROJECT, THE WYOMING DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY PLANS, DEVELOPS, MAINTAINS AND IMPROVES A NETWORK TO STUDY FINE PARTICULATES AND THEIR DISTRIBUTION IN SEVERAL AREAS OF THE STATE.  THIS AWARD PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE TO OPERATE AND MAINTAIN A NETWORK TO MONITOR AMBIENT LEVELS AT SITES WITHIN THE STATE, MAINTAIN A DATABASE AND REPORT RESULTS TO THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.   ACTIVITIES: THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ADDRESS PRIORITIES IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS.SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL: UTILIZE FUNDING TO PROVIDE THE UNDERLYING INFRASTRUCTURE NEEDED TO SUPPORT AIR QUALITY MONITORING, AS WELL AS PURCHASE AND DEPLOY PM 2.5 MONITORING ON TRIBAL LANDS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES: EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR(S)/.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:PURPOSE: PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING TO KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT TO COLLECT ADDITIONAL AIR DATA DURING CONTROLLED BURN OF THE FLINT HILLS.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT INCLUDES THE ANALYSES OF REMOTELY SENSED BURNED AREA (I.E., BURN SCAR DATA) COLLECTED USING THE ENVIRONMENT FOR VISUALIZING IMAGES (ENVI) SYSTEM DURING THE SUMMER AND FALL MONTHS OF 2022.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PROJECT WILL PROVIDE INSIGHT INTO THE IMPACT ON THE ECOSYSTEM AND AIR QUALITY DURING AN EXTENDED PRESCRIBED BURN SEASON THROUGH THE SUMMER AND FALL MONTHS OF THE YEAR. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF KANSAS AND OTHER MIDWESTERN STATES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED GRANT IS TO ENHANCE THE KICKAPOO'S AMBIENT AIR MONITORING PROGRAM BY WAY OF PURCHASING AND DEPLOYING A PM2.5 SYSTEM. ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: THE RESEARCH AND DESIGN OF A PM2.5 MONITORING PROGRAM, LEADING TO THE PURCHASE AND DEPLOYMENT OF SAID SYSTEM WITH THE GOAL OF QUALITY ASSURED DATA COLLECTION. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE PROPER OPERATION OF PM2.5 POLLUTANT MONITORING SYSTEM IN ACCORDANCE WITH EPA REQUIREMENTS, LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA THAT WILL BE UPLOADED TO THE NATIONAL AIR QUALITY SYSTEM (AQS) NETWORK TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THOSE LIVING AND WORKING ON KICKAPOO TRIBAL LANDS, AS WELL AS THE GENERAL PUBLIC.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED GRANT IS TO DEMOLISH AND REPLACE AN AGING AND DEFICIENT MONITORING SHELTER TO CONTINUE PM2.5 MONITORING ACTIVITIES.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE COORDINATION WITH PBPN'S CONSTRUCTION DEPARTMENT TO INITIATE BIDDING AND PROCUREMENT REQUESTS FOR PM2.5 MONITOR SHELTER DEMOLITION, AND SUBSEQUENTLY, INITIATE AND COMPLETE SHELTER REPLACEMENT. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE MODERNIZATION OF THE PRAIRIE BAND POTAWATOMI NATION'S PM2.5 MONITORING PROGRAM BY WAY OF REPLACING THEIR AGING SHELTER LAB. OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE CONTINUATION OF PM2.5 QUALITY ASSURED DATA COLLECTION. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF THE PRAIRIE BAND POTAWATOMI NATION AND THE PUBLIC AT LARGE.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS. SPECIFICALLY, IOWA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL FULLY AUTOMATE PM2.5 MONITORS AND UPGRADE OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES AND NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS.SUBRECIPIENT:THE GRANTEE, IOWA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL PROVIDE $88,199 TO POLK CO PUBLIC WORKS AND $44,900 TO LINN CO HEALTH DEPT. TO EQUIPMENT AND SOFTWARE TO ASSIST IDNR WITH  THE PROJECT.  OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE PURCHASE OF AIR QUALITY INSTRUMENTS TO MONITOR PM2.5 EXPECTED OUTCOMES: OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE AMBIENT AIR TOXICS MEASUREMENTS UNDER THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS STATION (NATTS) NETWORK.  THE NATTS NETWORK TRACKS TRENDS IN AIR TOXICS LEVELS TO FACILITATE MEASURING PROGRESS TOWARD EMISSION AND RISK REDUCTION GOALS. ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED AIR TOXICS SAMPLES FOR SELECTED HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS AND SUBMIT RESULTS TO THE NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:LONG-TERM MONITORING OF AMBIENT AIR TOXICS LEVELS FACILITATES THE IDENTIFICATION OF AREAS OF CONCERN, CHARACTERIZATION OF RISK, AND TRACKING OF PROGRESS.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF MISSOURI WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE STATE RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.  
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO MAINTAIN FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) MONITORING NETWORKS.  THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED DATA ON AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF PM2.5 AS WELL AS CHEMICAL COMPOSITION AND PRECURSORS. DATA WILL BE USED FOR: (1) PROVIDING AIR POLLUTION DATA TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN A TIMELY MANNER, (2) PM2.5 NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) COMPARISONS, (3) DEVELOPMENT AND TRACKING OF IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, (4) ASSESSMENTS OF REGIONAL HAZE, AND (5) ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH STUDIES AND OTHER AMBIENT AEROSOL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. THE PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORK DESIGN ADDRESSES THESE FOUR PROGRAM OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMBINATION OF SITING AND INSTRUMENTATION STRATEGIES.  
ACTIVITIES:
THE RECIPIENT WILL COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND SUBMIT RESULTS TO EPA'S NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE.
OUTCOMES:
THE ANTICIPATED SHORT-TERM OUTCOME FOR THIS PROJECT IS AN INCREASE IN THE KNOWLEDGE REGARDING THE CHARACTER AND EXTENT OF PM2.5 IN THE AMBIENT AIR. THE LONG-TERM OUTCOME, THROUGH THE EVENTUAL DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THE STATE'S IMPLEMENTATION PLAN, IS REDUCED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH THE PM2.5 NAAQS AS SET FORTH IN THE CLEAN AIR ACT.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE STATE RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.  
SUBRECIPIENT:
IDNR WILL PROVIDE THE SUBRECIPIENT POLK CO PUBLIC WORKS $20,000 AND LINN CO HEALTH DEPT. $17,500 TO CARRY OUT THIS PROJECT IN ITS COUNTY.

PURPOSE: PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING TO KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT TO COLLECT ADDITIONAL AIR DATA DURING CONTROLLED BURN OF THE FLINT HILLS. 
ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT INCLUDES THE ANALYSES OF REMOTELY SENSED BURNED AREA (I.E., BURN SCAR DATA) COLLECTED USING THE ENVIRONMENT FOR VISUALIZING IMAGES (ENVI) SYSTEM DURING THE SUMMER AND FALL MONTHS OF 2021.
EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PROJECT WILL PROVIDE INSIGHT INTO THE IMPACT ON THE ECOSYSTEM AND AIR QUALITY DURING AN EXTENDED PRESCRIBED BURN SEASON DURING SUMMER AND FALL MONTHS OF THE YEAR.  
INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF KANSAS AND OTHER MIDWESTERN STATES.  
SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: SUB-AWARDS ARE NOT ANTICIPATED.
