DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE UTE INDIAN TRIBE. THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO MONITOR PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) TO DETERMINE POSSIBLE AIR QUALITY IMPAIRMENT AND TO CREATE AWARENESS AND UNDERSTANDING OF PARTICULATES IN THE AIR ON A DAILY BASIS. THIS FUNDING WILL ENHANCE THE AIR MONITORING CURRENTLY BEING CONDUCTED BY THE TRIBE.  

SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL WORK WITH A CONTRACTOR TO OPERATE PM2.5 MONITORS ACCORDING TO APPROVED QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN AND TRIBAL STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE OPERATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS, THE COLLECTION, VALIDATION AND VERIFICATION OF DATA ACCORDING TO THE QUALITY ASSURANCE PLAN AND TRIBAL STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES. CALIBRATIONS AND MAINTENANCE OF THE MONITORING SYSTEMS, PERFORMANCE EVALUATIONS OF THE AIR MONITORING INSTRUMENTS AND PROVIDING COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITH ACCURATE INFORMATION REGARDING AIR QUALITY ISSUES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PM 2.5 DATA COLLECTED AT EACH SITE, QUALITY ASSURED AND REPORTED WITHIN 90 DAYS OF THE WHEN THE DATA IS GATHERED. DOCUMENTATION OF ALL QUALITY CONTROL PRACTICES IN EACH QUARTER FOR FUTURE REFERENCE IN TROUBLE SHOOTING. DOCUMENTATION OF DATA, SUMMARIES OF MAINTENANCE AND CALIBRATION WORK AND AUDITING THROUGH PROGRESS REPORTING.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE QUALITY ASSURED DATA THAT CAN INFORM THE CITIZENS OF THE AIR QUALITY IN THE AREA, THROUGH NEAR REAL TIME INFORMATION TO THE UTE INDIAN TRIBE AIR QUALITY PUBLIC KIOSKS.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE UTE INDIAN TRIBE MEMBERS AND SURROUNDING TRIBAL COMMUNITY.

MONITORING FOR HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS (HAPS) IN THE BOUNTIFUL-WOODS CROSS-WEST BOUNTIFUL AREA IN DAVIS COUNTY, UTAH. THE AREA HAS A LARGE INDUSTRIAL COMPLEX WITH MULTIPLE INDUSTRIES AND SEVERAL UNREGULATED EMISSIONS SOURCES. THESE INCLUDE OIL REFINERIES, INDUSTRIAL GAS COMPANIES AS WELL AS METAL PROCESSING, RECYCLING, PAINTING/COATING MANUFACTURING AND ELECTRICITY GENERATION FACILITIES. SEVERAL ROADWAYS, RAILROADS AND HIGHWAYS ALSO RUN THROUGH THIS AREA. GIVEN THEIR CLOSE PROXIMITY TO AND MOSTLY DOWNWIND LOCATION FROM THESE SOURCES, COMMUNITIES IN THIS AREA ARE AT A HIGH RISK OF EXPOSURE TO HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS (HAPS) EMISSIONS, PARTICULARLY FORMALDEHYDE AND ACETALDEHYDE.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AWARD IS TO ADVANCE THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS STATION PROGRAM WHICH WAS DEVELOPED TO FULFILL THE NEED FOR LONG-TERM HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTION MONITORING DATA OF CONSISTENT QUALITY. THERE ARE CURRENTLY 187 HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS, OR AIR TOXICS, REGULATED UNDER THE CLEAN AIR ACT THAT HAVE BEEN ASSOCIATED WITH A WIDE VARIETY OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS. THESE AIR TOXICS ARE EMITTED FROM MULTIPLE SOURCES, INCLUDING MAJOR STATIONARY, AREA AND MOBILE SOURCES, RESULTING IN POPULATION EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS. THIS BOUNTIFUL, UTAH SITE IS PART OF A 27-SITE NATIONAL NETWORK OF AIR TOXICS MONITORING STATIONS. THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS STATION NETWORK IS TRACKING TRENDS IN AMBIENT AIR TOXICS LEVELS TO FACILITATE MEASURING PROGRESS TOWARDS EMISSION AND RISK REDUCTION GOALS.ACTIVITIES:WITH THIS FUNDING, THE UTAH DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY OPERATES A MONITORING NETWORK AND COLLECTS AIR TOXIC POLLUTION DATA IN BOUNTIFUL, UT. THE MONITORING NETWORK IS INTENDED, OVER A MULTI-YEAR PERIOD, TO BE ABLE TO DETECT A 15% DIFFERENCE (TREND) BETWEEN TWO SUCCESSIVE 3-YEAR ANNUAL MEAN CONCENTRATIONS WITHIN ACCEPTABLE LEVELS OF DETECTION ERROR. MONITORING FOR ALL POLLUTANTS WILL BE AT A 1 IN 6 DAY FREQUENCY FOR A ONE YEAR DURATION. THE GRANTEE WILL SUBMIT AIR TOXICS COLLOCATED, DUPLICATE AND REPLICATE DATA, AS APPLICABLE, TO THE AIR QUALITY SYSTEM (AQS) DATABASE WITHIN 180 DAYS AFTER THE END OF THE QUARTER.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE A COLLECTION OF A YEAR'S WORTH OF AMBIENT AIR TOXIC'S DATA THAT WILL BE SUBMITTED TO AIR QUALITY SYSTEM (AQS) DATA REPOSITORY. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: CHARACTERIZING AMBIENT LEVELS OF AIR TOXICS WITHIN COMMUNITIES, AREAS OR REGIONS; PROVIDING QUALITY ASSURED HAP DATA FOR TRENDS DETERMINATION; DIRECTLY EVALUATING PUBLIC EXPOSURE AND ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS IN THE VICINITY OF MONITORS; PROVIDING QUALITY ASSURED HAPS DATA FOR RISK CHARACTERIZATION; ASSESSING THE EFFECTIVENESS OF SPECIFIC EMISSION REDUCTION ACTIVITIES; AND EVALUATING AND SUBSEQUENTLY IMPROVING AIR TOXICS EMISSION INVENTORIES AND MODEL PERFORMANCE. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS IN BOUNTIFUL, UT WHO WILL HAVE A INCREASE KNOWLEDGE OF RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE SPIRIT LAKE TRIBE IN ITS EFFORTS TO IMPLEMENT THE CLEAN AIR ACT 103 REGULATION THROUGHOUT THE SPIRIT LAKE RESERVATION AND AIRSHED.  ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE THE MONITORING OF AIR QUALITY, DATA QUALITY CONTROL ACTIVITIES, ATTENDING ENVIRONMENTALLY-RELATED TRAININGS AND MEETINGS, CONDUCTING ENVIRONMENTAL OUTREACH AND GRANT WRITING, AND OTHER AIR PLANNING ACTIVITIES.  THESE ACTIVITIES ARE TO IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN THE PUBLIC'S AIR QUALITY.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS TO THE EPA, THE APPROPRIATE AND EFFECTIVE MANAGEMENT OF EPA FUNDING, AND MEASURES TO IMPROVE AND PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.  THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE THE CITIZENS AND RESIDENTS OF SPIRIT LAKE RESERVATION.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.   ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL UPGRADE ONE PM2.5 MONITOR.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING A CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR TO REPLACE A FILTER-BASED PM2.5 MONITOR. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

WITH THIS FUNDING THE UTAH DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY WILL CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING AND A HEALTH RISK ASSESSMENT OF ETHYLENE OXIDE EMISSIONS FROM MAJOR COMMERCIAL STERILIZERS IN UTAH. RECENT EPIDEMIOLOGICAL STUDIES SHOWED THAT ETHYLENE OXIDE IS A MORE POTENT CARCINOGEN THAN PREVIOUSLY DOCUMENTED, RESULTING IN AN UPDATE TO THE INHALATION RISK ESTIMATE FOR ETHYLENE OXIDE. THIS RESULTED IN THE IDENTIFICATION OF ETHYLENE OXIDE AS A POTENTIAL HEALTH CONCERN IN SEVERAL AREAS ACROSS THE UNITED STATES, INCLUDING IN THE STATE OF UTAH. MODELING RESULTS FROM THE 2014 NATIONAL AIR TOXICS ASSESSMENT INDICATE AN INCREASED POTENTIAL CANCER RISK FROM ETHYLENE OXIDE FOR SEVERAL CENSUS TRACKS ACROSS THE UNITED STATES DUE TO EMISSIONS FROM 26 FACILITIES, INCLUDING TWO IN UTAH. THE FIRST IS A MEDICAL STERILIZATION FACILITY LOCATED IN CLOSE PROXIMITY OF THE SALT LAKE CITY INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT. THE OTHER IS A MEDICAL DEVICE MANUFACTURING PLANT LOCATED IN SANDY, UTAH WHO USES ETHYLENE OXIDE TO STERILIZE THE MEDICAL EQUIPMENT IT MANUFACTURES. TO CHARACTERIZE AMBIENT EMISSION OF ETHYLENE OXIDE FROM THE FACILITIES AND ASSESS THEIR HEALTH IMPACT ON SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES, THE UTAH DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY IS PROPOSING TO CONDUCT AMBIENT MONITORING IN THE VICINITY OF THE TWO FACILITIES. 24-HOUR CANISTER MEASUREMENTS WILL BE COLLECTED AT MULTIPLE SAMPLING SITES, LOCATED NEAR AND AT DIFFERENT DISTANCES FROM THE STERILIZATION FACILITIES. MEASURED AMBIENT DATA WILL THEN BE USED IN A HEALTH RISK ASSESSMENT ANALYSIS TO IDENTIFY CANCER AND NON-CANCER RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH THE EXPOSURE TO ETHYLENE OXIDE FROM THESE FACILITIES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO MAINTAIN FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) MONITORING NETWORKS.  THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED DATA ON AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF PM2.5 AS WELL AS CHEMICAL COMPOSITION AND PRECURSORS. DATA WILL BE USED FOR: (1) PROVIDING AIR POLLUTION DATA TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN A TIMELY MANNER, (2) PM2.5 NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) COMPARISONS, (3) DEVELOPMENT AND TRACKING OF IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, (4) ASSESSMENTS OF REGIONAL HAZE, AND (5) ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH STUDIES AND OTHER AMBIENT AEROSOL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. THE PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORK DESIGN ADDRESSES THESE FOUR PROGRAM OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMBINATION OF SITING AND INSTRUMENTATION STRATEGIES. ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND SUBMIT RESULTS TO EPA'S NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED SHORT-TERM OUTCOME FOR THIS PROJECT IS AN INCREASE IN THE KNOWLEDGE REGARDING THE CHARACTER AND EXTENT OF PM2.5 IN THE AMBIENT AIR. THE LONG-TERM OUTCOME, THROUGH THE EVENTUAL DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THE STATE'S IMPLEMENTATION PLAN, IS REDUCED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH THE PM2.5 NAAQS AS SET FORTH IN THE CLEAN AIR ACT.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE STATE RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

THIS AWARD PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE TO OPERATE AND MAINTAIN A NETWORK TO MONITOR AMBIENT LEVELS AT SITES WITHIN THE STATE, MAINTAIN A DATABASE AND REPORT RESULTS TO THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.   ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL BE UPGRADING:12 MONITORS; 6 SHELTERS; 1 DATALOGGER AND METEOROLOGICAL EQUIPMENT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR(S) TO REPLACE FILTER-BASED PM2.5 MONITOR(S). EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE AMBIENT AIR TOXICS MEASUREMENTS UNDER THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS STATION (NATTS) NETWORK. THE NATTS NETWORK TRACKS TRENDS IN AIR TOXICS LEVELS TO FACILITATE MEASURING PROGRESS TOWARD EMISSION AND RISK REDUCTION GOALS.ACTIVITIES:WITH THIS FUNDING, MODNR WILL CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING AT ITS NATTS IN ST. LOUIS.  AMBIENT AIR SAMPLES WILL BE COLLECTED BY THE MODNR AND SENT TO EPA'S NATIONAL CONTRACTOR LABORATORY FOR ANALYSIS.  THE RECIPIENT WILL COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED AIR TOXICS SAMPLES FOR SELECTED HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS AND SUBMIT RESULTS TO THE NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:LONG-TERM MONITORING OF AMBIENT AIR TOXICS LEVELS FACILITATES THE IDENTIFICATION OF AREAS OF CONCERN, CHARACTERIZATION OF RISK, AND TRACKING OF PROGRESS TOWARD IMPROVED AIR QUALITY. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF MISSOURI WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION: THE PURPOSE OF THIS INFLATION REDUCTION ACT FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO RELOCATE SANTEE SIOUX NATION'S CASTNET, NADP MDN, AND AMON AIR QUALITY MONITORING STATIONS. THIS WILL IMPROVE ACCESS AND ABILITY FOR SANTEE SIOUX NATION TO MONITOR AND COLLECT AIR QUALITY DATA ON TRIBAL LAND. ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO IMPROVE THE ACCESSIBILITY OF SANTEE SIOUX NATION'S  AIR QUALITY MONITORING STATIONS FOR REGULAR DATA COLLECTION AND MAINTENANCE. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL HIRE WPS USA TO PREPARE THE NEW AIR MONITORING SITE ADJACENT TO THE ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE AND RELOCATING THE CASTNET, NADP MDN, AND AMON AIR QUALITY STATION.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE HIRING WPS USA TO PREPARE THE NEW AIR MONITORING SITE ADJACENT TO THE ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE AND RELOCATING THE CASTNET, NADP MDN, AND AMON AIR QUALITY STATION.

EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A NEW AIR QUALITY MONITORING STATION LOCATION ADJACENT TO SANTEE SIOUX NATION'S OFFICE OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION, ALLOWING CONSISTENT DATA COLLECTION AND EQUIPMENT MAINTENANCE.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE TRIBAL CITIZENS OF SANTEE SIOUX NATION AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE-RELATED PROJECTS AIMED AT IMPROVING AIR QUALITY AND REDUCING LOCALIZED POLLUTION AND HEALTH IMPACTS.
SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL IMPLEMENT TWO PROJECTS AS PART OF THIS GRANT APPLICATION. PROJECT NO. 1 INVOLVES CONDUCTING TOXICS AMBIENT AIR MONITORING IN DOWNTOWN KANSAS CITY. PROJECT NO. 2 FOCUSES ON DEPLOYING AND EVALUATING LOW-COST AND MID-COST AIR MONITORS AT EXISTING MONITORING SITES IN MISSOURI TO ASSESS THEIR EFFECTIVENESS AND POTENTIAL USE IN FUTURE AIR QUALITY CHARACTERIZATION EFFORTS.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PURCHASING EQUIPMENT AND ESTABLISHING A TOXICS MONITORING STATION IN KANSAS CITY, COMPARING THE COLLECTED DATA WITH AN EXISTING MONITORING SITE, IDENTIFYING HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS OF CONCERN, AND GENERATING A COMPREHENSIVE REPORT AT THE END OF THE ONE-YEAR SAMPLING PERIOD. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PURCHASE AND DEPLOY LOW-COST AND MID-COST AIR MONITORS AT VARIOUS LOCATIONS, COMPARING THEIR READINGS WITH THOSE FROM STANDARD MONITORING EQUIPMENT, ASSESSING DURABILITY AND MAINTENANCE REQUIREMENTS, AND UTILIZING THE GATHERED INFORMATION TO INFORM THE PUBLIC.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE ESTABLISHMENT AND OPERATION OF A TOXICS MONITORING STATION IN KANSAS CITY, DATA COMPARISON REPORTS, AN EVALUATION OF LOW-COST AND MID-COST AIR MONITORS, AND A FINAL PROJECT REPORT SUMMARIZING THE FINDINGS AND RECOMMENDATIONS.
THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF AIR QUALITY IN DOWNTOWN KANSAS CITY, IDENTIFICATION OF HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS, EVALUATION OF LOW-COST AND MID-COST MONITORING TECHNOLOGIES, AND INCREASED PUBLIC AWARENESS REGARDING THE USE OF SUCH MONITORS TO GATHER INFORMATION ABOUT AIR QUALITY.
THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE RESIDENTS OF DOWNTOWN KANSAS CITY AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED AIR QUALITY INFORMATION, AS WELL AS THE BROADER POPULATION OF MISSOURI WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE EVALUATION AND POTENTIAL FUTURE DEPLOYMENT OF LOW-COST AND MID-COST AIR MONITORS IN AREAS WITHOUT REGULATORY MONITORING.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT (KDHE).  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO IMPROVE AIR QUALITY AND MONITORING CAPABILITIES FOR THE STATE OF KANSAS.
SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL ENHANCE AND UPGRADE CURRENT AIR MONITORING EFFORTS TO REDUCE INSTRUMENT DOWNTIME, INCREASE DATA COMPLETENESS REQUIREMENTS, AND PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR PLANNING AND PREPARATION FOR IMPLEMENTING OTHER IRA PROVISIONS.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE PURCHASES OF PM2.5 MONITORING EQUIPMENT, COMMUNICATIONS EQUIPMENT, AND VARIOUS SPARE PARTS. 
SPECIFICALLY, THE PURCHASE OF A SPARE INSTRUMENTS, NEW SAMPLERS, AND VARIOUS PARTS TO REBUILD AN AGING MONITORING EQUIPMENT INVENTORY AND UPGRADES TO AN EXISTING MONITORING SITES.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE UPGRADED MONITORING EQUIPMENT AND MONITORING SITES FOR IMPROVED AIR QUALITY DATA. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF KANSAS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO IOWA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES. THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO IMPROVE AIR QUALITY AND AIR MONITORING CAPABILITIES FOR THE STATE OF IOWA.

ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ESTABLISHING OF A NEW AIR OZONE MONITORING SITE AND PROVIDING ENHANCED AIR DATA QUALITY. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PROGRESS REPORTS EVERY SIX MONTHS, ESTABLISHMENT OF A NEW OZONE MONITORING SITE, TWO NEW OZONE MONITORS, AND INCREASED DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVED, HIGH-QUALITY AIR MONITORING DATA WHICH WILL BE UTILIZED TO PROMOTE PUBLIC HEALTH. DATA FROM THE AIR MONITORS WILL BE UTILIZED TO GENERATE AIR QUALITY MAPS TO PROVIDE INCREASED AWARENESS FOR MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE NEBRASKA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND ENERGY. THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO IMPROVE AIR MONITORING CAPABILITIES IN NEBRASKA.ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE RESTORING THE IMPROVE AIR MONITORING SITE IN THE NEBRASKA NATIONAL FOREST IN HALSEY, NEBRASKA, ENHANCING THE CONTINUOUS MONITORING CAPABILITIES IN DOUGLAS COUNTY, NEBRASKA, AND TRAINING AIR PERMIT WRITERS IN AIR DISPERSION MODELING.SUBRECIPIENT:THE ELECTRICAL UTILITY LINE WILL BE SUB-AWARDED TO THE USDA FOREST SERVICE BY THE NEBRASKA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND ENERGY DUE TO A NECESSARY PRE-EXISTING CONTRACTUAL RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE UTILITY AND THE USDA FOREST SERVICE. THIS COST WAS MOVED FROM THE CONTRACTUAL CATEGORY BY THE PROJECT OFFICER TO THE 'OTHER' CATEGORY AS A SUBAWARD AS A PEN AND INK CHANGE. EMAILS TO THE RECIPIENT CONFIRMING THIS PEN AND INK CHANGE TO THE WORKPLAN AND BUDGET AND ASSOCIATED JUSTIFICATION WILL BE REFLECTED IN THE GRANT FILES DOCUMENTATION. PER THE UPDATED WORKPLAN, USDA IS TO RECEIVE THE SUBAWARD AND USE THEIR PRE-EXISTING CONTRACT WITH THE UTILITY FOR PAYMENT TO THE UNDERGROUND ELECTRICAL LINE AND TRANSFORMER. OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PROGRESS REPORTS EVERY SIX MONTHS, AIR DISPERSION MODELING TRAINING, A REBUILT AND RESTORED MONITORING SITE, A NEW CONTINUOUS PARTICULATE AIR MONITOR, AND INCREASED DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE BETTER TRAINED PERSONNEL AND MORE PUBLIC ACCESS TO AIR QUALITY DATA. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF NEBRASKA AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO MAINTAIN FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) MONITORING NETWORKS.  THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED DATA ON AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF PM2.5 AS WELL AS CHEMICAL COMPOSITION AND PRECURSORS. DATA WILL BE USED FOR: (1) PROVIDING AIR POLLUTION DATA TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN A TIMELY MANNER, (2) PM2.5 NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) COMPARISONS, (3) DEVELOPMENT AND TRACKING OF IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, (4) ASSESSMENTS OF REGIONAL HAZE, AND (5) ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH STUDIES AND OTHER AMBIENT AEROSOL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. THE PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORK DESIGN ADDRESSES THESE FOUR PROGRAM OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMBINATION OF SITING AND INSTRUMENTATION STRATEGIES. ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND SUBMIT RESULTS TO EPA'S NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE. SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS WILL BE PROVIDED TO LINN AND POLK COUNTIES TO ASSIST IN THE COLLECTION OF DATA.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED SHORT-TERM OUTCOME FOR THIS PROJECT IS AN INCREASE IN THE KNOWLEDGE REGARDING THE CHARACTER AND EXTENT OF PM2.5 IN THE AMBIENT AIR. THE LONG-TERM OUTCOME, THROUGH THE EVENTUAL DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THE STATE'S IMPLEMENTATION PLAN, IS REDUCED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH THE PM2.5 NAAQS AS SET FORTH IN THE CLEAN AIR ACT.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE STATE RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THIS AWARD FUNDS  THE WINNEBAGO TRIBE IN BUILDING THE INFRASTRUCTURE NEEDED TO SUPPORT NEW AIR MONITORING STATIONS INCLUDING METEOROLOGIC, MERCURY, AND PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5).ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL USE THESE FUNDS TO HIRE CONTRACTORS TO BUILD OUT A NEW AIR MONITORING SITE ON TRIBAL LANDS (CONCRETE WORK, ELECTRICAL, LAND SELECTION, TOWER ERECTION, AND EQUIPMENT INSTALLATION) WITH THE GOAL OF MONITORING THE AIRSHED FOR THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITY.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES: DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE COMPLETE BUILDOUT OF AN AIR MONITORING STATION INCLUDING PM2.5, METEOROLOGIC, AND MERCURY STATIONS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: DATA COLLECTION OF LOCAL CLIMATE, MERCURY LEVELS, AND FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

THIS GRANT WILL SUPPORT MEMBER STATES' AIR POLLUTION CONTROL PROGRAMS TO UNDERSTAND AND ADDRESS AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS IN THE GREAT LAKES REGION. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: CONDUCTING DATA ANALYSES TO FURTHER ENHANCE KNOWLEDGE OF REGIONAL AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS, INCLUDING UPDATING CONCEPTUAL MODELS FOR O3, PM2.5, AND REGIONAL HAZE AND PERFORMING BACK TRAJECTORY AND TRENDS ANALYSES; PROVIDING TECHNICAL SUPPORT ON AIR QUALITY ISSUES SUCH AS ANALYZING MONITORING AND MODELING DATA AND QUANTIFYING THE CO-BENEFITS OF REDUCING EMISSIONS THAT IMPACT AIR QUALITY AND CLIMATE; CONDUCTING REGIONAL COORDINATION AND OUTREACH; SPONSOR TRAINING COURSES AND ORGANIZE WORKSHOPS TO IMPROVE THE TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF MEMBER STATES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN (ARP) FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL PRIMARILY BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS. THE FUNDS MAY BE USED TO ADDRESS OTHER CONSIDERATIONS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES WITH FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. THE FUNDS MAY BE USED TO ADDRESS OTHER CONSIDERATIONS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN (ARP) FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR WEST VIRGINIAN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.

THIS ACTION PROVIDES FEDERAL FUNDS OF $491,000. FEDERAL FUNDS OF $2,500 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.ACTIVITIES:ARP FUNDS WILL PRIMARILY BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN WEST VIRGINIA AND IN NEARBY COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS. FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES WITH FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. FUNDS MAY ALSO BE USED TO ADDRESS OTHER CONSIDERATIONS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, AND UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR(S) TO REPLACE FILTER-BASED PM2.5 MONITOR(S) AND UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE THE FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS THAT WILL PROVIDE ALL WEST VIRGNINAN COMMUNITIES WITH FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS IN WEST VIRGINIA WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $136,026 TO PROVIDE AMBIENT AIR TOXICS MEASUREMENTS UNDER THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS STATION (NATTS) NETWORK.  THE NATTS NETWORK TRACKS TRENDS IN AIR TOXICS LEVELS TO FACILITATE MEASURING PROGRESS TOWARD EMISSION AND RISK REDUCTION GOALS.  FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $245,452 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED AIR TOXICS SAMPLES FOR SELECTED HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS AND SUBMIT RESULTS TO THE NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:LONG-TERM MONITORING OF AMBIENT AIR TOXICS LEVELS FACILITATES THE IDENTIFICATION OF AREAS OF CONCERN, CHARACTERIZATION OF RISK, AND TRACKING OF PROGRESS.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE THE STATE OF VIRGINIA RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO FUND PENNSYLVANIA ASTHMA CONTROL PROGRAM'S INDOOR AIR QUALITY OUTREACH PROGRAM TO ADDRESS THE BURDEN OF ASTHMA IN THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA. IN THE NEW ASTHMA STRATEGIC PLAN, THE ASTHMA CONTROL PROGRAM (ACP) HAS DEVELOPED A VISION TO ACT COLLECTIVELY TO ADDRESS THE BURDEN OF ASTHMA IN PENNSYLVANIA WITH THESE GUIDING PRINCIPLES: EQUITY, COLLABORATIONS AND PARTNERSHIPS, ACCESS TO GUIDELINES-BASED CARE AND COMMUNITY SUPPORT SERVICES, PATIENT-CENTERED APPROACHES, DATA DRIVEN, AND THE SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH. THE ACP IS COMMITTED TO IMPLEMENTING STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS ASTHMA IN OVERBURDENED COMMUNITIES AND POPULATIONS AT HIGH-RISK FOR ASTHMA.  

THE PROJECT WILL BE DESIGNED TO DEMONSTRATE EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH APPROACHES THAT MAY BE USED SUCCESSFULLY IN THE FUTURE AND ON A BROADER SCALE (ADVANCING STATE/LOCAL POLICY OR SYSTEMS-LEVEL INITIATIVES) TO SIGNIFICANTLY ADDRESS INDOOR AIR QUALITY (IAQ) CONCERNS WITHIN COMMUNITIES.  BY THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD, ACP WILL ULTIMATELY CREATE A REPLICABLE AND SUSTAINABLE EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH APPROACH(S) TO EXPAND THE CAPACITY OF COMMUNITIES TO IMPROVE INDOOR AIR QUALITY.  ALL QUARTERLY REPORTS AND THE FINAL REPORT WILL INCLUDE LESSONS LEARNED, IDENTIFIED BARRIERS FROM THIS PILOT PROJECT AND RECOMMENDATIONS FOR DESIGNING FUTURE MEANINGFUL AND WORKABLE ACTION STEPS.
ACTIVITIES:THIS FUNDED PROJECT WILL ENABLE COMMUNITIES AND/OR LOCAL MUNICIPALITIES TO FIND LOCAL SOLUTIONS FOR THE DELIVERY AND SUSTAINABILITY OF IAQ INTERVENTIONS THROUGH EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH APPROACHES ON IAQ TOPICS SUCH AS IN-HOME ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENTS, ASTHMA TRIGGER REDUCTION, SECONDHAND SMOKE, MOLD, IAQ POLICY CHANGES IN SERVICE DELIVERY AND/OR SYSTEMS-LEVEL INITIATIVES TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF ASTHMA MANAGED CARE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THE PROJECT ARE NEW SYSTEM OR POLICY CHANGE FOR SUSTAINABLE IMPROVEMENT IN INDOOR AIR QUALITY IN THE PILOT COMMUNITY.  MORE PEOPLE HAVE WELL-CONTROLLED ASTHMA, FEWER ASTHMA ATTACKS, FEWER MISSED SCHOOL/WORKDAYS, AND FEWER ASTHMA-RELATED ED VISITS AND HOSPITALIZATIONS AS A RESULT OF THIS PROJECT. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF PENNSYLVANIA.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO MAINTAIN FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) MONITORING NETWORKS.  THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED DATA ON AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF PM2.5, AS WELL AS CHEMICAL COMPOSITION AND PRECURSORS. DATA WILL BE USED FOR: (1) PROVIDING AIR POLLUTION DATA TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN A TIMELY MANNER, (2) PM2.5 NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) COMPARISONS, (3) DEVELOPMENT AND TRACKING OF IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, (4) ASSESSMENTS OF REGIONAL HAZE, AND (5) ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH STUDIES AND OTHER AMBIENT AEROSOL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. THE PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORK DESIGN ADDRESSES THESE PROGRAM OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMBINATION OF SITING AND INSTRUMENTATION STRATEGIES. THIS ACTION PARTIALLY FUNDS THE GRANT IN THE AMOUNT OF $109,881.00. FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $219,762 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY OF ADDITIONAL FUNDING. ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND SUBMIT RESULTS TO EPA'S NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED SHORT-TERM OUTCOME FOR THIS PROJECT IS AN INCREASE IN THE KNOWLEDGE REGARDING THE CHARACTER AND EXTENT OF PM2.5 IN THE AMBIENT AIR. THE LONG-TERM OUTCOME, THROUGH THE EVENTUAL DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THE DISTRICT'S IMPLEMENTATION PLAN, IS REDUCED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH THE PM2.5 NAAQS AS SET FORTH IN THE CLEAN AIR ACT.  THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE DISTRICT RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO MAINTAIN FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) MONITORING NETWORKS.  THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT QUALITY-ASSURED DATA ON AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF PM2.5 AS WELL AS CHEMICAL COMPOSITION AND PRECURSORS. DATA WILL BE USED FOR: (1) PROVIDING AIR POLLUTION DATA TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN A TIMELY MANNER, (2) PM2.5 NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) COMPARISONS, (3) DEVELOPMENT AND TRACKING OF IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, (4) ASSESSMENTS OF REGIONAL HAZE, AND (5) ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH STUDIES AND OTHER AMBIENT AEROSOL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. THE PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORK DESIGN ADDRESSES THESE FOUR PROGRAM OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMBINATION OF SITING AND INSTRUMENTATION STRATEGIES.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE CITY OF PHILADELPHIA HEALTH DEPT. AIR MGMT. SERVICES (PHL AMS) TO SUPPORT THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TREND SITE (NATTS) PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT AND OPERATE A NATTS SITE TO FULFILL THE NEED FOR LONG-TERM HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS (HAPS) OR AIR TOXICS MONITORING DATA OF CONSISTENT QUALITY. THIS SITE IS PART OF A 27-SITE NATIONAL NETWORK OF AIR TOXICS MONITORING STATIONS. THE NETWORK IS TRACKING TRENDS IN AMBIENT AIR TOXICS LEVELS TO FACILITATE MEASURING PROGRESS TOWARD EMISSION AND RISK REDUCTION GOALS. THE MONITORING NETWORK IS INTENDED, OVER A SIX YEAR PERIOD, TO BE ABLE TO DETECT A 15% DIFFERENCE (TREND) BETWEEN TWO SUCCESSIVE 3 YEAR ANNUAL MEAN CONCENTRATIONS WITHIN ACCEPTABLE LEVELS OF DECISION ERROR. THIS GRANT ENABLES PHL AMS TO PROVIDE LABORATORY SUPPORT FOR THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TREND SITE (NATTS) IN WASHINGTON DC.  PHL AMS WILL USE THE GRANT FUNDS TO ANALYZE THE FILTERS FOR TO-11 (CARBONYLS).  THE BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF DC.

THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE SAINT REGIS MOHAWK TRIBE TO PERFORM A STUDY TO DETERMINE CONCENTRATIONS OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES IN THE AIR. DESCRIPTION:FUNDING IS PROVIDED TO THE NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION TO MAINTAIN AND OPERATE SPECIAL AIR TOXICS MONITORING PILOT STATIONS THAT ARE PART OF EPA'S NATIONAL TRENDS NETWORK THAT COLLECTS AND ANALYZES VARIOUS TOXIC POLLUTANTS IN THE ATMOSPHERE AT VARIOUS LOCATIONS WITHIN NEW YORK STATE. THE PROJECT ENTAILS THE COLLECTION OF AIR TOXICS MONITORING DATA FROM TWO NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TREND SITES IN ROCHESTER AND NEW YORK CITY.  THE DATA COLLECTED WILL BE SUBMITTED TO THE NATIONAL AIR DATABASE AND WILL HELP NEW YORK CHARACTERIZE AIR TOXICS TRENDS. THIS WORK IS BEING PERFORMED FOR THE BENEFIT OF CITIZENS IN NEW YORK.  ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL IMPLEMENT ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE SCOPE OF THE NATIONAL AIR TOXIC TREND SITE MONITORING PROGRAM. PRIMARILY THIS INCLUDES: 1) OPERATING AND MAINTAINING NATTS SITES IN THE STATE OF NY; 2) COLLECTING QUALITY-ASSURED AIR TOXICS DATA FROM THE MONITORING SITES; 3) DATA ANALYSIS AND MANAGEMENT.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:OUTCOMES INCLUDE AWARENESS OF AIR TOXICS IN THE ENVIRONMENT, WHETHER THERE ARE IMMEDIATE AND EMERGING THREATS TO PUBLIC HEALTH AND WELFARE FROM AIR TOXICS. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES WILL INCLUDE: NEW YORK STATE'S PERMANENT AND TEMPORARY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED EXPOSURE TO HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) AND OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.  ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS. THESE FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO ADDRESS PRIORITIES IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS. SPECIFICALLY NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION (NYDEC) WILL BE PURCHASING CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITORS, CALIBRATORS, DATA LOGGERS, AND MONITORING SHELTERS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) AND OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITORS TO REPLACE FILTER-BASED PM2.5 MONITORS, GAS CALIBRATORS, DATA LOGGERS, AND MONITORING SHELTERS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WHICH WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. CALIBRATORS, DATA LOGGERS, AND MONITORING SHELTERS WILL BE DEPLOYED TO MAINTAIN THE AIR MONITORING SYSTEM TO MEET THE DATA QUALITY OBJECTIVES. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION (NYSDEC) IN ITS EFFORTS TO MAINTAIN A MONITORING NETWORK FOR INHALABLE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) IN NY. THE PROJECT WILL ENTAIL FOCUSING ON OPERATING AND MAINTAINING PM2.5 MONITORS AND COLLECTING QUALITY-ASSURED DATA FROM THIS NETWORK. THIS PROJECT CONSTITUTES A SPECIAL SURVEY STUDY DONE BY THE NYSDEC (AN AIR POLLUTION CONTROL AGENCY). AIR QUALITY MONITORING DATA WILL BE COLLECTED AND EXPERIENCE AND OTHER KNOWLEDGE OBTAINED REGARDING THE OPERATION OF PM2.5 SAMPLING EQUIPMENT. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ARE THE CITIZENS OF NEW YORK.

THE ICAHN SCHOOL OF MEDICINE, THROUGH ITS REGION 2 PEDIATRIC ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH SPECIALTY UNIT (PEHSU) AT MOUNT SINAI, WILL DEVELOP AND DISSEMINATE EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS AND SUPPLIES TO BUILD KNOWLEDGE RELATED TO THE HEALTH EFFECTS OF WOOD BURNING WITHIN TRIBAL AND EJ COMMUNUTIES. IMPROPER BURNING OF WOOD CAN EXPOSE COMMUNITIES TO HARMFUL AIR POLLUTANTS AND HAVE SHORT AND LONG-TERM HEALTH EFFECTS. IN-PERSON OR VIRTUAL TUTORIALS WILL REDUCE THE ASTHMA AND RESPIRATORY BURDEN DUE TO WOOD SMOKE AND INDOOR AIR QUALITY ISSUES RESULTING FROM IMPROPERLY BURNED WOOD.
