DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO VADEQ.  THE PROJECT TO BE FUNDED, VA DEQ NETWORK IMPROVEMENT AND EXPANSION PROJECT, WILL IMPROVE AND EXPAND THE ESTABLISHED VADEQ  AIR MONITORING NETWORK. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THE GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDE PURCHASING IMPROVED OZONE QUALITY ASSURANCE THROUGH UPGRADED HARDWARE, IMPROVED INFRASTRUCTURE TO SUPPORT CONTINUOUS PM2.5 INSTRUMENTATION NETWORK, AND INSTALLING A NEW OZONE MONITORING SITE IN PREVIOUSLY UNMONITORED AREA.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT ARE QUALITY ASSURED OZONE DATA THAT MEETS NEWLY REVISED EPA MANDATED OZONE QUALITY ASSURANCE REQUIREMENTS FROM THE UPDATED NETWORK HARDWARE, AND THE EXPANSION OF THE CURRENT PM2.5 NETWORK SINCE THE RESULT OF THIS ADDITION WILL BE TO EXPAND THE VIRGINIA OZONE AND PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORKS INTO THE SOUTHSIDE REGION OF VIRGINIA. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE CITIZENS ACROSS THE ENTIRE STATE OF VIRGINIA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE AIR QUALITY DIVISION OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA'S DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT FOR THREE PROJECTS: 1) ESTABLISHING A REGIONAL WORKING GROUP TO PROMOTE COLLABORATION BETWEEN THE DISTRICT GOVERNMENT AND LOCAL ATMOSPHERIC SCIENTISTS AND RESEARCHERS; 2) COMMUNITY OUTREACH TO INFORM THE PUBLIC ON THE IMPACTS OF AIR QUALITY AND INFLUENCE PUBLIC BEHAVIOR TO HELP IMPROVE AIR QUALITY; AND 3) FUND SIXTY-FIVE PERCENT OF ONE FULL-TIME STAFF MEMBER TO PERFORM MONITORING TASKS MOST SPECIFICALLY FOR THE NEW AMBIENT AIR MONITORING STATIONS THAT ARE BEING DEPLOYED WITH AN ARPA DIRECT AWARD AND ARPA COMPETITIVE GRANT FUNDS.ACTIVITIES:THE FIRST PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP A REGIONAL WORKING GROUP, COMPRISED OF LOCAL ATMOSPHERIC AND CLIMATE SCIENTISTS, TO ADDRESS AIR QUALITY AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE ISSUES. THE WORKING GROUP WILL BE SPEARHEADED BY THE DISTRICT'S DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT AIR QUALITY DIVISION. THE SECOND PROJECT IS COMMUNITY AND STAKEHOLDER OUTREACH WITH THE GOAL OF INCREASING PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE ABOUT THE NEGATIVE EFFECTS OF AIR POLLUTION. OUTREACH WOULD INCLUDE INFORMING STAKEHOLDERS ABOUT LOCAL SOURCES OF AIR POLLUTION, AND CHANGES IN INDIVIDUAL BEHAVIOR THAT IMPROVE AIR QUALITY, E.G., PROMOTING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION AND BIKING OVER DRIVING, CONSERVING ELECTRICITY AND CHOOSING ELECTRIC LAWN EQUIPMENT INSTEAD OF GAS-POWERED. IN THE FIRST QUARTER OF THE GRANT PERIOD, THE AIR QUALITY DIVISION ALONGSIDE THE DOEE COMMUNICATIONS TEAM, WILL DRAFT A STRATEGIC COMMUNICATIONS PLAN TO OUTLINE HOW WE INTEND TO MEET THESE GOALS. THE THIRD PROJECT WILL FUND SIXTY-FIVE PERCENT OF ONE FULL-TIME EMPLOYEE (FTE) CS9 ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION SPECIALIST STAFF TO SUPPORT THE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE NEW AMBIENT AIR MONITORING STATIONS THAT DOEE WILL PLACE THROUGHOUT OVERBURDENED ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES, INCLUDING WARD 8.SUBRECIPIENT:DC'S  AIR QUALITY DIVISION WILL WORK WITH LOCAL NON-PROFITS, COMMUNITY GROUPS, ADVISORY NEIGHBORHOOD COMMISSIONS (ANCS), FAITH-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, AND OTHERS TO SET UP COMMUNITY MEETINGS AND OTHER EVENTS TO DISCUSS AIR QUALITY IN THEIR NEIGHBORHOOD. SUBTOPICS MAY INCLUDE HOW AIR QUALITY IMPACTS HEALTH, WAYS TO MITIGATE AIR POLLUTION, AND TO BUILD RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND AQD STAFF. WE WILL ALSO PROVIDE INFORMATION ON WHAT THE AIR QUALITY DIVISION OF THE DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT DOES AND HOW WE CAN BE OF USE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES.OUTCOMES:THE EXPECTED DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED OUTREACH TO THE PUBLIC, MORE STAFF TIME PAID UNDER THE PROJECT, AND ADDITIONAL COMMUNICATION ADDRESSING AIR QUALITY. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AND THE STAFF AT DC DOEE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT AGREEMENT PROVIDES FEDERAL FUNDING TO PADEP TO RESEARCH/TEST TECHNOLOGIES FOR USE IN INSPECTING BOTH CONVENTIONAL AND UNCONVENTIONAL NATURAL GAS FACILITIES AS WELL AS OTHER POTENTIAL SOURCES OF METHANE (LANDFILLS, COAL MINING, ETC.). PENNSYLVANIA HAS OVER 14,000 ACTIVE UNCONVENTIONAL WELLS SITES AND OVER 80,000 ACTIVE CONVENTIONAL WELL SITES. THE RECIPIENT WILL SELECT AND PURCHASE AT LEAST TEN INSTRUMENTS TO BE USED IN REGIONAL OFFICES BY AIR QUALITY INSPECTORS AND OILAND GAS STAFF IN INSPECTIONS OF SOURCES WITH POTENTIAL METHANE EMISSIONS. THE RESULTS OF INSPECTIONS USING SPECIFIC TYPES OF EQUIPMENT WILL BE DOCUMENTED IN TERMS OF LEAKING/NON-LEAKING AND, IF FOUND TO BE LEAKING, A QUANTIFYING READING WILL BE TAKEN AND DOCUMENTED. THE OVERALL GOAL OF THE PROJECT BEING TO BUILD UP A DATASET REGARDING LIKELIHOOD OF EMISSIONS FROM EQUIPMENT FOUND AT EACH TYPE OF INSPECTION.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INVOLVE TESTING NATURAL GAS FACILITIES. RECENT STUDIES CONDUCTED BY OR IN PARTNERSHIP WITH PADEP (METHANE OVERFLIGHT STUDY, DRONE STUDY OF METHANE EMISSIONS, AND VEHICLE MOUNTED METHANE SURVEY) HAVE EACH DEMONSTRATED A DIRECT CORRELATION BETWEEN NATURAL GAS EXTRACTION AND METHANE EMISSIONS INTO THE ATMOSPHERE. WHILE SOME ASPECTS OF THE NATURAL GAS INDUSTRY ARE REGULATED BY THE DEPARTMENT, SEVERAL LEAKS OF METHANE RESULTING IN POSSIBLY LARGE AMOUNTS OF FUGITIVE EMISSIONS STILL OCCUR. THE DEPARTMENT HAS RECENTLY ENACTED REGULATIONS THAT WILL COVER THOUSANDS OF PREVIOUSLY UNREGULATED CONVENTIONAL WELLS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COORDINATE A SYSTEMATIC INSPECTION PROCEDURE WHICH WILL UTILIZE TECHNOLOGY FOR DETECTING AND QUANTIFYING EMISSIONS AT NATURAL GAS WELLS, ASSOCIATED INFRASTRUCTURE, AND OTHER REGULATED POTENTIAL SOURCES OF METHANE. DEPARTMENT STAFF WILL THEN WORK TO CREATE A DATASET WHICH WILL ENABLE FIELD STAFF TO DETERMINE EQUIPMENT TYPES MOST LIKELY TO HAVE LEAKS AND THE RELATIVE SIZE OF THOSE LEAKS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES FOR THIS PROJECT INCLUDE PLANNING AND PREPARATION FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF EQUIPMENT AND INSPECTION RECORD KEEPING BY REGIONAL AND CENTRAL OFFICE STAFF; PLANNING, CONTROLLING, AND MONITORING EXPENDITURES OF STATE/FEDERAL FINANCIAL RESOURCES; COOORDINATING THE DEVELOPMENT OF PERFORMANCE REPORTS AND SUBMIT TO EPA; AND, IMPROVED DECISION MAKING BASED ON A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF DATA COLLECTED REGARDING NUMBER AND SIZE OF METHANE LEAKS DETECTED. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF PENNSYLVANIA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO WVDEP. THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT ARE TO PROMOTE AND ENHANCE ACTIVITIES OUTLINED IN SECTION 103, INCLUDING MONITORING OF PM2.5, AIR TOXICS, AND OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS; INVESTIGATIONS OF THE CAUSES, EFFECTS, EXTENT, PREVENTION, AND CONTROL OF AIR POLLUTION; ADDRESSING CITIZEN CONCERNS RELATED TO AIR POLLUTION, INCLUDING TECHNOLOGY-BASED RESPONSES AT COMMUNITY AND INDIVIDUAL RESIDENT LEVELS.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE OR PROVIDE FIVE (5) NEW HYBRID VEHICLES THAT WILL BE USED BY DIVISION OF AIR QUALITY (DAQ) STAFF. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO UPGRADE AIR MONITORING BUILDINGS THAT HOUSE STATIONARY EQUIPMENT USED IN ONGOING NAAQS AND AIR TOXICS MONITORING.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE REPORTING OF EXPENDITURES OF CAA GRANT FUNDS VIA COMPLETION OF PROCUREMENT OR TAKING DELIVERY OF REFERENCED EQUIPMENT OR COMPLETION OF SHELTER UPGRADES CONSISTENT WITH STATED GOALS AND OBJECTIVES FOR THE USE OF THE CAA GRANT UNDER IRA, SECTION 60105(F); REPORTING STATUS OF VEHICLE AND EQUIPMENT PURCHASES, INCLUDING: 1) BID DATES, 2) DELIVERY OR PROCUREMENT DATES, 3) INITIAL SERVICE DATES; AND REPORTING STATUS OF AIR MONITORING BUILDING UPGRADES.
THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE OPERATION OF REFERENCED EQUIPMENT AND COMPLETION OF SHELTER UPGRADES TO ENHANCE PERFORMANCE OF NAAQS AIR MONITORING AND COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS IN ACCORDANCE WITH EPA REQUIREMENTS TO ENSURE STATE RESIDENTS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET AIR QUALITY STANDARDS NECESSARY FOR RESPIRATORY HEALTH AND ENJOYMENT OF LIFE AND PROPERTY.  THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF WEST VIRGINIA AND THE STAFF OF WVDEP.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO ALLEGHENY COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT - AIR QUALITY TO SUPPORTS ITS OPERATIONAL GOALS.  THIS INCLUDES PROVIDING FUNDS FOR TECHNICAL SUPPORT CONCERNING THE MONITORING AND ANALYSIS FOR CRITERIA AND HAZARDOUS POLLUTANTS, PROVIDING TRAINING SUPPORT FOR LAB PERSONNEL TO INCREASE IN-HOUSE AIR SAMPLE ANALYSIS CAPACITY, PROVIDE FUNDS FOR ADVANCING KNOWLEDGE OF AIR POLLUTION SOURCES IN THE MON VALLEY REGION OF THE COUNTY BY VERIFY ACCURACY OF MONITORING EQUIPMENT AND TO SUPPORT CLIMATE RESILIENCY PLANNING EFFORTS..ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PLANNING AND PREPARATION FOR IMPLEMENTING OTHER GRANTS, INCLUDING OTHER IRA PROVISIONS; TRAINING OF LAB PERSONNEL ON NEW EQUIPMENT; ANALYSIS OF DISPARATE COMMUNITY IMPACTS FROM POLLUTION SOURCES IN THE MON VALLEY; AND CLIMATE RESILIENCY PLANNING.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED PARTICIPATION AND DEDICATED FOCUS TO IRA AND OTHER GRANT OPPORTUNITIES AVAILABLE TO ACHD - AIR QUALITY; INCREASED NUMBER OF STAFF TRAINED TO PROVIDE INCREASED SAMPLE ANALYSIS RESOURCES TO ADDRESS AGENCY MONITORING AND ANALYSIS NEEDS; INFORMED ANALYSIS OF AREAS THAT OBSERVED ELEVATED LEVELS OF MONITORED POLLUTANTS TO GUIDE POLICY, ENFORCEMENT, AND IMPROVE COMMUNITY AWARENESS; AND TO DEVELOP THE CLIMATE RESILIENCY STRATEGY AND CLIMATE RESILIENCY PLAN TEMPLATE. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF ALLEGHENY COUNTY AS WELL AS THE STAFF AT ACHD.

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO DELAWARE DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL (DNREC). THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ENSURE THE ONGOING SUCCESS OF DELAWARE'S AMBIENT AIR MONITORING PROGRAM.  THIS PROGRAM HAS EVOLVED OVER THE YEARS AS TECHNOLOGY HAS CHANGED AND AIR MONITORING REQUIREMENTS HAVE DEVELOPED.  DELAWARE'S PROGRAM HAS LONG STRUGGLED WITH EMPLOYEE RETENTION AT THE STAFF LEVEL.  MORE RECENTLY, SINCE 2020, DELAWARE'S PROGRAM HAS EXPERIENCED LOSS OF EXPERTISE THROUGH ATTRITION.  THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE SOME FUNDAMENTAL MANAGEMENT TOOLS AND RESOURCES THAT WILL PROVIDE FUTURE STABILITY OF THE PROGRAM IF/WHEN STAFF CHANGES OCCUR.  THESE FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO REPLACE CRITERIA POLLUTANT INSTRUMENTS AND MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS.  THE FUNDS MAY BE USED TO ADDRESS OTHER CONSIDERATIONS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS.  ACTIVITIES:AS A RECIPIENT OF THIS EPA GRANT, DNREC WILL CONDUCT DATA VALIDATION OF DATA COLLECTED FROM APRIL 2022 THROUGH DECEMBER 2022, INCLUDING SUBMISSION TO AQS; TRAINING FOR NEW QA STAFF; REVIEW OF EXISTING SOPS AND RECOMMENDATIONS FOR SOPS INCLUDING FUTURE MANAGEMENT; ESTABLISH THE USE OF MAINTAIN VIEW AND DEVELOP PROCEDURES FOR FUTURE MANAGEMENT OF THE SYSTEM; TRAINING ON MONITORING INSTRUMENTS AND SOPS; DEVELOP MAINTENANCE PLANS AND PROCEDURES FOR GENERAL EQUIPMENT OPERATION AND ESTABLISH A RECOMMENDED PARTS LIST TO ENSURE THAT EQUIPMENT REPAIRS CAN PROCEED IN A REASONABLE TIME FRAME; AND, PURCHASE REPLACEMENT AIR MONITORING INSTRUMENTS - CARBON MONOXIDE ANALYZER, OZONE CALIBRATOR, NO/NO2/NOX ANALYZERS (2), NO/NODIFF/NOY ANALYZER, ZERO AIR GENERATORS.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES FOR THIS GRANT ARE REPORTING OF EXPENDITURES OF IRA FUNDS VIA COMPLETION OF PROCUREMENT OR TAKING DELIVERY OF AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT FOR ENHANCING AMBIENT AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARD (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS CONSISTENT WITH STATED GOALS AND OBJECTIVES FOR THE USE OF INFLATION REDUCTION ACT FUNDING.  THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES OF THIS GRANT ARE THE OPERATION OF NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE DELAWARE RESIDENTS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF DELAWARE AND THE STAFF AT DNREC.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER INFLATION REDUCTION ACT TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.

THE GOAL OF THE OVERBROOK BREATHE RIGHT COMMUNITY AIR MONITORING PROJECT IS TO INCREASE AWARENESS OF AIR POLLUTION IN TARGETED ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES OF WEST PHILADELPHIA. WITH THE ENGAGEMENT OF COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN THE OVERBROOK / WYNNEFIELD / MILL CREEK / MANTUA COMMUNITIES, THE 'BREATHE RIGHT' PROJECT WILL MONITOR FIVE CRITERIA AIR POLLUTANTS AND ANALYZE SEVERAL HEAVY METALS INCLUDING LEAD IN PM2.5 TO BETTER INFORM COMMUNITY MEMBERS ABOUT THE STATE OF AIR POLLUTION IN THEIR NEIGHBORHOODS. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. THE ACTIVITIES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE COLLECTING, ANALYZING OF AIR SAMPLES, AND DISTRIBUTION OF RESULTS TO COMMUNITY MEMBERS. ANALYSIS OF FIVE TRACE GASES AND PARTICULATE MATTER CONCENTRATIONS (PM2.5 AND PM10) WILL HELP TO INFORM THE COMMUNITY ABOUT THE STATE OF AIR POLLUTION IN THE NEIGHBORHOODS. ADDITIONAL CHEMICAL CHARACTERIZATION OF PARTICULATE MATTER (HEAVY METALS INCLUDING PB) WILL HELP TO ASSESS EMISSION SOURCES AND TOXICITY OF PARTICULATE MATTER. LEAD HAS BEEN PROBLEMATIC THROUGHOUT PHILADELPHIA IN AIR POLLUTION THROUGHOUT THE CITY RELATED TO CONSTRUCTION, AMONG OTHER ACTIVITIES. THE BREATHE RIGHT PROJECT IS PROPOSING TWO-YEAR CONTINUOUS SAMPLING FOR PM2.5 AND PM10 AT 15 OUTDOOR SITES AND AN INTENSIVE, TWO-WEEK CAMPAIGN MEASURING TRACE GASES FROM 15 OUTDOOR SITES PER YEAR. A FOUR-WEEK INTENSIVE MEASUREMENT CAMPAIGN WILL ASSESS CHEMICAL CHARACTERISTICS OF PM2.5 (HEAVY METALS) AT ONE SITE EACH YEAR. WE WILL ALSO MEASURE PM2.5, PM10, AND FOUR TRACE GASES FROM 5 CO-LOCATED INDOOR ENVIRONMENTS. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL SHARE THE RESULTS IN COMMUNITY MEETINGS IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD ONCE PER YEAR IN MEETINGS AND ON THE OEEC WEBSITE. NEIGHBORHOOD COMMUNITY MEETINGS WILL BE ORGANIZED TOO. ADDITIONALLY, THEY WILL DEVELOP A WEBSITE FOR RESIDENTS TO CHECK THE STATUS OF AIR POLLUTION. SUBRECIPIENT:THE SUBAWARD WITH VILLANOVA UNIVERSITY WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT THE AIR SAMPLING PORTION OF THE PROJECT. THIS INCLUDES INSTALLING THE AIR MONITORS, COLLECTION OF SAMPLES, ANALYZING THE LAB SAMPLES, AND DISTRIBUTION OF THE RESULTS TO THE LARGER COMMUNITY. THE SUBAWARD TO THE ACADEMY OF NATURAL SCIENCES AND DREXEL UNIVERSITY ARE TO SUPPORT THE COMMUNITY-BASED PARTICIPATORY PROJECT. THE ACTIVITIES INVOLVED WILL INCLUDE INTERPRETING, TRANSLATING, AND CREATING VISUALIZATIONS OF THE PROJECT RESULTS FOR THE LARGER COMMUNITY. THE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO ISSUE SUBAWARD AGREEMENTS TO ITS PARTNERS IN COMPLIANCE WITH APPENDIX A OF EPA'S SUBAWARD POLICY.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES WILL COMPARE THE COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION DATA WITH THE EPA CENTRAL MONITORING STATION AND WILL PREPARE AIR QUALITY MAPS USING GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEM (GIS). THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY IS THE OVERBROOK NEIGHBORHOOD WHICH HAS A POPULATION OF ROUGHLY 43,172 PEOPLE, AND ITS GEOGRAPHY IS AN IMPORTANT PART OF ITS DEMOGRAPHICS; OVERBROOK IS IN AN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE NEIGHBORHOOD IN PHILADELPHIA, PENNSYLVANIA. KNOWLEDGE OF AIR POLLUTION RISKS AND EXPOSURE ALLOW FOR GREATER COMMUNITY ADVOCACY AND ACTION WITH CITY AND FEDERAL AGENCIES TO BETTER REGULATE AIR POLLUTION. SOME OF THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE COLLABORATIVE DATA COLLECTION OF FIVE CRI

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO MAINTAIN FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) MONITORING NETWORKS.  THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED DATA ON AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF PM2.5 AS WELL AS CHEMICAL COMPOSITION AND PRECURSORS. DATA WILL BE USED FOR: (1) PROVIDING AIR POLLUTION DATA TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN A TIMELY MANNER, (2) PM2.5 NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) COMPARISONS, (3) DEVELOPMENT AND TRACKING OF IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, (4) ASSESSMENTS OF REGIONAL HAZE, AND (5) ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH STUDIES AND OTHER AMBIENT AEROSOL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. THE PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORK DESIGN ADDRESSES THESE FOUR PROGRAM OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMBINATION OF SITING AND INSTRUMENTATION STRATEGIES.  

THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $487,631. FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $975,262 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE COLLECTING QUALITY ASSURED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND SUBMITTING RESULTS TO EPA'S NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED SHORT-TERM OUTCOME FOR THIS PROJECT IS AN INCREASE IN THE KNOWLEDGE REGARDING THE CHARACTER AND EXTENT OF PM2.5 IN THE AMBIENT AIR. THE LONG-TERM OUTCOME, THROUGH THE EVENTUAL DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THE STATE'S IMPLEMENTATION PLAN, IS REDUCED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH THE PM2.5 NAAQS AS SET FORTH IN THE CLEAN AIR ACT. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE STATE RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER INFLATION REDUCTION ACT TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.  THIS PROJECT AIMS TO UTILIZE A COLLABORATIVE PROCESS THAT ENGAGES RESIDENTS IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF A COMMUNITY AIR MONITORING NETWORK THAT ACHIEVES COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WHILE SUPPORTING RESEARCH, PUBLIC POLICY AND IMPROVED HEALTH OUTCOMES IN NEW CASTLE COUNTY, DELAWARE.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PREFORMED WILL SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR AIR QUALITY AND PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. 
 
SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL: ESTABLISH A COMMUNITY AIR MONITORING NETWORK (CAMN) OF 20 PM MONITORS IN NEW CASTLE COUNTY, DELAWARE; PROVIDE RESIDENTS WITH ACCURATE, REAL-TIME DATA ON AIR QUALITY IN THEIR COMMUNITIES; INTEGRATE A COLLABORATIVE COMMUNITY PROCESS THAT'S COMMUNITY-LED TO IDENTIFY AND SELECT MONITOR SITES, A MONITOR CALIBRATION AND VALIDATION PROCESS, AND SPATIAL ANALYSIS AS MECHANISMS TO INTEGRATE COMMUNITY AND SCIENTIFIC PRIORITIES INTO THE DESIGN OF THE NETWORK.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: HIRING SUPPORT STAFF AND CONSULTANTS; PURCHASING EQUIPMENT; TRAINING AND TESTING; PREPARATION FOR SITES AND FIELD MONITORING; MONITORING INTENSIVES; DATA ANALYSIS AND ASSESSMENT; PRELIMINARY ASSESSMENT REPORTS; AND FINAL REPORTS.

EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: ESTABLISHING A STEERING COMMITTEE; ESTABLISHING A COMMUNITY AIR MONITORING NETWORK (CAMN) THAT WOULD PROVIDE RESIDENTS WITH ACCURATE, REAL-TIME DATA ON AIR QUALITY IN THEIR COMMUNITIES THAT COULD ALSO BE USED IN SCIENTIFIC ANALYSES TO IDENTIFY LOCAL TRENDS AND HOTSPOTS; DEPLOYMENT OF 20 MONITORS WITHIN THE CAMN OVER A TWO-YEAR PERIOD, WITH SIGNIFICANT COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT THROUGHOUT; REAL-TIME CAMN DATA WILL BE MADE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE THROUGH THE AIR MONITORING WEBSITE; AN INTERACTIVE WEB MAP SHOWING REAL-TIME DATA FOR EACH SITE ALONG WITH SUMMARY DATA FOR INDIVIDUAL MONITORS, WILL BE AVAILABLE ON THE WEBSITE.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF NEW CASTLE COUNTY, DELAWARE, ALONG WITH THE GENERAL PUBLIC.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.

THIS PROJECT, COMMUNITY-DRIVEN IN ALL ASPECTS, WILL IDENTIFY AND IMPLEMENT AIR POLLUTION EXPOSURE AND RISK REDUCTION MEASURES BASED ON COMMUNITY RECOMMENDATIONS AND DATA FROM MULTI-POLLUTANT AIR SENSOR SUPERSITES IN THREE EJ COMMUNITIES. ACTIVITIES, OUTPUTS, AND OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS AND TRAINING; A COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP STEERING COMMITTEE GUIDING THE PROJECT; A TECHNICAL ADVISORY GROUP; COMMUNITY WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT; AIR SENSOR AND OTHER DATA ANALYSES, INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF AIR POLLUTION, AIR POLLUTION MONITORING AND MITIGATION, AND POLICY CHANGES. THIS INCLUDES DEPLOYMENT OF A HYPER-LOCAL NETWORK OF SENSORS, TRADITIONAL AIR MONITORING, AND OTHER MEASUREMENT AND FINGERPRINTING TECHNIQUES TO LINK MEASURED DATA TO SOURCES CONTRIBUTING TO HIGH EXPOSURES.
ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. 

SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL CREATE A STEERING COMMITTEE AND ESTABLISH COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS; CONDUCT SITE SELECTIONS AND DEPLOY AIR MONITORS IN 3 COMMUNITIES TO BUILD ON EXISTING AIR SENSOR NETWORKS; CONDUCT AIR DATA ANALYSIS; SOLICIT COMMUNITY INPUT TO IDENTIFY SPECIFIC SOURCES OR SOURCE CATEGORIES OF EXPOSURE AND IMPLEMENT REDUCTION STRATEGIES; CONDUCT CUMULATIVE IMPACTS ANALYSIS; AND, MAKE SITE VISITS AND INSPECTIONS.SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARD TO UMD FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROJECT: (1) $70,000 X 2 STUDENTS/STAFF X 2 YEARS TO DEPLOY AND MANAGE THE AIR SENSORS, ANALYZE RESULTS, AND CONDUCT COMMUNITY OUTREACH, TRAINING, AND PARTNERSHIP BUILDING WITH THE 3 COMMUNITIES AS DESCRIBED IN THE BUDGET NARRATIVE;OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE CREATION OF A STEERING COMMITTEE, INCLUDING EJ COMMUNITY REPRESENTATIVES TO OVERSEE AND MAKING PROJECT DECISIONS; WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT TRAININGS; COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT IN AIR SENSOR DEPLOYMENT, COLLECTION, AND MEASUREMENT; AIR SENSOR DATA ANALYSIS; INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF AIR POLLUTION MONITORING AND POLICY CHANGES; AND, STRENGTHENED COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE IDENTIFICATION AND DOCUMENTATION OF AIR POLLUTION EXPOSURE RISKS IN EJ COMMUNITIES; INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF AIR QUALITY POLLUTION, DISPARITIES, AND OPPORTUNITIES TO MITIGATE RISK; INCREASED ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND TOOLS VIA THE CUMULATIVE IMPACT ASSESSMENT TO BETTER UNDERSTAND AND REDUCE THE ENVIRONMENTAL AND HUMAN HEALTH RISKS; MITIGATION MEASURES FOR COMMUNITIES, STATE REGULATORS AND INDUSTRY TO REDUCE MOBILE, AREA SOURCE, AND/OR STATIONARY AIR POLLUTION SOURCES' EMISSIONS IN EJ COMMUNITIES; COMMUNITY ACTION PLAN TO HELP MITIGATE AIR POLLUTANT(S); CHANGES IN POLICIES REGARDING POLLUTION IN EJ COMMUNITIES; REDUCTION OF PROJECT'S AIR POLLUTANT EMISSIONS; AND, REDUCTION OF HUMAN EXPOSURE TO AIR POLLUTANT EMISSIONS.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS OF: CHEVERLY, MD; CURTIS BAY, MD; AND TURNER STATION, MD. THE BENEFITS WILL BE REDUCED AIR POLLUTION IN EJ COMMUNITIES AND IMPROVED LOCAL ISSUES, E.G., TRUCK TRAFFIC ROUTES AND STREET SWEEPING.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE RECIPIENT TO FUND A PROPOSED PILOT PROJECT TO DETERMINE IF PROVIDING LANDLORDS WITH A 50% REBATE FOR MITIGATING THEIR RENTAL PROPERTIES IS AN EFFECTIVE WAY TO INCREASE RADON TESTING AND MITIGATION IN A PREDOMINANTLY HISPANIC COMMUNITY OF RENTERS IN ALLENTOWN, PA.  THE GOAL IS TO SEE IF PROVIDING AN INCENTIVE OR REDUCED COST RADON MITIGATION SYSTEM WILL ENCOURAGE LANDLORDS TO TEST. THE ULTIMATE GOAL IS TO REDUCE RADON LEVELS IN HOMES AND SAVE LIVES FROM RADON INDUCED LUNG CANCER.  FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $12,917 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

ACTIVITIES:THE PROPOSED PLAN WILL INCLUDE IDENTIFYING LANDLORDS IN ALLENTOWN, PA WHO OWN RESIDENTIAL RENTAL PROPERTIES IN THE ZIP CODES 18101,18102, AND 18109, AND REQUESTING PERMISSION TO TEST THOSE PROPERTIES FOR RADON. IF THE RADON LEVELS ARE FOUND TO BE ABOVE THE 4 PCI/L ACTION LEVEL SET BY THE EPA, RADON EXHAUST SYSTEMS WILL BE INSTALLED AT 50% OF THE NORMAL MITIGATION COST. BIDS FOR MITIGATION COSTS WILL BE PROCURED FROM 2 RADON MITIGATION COMPANIES, AS REQUIRED BY MUHLENBERG COLLEGE. EPA FUNDING WILL BE USED TO FUND 50% OF THE MITIGATION PROJECT. WORK WILL COMMENCE ON JUNE 12, 2023 AND END ON JUNE 11, 2024.  THE PROJECT IS A COLLABORATION BETWEEN AN ACADEMIC INSTITUTION, (MUHLENBERG COLLEGE) AND A LOCAL COMMUNITY PARTNER (PROMISED NEIGHBORHOODS OF THE LEHIGH VALLEY). TO OUR KNOWLEDGE, THIS IS THE FIRST SUCH COLLABORATION FOR RADON MITIGATION IN THE COUNTRY. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE OUTCOMES WOULD BE: 1) RESIDENTS ARE MORE KNOWLEDGEABLE RADON, 2) HOMES ARE BEING MITIGATED IF OVER THE EPA RECOMMENDED ACTION LEVEL, 3) SAVING LIVES FROM RADON INDUCED LUNG CANCER, AND 4) DEVELOPING A PILOT PROJECT THAT COULD BE REPLICATED NATIONALLY THAT PROVIDES INCENTIVES TO LANDLORDS/TENANTS IN LOW INCOME AND SOCIAL ECONOMICALLY CHALLENGED COMMUNITIES.  INTENDED BENEFICIATES INCLUDE THE RESIDENTS IN THE ALLENTOWN ZIP CODES OF 18101, 18102 AND 18109.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT'S (DOEE) AIR QUALITY DIVISION FUNDING TO ESTABLISH A SHARED GOVERNANCE STRUCTURE TO PUT AIR QUALITY DATA AND DECISION MAKING IN THE HANDS OF COMMUNITIES WITH TECHNICAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT FROM THE AGENCY. DCDOEE WILL ACHIEVE THIS BY INSTALLING THREE NEW AIR QUALITY MONITORS IN OVERBURDENED COMMUNITIES TO MONITOR PM2.5 AND OZONE, EMPOWER FAMILIES LIVING IN NEIGHBORHOODS HISTORICALLY OVERBURDENED BY AIR QUALITY TO SHARE THEIR STORIES OF ENVIRONMENTAL INJUSTICE AND PERSONAL EXPERIENCES WITH AIR QUALITY IN THEIR ENVIRONMENTS, AND MAP BOTH NEW DATA SOURCES (ALONG WITH EXISTING AIR QUALITY DATA) IN AN ONLINE TOOL. DOEE WILL WORK WITH COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS TO CREATE AN AIR QUALITY ADVISORY BOARD TO PROVIDE GUIDANCE AND MAKE FINAL DECISIONS ABOUT THE ONLINE TOOL, COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT, AND THE LOCATION FOR AIR QUALITY SENSORS.


ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL INCLUDE ESTABLISHING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, CREATING AN ONLINE MAPPING TOOL FOR THE COMMUNITY TO UTILIZE, INSTALLING, AND MAINTAINING THREE, BRAND NEW AIR QUALITY MONITORS THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY, AND UPDATING THEIR EJ SCREENING TOOL.SUBRECIPIENT: STORY TELLING SUPPORT. A SUBGRANTEE WILL DEVELOP AND DELIVER WORKSHOPS TO DC RESIDENTS TO AID THEM 
IN RECALLING AND TELLING THEIR STORIES ON FILM ($8,000 TO DEVELOP AND STAFF WORKSHOPS). THE SUBGRANTEE
WILL ALSO GATHER ARCHIVAL ASSETS FROM RESIDENTS AND FROM HISTORICAL ARCHIVES. THE SUBGRANTEE WILL EDIT 
AND CATALOG VIDEOS SO THAT DOEE CAN USE THEM IN THE AIR QUALITY DATA DASHBOARD ($8,000). THE SERIES 
OF SHORT VIDEOS WILL BE SHOWN USING THE DC HUMANITIES TRUCK ($11,000). THE VIDEO SERIES WILL BE 
EDITED AND COMPILED INTO A SHORT FILM ($9,000 FOR EDITING/POST-PRODUCTION, $4,000 FOR OUTREACH 
(SUPPLIES AND ADVERTISEMENTS)). ANTICIPATED AWARD: $40,000

- AQAB MEMBERS. WE PLAN TO ISSUE A SUB-GRANT TO AN ORGANIZATION TO COORDINATE THE AQAB UP TO 15
AQAB MEMBERS WITH SIGNIFICANT EXPERIENCE WORKING WITH DC EJ COMMUNITIES. THE MEMBERS WOULD 
GUIDE THE WORK THROUGH AN EJ LENS, HELPING DOEE AND OTHER PARTNERS IDENTIFY POTENTIAL OPPORTUNITIES 
TO ADDRESS AND BE SENSITIVE TO INTERSECTIONAL HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL EQUITY ISSUES. ADDITIONALLY, 
THESE MEMBERS WOULD HELP DEVELOP EVALUATION METRICS FOR THE PROJECT, DEVELOP A LONG-TERM PLAN TO 
CARRY THE PROJECT INTO THE NEXT PHASE AND HELP DISSEMINATE PROJECT RESULTS. ANTICIPATED AWARD: 
$41,246.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITORS TO OVERBURDENED COMMUNITIES. SHORT TERM EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WHICH WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS AND OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. LONG TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, CHANGES IN HEALTH POLICIES AND REGULATIONS, AND ALIGNING COMMUNITY EXPERIENCES WITH REGULATION.  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS,

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER INFLATION REDUCTION ACT TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.

THE RECIPIENT WILL USE THESE FUNDS TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR AIR QUALITY AND PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND.ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE DEPLOYING 80+ LOW-COST PM MONITORS IN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES ACROSS 5 STATES, ANALYZING THIS DATA AND MAKING IT PUBLICLY AVAILABLE, AND SUPPORTING THESE COMMUNITIES' ENGAGEMENT IN LOCAL AND REGIONAL AIR QUALITY ISSUES. IN ADDITION, PROJECT PARTNERS WILL CONDUCT SO2/ VOC MONITORING IN TWO EJ COMMUNITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARD TO HOPE FOR COSTS OF SHIPPING SAMPLES.
SUBAWARD TO VIRGINIA TECH FOR STAFF TIME, MONITORING SUPPLIES, ANALYSIS, AND CALIBRATION.
THE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO ISSUE SUBAWARD AGREEMENTS TO ITS PARTNERS IN COMPLIANCE WITH APPENDIX A OF EPA'S SUBAWARD POLICY.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT; DEPLOYMENT OF MONITORS; PROVIDING QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS; PROVIDING ANNUAL REPORTS; WEBINARS; ARTICLES; SUBMITTING PARTNER COMMENTS; AND ISSUING PRESS RELEASES. THE EXPECTED OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE DEPLOYMENT OF AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT IN AND AROUND TWO DOZEN COMMUNITIES; MAKING AVAILABLE RAW AIR MONITORING DATA IN NEAR REAL-TIME VIA THE PURPLEAIR WEB MAP; UPDATING QUARTERLY PM 2.5 READINGS AND SO2/VOC DATA; ANALYZING DATA AND NOTING ANY EVIDENCE OF NONATTAINMENT OF NAAQS; PROVIDING QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS; WORKING WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS AND MEMBERS; IDENTIFICATION OF PUBLIC AWARENESS OF AIR QUALITY ISSUES; INCREASED ACCESSIBILITY OF DATA AND EXPERT ANALYSIS; IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING AMONGST THE GENERAL PUBLIC; AND, ENGAGEMENT WITH REGULATORS AND INDIVIDUALS LIVING WITH IMPAIRED LOCAL AIR QUALITY.
DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.  THESE BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THOSE IN THE APPALACHIAN VALLEY AREA, WHICH CROSSES SEVERAL STATES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES WILL SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR AIR QUALITY AND PROMOTE PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS TO LEVERAGE EXISTING EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND.SUBRECIPIENT:THE SUBAWARD INCLUDES UNIVERSITY STUDENT RESEARCH STIPENDS WILL BE DISBURSED TO VIRGINIA TECH AND GEORGE MASON STUDENTS TO ASSIST THE TRIBE IN COMPLETING OUTPUT 3: DEPLOYMENT OF AIR QUALITY MONITORING EQUIPMENT ON TRIBAL LAND; OUTPUT 4: NEAR REAL-TIME AIR QUALITY DATA AVAILABILITY/DATABASE FOR THE TRIBAL AND OTHER LOCAL STAKEHOLDERS; AND OUTPUT 5: TRIBAL COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT OF AIR POLLUTION DATA. THE TRIBE WILL COORDINATE WITH EACH UNIVERSITY'S CORRESPONDING PROJECT PARTNER TO ASSIGN A STUDENT RESEARCHER TO SUPPORT THE TRIBE WITH THESE OBJECTIVES. THIS COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH SUPPORT WILL BE PROVIDED OVER 15 MONTHS. IT IS PART OF THE TRIBE'S GOAL TO BUILD COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS AND SUPPORT YOUTH EDUCATION.OUTCOMES:THIS PROJECT WILL BUILD TRIBAL CAPACITY TO IMPLEMENT AN AIR QUALITY PROGRAM THROUGH 1) TRAINING TRIBAL CITIZENS, 2) DEVELOPING A COMMUNITY ADVISORY BOARD, 3) INSTALLATION AND MAINTENANCE OF AN AIR QUALITY MONITORING STATION, AND 4) ASSESSMENT OF AIR QUALITY AND OPPORTUNITIES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE TRIBAL MEMBERS AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM REDUCED AIR POLLUTION.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT WILL COORDINATE LOGISTICAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT FOR THE NATIONAL TRIBAL AIR ASSOCIATION (NTAA) CONTINUED OPERATIONS. THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES CONSIST OF NAU DELIVERING SUPPORT AND OPERATIONAL SUCCESS TO THE NTAA SO THAT THEY CAN PROVIDE INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION OPPORTUNITIES TO TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS INTERESTED IN EPA AIR RELATED ISSUES IMPACTING INDIAN COUNTRY AND TRIBAL COMMUNITIES. NAU WILL FOCUS ON THE FOLLOWING FOUR TASKS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO THE NTAA: 1) NTAA EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND MEMBER SUPPORT, 2) NTAA POLICY ANALYSIS, 3) NTAA'S AND TRIBAL COMMUNICATION AND COORDINATION AND, 4) COORDINATING THE NATIONAL TRIBAL AIR QUALITY FORUMACTIVITIES:ITEP'S EXPERIENCED STAFF WILL PROVIDE ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT TO EFFECTIVELY AND EFFICIENTLY CONDUCT THE BUSINESS OF THE NTAA. THIS WILL INCLUDE SUPPORT FOR THREE MEETINGS OF THE NTAA EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE (EC), MONTHLY CONFERENCE CALLS, AND FILLING OF EC VACANCIES WHEN NECESSARY. ITEP HAS PROVEN EXPERIENCE AS AN ADMINISTRATOR FOR SIX TRIBAL PARTNERSHIP GROUPS1 AND WILL USE THIS EXPERIENCE TO EFFECTIVELY SUPPORT A STRONG WORKING PARTNERSHIP WITH NTAA AND EPA'S OFFICE OF AIR AND RADIATION (OAR) TO ADVANCE AND PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT ISSUES OF IMPORTANCE TO TRIBES AND EPA.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THIS GRANT WILL BENEFIT FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBES NATIONWIDE PROVIDING SUPPORT TO THEM THRU THEIR REPRESENTATION ON THE NATIONAL TRIBAL AIR ASSOCIATION. ITEP WILL SPECIFICALLY
ORGANIZE MEETINGS OF THE NTAA EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, ORGANIZE TRIBAL WORKGROUPS, PROVIDE POLICY ANALYSIS, AND MAINTAIN A POLICY ADVISORY COMMITTEE TO ASSIST TRIBES ON AIR QUALITY RELATED ISSUES.

THE PRINCIPAL OBJECTIVES OF NACAA ARE TO COORDINATE THE ACTIVITIES OF STATE AND LOCAL AIR POLLUTION CONTROL OFFICIALS AND TO ENGAGE IN INITIATIVES THAT ENHANCE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THEIR AGENCIES. NACAA PLANS TO FOCUS ITS EFFORTS ON DISTRIBUTING PROPOSED AND FINAL EPA REGULATIONS, GUIDANCE DOCUMENTS AND POLICY STATEMENTS TO ITS MEMBERS FOR COMMENTS AND INFORMATIONAL PURPOSESAND COORDINATING STATE AND LOCAL COMMENTS ON EPA AND OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES&RSQUOAND PROPOSED RULES AND GUIDANCEAND COORDINATING STATE AND LOCAL PARTICIPATION IN NUMEROUS STAKEHOLDER PROCESSESAND FACILITATING THE EXCHANGE OF TECHNICAL AND POLICY INFORMATION TO AND AMONG THE MEMBERSAND COORDINATING THE DISSEMINATION OF INFORMATION FROM OTHER GROUPS TO THE MEMBERSAND AND SERVING AS A LIAISON FOR STATE AND LOCAL AIR POLLUTION CONTROL OFFICIALS IN COMMUNICATIONS WITH EPA, OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONS.

THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR HEALTHY HOUSING (NCHH) IS A RENOWNED AND CREDIBLE CHANGE AGENT SUCCESSFULLY INTEGRATING HEALTHY HOUSING ADVOCACY, RESEARCH, AND CAPACITY BUILDING TO REDUCE HEALTH DISPARITIES. 
NCHH WILL BUILD A CENTRAL KNOWLEDGE BASE AND PROVIDE FLEXIBLE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SUPPORT COMMUNITIES IN TAKING SYSTEMS-LEVEL ACTION TO REDUCE INDOOR AIR RISKS. THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND SUPPORT WILL BE CUSTOMIZED AND RESPONSIVE TO COMMUNITY NEEDS, INTERESTS, AND CAPACITY AND MAY ADVANCE ANY COMPREHENSIVE INDOOR AIR RISK REDUCTION ACTIONS, BUT WILL MAINTAIN A FOCUS ON WORKING TOWARD SUSTAINABLE, POLICY-LEVEL IMPACT AND BE FRAMED THROUGH AN OVERARCHING LENS TO INCREASE CAPACITY TO HOLISTICALLY ADDRESS INDOOR AIR QUALITY (IAQ). COMMUNITIES WILL IDENTIFY PRIORITY AREAS FOR ACTION (E.G., RADON, INDOOR ENVIRONMENTAL ASTHMA TRIGGERS, OR COMPREHENSIVE INDOOR AIR RISK REDUCTION) AS WELL AS THE TYPES OF STRATEGIES THEYRE INTERESTED IN PURSUING (E.G., IMPROVED HOUSING CODES AND/OR LOCAL POLICIES, DATA SHARING INITIATIVES, ETC.)  THE PROJECT WILL CONSISTS OF FOUR CATEGORIES OF TASKS: (1) BUILD THE FOUNDATION - CONDUCT A TOOLS INVENTORY AND DEVELOP A MENU OF RESOURCES AVAILABLE TO SUPPORT COMMUNITIES TAKING ACTION TO ADDRESS IAQ CONCERNS; CRAFT A COMPETITIVE SOLICITATION TO IDENTIFY FLAGSHIP COMMUNITIES FOR INTENSIVE COACHING AND SUPPORT; CREATE AN INTAKE ASSESSMENT TO SUPPORT SELF-IDENTIFIED ENROLLMENT; (2) RECRUIT PARTICIPANTS - PUBLICIZE PROJECT RESOURCES AND RECRUIT PROJECT PARTICIPANTS; (3) DELIVER FLEXIBLE, CUSTOMIZED COACHING AND SUPPORT - DELIVER TAILORED, RESPONSIVE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO IDENTIFY, DEVELOP, AND/OR ESCALATE ACTIONS; AND (4) AMPLIFY VOICES - BRING NEW VOICES TO FEDERAL LEARNING COMMUNITIES AND DISTILL LESSONS LEARNED TO RECOGNIZE COMMUNITIES IN ACTION AND EQUIP AND INSPIRE COMMUNITIES NATIONWIDE TO IMPROVE IAQ NOW AND FOR GENERATIONS.

THE PUBLIC HEALTH INSTITUTE (PHI), AND THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR HEALTHY HOUSING (NCHH) AIMS TO EDUCATE THE GENERAL PUBLIC ABOUT INDOOR AIR QUALITY CONCERNS AND EQUIP SPECIFIC STAKEHOLDERS TO TAKE ACTIONS TO REDUCE POTENTIAL ASTHMA RISKS IN HOMES. THIS PROJECT WILL 1) INCREASE THE NUMBER OF STATE ENVIRONMENTAL, PUBLIC HEALTH, AND MEDICAID PROGRAMS WORKING COLLABORATIVELY TO SUPPORT IN-HOME ASTHMA INTERVENTIONS; 2) INCREASE THE NUMBER OF HEALTH PLANS SERVING MEDICAID POPULATIONS THAT REIMBURSE IN-HOME INTERVENTIONS; 3) BUILD STATE, TRIBAL, AND LOCAL CAPACITY TO DELIVER AND SUSTAIN IN-HOME ENVIRONMENTAL ASTHMA INTERVENTIONS THROUGH TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING.

THE ENVIRONMENTAL LAW INSTITUTE (ELI) AIMS TO ADDRESS INDOOR AIR CONTAMINANTS HOLISTICALLY AND TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF STATE PROGRAMS TO COMPREHENSIVELY ADDRESS IAQ IN HOMES AND SCHOOLS. ELI AIMS TO ADVANCE STATE AND LOCAL IAQ POLICIES AND PROGRAMS THAT INCORPORATE BEST PRACTICES CONSISTENT WITH EPA GUIDANCE. ELI WILL ACCOMPLISH THIS BY DEVELOPING AND PROVIDING CLEAR AND PRACTICAL INFORMATION THAT: EXPLAINS THE POLICIES THAT STATES AND LOCALITIES HAVE ENACTED TO DATEAND HIGHLIGHTS POLICY MODELS THAT INCORPORATE BEST PRACTICES CONSISTENT WITH EPA GUIDANCEAND AND RECOMMENDS A RANGE OF POLICY AND PROGRAM STRATEGIES FOR FILLING THE GAPS AND STRENGTHENING RISK REDUCTION. THE INFORMATION ELI PROVIDES WILL BE USED BY A WIDE RANGE OF STAKEHOLDERS WORKING TO STRENGTHEN IAQ POLICIES AND PROGRAMS, INCLUDING POLICYMAKERS, AGENCY OFFICIALS, NATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS, AND COMMUNITY ADVOCATES.

THE SPECIFIC GOAL OF THIS PROPOSAL IS INCREASING THE PUBLICS ACTIONS TO REDUCE RISKS OF RADON EXPOSURE. THE OBJECTIVES FOR THIS GOAL ARE MULTI-DIMENSIONAL: 1. THE RECIPIENT WILL TARGET A GOAL OF 15,000 PERSONS FOR EACH TWELVE MONTH PERIOD RECEIVING INFORMATION AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE THROUGH ANSWERED, TRANSFERRED OR RETURNED TOLL-FREE PHONE CALLS AND EMAILS; 2. THE RECIPIENT WILL SET A GOAL OF 6,000 TEST KITS SOLD ANNUALLY, LEADING TO TESTING OF APPROXIMATELY 4,800 HOMES PER YEAR; 3. THE RECIPIENT WILL ANNUALLY SERVICE 160,000 UNIQUE VISITORS TO THE WWW.SOSRADON.ORG WEB SITE ENABLING ACCESS TO UPDATED RESOURCES AND INFORMATION ADDRESSING MULTIPLE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROPOSAL; 4. THE RECIPIENT WILL SUPPORT THE NCSL CONFERENCE BOOTH IN 2021 WITH COLLATERAL MATERIAL, ATTENDANCE AND SUPPORT FOR ENGAGING LEGISLATORS IN PROMOTING RADON POLICY ACTION AND AWARENESS; 5. THE RECIPIENT WILL ENGAGE WITH EPA REGIONS AND STATE RADON PROGRAMS IN OUTREACH AND EDUCATION INITIATIVES; 6. THE RECIPIENT, IN COLLABORATION WITH EPA, WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO NATIONAL AND FEDERAL RADON ACTION PLAN AGENCIES, COOPERATIVE PARTNERS, AND RADON STAKEHOLDER ORGANIZATIONS; 7. THE RECIPIENT WILL SUPPORT STATE RADON PROGRAM AND INDUSTRY PARTICIPATION IN STATE COMPREHENSIVE CANCER CONTROL PROGRAM ACTIVITIES 8. THE RECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT SOCIAL MEDIA CAMPAIGN EFFORTS, INVESTIGATE SETTING UP A YOUTUBE CHANNEL OF QUALITY RADON VIDEOS, AND SEEK TO USE THESE AVENUES TO SUPPORT OTHER OUTLINED ACTIVITIES THROUGH TARGETED EVENTS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO THE ALA DC TO IMPLEMENT ITS OWN PROJECT TO EXPANDING NATIONAL RADON ACTION IS TO SAVE LIVES THAT WOULD OTHERWISE BE LOST TO LUNG CANCER CAUSED BY EXPOSURE TO RADON. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE RADON STAKEHOLDER ORGANIZATIONS AND AGENCIES SERVING ON THE NRAP LEADERSHIP COUNCIL; EQUITY STAKEHOLDERS, INCLUDING HOUSING AGENCIES, TENANTS RIGHTS ORGANIZATIONS, COMMUNITY HOME REPAIR PROGRAMS, AND ADVOCATES FOR UNDERREPRESENTED COMMUNITIES; HOME BUILDERS, FINANCING AND REAL ESTATE ORGANIZATIONS AND PROFESSIONALS; LUNG CANCER ADVOCATES, INCLUDING STATE CANCER CONTROL PROGRAMS AND COALITIONS; HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS; SCHOOL BASED STAKEHOLDERS; THE PUBLIC BENEFICIARIES OF A DIVERSIFIED APPROACH TO RADON RISK REDUCTION HOMEOWNERS, RENTERS, WORKERS, SCHOOL CHILDREN. SUBSTANTIAL FEDERAL INVOLVEMENT INCLUDES PROGRAMMATIC OVERSIGHT, AND REVIEW AND COMMENT OF ALL AGREEMENT ACTIVITIES AND PRODUCTS, AS IDENTIFIED IN THE WORK PLAN. SECTION 2.B PROJECT SUMMARY/APPROACH PROVIDES SPECIFIC REFERENCES TO SECTIONS OF THE WORKPLAN THAT DESCRIBE EPA INVOLVEMENT IN THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT.

AAPCA IS A NATIONAL, NON-PROFIT, CONSENSUS-DRIVEN ORGANIZATION FOCUSED ON ASSISTING STATE AND LOCAL AIR QUALITY AGENCIES AND PERSONNEL WITH IMPLEMENTATION AND TECHNICAL ISSUES ASSOCIATED WITH THE FEDERAL CLEAN AIR ACT. THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT AND COORDINATE CAA-RELATED ACTIVITIES. COORDINATION INCLUDES PROVIDING A TECHNICAL FORUM, EXPEDITIOUSLY DISSEMINATING PROPOSED AND FINAL EPA REGULATIONS, GUIDANCE DOCUMENTS AND POLICY STATEMENTS, AND PROVIDING RESOURCES TO INFORM MEMBER FEEDBACK ON EPA ACTIONS.

TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR SENIOR-LEVEL UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS TO ENGAGE IN TRANSPORTATION, GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS, AND ENVIRONMENTAL POLICY RESEARCH, MIDAS WILL DEVELOP AND ADMINISTER A COMPREHENSIVE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM DURING THE 2020-2021 ACADEMIC YEAR AT THE UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN, ANN ARBOR THAT WILL SATISFY ALL THREE REQUESTED COMPONENTS AS REQUESTED BY THE EPA.  IN THIS PROPOSAL, DR. GRYAK (COMPONENTS 1 AND 2) AND PROFESSOR JAGADISH (COMPONENT 3) WILL SERVE AS THE MIDAS FACULTY ADVISORS FOR THE PARTICIPATING STUDENTS, PROVIDING MENTORING, SCIENTIFIC GUIDANCE, AND STUDENT EVALUATIONS. MIDAS STAFF WILL ASSIST WITH STUDENT RECRUITMENT, ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT, AND EVENT PLANNING. TRANSPORTATION TO THE NATIONAL VEHICLE AND FUEL EMISSIONS LABORATORY (NVFEL) IS AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS VIA THE USE OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN'S SHUTTLE SERVICE.  IN THEIR PROJECT ROLE, NVFEL WILL IDENTIFY THE NECESSARY DATASETS RELATED TO EACH OF THE PROJECT'S COMPONENTS AND PRODUCE THEM IN A TIMELY

THIS PROJECT WILL  ADVANCE THE FIELD OF ENERGY ECONOMICS AND INTEGRATED ASSESSMENT THROUGH A REGULAR SERIES OF MODEL INTERCOMPARISON STUDIES OF THE EMISSIONS OF ATMOSPHERIC POLLUTANTS, AND APPROACHES TO MITIGATING EMISSIONS AND ATMOSPHERIC POLLUTANTS' IMPACTS.

COLORADO STATE UNIVERSITY (CSU) WILL WORK TO PROMOTE CLEAN, AFFORDABLE HOUSEHOLD ENERGY BY BUILDING ON PAST SUCCESS WHILE ADDRESSING BOTH CURRENT AND EMERGING CHALLENGES IN THE HOUSEHOLD ENERGY SECTOR.  CSU'S OBJECTIVES ARE TO INCREASE THE ADOPTION AND USE OF CLEAN HOUSEHOLD ENERGY DEVICES THROUGHOUT THE HOUSEHOLD ENERGY COMMUNITY AND FOCUS ON EXPEDITING THE TRANSITION TO CLEANER, MORE EFFICIENT HOUSEHOLD ENERGY SYSTEMS (INCLUDING BIOGAS, ELECTRICITY, ETHANOL, LIQUEFIED PETROLEUM GAS, PELLETS, AND SOLAR) IN DOMESTIC AND INTERNATIONAL SETTINGS.

THE ALLIANCE PROPOSES A PARTNERSHIP WITH EPA TO INCREASE THE EXCHANGE OF INNOVATIVE TECHNOLOGY, BEST PRACTICES AND LESSONS LEARNED, AND TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY AMONG ORGANIZATIONS WORKING IN THE AIR QUALITY, HEALTH, AND ENVIRONMENTAL SECTORS. THE PARTNERSHIP WILL ULTIMATELY REDUCE INDOOR AIR POLLUTION, GLOBAL AMBIENT AIR POLLUTION, AND BY REDUCING TRANSBOUNDARY AIR POLLUTION ' HAVE A POSITIVE IMPACT ON US AIR QUALITY.

THIS PROJECT WILL COORDINATE LOGISTICAL AND ADMINISTRATIVESUPPORT FOR THE NATIONAL TRIBAL AIR ASSOCIATION (NTAA) CONTINUED OPERATIONS. THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES CONSIST OF NAU DELIVERING SUPPORT AND OPERATIONAL SUCCESS TO THE NTAA SO THAT THEY CAN PROVIDE INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION OPPORTUNITIES TO TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS INTERESTED IN EPA AIR RELATED ISSUES IMPACTING INDIAN COUNTRY AND TRIBAL COMMUNITIES. NAU WILL FOCUS ON THE FOLLOWING FOUR TASKS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO THE NTAA: 1) NTAA EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND MEMBER SUPPORT, 2) NTAA POLICY ANALYSIS, 3) NTAA'S AND TRIBAL COMMUNICATION AND COORDINATION AND, 4) COORDINATING THE NATIONAL TRIBAL AIR QUALITY FORUM.

THE PRINCIPAL OBJECTIVES OF NACAA ARE TO COORDINATE THE ACTIVITIES OF STATE AND LOCAL AIR POLLUTION CONTROL OFFICIALS AND TO ENGAGE IN INITIATIVES THAT ENHANCE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THEIR AGENCIES.  NACAA PLANS TO FOCUS ITS EFFORTS ON DISTRIBUTING PROPOSED AND FINAL EPA REGULATIONS, GUIDANCE DOCUMENTS AND POLICY STATEMENTS TO ITS MEMBERS FOR COMMENTS AND INFORMATIONAL PURPOSES; COORDINATING STATE AND LOCAL COMMENTS ON EPA AND OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES' PROPOSED RULES AND GUIDANCE; COORDINATING STATE AND LOCAL PARTICIPATION IN NUMEROUS STAKEHOLDER PROCESSES; FACILITATING THE EXCHANGE OF TECHNICAL AND POLICY INFORMATION TO AND AMONG THE MEMBERS; COORDINATING THE DISSEMINATION OF INFORMATION FROM OTHER GROUPS TO THE MEMBERS; AND SERVING AS A LIAISON FOR STATE AND LOCAL AIR POLLUTION CONTROL OFFICIALS IN COMMUNICATIONS WITH EPA, OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONS.

THE WORK TO BE COMPLETED INCLUDES RESEARCH STUDIES THAT WILL HELP IDENTIFY BEST PRACTICES AND APPROACHES THAT INFORM THE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF FUTURE ENERGY EFFICIENTCY (EE) PROGRAMS. THE STUDIES ARE NECESSARY TO ENSURE THAT LOW-COST EMISSIONS REDUCTIONS FROM EE PROGRAMS CONTINUE TO MATERIALIZE. SUCH EE PROGRAMS ' INCLUDING THOSE THAT LEVERAGE EPA'S ENERGY STAR ' NOT ONLY SAVE CONSUMERS AND BUSINESSES MONEY BUT PROVIDE A NO-REGRETS SOURCE OF COST-EFFECTIVE, VOLUNTARY EMISSIONS REDUCTIONS. ONGOING RESEARCH IS NEEDED TO ENSURE THAT STAKEHOLDERS WORKING TO DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT EE PROGRAMS HAVE UPDATED INFORMATION THAT HELPS THEM STAY AHEAD OF A RAPIDLY EVOLVING MARKETPLACE. THE RESEARCH STUDIES TO BE COMPLETED UNDER THIS PROJECT WILL THEREFORE HELP ENSURE THAT EE PROGRAMS CONTINUE TO BE COST-EFFECTIVE, WHILE SUPPORTING ECONOMIC GROWTH, CREATING JOBS, AND REDUCING AIR EMISSIONS ASSOCIATED WITH ENERGY USE.

THE INTENDED OUTCOME OF THE PROJECT IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF COUNTRIES TO MANAGE THE FLUORINATED WASTE. BETTER MANAGEMENT OF HAZARDOUS WASTE BRINGS A LOT OF ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS. THE DISSEMINATION OF RESULTS OF BEST PRACTICES UNDER THIS PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO REDUCE THE AIR AND WATER POLLUTION AND ELIMINATE THE NEGATIVE IMPACT ON BIODIVERSITY. IT WILL ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO SAFEGUARDING HUMAN HEALTH THROUGH THE REDUCTION OF EMISSIONS OF DIOXINS AND FURANS. DESTRUCTION OF FLUOROCARBONS INCLUDING OZONE-DEPLETING SUBSTANCES (ODS) BANKS WILL AVOID THE EMISSIONS OF GASES WHICH HAVE BOTH OZONE DEPLETING AND GLOBAL WARMING POTENTIAL. THEREFORE THE PROJECT WILL AIM TO EDUCATE DECISION MAKERS AND PRACTITIONERS FROM SELECTED COUNTRIES ON THE SUSTAINABLE WAYS OF MANAGING THE FLUORINATED CHEMICALS WASTE. THE PROJECT WILL SHARE THE EXPERIENCES AND LESSONS LEARNT TOWARDS A SUSTAINABLE, ENVIRONMENTALLY SOUND, AND AFFORDABLE CAPABILITY TO DESTROY THE 'END OF LIFE' (EOL) ODS AND PERSISTENT ORGANIC P

THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS FOR THE SOUTHWEST ENERGY EFFICIENCY PROJECT (SWEEP) TO WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH ELECTRIC AND GAS UTILITIES IN SIX SOUTHWEST STATES (AZ, CO, NV, NM, UT, WY) TO EXPAND AND IMPROVE ENERGY EFFICIENCY (EE) PROGRAMS FOR LOW INCOME HOUSEHOLDS. PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE RESEARCHING BEST PRACTICE LOW INCOME PROGRAMS FOR SINGLE AND MULTIFAMILY HOUSING AND PROVIDING ASSISTANCE TO UTILITY STAFF IN DEVELOPING EE PROGRAM PLANS FOR LOW INCOME HOUSEHOLDS.  SWEEP IS A NONPROFIT 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION FOUNDED IN 2001 TO PROMOTE ENERGY EFFICIENCY POLICIES AND PROGRAMS IN THIS HIGH GROWTH REGION WHERE AIR POLLUTION HAS BEEN AND CONTINUES AS A GROWING CONCERN.  SWEEP COLLABORATES WITH UTILITIES, STATE AGENCIES, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, UNIVERSITIES, BUSINESSES, AND ENERGY SPECIALISTS TO DEVELOP EE PROGRAMS THAT REDUCE ENERGY COSTS FOR CONSUMERS AND BUSINESS AS WELL AS AIR POLLUTANT EMISSIONS AND WATER USE.

THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP, EXTERNALLY REVIEW, AND PUBLISH TECHNICAL REPORT(S) TO INFORM CONSUMERS, STATES, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, UTILITIES, AND BUSINESSES OF POTENTIAL ENERGY SAVINGS IN SMART TECHNOLOGIES AND HOW ENERGY EFFICIENCY (EE) CAN SUPPORT ELECTRIC SYSTEM RELIABILITY. THE REPORTS WILL INCLUDE THE STATUS/MATURITY OF THE SMART TECHNOLOGIES MARKET, METHODS FOR ESTABLISHING ACCURATE ESTIMATES OF ENERGY SAVINGS ATTRIBUTABLE TO SMART TECHNOLOGY UTILIZATION, AND IDENTIFYING EE PROGRAMS THAT HAVE HIGH VALUE FOR SYSTEM RELIABILITY. THE AMERICAN COUNCIL FOR ENERGY-EFFICIENT ECONOMY (ACEEE) IS A NONPROFIT, 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION FOUNDED IN 1980 BY PROMINENT RESEARCHERS IN THE ENERGY FIELD, ACTS AS A CATALYST TO ADVANCE ENERGY EFFICIENCY POLICIES, PROGRAMS, TECHNOLOGIES, INVESTMENTS, AND BEHAVIORS.  THE ACEEE IS RECOGNIZED AS AMERICA'S LEADING CENTER ON EE EXPERTISE BECAUSE OF ITS CREDIBLE, HIGH-QUALITY, AND RELEVANT TECHNICAL WORK.

THIS PROJECT WILL DISTRIBUTE PROPOSED AND FINAL EPA REGULATIONS, GUIDANCE DOCUMENTS AND POLICY STATEMENTS TO THE MEMBERS FOR COMMENTS AND FOR INFORMATIONAL PURPOSES; COORDINATING STATE AND LOCAL COMMENTS ON EPA AND OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES' PROPOSED RULES AND GUIDANCE; COORDINATING STATE AND LOCAL PARTICIPATION IN NUMEROUS STAKEHOLDER PROCESSES; FACILITATING THE EXCHANGE OF TECHNICAL AND POLICY INFORMATION TO AND AMONG THE MEMBERS; COORDINATING THE DISSEMINATION OF INFORMATION FROM OTHER GROUPS TO THE MEMBERS; AND SERVING AS A LIAISON FOR STATE AND LOCAL AIR POLLUTION CONTROL OFFICIALS IN COMMUNICATIONS WITH EPA, OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONS.

THE SPECIFIC GOAL OF THIS PROPOSAL IS INCREASING THE PUBLIC'S ACTIONS TO REDUCE RISKS OF RADON EXPOSURE. THE OBJECTIVES FOR THIS GOAL ARE: PREVENT FUTURE LUNG CANCER DEATHS BY INCREASING THE PUBLIC'S KNOWLEDGE OF RADON AND THE NEED TO TEST AND MITIGATE HOMES AND SCHOOLS, BY INCREASING HOMES, SCHOOLS AND OTHER STRUCTURES BUILT WITH RADON REDUCING FEATURES AND BY SUPPORTING RADON POLICY IMPLEMENTATION THAT WILL LEAD TO RADON RISK REDUCTION.

ALA WILL LEAD THE WORK OF THE COALITION AND ITS SUBGROUPS TO FURTHER DEVELOP THE ACTION PLANS TO IMPLEMENT THE STRATEGIES IN THE NATIONAL RADON ACTION PLAN (NRAP) TO PREVENT FUTURE LUNG CANCER DEATHS THROUGH THE MITIGATION OF EXISTING HOMES/SCHOOLS AND BY CONSTRUCTING NEW HOMES/SCHOOLS WITH RADON-REDUCING FEATURES. THESE ACTIONS WILL MOVE THE NATION CLOSER TO MEETING THE NRAP'S 2020 GOALS OF REDUCING RADON RISK IN 5 MILLION HOMES AND SAVING 3,200 LIVES.

THE GREEN & HEALTHY HOMES INITIATIVE, INC. (GHHI) PROPOSES A WELL-CONCEIVED STRATEGY THAT ALIGNS WELL WITH EPA'S STRATEGIC PLAN. THE APPLICANT PROPOSES TO BUILD ON AND LEVERAGE EXISTING WORK WITH COMMUNITIES TO SECURE REIMBURSEMENT FOR HOME-BASED ENVIRONMENTAL ASTHMA INTERVENTION PROGRAMS THROUGH MEDICAID WITHIN COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE COUNTRY. THE MULTI-PRONGED STRATEGIC APPROACH INCLUDES DEVELOPMENT OF A NATIONAL EDUCATION CAMPAIGN TO DISSEMINATE BEST PRACTICES OF ASTHMA MANAGEMENT INCLUDING REDUCTION OF ENVIRONMENTAL ASTHMA TRIGGERS; AN EVALUATION WORK GROUP THAT WILL BUILD CONSENSUS ON A CORE SET OF EVALUATION METRICS; AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SUPPORT COMMUNITIES WITH SEEKING REIMBURSEMENT FOR IN-HOME REMEDIATION OF ENVIRONMENTAL ASTHMA TRIGGERS, IDENTIFYING PAYMENT MODELS, AND GROWING KEY PARTNERSHIPS TO SUPPORT BRAIDED FUNDING.
