DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE QUINAULT INDIAN NATION TO DEVELOP A DEMONSTRATION PROJECT FOR A TEMPORARY FIREWOOD SHED. THE AVAILABILITY OF DRY WOOD FOR TRIBAL RESIDENTS WILL ENABLE THEM TO HAVE ACCESS TO DRY WOOD TO BURN INSTEAD OF WET WOOD. BURNING WET WOOD EMITS SMOKE INDOORS AND INCREASES PM2.5 IN THE LIVING SPACE AND IS HARMFUL TO HUMAN HEALTH. IF DRY, SEASONED FIREWOOD IS NOT AVAILABLE, HOWEVER, INDIVIDUALS MAY INSTEAD BURN WET, UNSEASONED WOOD, WHICH PRODUCES MORE FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (SMOKE), AND CREATES AN AIR QUALITY CONCERN, PARTICULARLY FOR SENSITIVE POPULATIONS. THE TRIBE WILL ALSO LEAD OUTREACH ON THE WOOD SHEDS AND EDUCATION ON THE IMPORTANT OF BURNING DRY WOOD THROUGH THEIR CAA 105 GRANT WORK. ACTIVITIES:THE TRIBE WILL PROCURE THE MATERIALS NEEDED FOR THE WOOD SHED AND TO PREPARE THE SITE. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE TRIBE WILL REPORT ON PROCUREMENT OF MATERIALS AND SITE PREPARATION PROGRESS. THE TRIBE WILL REPORT SEMI-ANNUALLY ALONG WITH A FINAL REPORT DUE AFTER THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD.

DESCRIPTION:FUNDING IS FOR THE CONTINUED OPERATION OF OREGON DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY'S (ODEQ) NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS SITES (NATTS) AT LA GRANDE AND PORTLAND, OREGON 

THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS SITE (NATTS) MONITORING PROGRAM WAS DEVELOPED IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE NATIONAL AIR MONITORING STRATEGY, TO MONITOR THE AMBIENT CONCENTRATION OF AIR TOXIC COMPOUNDS AND ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THE AMBIENT AIR MONITORING COMMUNITY. 

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FEDERAL INCREMENTAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $424,170
PRE-AWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 07/01/2023.
ACTIVITIES:THE GRANT RECIPIENT WILL OPERATE AIR TOXICS MONITORING SITES TO COLLECT DATA THAT WILL BE THE BASIS FOR FUTURE EMISSION CONTROL ACTIONS THAT WILL HELP MORE PEOPLE BREATH CLEANER AIR IN THEIR STATE. 

SUCCESSFUL ANNUAL NATTS SITE OPERATION WILL RESULT IN THE COLLECTION OF A YEAR'S WORTH OF QUALITY-ASSURED AMBIENT AIR TOXICS MEASUREMENTS FOR SELECTED HAPS WITH SUBMITTAL TO THE NATIONAL AIR QUALITY. DATABASE (AQS) FOR THE TWO NATTS SITES.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CHARACTERIZING AMBIENT LEVELS OF AIR TOXICS WITHIN PORTLAND AND LA GRANDE AREAS; PROVIDING QUALITY ASSURED HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS (HAP) DATA FOR TRENDS DETERMINATION; DIRECTLY EVALUATING PUBLIC EXPOSURE AND ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS IN THE VICINITY OF MONITORS; PROVIDING QUALITY ASSURED HAPS DATA FOR RISK CHARACTERIZATION; ASSESSING THE EFFECTIVENESS OF SPECIFIC EMISSION REDUCTION ACTIVITIES; EVALUATING AND SUBSEQUENTLY IMPROVING AIR TOXICS EMISSION INVENTORIES AND MODEL PERFORMANCE

THE ANTICIPATED SHORT TERM OUTCOMES FOR THIS PROJECT IS TO DETERMINE AMBIENT CONCENTRATIONS OF AIR TOXICS IN THE PORTLAND AND LA GRANDE AREAS. THE LONG TERM OUTCOME WOULD BE TO USE THESE MONITORING DATA TO IDENTIFY RESIDUAL HEALTH RISKS DUE TO AMBIENT AIR TOXICS, ASSESSING THE EFFECTIVENESS OF SPECIFIC EMISSION REDUCTION ACTIVITIES; AND EVALUATING AND IMPROVING AIR TOXICS EMISSION INVENTORIES AND MODEL PERFORMANCE.  

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE RESIDENTS AND OCCUPANTS OF LA GRANDE AND PORTLAND OREGON.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN-FUNDED AND COMPETITIVELY SELECTED AWARD IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE ALEUTIAN PRIBILOF ISLANDS ASSOCIATION (APIA) WILL MANAGE A SUBAWARD TO THE ALEUT COMMUNITY OF ST. PAUL ISLAND, SO THE TRIBE CAN IMPLEMENT A PROJECT TO COLLECT BASELINE AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO INVESTIGATE AIR QUALITY IMPACTS FROM SOLID WASTE BURNING ON ST. PAUL ISLAND. PARTICULATE MATTER, NITROGEN OXIDE, SULFUR DIOXIDE, AND PARTICULATE MATTER- PRECURSOR CARBON MONOXIDE WILL BE MEASURED. THE DATA WILL BE USED TO INFORM COMMUNITY HEALTH CONCERNS AND TO UNDERSTAND THE AIR QUALITY IMPACTS ON THE ISLAND COMMUNITY FROM WASTE BURNING. ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL SUPPORT AIR QUALITY MONITORING ON ST. PAUL ISLAND. THIS PROJECT WILL BE THE FIRST AIR QUALITY MONITORING WORK BEING DONE ON THE ISLAND. THE WORK WILL GIVE THE COMMUNITY BASELINE DATA TO BUILD UPON IN MANAGING WASTE BURNING ON THE ISLAND. THE PROJECT WILL ALLOW ALEUTIAN PRIBILOF ISLANDS ASSOCIATION AND ALEUT COMMUNITY OF ST. PAUL ISLAND TO BUILD AIR MONITORING CAPACITY AND KNOWLEDGE OF LOCAL-SCALE, REAL-TIME AIR QUALITY, WHILE COLLECTING BASELINE AIR QUALITY DATA.  
 
SUBRECIPIENT:ALEUTIAN PRIBILOF ISLANDS ASSOCIATION WILL WORK WITH THEIR PARTNER, ALEUT COMMUNITY OF ST. PAUL ISLAND THROUGH A SUBAWARD. FUNDS INCLUDED IN THE SUBAWARD TO ALEUT COMMUNITY OF ST. PAUL ISLAND WILL PROVIDE SALARY AND FRINGE BENEFITS TO TWO ALEUT COMMUNITY OF ST. PAUL ISLAND STAFF, THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL PROJECT MANAGER, AND THEIR TECHNICIAN. ALEUT COMMUNITY OF ST. PAUL ISLAND 'S ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM MANAGER IS RESPONSIBLE FOR QUALITY ASSURANCE AND CONTROL DURING ALEUT COMMUNITY OF ST. PAUL ISLAND 'S ANNUAL SUMMER FIELD WORK AND WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR INSPECTING THE MONITOR ANNUALLY FOR ANY NEEDED MAINTENANCE. TRAVEL FUNDS FOR ALEUT COMMUNITY OF ST. PAUL ISLAND 'S ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM MANAGER TO TRAVEL TO ST. PAUL ANNUALLY ARE INCLUDED, IN ADDITION TO TRAVEL TO THE NATIONAL TRIBAL FORUM ON AIR QUALITY (OR RELATED AIR QUALITY CONFERENCE) TO KEEP HER UP TO DATE ON AIR QUALITY METHODOLOGY AND PROVIDE NETWORKING OPPORTUNITIES. SALARY AND FRINGE BENEFITS FOR ALEUT COMMUNITY OF ST. PAUL ISLAND'S TECHNICIAN WILL ALLOW HIM TO PERFORM MONTHLY DATA DOWNLOADS AND REGULAR CHECKS ON THE MONITOR TO ENSURE DATA IS COLLECTED IN A TIMELY FASHION (IN THE EVENT OF CELL SERVICE INTERRUPTION) AND THAT THE MONITOR IS RUNNING AS INTENDED.
OUTCOMES:ALEUT COMMUNITY OF ST. PAUL ISLAND STAFF WILL MONITOR FOR PARTICULATE MATTER, NO, NO2, AND SO2, WHICH SUPPORTS AIR QUALITY MONITORING KEY PRIORITIES AS OUTLINED IN THEIR TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL GOALS, AS WELL AS A REGIONAL PRIORITY SET FORTH BY ALEUTIAN PRIBILOF ISLANDS ASSOCIATION. BY MONITORING FOR THESE SPECIFIC POLLUTANTS, THE PARTNERS WILL ALSO DETECT CONCENTRATION SPIKES THAT MAY OCCUR DURING SOLID WASTE BURNING. RESULTS FROM THESE AMBIENT AIR MONITORING EFFORTS WILL BE USED TO DETERMINE WHAT MITIGATION EFFORTS ARE NEEDED TO ADDRESS SOLID WASTE BURNING AND BE USED TO INFORM EFFORTS TO ACQUIRE MORE EFFICIENT SYSTEMS FOR WASTE BURNING AND TO DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT A RECYCLING PROGRAM IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE TRIBAL AND MUNICIPAL GOVERNMENT, TO REDUCE WHAT GOES INTO THE WASTE STREAM.

THE DATA WILL INFORM THE ALEUT COMMUNITY OF ST. PAUL ISLAND COMMUNITY ABOUT THE AI

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS INFLATION REDUCTION ACT FUNDED GRANT IS TO FURTHER EXPLORE THE HEALTH RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH FINE AIR PARTICULATES AND AIR OTHER AIR TOXIC COMPOUNDS, WHICH ARE KNOWN TO CAUSE RESPIRATORY ILLNESSES SUCH AS ASTHMA AND LUNG CANCER.  THE CONFEDERATED TRIBES OF THE COOS, LOWER UMPQUA, AND SIUSLAW INDIANS (CTCLUSI)  WANTS TO BE AWARE OF THE PRESENCE OF TOXIC MATTER, DEVELOP STRATEGIES AND PLANS FOR IMPROVEMENT, AND THEN IMPLEMENT EFFECTIVE METHODS TO IMPROVE AIR QUALITY. 


ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO UNDERSTAND FINE PARTICULATE MATTER AND AIR TOXICS IN THE CTCLUSI ENVIRONMENTAL LABORATORY AND CLEANROOM. THE PROJECT WILL HELP DETERMINE THE EFFICIENCY OF HEPA FILTER SYSTEMS IN REMOVING AMBIENT FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM), VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS (VOCS), AND SULFUR DIOXIDE (SO2). 

SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PURCHASE EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES TO UNDERSTAND HOW TO REDUCE AIR POLLUTION. FUNDING WILL ALSO BE USED TO DEVELOP A QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN (QAPP) FOR THE EQUIPMENT PURCHASED WITH THESE FUNDS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE A FINAL FORMAL REPORT TO INCLUDE DATA AND CONCLUSIONS ON CLEAN ROOM NEW HVAC AND HEPA FILTRATION EFFICIENCY ON CONTROLLING AIR POLLUTION BY REMOVING PM, VOCS, AND SO2. 

EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A GENERAL UNDERSTANDING OF CLEAN ROOM HVAC AND HEPA FILTRATION EFFICACY IN THE CTCLUSI ENVIRONMENTAL LABORATORY AND CLEANROOM, AND AN UNDERSTANDING OF ASSOCIATED HEALTH RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH FINE PARTICULATE MATTER AND AIR TOXICS. KNOWLEDGE GAINED  WILL CONTRIBUTE TO STRATEGIES FOR BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES AND FUTURE DEVELOPMENT OF PLANS AND PROTOCOLS TO ADDRESS HEALTH RISKS. 

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO RESIDE ON OR NEAR THE CONFEDERATED TRIBES OF THE COOS, LOWER UMPQUA, AND SIUSLAW INDIANS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE CONFEDERATED TRIBES OF THE UMATILLA INDIAN RESERVATION (CTUIR).  THE PURPOSE OF THIS INFLATION REDUCTION ACT FUNDED GRANT IS TO COLLECT AIR QUALITY DATA IN THE UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES ON THE CTUIR LANDS THAT ARE AFFECTED BY PM 2.5 EMISSIONS AND TO CONTRIBUTE THAT DATA TO THE NATIONAL AIR DATABASE.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE TO COLLECT AIR QUALITY DATA IN THE UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES ON THE CONFEDERATED TRIBES OF THE UMATILLA INDIAN RESERVATION LANDS. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PURCHASE A BAM 1022 PM 2.5 REFERENCE MONITOR AND ATTEND ASSOCIATED TRAINING TO HELP BUILD FOUNDATIONAL CAPACITY TO THE CTUIR OFFICE OF AIR QUALITY FOR SUCCESSFUL AIR MONITOR DEPLOYMENT AND OPERATION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE ESTABLISHING A BETTER BASELINE EMISSION ON THE CTUIR AND TO MAINTAIN COMPLIANCE WITH THE NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS.)  
DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO LIVE ON AN NEAR THE CTUIR LANDS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE SWINOMISH INDIAN TRIBAL COMMUNITY (SITC).  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO FURTHER DEVELOP STIC'S AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM AND ASSESSMENT CAPABILITIES. 

SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL AUTOMATE DATA COLLECTION FOR CRITERIA AIR POLLUTANTS (CAPS) (O3, NO2, SO2, AND PM2.5) AND WORK TO ALLOW REMOTE ACCESS TO THE MONITORING STATIONS FOR EMERGENCIES. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE CONTINUING TO UPLOAD DATA TO EPA'S AIR QUALITY SYSTEM (AQS) AND SITC'S AIR QUALITY WEBSITE. ENSURING DATA COLLECTED AND USED UNDER THIS GRANT IS CONSISTENT WITH EPA QUALITY ASSURANCE STANDARDS BY DRAFTING A QUALITY ASSURANCE MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR MONITORING CAPS (SO2 AND PM2.5) AND HAPS (H2S). 

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE A QUALITY ASSURANCE MANAGEMENT PLAN.
THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE QUALITY ASSURED AIR MONITORING DATA WHICH SUPPORTS DECISION MAKING BY LOCAL AND STATE AGENCIES. 
THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE COMMUNITIES IN AND AROUND THE SWINOMISH INDIAN TRIBAL COMMUNITY.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DESIGN AND DEPLOY A COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT CAMPAIGN TO UNDERSTAND AND MONITOR AIR QUALITY THROUGH LIBRARY AND SCHOOLS VIA LOANABLE AIR QUALITY KITS. IN ADDITION, THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE WILL PILOT A HOUSEHOLD INDOOR AIR QUALITY (IAQ) IMPROVEMENT/SMOKE READY/CLIMATE READY PROJECT TO REPLACE WOOD STOVES WITH EPA-CERTIFIED UNITS. 

ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE DESIGNING AND DEPLOYING THE PILOT PROGRAMS AND TO PROVIDE FIVE TRIBAL-MEMBER HOMES WITH ONE HEPA-FILTER AIR CLEANER UNIT AND TWO YEARS OF REPLACEMENT FILTERS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS TO PROVIDE AT-RISK COMMUNITIES WITH AN EPA-CERTIFIED WOOD STOVE CHANGEOUT AND MINISPLIT INSTALLATION, ALONG WITH AN AIR CLEANER UNIT AND WEATHERIZATION TO: (1) REDUCE AMBIENT EMISSIONS, (2) IMPROVE INDOOR AIR QUALITY, (3) PROVIDE FOR A SECONDARY SOURCE OF HEATING DURING WOOD STOVE CURTAILMENT EVENTS, (4) PROVIDE A SOURCE OF COOLING DURING HEAT EVENTS, AND (5) IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES IS TO PROVIDE AT-RISK COMMUNITIES WITH THE INFORMATION THEY NEED FOR PREPAREDNESS AND ACTION CHANGE FOR IMPROVEMENT OF INDOOR AIR QUALITY AND TO IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE AT RISK COMMUNITIES OF THE NEZ PERCE RESERVATION.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE CONFEDERATED TRIBES OF COOS, LOWER UMPQUA AND SIUSLAW INDIANS (CTCLUSI) PROJECT GOAL IS TO ENSURE CLEAN AND HEALTHY AIR BY REDUCING THE FREQUENCY AND SEVERITY OF AIR POLLUTION EXPOSURE IN OUR COMMUNITY. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE TO INCREASE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT ON OUTDOOR AND INDOOR AIR QUALITY AND TO DEVELOP A NETWORK OF AIR QUALITY MONITORS. THIS PROJECT AIMS TO EXPAND THE TRIBES MONITORING EFFORTS AND PROTECT THE HEALTH OF TRIBAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS, ESPECIALLY OUR ELDERS, YOUNG, AND OTHER MEDICALLY VULNERABLE PEOPLE. IN ADDITION, THE TRIBE WILL CONDUCT EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH AND PROVIDE THE PEOPLE WITH RESOURCES TO IMPROVE AIR QUALITY IN THEIR COMMUNITY. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE ENHANCING AMBIENT AIR MONITORING BY DEPLOYING PURPLE AIR MONITORS IN THE CTCLUSI FIVE COUNTY SERVICE AREA, DEVELOPING A DASHBOARD AND OUTREACH MATERIALS ILLUSTRATING RELATIONSHIPS IN AIR QUALITY AND HEATING SOURCES, AND CONDUCTING A NEEDS ASSESSMENT ON CRITICAL AIR QUALITY ISSUES, AND DEVELOPING ACTION PLANS TO IMPLEMENT RECOMMENDATIONS ARISING FROM THE ASSESSMENT. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES IS TO IMPROVE PUBLIC HEALTH, SAFETY, ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH AND PROTECTION OF TRIBAL MEMBERS AND RESOURCES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE TRIBE'S FIVE COUNTY SERVICE AREAS OF COOS, CURRY, DOUGLAS, LANE, AND LINCOLN COUNTIES, AS WELL AS THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER INFLATION REDUCTION ACT TO WASHINGTON DEPARTMENT OF ECOLOGY.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS  TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND.

ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO TAKE PLACE UNDER THIS GRANT AWARD INCLUDE UPGRADING AND RELOCATE SEATTLE-BEACON HILL NCORE SITE WITHIN JEFFERSON PARK;  REPLACING A REGULATED AIR POLLUTION SOURCE MANAGEMENT SYSTEM/DATABASE; PURCHASING AN AETHALOMETER TO BETTER UNDERSTAND PM2.5 POLLUTION IN THURSTON COUNTY; PURCHASING AN AIR QUALITY WEATHER STATION; CONDUCTING  A WINTER 2023-2024 BLACK CARBON SURVEY  FOR THE CITY OF SPOKANE; AND DOING A  HEXAVALENT CHROMIUM SAMPLING STUDY IN THE DUWAMISH VALLEY.
SUBRECIPIENT: BENTON CLEAN AIR AGENCY WILL REPLACE A REGULATED AIR POLLUTION SOURCE MANAGEMENT SYSTEM/DATABASE; OLYMPIC REGION CLEAN AIR AGENCY WILL ACQUIRE AN AETHALOMETER TO BETTER UNDERSTAND PM2.5 POLLUTION IN THURSTON COUNTY; SOUTHWEST CLEAN AIR AGENCY WILL  PURCHASE AND INSTALL AN AIR QUALITY WEATHER STATION; SPOKANE REGIONAL CLEAN AIR AGENCY WILL CONDUCT 
 SPOKANE WINTER 2023-2024 BLACK CARBON SURVEY; AND PUGET SOUND CLEAN AIR AGENCY WILL CONDUCT  HEXAVALENT CHROMIUM SAMPLING STUDY IN THE DUWAMISH VALLEY.
OUTCOMES:SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THESE PROJECTS WILL RESULT IN ENHANCED MONITORING, SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH, REGULATION AND TRACKING OF SOURCES OF PM2.5 AND ITS COMPONENT SPECIES, TRACE GAS NCORE MONITORING, AND UNDERSTANDING OF AIR POLLUTION WITHIN KEY ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES. SPECIFIC PROJECT OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVED CAPACITY OF SEATTLE NCORE MONITORING SITE TO SUPPORT COLLECTION OF DATA ON PM2.5, TRACE GASES AND OTHER MONITORED PARAMETERS AND BETTER COMPLIANCE WITH EPA SITING CRITERIA; IMPROVED TRACKING OF REGULATED SOURCES OF AIR POLLUTION IN BENTON COUNTY; AN  ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING OF PM2.5 SOURCES AND CHARACTERISTICS THROUGH BLACK CARBON MONITORING IN THURSTON COUNTY AND SPOKANE; 
METEOROLOGICAL DATA TO SUPPORT MODELING OF AIR POLLUTION DISPERSION IN SOUTHWEST WASHINGTON LEADING TO MORE EFFECTIVE AIR POLLUTION MANAGEMENT; IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF RISK ESTIMATES FOR HEXAVALENT CHROMIUM IN SEATTLE'S DUWAMISH VALLEY; AND  MORE PUBLIC ACCESS TO DATA VIA ECOLOGY'S MONITORING WEBSITE, EPA'S AIRNOW, AND FINAL VALIDATED DATA VIA EPA'S AIR QUALITY SYSTEM (AQS) DATABASE.


THE INTENDED  BENEFICIARIES ARE THE CITIZENS THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF WASHINGTON

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED GRANT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.  ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL EXPAND ITS MONITORING CAPACITY OF CRITERIA AIR POLLUTANTS (CAPS), HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS (HAPS), AND METEOROLOGICAL OBSERVATIONS TO ENHANCE SITC'S ABILITY TO RESPOND TO RELEASES OF UNKNOWN GASEOUS MIXTURES BY NEARBY TITLE V SOURCES. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR(S) TO REPLACE FILTER-BASED PM2.5 MONITOR(S) AND THE EXPANSION OF MONITORING OF SULFUR DIOXIDE (SO2). THE EXPANSION OF HAPS MONITORING WOULD INCLUDE CONTINUOUS MONITORING OF HYDROGEN SULFIDE (H2S) TO ADD TO THE DISCRETE SAMPLING OF 75 DIFFERENT VOCS VIA EPA'S METHOD TO-15. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT CHILKOOT INDIAN TRIBAL COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  ESTABLISH BASELINE CONTINUOUS OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY (PM2.5) MONITORING IN THE HAINES BOROUGH, TRACKING EXPECTED POLLUTION SOURCES OF: LARGE CRUISE SHIPS EXHAUST, WILDFIRE SMOKE, CONSTRUCTION/QUARRYING DUST, COMMUNITY DIESEL GENERATOR EXHAUST, POLLEN RELEASE, AND GLACIAL SILT THAT WILL LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE. . . ESTABLISHING BASELINE CONTINUOUS OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY (PM2.5) MONITORING IN THE HAINES BOROUGH, TRACKING EXPECTED POLLUTION SOURCES OF: LARGE CRUISE SHIPS EXHAUST, WILDFIRE SMOKE, CONSTRUCTION/QUARRYING DUST, COMMUNITY DIESEL GENERATOR EXHAUST, POLLEN RELEASE, AND GLACIAL SILT. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO CONDUCT INDOOR AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENTS FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS HOUSEHOLDS AND LOCAL SCHOOLS AND TAKE INTERMITTENT MEASUREMENTS ON A VARIETY OF POLLUTANTS (PM2.5, CO, VOCS) IN THESE INDOOR SETTINGS. PROGRAM STAFF WILL ATTEND BOTH INTRODUCTORY AND ADVANCED TRAININGS ON RURAL ALASKA AIR QUALITY TOPICS. FINDINGS OF THE MONITORING EFFORTS WILL BE SHARED THROUGH THE FORMATION OF A NORTHERN LYNN CANAL INTERTRIBAL AIR QUALITY WORKING GROUP AND WITH ALL PROJECT PARTNERS, AND THE WORKING GROUP WILL EXPLORE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE ACTIONS TO SUBOPTIMAL AIR QUALITY.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE . . .(1)	USE CONTINUOUS AQ MONITORING TECHNOLOGIES TO EVALUATE THE TIMING AND INTENSITY OF PM2.5 POLLUTION FROM THE FOLLOWING SOURCES: LARGE CRUISE SHIPS EXHAUST, WILDFIRE SMOKE, CONSTRUCTION/QUARRYING DUST, COMMUNITY DIESEL GENERATOR EXHAUST, POLLEN RELEASE, AND GLACIAL SILT.
(2)	USE ESTABLISHED AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENTS FOR SCHOOLS AND HOMES TO IDENTIFY POTENTIAL HAZARDS AND CONDUCT SITE VISITS TO DO INTERMITTENT TESTING FOR: PM2.5, CARBON MONOXIDE, AND VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS (VOCS).
(3)	SYNTHESIZE, AND SHARE THE AQ DATA WITH PROJECT COLLABORATORS THROUGH MEETINGS WITH THE INTERTRIBAL AQ WORKING GROUP, AND WORK TO DEVELOP APPROPRIATE RESPONSE ACTIONS FOR ANY SITES EXPERIENCING DEGRADED AIR QUALITY. 

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE. . .CHILKOOT TRIBE INDIAN ASSOCIATION; CHILKAT VILLAGE (KLUKWAN); SKAGWAY TRADITIONAL COUNCIL; HAINES HARBOR; VETERANS HOME, AND WATERSHED COUNCIL AND ALL TRIBAL MEMBERS.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, ODEQ WILL WORK WITH COMMUNITIES, UNIVERSITIES, AND LOCAL AND STATE AGENCIES TO CO-DESIGN AN EQUITABLE AND SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITY MONITORING FRAMEWORK FOR COLLABORATIVE ACTION. THIS FRAMEWORK WILL BE USED TO EMPOWER COMMUNITIES - PRIORITIZING UNDERSERVED, DISADVANTAGED AND OVERBURDENED COMMUNITIES - TO MONITOR AND LEVERAGE THE DATA TO INFORM ACTION THAT WILL IMPROVE THEIR LOCAL AIR QUALITY.
SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS TO NEIGHBORS FOR CLEAN AIR FOR BUILDING COMMUNITY CAPACITY AND IMPLEMENTATION OF COMMUNITY MONITORING IN 4 OREGON COMMUNITIES. SUBAWARD TO CONTRACTOR FOR REMOTE/RURAL
COMMUNITY OUTREACH. SUBAWARDS TO DESERT RESEARCH INSTITUTE FOR DATA MANAGEMENT AND PORTLAND STATE UNIVERSITY FOR PROJECT PERFORMANCE EVALUATION.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF COMMUNITY MONITORING PROJECTS AND A SENSOR INSTRUMENT LIBRARY. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED AWARENESS OF COMMUNITY MONITORING. IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF HOW COMMUNITY MONITORING CAN BE USED TO IMPROVE LOCAL AIR, IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF AIR QUALITY DATA AND HEALTH IMPACTS, AND NEW AND STRENGTHENED PARTNERSHIPS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE ALL COMMUNITIES IN OREGON WITH A FOCUS ON UNDERSERVED, DISADVANTAGED, RURAL AND REMOTE COMMUNITIES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF QUALITY (IDEQ).  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO CONDUCT A DETAILED STATEWIDE EMISSION INVENTORY FOR WOODSTOVE USAGE AND PRESCRIBED FIRE USE THROUGHOUT IDAHO.  DEQ WILL ALSO PURCHASE AND INSTALL VISIBILITY CAMERAS THROUGHOUT IDAHO TO SUPPORT THE SMOKE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM.ACTIVITIES:IDEQ  WILL BE CONDUCTING A DETAILED STATEWIDE EMISSION INVENTORY FOR WOODSTOVE USAGE AND PRESCRIBED FIRE USE THROUGHOUT IDAHO.  DEQ WILL ALSO PURCHASE AND INSTALL 10 VISIBILITY CAMERAS THROUGHOUT IDAHO TO SUPPORT THE SMOKE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE DEQ CONTRACTING WITH ONE OR MORE ENTITIES TO COLLECT STATEWIDE ACTIVITY DATA ON WOODSTOVE AND PRESCRIBED FIRE USAGE. OUTCOME: THESE CONTRACTS WILL ALSO COLLECT DATA THAT WILL HELP IDEQ DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT AN OUTREACH PROGRAM FOR BOTH SOURCE CATEGORIES USING THE COMMUNITY BASED SOCIAL MARKETING METHOD.  ALSO, IDEQ WILL PURCHASE 10 VISIBILITY CAMERAS TO BE USED THROUGHOUT THE STATE. THESE VISIBILITY CAMERAS WILL BE USED TO SUPPLEMENT THE PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORK TO SUPPORT THE SMOKE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM.

INTENDED OUTCOMES INCLUDE ALLOWING THE PUBLIC AND IDEQ TO VIEW IN REAL TIME SMOKE IMPACTS WHERE THERE ARE NO PM2.5 MONITORS. IDEQ WILL ALSO BE USING THESE MONITORS DURING THE CROP RESIDUE BURNING AND PRESCRIBED FIRE SEASONS TO ENSURE PUBLIC HEALTH IS PROTECTED.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF IDAHO.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES AND CONDUCTS AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN THE ALASKAN SKAGWAY COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT THE SKAGWAY COMMUNITY WHILE COMBINING AIR QUALITY EFFORTS AND EQUIPMENT WITH THE KLONDIKE GOLD RUSH NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK AND THE MUNICIPALITY OF SKAGWAY:  LEVERAGE A COMPREHENSIVE AIR QUALITY MEASUREMENT AND REAL-TIME ADVISORY PROGRAM THAT HAS BEEN DESIGNED TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENTAL RESOURCES FOR THE RESIDENTS AND VISITORS OF SKAGWAY, ALASKA. WELL-PROVEN TECHNIQUES WILL BE IMPLEMENTED TO ENSURE THE HIGHEST QUALITY IS GATHERED AND DISSEMINATED TO THE PUBLIC IN REAL-TIME IN PROVIDING VALUABLE POLLUTANT SOURCES THAT IMPACTS THE ECOSYSTEM AND HUMAN HEALTH. 

SKAGWAY TRADITIONAL COUNCIL WILL BE A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: DEPLOY MULTI-POLLUTANT AIR QUALITY MEASUREMENT SYSTEM USING A COMBINATION OF FEM MEASUREMENTS AND SENSOR NODES. COLLECTION OF REAL-TIME DATA FOR OZONE, NITROGEN OXIDE, NITROGEN DIOXIDE, SULFUR DIOXIDE, CARBON MONOXIDE, CARBON DIOXIDE, AND PARTICULATE MATTER WILL BE CONDUCTED. 

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: THE COMBINING EFFORTS OF AIR QUALITY WITH BOTH KLONDIKE GOLD RUSH NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK AND MUNICIPALITY OF SKAGWAY WILL NURTURE, EDUCATE, AND PROTECT TRIBAL MEMBERS AND VISITORS OF SKAGWAY, ALASKA.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE.: RESIDENTS OF SKAGWAY, ALASKA.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. 


SUBRECIPIENT:ONE SUBRECIPIENT WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR CARRYING OUT THE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT SEGMENT OF THIS WORKPLAN.  THE AGENCY WILL HELP PREPARE A COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PLAN BY IDENTIFYING AND ENGAGING WITH KEY COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND OTHER INTERESTED STAKEHOLDERS.  A GOAL IS TO LEAD  DISCUSSIONS REGARDING COMMUNITIES' CONCERNS WITH LOCAL AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE EXPERIENCE ENGAGING UNDERSERVED AND DIVERSE POPULATIONS. THEY WILL OVERSEE THE  COMMUNITY-LED AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES (WALKING OR BIKING TOURS, ETC.) THAT WILL USE PORTABLE HAND-HELD SENSORS WHICH CAN BE CROSS-REFERENCED TO THE RESEARCH-GRADE INSTRUMENTS IN THE TREE.

A DIFFERENT  SUBRECIPIENT  WILL  ANALYZE THE DATA TO IDENTIFY DOMINANT SOURCES AND HEALTH RISKS.

OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE:
IN FOUR COMMUNITIES THAT PSCAA  IDENTIFIED AS BEING DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED, PSCAA WILL DEPLOY AN INNOVATIVE AIR MONITORING APPROACH USING A TREE (TRAILER FOR RESEARCHING ENVIRONMENTAL EQUITY) EQUIPPED WITH STATIONARY REFERENCE INSTRUMENTS AT A FIXED LOCATION BASED ON COMMUNITY INPUT TO EXPLORE THEIR NEIGHBORHOOD AIR QUALITY CONCERNS. BRANCHING OUT FROM THE TREE WILL BE COMMUNITY-LED AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES (WALKING OR BIKING TOURS, ETC.) THAT WILL USE PORTABLE HAND-HELD SENSORS WHICH CAN BE CROSS-REFERENCED TO THE RESEARCH-GRADE INSTRUMENTS IN THE TREE.

OUTCOMES: PSCAA  WILL LEVERAGE THEIR CURRENT WEB-BASED TOOLS AND DEVELOP THEM FURTHER FOR DISPLAYING AND COMMUNICATING THE DATA AS CLOSE TO REAL-TIME AS POSSIBLE. OUR UNIV. OF DATA WILL BE ANALYZED  TO IDENTIFY DOMINANT SOURCES AND HEALTH RISKS. WE WILL SHARE DATA AS IT IS COLLECTED AND COMMUNICATE THE RESULTS REGULARLY TO OUR COMMUNITY PARTNERS, WITH THE AIM OF INCREASING AWARENESS, EDUCATING, AND HELPING THE COMMUNITIES TO DEVELOP GOALS AND ACTION PLANS. PSCAA  VISION IS THAT THIS APPROACH CAN CONTINUE BEYOND THE TIMELINE OF THE GRANT; AND BECOME A BEACON FOR HOW GOVERNMENT AGENCIES AND COMMUNITIES CAN SHARE POWER, EXCHANGE INFORMATION, AND PROVIDE DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES WITH FLEXIBLE, RESPONSIVE AIR QUALITY RESOURCES.

WHO BENEFITS:  COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN 4 DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED NEIGHBORHOODS IN SEATTLE AND TACOMA WASHINGTON.


THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE COMMUNITY MEMBERS FROM 4 SEATTLE AND TACOMA NEIGHBORHOODS DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO MAINTAIN FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) MONITORING NETWORKS. THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED DATA ON AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF PM2.5 AS WELL AS CHEMICAL COMPOSITION AND PRECURSORS. DATA WILL BE USED FOR: (1) PROVIDING AIR POLLUTION DATA TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN A TIMELY MANNER, (2) PM2.5 NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) COMPARISONS, (3) DEVELOPMENT AND TRACKING OF IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, (4) ASSESSMENTS OF REGIONAL HAZE, AND (5) ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH STUDIES AND OTHER AMBIENT AEROSOL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. THE PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORK DESIGN ADDRESSES THESE FOUR PROGRAM OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMBINATION OF SITING AND INSTRUMENTATION STRATEGIES.ACTIVITIES:FUNDING IS FOR OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) NATIONAL CORE (NCORE) MONITORING NETWORK AT CHEEKA PEAK OBSERVATORY (CPO) MONITORING SITE. THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS COMPLIANCE WITH NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS BY CONTINUING THE ONGOING COLLECTION OF DATA ON THE AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF FINE PARTICULATE MATTER.

ORCAA WILL OPERATE AND MAINTAIN TRACE LEVEL SO2, NO/NOY AND CO ANALYZERS, AN O3 ANALYZER, A NEPHELOMETER AEROSOL SCATTERING AND CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR, WIND SPEED, WIND DIRECTION, RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AMBIENT TEMPERATURE AND BAROMETRIC PRESSURE MONITORS TO SATISFY THE WASHINGTON STATE DEPARTMENT OF ECOLOGY (ECY) QUALITY ASSURANCE (QA) REQUIREMENTS. THE RECIPIENT WILL COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND SUBMIT RESULTS TO EPA'S NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT THE STATE OF ALASKA'S COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION PROPOSES A THREE-YEAR PROJECT TO EXPAND THE EXISTING AIR QUALITY SENSOR NETWORK USING AQMESH SENSOR PODS AND TO PROVIDE BASELINE AIR QUALITY DATA FOR AREAS NOT COVERED BY THE STATE'S REGULATORY MONITORING NETWORK. WITH THE FUNDING DEC WILL PURCHASE AND INSTALL EIGHT ADDITIONAL SENSOR PODS (SEVEN FOR COMMUNITY INSTALL PLUS ONE AUDIT POD), MAINTAIN THE ENTIRE AQMESH SENSOR POD NETWORK IN 33 COMMUNITIES AND PROVIDE OUTREACH, EDUCATION, AND ASSISTANCE TO THE COMMUNITIES WITH SENSORS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THIS PROJECT WILL FUND THE INSTALLATION OF AQMESH PODS IN SEVEN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE STATE, ALL OF WHICH EITHER HAVE NO PRIOR AIR QUALITY MONITORING DATA FOR THE AREA OR ARE IN AN AREA WITH HIGH AIR POLLUTION BUT NOT COVERED BY AN AIR MONITOR. ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION  WILL COLLECT THREE YEARS OF BASELINE GASEOUS CRITERIA POLLUTANT DATA (EXCEPT FOR OZONE, SINCE OZONE IS NOT A PROBLEM IN ALASKA) AND BASELINE PM DATA YEAR-ROUND FOR THE 33 COMMUNITIES IN THE ENTIRE NETWORK. THE DATA WILL BE DISPLAYED ON THE STATE'S WEBSITE, WILL PROVIDE REAL-TIME AQI INFORMATION AND WILL BE USED TO ISSUE AIR QUALITY ADVISORIES SHOULD LOCAL CONCENTRATIONS REACH 'UNHEALTHY FOR SENSITIVE GROUPS' LEVELS OR ABOVE. ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION  WILL WORK WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES TO IDENTIFY LOCALIZED AIR POLLUTION SOURCES, DEVELOP BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF AIR QUALITY AND IMPACTS TO HEALTH, AND WORK WITH THE LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL STAFF, TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICES AND SCHOOLS TO DEVELOP TAILORED OUTREACH AND EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS. ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION  WILL SUPPORT LOCAL COMMUNITIES IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF MITIGATION MEASURES AND OTHER STRATEGIES TO REDUCE EMISSIONS. IF THE MONITORING DATA DOCUMENT MANMADE AIR QUALITY IMPACTS, ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION WILL CONSIDER IF A MORE SOPHISTICATED LONG-TERM MONITORING METHOD IS APPROPRIATE FOR THE LOCATION.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN (ARP) FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.   ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING A CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR AT THE ALEXANDER SITE ON THE PUYALLUP TRIBE RESERVATION. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: ENSURE THAT ALL PUYALLUP TRIBE RECIPIENTS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS THROUGH THE OPERATION OF PM2.5 AND OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT AIR MONITORING THAT ARE IN ACCORDANCE TO ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS THAT LEAD TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR DATA.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PURCHASE AN AQ MESH AIR QUALITY MONITOR.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR(S) TO REPLACE FILTER-BASED PM2.5 MONITOR(S). EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ENHANCE MONITORING OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARD (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.  THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ENHANCE MONITORING OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARD (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.  ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL PRIMARILY BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS.  FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS.  THE FUNDS MAY BE USED TO ADDRESS OTHER CONSIDERATIONS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS. AS A RECIPIENT OF THIS EPA GRANT, CONFEDERATED TRIBES AND BANDS OF THE YAKAMA NATION WILL: 1. REVIEW AND COMPARE EPA PROPOSED EQUIPMENT FOR PURCHASE AND DETERMINE IF ANY ADJUSTMENTS NEED TO BE MADE ON ENHANCEMENTS AT VARIOUS AIR MONITORING SITES BASED ON CURRENT NEEDS IN COORDINATION WITH WASHINGTON DEPARTMENT OF ECOLOGY (WA DOE), CONSULT WITH EPA AND WA DOE ABOUT PROPOSED CHANGES/UPDATES, 2. PREPARE AND INITIATE PROCUREMENT REQUEST(S) FOR EQUIPMENT PURCHASE(S), 3. PURCHASE EQUIPMENT, 
4.TAKE DELIVERY OF EQUIPMENT UPON VERIFICATION OF FUNCTIONALITY OF EQUIPMENT AND MOVE FORWARD WITH PAYMENT OF VENDOR INVOICES, AND  5. PLAN FOR TIMELY SET-UP AND INSTALLATION OF EQUIPMENT CONSISTENT WITH THE GOAL OF ENHANCING AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES IN EJ AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.  
SUBRECIPIENT:YAKAMA NATION WILL CONTRACT WASHINGTON DEPARTMENT OF ECOLOGY TO PURCHASE AND INSTALL: MET ONE BAM 1020 WITH VSC TO MONITOR FOR PM2.5, EKTO BX-904 SHELTER (AC INCLUDED), GREAT PLAINS DTMHLT3012 MID-HINGE-FOLD-LATTICE-TOWER, VAISALA WMT700 ULTRASONIC WIND SENSOR, SUPPLIES FOR BAM 1020, ROOM TEMPERATURE SENSOR AND ASSORTED CABLING FOR AC/HEATER INTEGRATION, AND DATA LOGGER, MODEM, AND ROUTER.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE 1) REPORTING OF EXPENDITURES OF ARP FUNDS VIA COMPLETION OF PROCUREMENT OR TAKING DELIVERY OF AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT FOR ENHANCING AMBIENT AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARD (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS CONSISTENT WITH STATED GOALS AND OBJECTIVES FOR THE USE OF AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDING, 2) REPORTING OF STATUS OF SETTING UP AND INSTALLING OF EQUIPMENT TO BEGIN USE OF ACTUAL EQUIPMENT AS PART AIR MONITORING NETWORK SITES, AND  3) REPORTING OF DRAW DOWN OF FEDERAL FUNDS UPON DELIVERY AND ACCEPTANCE OF ARP FUNDED EQUIPMENT. OUTCOMES INCLUDE OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS THE CONTINUANCE THAT THE SPOKANE TRIBE WILL DEVELOP THEIR AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES AND PROGRAM THROUGH AMBIENT AIR QUALITY MONITORING AND ANALYSIS, CONDUCTING EDUCATION AND OUTREACH ON ACTIVITIES CONCERNING AIR QUALITY, COLLABORATING WITH EPA ON IMPLEMENTATION OF THE FEDERAL AIR RULES FOR RESERVATIONS (FARR) AND CLEAN AIR ACT (CAA), AND PREPARING AN EMISSIONS INVENTORY. IMPLEMENTATION OF THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BENEFIT AND PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH AND AIR QUALITY ON THE RESERVATION.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ON THIS GRANT WILL BE THE FOLLOWING:
- MONITOR PM2.5 DATA MONTHLY FOR AIR QUALITY.
- PROVIDE RECOMMENDATIONS FROM TECHNICAL REVIEW OF PM10 MONITORING SITE AT MIDNITE MIND SUPERFUND. REVIEW WEEKLY REPORTS FROM NEWMONT/DAWN MINING ON AQ. 
- PARTICIPATE IN GROUND RADIATION SURVEYS OF IDENTIFIED HOMES AND SITES THAT HAS ELEVATED LEVELS.
- PERFORM RADON TESTING IN HOMES, SCHOOLS, AND TRIBAL OFFICES.
- IDENTIFY TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR TRIBAL CONSTRUCTION, MAINTENANCE AND APPRENTICE PROGRAMS TO MITIGATE HOMES WITH EXCEEDED RADON LEVELS. OUTREACH  AND EDUCATION TO CONTRACTORS, SPOKANE HOUSING AUTHORITY, PLANNING, TRIBAL MAINTENANCE STAFF, AND OTHERS ON THE RADON RESISTANT NEW CONSTRUCTION (RRNC) BUILDING CODES. PARTICIPATE IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL RADON MEETINGS AND TRAININGS. 
- PROMOTE AWARENESS AND USE OF FARR HOTLINE WHILE COORDINATING WITH R10 ON FARR REGISTRATION AND PARTICIPATE IN BURN BAN CALLS. 
- ATTEND AQ TRAININGS (ITEP, TREATMENT AS A STATE, RADON MITIGATION SYSTEMS, REGIONAL/NATIONAL TRIBAL AIR, INDOOR AIR QUALITY, AND ASTHMA MEETINGS).
- PARTICIPATE IN CONFERENCE CALLS, WEBINARS, AND OTHER AVAILABLE ONLINE TRAININGS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE REPORTS ON MONITORING SUMMARIES, ON ARTICLES, NEWS/RADIO PIECES, BURN BANS ADVISORY, AND MEETINGS ATTENDED FOR AIR QUALITY. REDUCTION IN HEALTH RISK ASSOCIATED WITH RADON AND RADON REDUCTION SYSTEMS THAT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED IN THE REPORTS

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO ODEQ TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES IN THE STATE OF OREGON WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.  
ACTIVITIES:THESE ARP FUNDS WILL PRIMARILY BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS.   THE FUNDS MAY BE USED TO ADDRESS OTHER CONSIDERATIONS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE MONITORING INVESTMENTS THAT STRENGTHEN AN AGENCY'S MONITORING NETWORK.  SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES COULD INCLUDE BUT NOT LIMITED TO  THE PURCHASE OF MONITORING EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES, THE PURCHASE OF AIR MONITORING SHELTERS, AND THE INSTALLATION OF AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT AND SITES.
OUTCOMES:OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS.  FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS.   INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.  
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO MAINTAIN FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) MONITORING NETWORKS.  THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED DATA ON AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF PM2.5 AS WELL AS CHEMICAL COMPOSITION AND PRECURSORS. DATA WILL BE USED FOR: (1) PROVIDING AIR POLLUTION DATA TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN A TIMELY MANNER, (2) PM2.5 NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) COMPARISONS, (3) DEVELOPMENT AND TRACKING OF IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, (4) ASSESSMENTS OF REGIONAL HAZE, AND (5) ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH STUDIES AND OTHER AMBIENT AEROSOL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. THE PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORK DESIGN ADDRESSES THESE FOUR PROGRAM OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMBINATION OF SITING AND INSTRUMENTATION STRATEGIES.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  THE RECIPIENT WILL COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND SUBMIT RESULTS TO EPA'S NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  THE ANTICIPATED SHORT-TERM OUTCOME FOR THIS PROJECT IS AN INCREASE IN THE KNOWLEDGE REGARDING THE CHARACTER AND EXTENT OF PM2.5 IN THE AMBIENT AIR. THE LONG-TERM OUTCOME, THROUGH THE EVENTUAL DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THE STATE'S IMPLEMENTATION PLAN, IS REDUCED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH THE PM2.5 NAAQS AS SET FORTH IN THE CLEAN AIR ACT.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE STATE RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:  THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE ARKANSAS DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT/DIVISION OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IS TO ENHANCE AIR QUALITY AND ECONOMIC MODELING IN ARKANSAS STATE IMPLEMENTATION PLAN DEVELOPMENT.

SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL USE THE FUNDS PROVIDED UNDER THIS GRANT TO TO PROCURE ADDITIONAL STORAGE AND CORES FOR ITS COMPREHENSIVE AIR QUALITY MODEL WITH EXTENSIONS (CAMX) WORK STATION, TO SUPPORT A PHOTOCHEMICAL MODELING CONTRACT, TO UPGRADE DATA LOGGERS AT AIR MONITORING SITES, TO PROCURE ENHANCEMENTS TO THE AIRVISION DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM THAT CREATES A WEB-BASED PUBLIC INFORMATION SYSTEM FOR REAL-TIME AIR QUALITY DATA AND HISTORICAL DATA, AND TO PARTICIPATE IN AIRVISION TRAINING.

DIVISION OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY USES COMPREHENSIVE AIR QUALITY MODEL WITH EXTENSIONS TO EVALUATE SOURCES IMPACTING AIR QUALITY FOR STATE IMPLEMENTATION PLAN DEVELOPMENT AND EVALUATING THE IMPACT OF EMISSION CONTROL STRATEGIES ON AIR QUALITY.  THE MODELING FILES REQUIRE SUBSTANTIAL HARD DRIVE SPACE, WHICH MUST BE RETAINED FOR A PERIOD AFTER STATE IMPLEMENTATION PLANS ARE SUBMITTED. IN ADDITION, DIVISION OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY USES A PHOTOCHEMICAL MODELING CONTRACTOR WHEN ITS STAFF MODELING POSITION IS VACANT AND TO PROVIDE TRAINING TO STAFF ON PHOTOCHEMICAL GRID MODELING. EXAMPLES OF STATE IMPLEMENTATION PLANS THAT MAY BE SUPPORTED BY PHOTOCHEMICAL MODELING STUDIES INCLUDE EVALUATION OF INTERSTATE TRANSPORT OF OZONE AND FINE PARTICULATE MATTER AND REGIONAL HAZE PLANS.

DIVISION OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY CURRENTLY USES LEGACY MODEL 8832 DATA LOGGERS, WHICH WILL BE REPLACED WITH MODEL 8872 WINDOWS-BASED DATA LOGGERS. THE REPLACEMENT DATA LOGGERS INCLUDE IMPROVEMENTS TO GSI/MODBUS CHANNEL TYPES AND INTEGRATE WITH THE AGILAIRE AIRVISION SOFTWARE. THE MODEL 8872 DATA LOGGERS ALSO ENABLE THE USE OF THE TECH-ASSIST MOBILE APP TO ENABLE AIR MONITORING STAFF TO ACCESS MOST OF THE FUNCTIONALITY OF THE LOGGER TOOL BOX FROM MOBILE PHONES AND TABLETS. 

PROCUREMENT OF AGILE-WEB WILL ENABLE DIVISION OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY TO UPDATE HOW THE AGENCY PROVIDES ACCESS TO AIR QUALITY MONITORING INFORMATION. THE WEB INTERFACE WILL MAKE PUBLIC ACCESS TO REAL-TIME AND HISTORICAL AIR QUALITY DATA AND REPORT GENERATION EASIER.  IT WILL ALSO PROVIDE A PASSWORD-PROTECTED WEB INTERFACE FOR AIR QUALITY INDEX FORECAST ENTRY. 
LASTLY, DIVISION OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY WILL PARTICIPATE IN TRAINING FOR ITS EXISTING AIRVISION DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM, THE NEW DATA LOGGERS, AND AGILE-WEB.
ACTIVITIES:DIVISION OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY STAFF WILL UTILIZE THE EQUIPMENT AND SOFTWARE PURCHASED UNDER THIS GRANT TO CONDUCT AIR QUALITY MODELING STUDIES OF POTENTIAL POLICY SCENARIOS ASSOCIATED WITH STATE IMPLEMENTATION PLAN DEVELOPMENT AND TO ENHANCE AIR MONITORING DATA COLLECTION, MANAGEMENT, AND IMPROVE PUBLIC INFORMATION RESOURCES ABOUT AIR QUALITY IN ARKANSAS.

PHOTOCHEMICAL MODELING, ECONOMIC MODELING.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE TECHNICAL SUPPORTING DOCUMENTATION FOR STATE AIR QUALITY POLICY DOCUMENTS, SUCH AS STATE IMPLEMENTATION PLANS AND 111D PLANS.

COMITTMENT 1.1 : PROCURE ADDITIONAL MODELING HARD DRIVES AND CPU CORES AND MODELING SUPPORT CONTRACT: 
MODELING RESULTS
TECHNICAL SUPPORT DOCUMENTS

COMITTMENT 1.2: COMITTMENT 1.2: AIR MONITORING DATA MANAGEMENT ENHANCEMENTS: 
AIR MONITORING DATA
WEB-BASED PUBLIC INFORMATION SYSTEM FOR REAL-TIME AIR QUALITY DATA AND HISTORICAL DATA

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE:

MODELING RESULTS WILL HELP ESTIMATE THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN SOURCES AND THEIR EFFECTS ON AMBIENT AIR QUALITY, INCLUDING POTENTIAL REDUCTIONS UNDER VARYING CONTOL TECHNOLGIES AND STRATEGIES.

UPGRADES TO DATALOGGERS, ENHANCEMENTS TO AIRVISION DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM, AND  TRAINING WILL ENHANCE DATA QUALITY AND COMMUNICATION TO THE PUBLIC ABOUT AIR QUALITY

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO CITY OF ALBUQUERQUE.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PERFORM ADMINISTRATION AND COORDINATION, RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT, AIR PLANNING, POLLUTION SOURCE INFORMATION AND OR EMISSION INVENTORY AND AIR MONITORING.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ADMINISTRATION AND COORDINATION, RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT, AIR PLANNING, POLLUTION SOURCE INFORMATION AND OR EMISSION INVENTORY AND AIR MONITORING.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE GEOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION SYSTEM (GIS) MAPPING OF SENSITIVE AND OVERBURDENED COMMUNITIES IN ALBUQUERQUEMDASH;BERNALILLO COUNTY, HEALTH RISK ASSESSMENT FOR OVERBURDENED COMMUNITIES IN ALBUQUERQUE-BERNALILLO COUNTY. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE CONTRACTOR WILL ASSIST THE PROGRAM WITH IDENTIFYING SENSITIVE AND OVERBURDENED COMMUNITIES IN THE CITY OF ALBUQUERQUE AND BERNALILLO COUNTY THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF AN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE ('EJ') INDEX OR SCORE BASED ON DEMOGRAPHIC, ENVIRONMENTAL, PUBLIC HEALTH, AND OTHER APPROPRIATE DATA. CONDUCT BRIEF QUALITY CONTROL (QC) OF VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUND (VOC), BLACK CARBON (BC), AND CRITERIA POLLUTANT DATA; 2) CONDUCT WIND DIRECTION AND TEMPORAL ANALYSES TO UNDERSTAND DIRECTION OF SOURCES AND RELATIVE IMPACTS OF LOCAL VERSUS REGIONAL SOURCES FOR SELECTED POLLUTANTS; 3) CONDUCT SOURCE APPORTIONMENT OF VOC DATA TO QUANTIFY VOC SOURCES; AND 4) DETERMINE THE CANCER AND NON-CANCER RISK ASSOCIATED WITH SELECTED POLLUTANTS, INCLUDING ASSESSMENT OF HOW CONCENTRATIONS COMPARE TO NEARBY SITES AND NATIONAL RANGES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE COMMUNITIES IN THE CITY OF ALBUQUERQUE.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER INFLATION REDUCTION ACT TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.  THE PROJECT WILL ESTABLISH AN AIR QUALITY MONITORING PROGRAM TO UNDERSTAND AIR QUALITY RISKS TO THE
COMMUNITY'S HEALTH AND WELFARE.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND THE TRIBAL GOVERNMENT THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. THE OVERALL PROJECT OBJECTIVE IS TO ESTABLISH AN AIR QUALITY MONITORING PROGRAM TO UNDERSTAND THE AIR QUALITY RISKS TO THE HEALTH AND WELFARE OF OUR COMMUNITY, BY INSTALLING AMBIENT AIR SAMPLERS TO MEASURE LEVELS OF AIRBORNE RADIONUCLIDES EMANATING FROM LANL OPERATIONS AND INSTALL A PURPLEAIR SENSOR NETWORK TO MONITOR DUST AND SMOKE CONCENTRATIONS NEAR THE PUEBLO HOUSING AREAS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE ESTABLISHMENT OF AN AIR QUALITY MONITORING PROGRAM BY INSTALLING AMBIENT AIR SAMPLERS TO MEASURE LEVELS OF AIRBORNE
RADIONUCLIDES EMANATING FROM LANL OPERATIONS AND INSTALLING A PURPLEAIR SENSOR NETWORK TO MONITOR DUST AND SMOKE CONCENTRATIONS NEAR THE PUEBLO HOUSING AREAS. ADDITIONALLY, THE PUEBLO WILL INCORPORATE PROJECT FINDINGS INTO A CUMULATIVE IMPACT ASSESSMENT BASED ON GREATER EXPOSURE PATHWAYS ASSOCIATED WITH THE TRIBAL LIFEWAYS AND DEVELOP DATA-DRIVEN STRATEGIES.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASING COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE ABOUT AIR POLLUTION, DRIVE BEHAVIOR CHANGE TO MINIMIZE THE HEALTH RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH EXPOSURE TO POOR AIR QUALITY AND ULTIMATELY PROMOTE IMPROVED AIR QUALITY THOROUGH COMMUNITY EDUCATION AND ACTION BY (1) LEVERAGING RESULTS-ORIENTED ANALYSES BASED ON REAL-TIME DATA COLLECTION; (2) ALIGNING WITH THE AGENCY'S STRATEGIC GOAL OF CAPACITY BUILDING IN UNDERSERVED/OVERBURDENED COMMUNITIES; AND (3) DEMONSTRATING ACHIEVEMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH PROTECTION.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE RESIDENTS AND TRIBAL COMMUNITY WITHIN AND NEAR THE PUEBLO DE SAN ILDEFONSO IN THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO.  THIS PROJECT WILL BETTER CHARACTERIZE THE MAGNITUDE AND EXTENT OF THE AIR QUALITY PROBLEMS TO PROTECT THE HEALTH OF THE COMMUNITY.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE LOUISIANA ENVIRONMENTAL ACTION NETWORK (LEAN) WILL BE ASSESSING AIR QUALITY AT THE BLOCK LEVEL THROUGHOUT LOUISIANA'S INDUSTRIAL CORRIDOR WHILE EXPANDING AIR QUALITY LITERACY IN HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES AND IDENTIFYING ACTIONABLE STRATEGIES TO REDUCE EXPOSURE AND EMISSIONS.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL: DESIGN A MONITORING STRATEGY, WITH COMMUNITY GUIDANCE, CENTERED AROUND ACLIMA'S (LOUISIANA ENVIRONMENTAL ACTION NETWORK'S (LEAN'S) TECHNICAL PARTNER) PROPRIETARY TECHNOLOGY AND REINFORCED BY STATIONARY AIR MONITORING HUBS IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. THIS PROJECT WILL TAKE PLACE IN 4 DISTINCT PHASES: 1. OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT, 2. ACLIMA'S HYPERLOCAL MONITORING, 3. BUILDING COMMUNITY AIR HUBS, 4. ANALYSIS AND SOLUTIONS. THROUGH A COMBINATION OF PUBLIC OUTREACH, COMMUNITY WORKSHOPS, DATA COLLECTION, AND ANALYSIS, THIS PROJECT AIMS TO FILL THE GAPS IN INFORMATION NECESSARY TO ADDRESS LONG STANDING CONCERNS IN AN OVERBURDENED REGION. THE ULTIMATE GOAL OF THIS WORK IS TO PROVIDE AIR QUALITY DATA TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, IMPROVE AIR QUALITY LITERACY, IDENTIFY LOCALLY SPECIFIC STRATEGIES TO REDUCE EXPOSURE, AS WELL AS DEVELOP RECOMMENDATION TO REDUCE EMISSIONS.SUBRECIPIENT:LEAN WILL HOST A SERIES OF WORKSHOPS WITH COMMUNITY/NEIGHBORHOOD/SCHOOL PARTNERS COMMUNICATING RESULTS OF COMMUNITY MONITOR RESULTS, ACLIMA COLLECTED DATA AS WELL AS APPLICABLE DATA COLLECTED BY LDEQ / EPA.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES: 
- PRINT/DIGITAL AD CAMPAIGN MATERIAL
- ENGAGEMENT WORKSHOPS AND ACLIMA EMPLOYMENT RECRUITMENT 
- COMPREHENSIVE AIR QUALITY DATA OF ENTIRE INDUSTRIAL CORRIDOR
- 3-4 AIR MONITORING STATIONS CONTROLLED AND MAINTAINED BY LOCAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS
- FEEDBACK MEETINGS WITH COMMUNITY PARTNER/LIAISONS TO AID IN OPERATION AND USE OF HUBS
- COMPREHENSIVE REPORT OF ENTIRE MONITORING EFFORTS TO DATE, INCLUDING MOBILE MONITORING AND STATIONARY HUBS.
- EDUCATIONAL MATERIAL COMMUNICATING THE RESULTS OF MOBILE AND STATIONARY MONITORING

OUTCOMES:
- WIDER SCOPE OF COMMUNITIES AND INDIVIDUALS DEMONSTRATING INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF AIR QUALITY DATA AND ASSOCIATED RISKS.
- INDIVIDUALS INTERACTING WITH THE PROJECT WILL BE KNOWLEDGEABLE ABOUT LOCAL POLLUTING AGENTS, POLLUTANTS PRESENT AROUND THEIR HOMES AND NEIGHBORHOODS, CONCENTRATIONS OF AMBIENT AIR POLLUTION, AND THE HAZARDS THEY POSE TO HUMAN HEALTH.
- ADJUSTMENT IN COMMUNITY AND INDIVIDUAL BEHAVIORS TO REDUCE EXPOSURE. COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL BE ABLE TO IDENTIFYING SAFE TIMES OF DAY TO BE OUTSIDE AND IN CLOSE PROXIMITY TO EMITTING FACILITIES,
- COMMUNITIES COLLECTIVELY ORGANIZING TO ENGAGE IN CONVERSATION AND ACTION WITH LOCAL GOVERNMENT AND INDUSTRIES ABOUT AIR QUALITY IN THEIR AREAS.
- POLICY RECOMMENDATIONS FOR CHANGES TO INDUSTRIAL ZONING AND PERMITS.
- REDUCTION OF HARMFUL EMISSIONS FROM INDUSTRIES WITHIN THE PROGRAM AREA.
- REDUCED ILLNESS AND HOSPITALIZATION DUE TO RESPIRATORY HAZARDS.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER INFLATION REDUCTION ACT TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE CORONAVIRUS DISEASE (COVID-19) PANDEMIC.ACTIVITIES:CAPITOL AREA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (CAPCOG) ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS. CAPITOL AREA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (CAPCOG) PROPOSES TO OPERATE SEVEN RESEARCH-GRADE CONTINUOUS PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) MONITORS AND TO DISTRIBUTE UP TO 20 LOW-COST CONTINUOUS PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) SENSORS IN THE REGION. PROJECT WILL CONSIST OF CONTINUOUS MEASUREMENTS OF PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) CONCENTRATIONS IN THE METROPOLITAN STATISTICAL AREA (MSA). PROJECT WILL ALSO IMPROVE THE UNDERSTANDING OF WHERE HIGH LEVELS OF PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) OCCUR IN THE REGION, IMPROVE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) FORECASTING, ENHANCE LOCAL DECISION-MAKING, BETTER-TARGETED PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) EMISSION REDUCTION ACTIONS, REDUCE PUBLIC'S EXPOSURE TO SHORT-TERM PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) POLLUTION AND EXPAND COMMUNITY CAPACITY FOR FUTURE MONITORING. 

SUBRECIPIENT:CAPITOL AREA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (CAPCOG) WILL ISSUE SUBAWARDS TO HUSTON TILLOTSON UNIVERSITY (HTU) AND ST. EDWARDS UNIVERSITY (SEU). EACH UNIVERSITY WILL HAVE 2 FACULTY MEMBERS THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT PERIOD AND ONE STUDENT FOR SUMMER 2025. THE SUBAWARDS WILL FUND FACULTY TIME TO PARTICIPATE THROUGHOUT THE GRANT PERIOD AS A PROJECT PARTNER IN ADDITION TO TRAINING THE FACULTY ON THE MAINTENANCE AND OPERATION OF THE MONITORS. THE SUBAWARDS WILL FUND ONE STUDENT FROM EACH UNIVERSITY TO WORK ON THE PROJECT IN SUMMER 2024 TO LEARN THE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE MONITORS AND TO ASSIST IN DATA ANALYSES OF THE COLLECTED DATA THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT PERIOD. THE SUBAWARD AMOUNTS INCLUDE TRAVEL FOR UNIVERSITY FACULTY AND STUDENTS TO VISIT THE SITES TO RECEIVE TRAINING ON THE MAINTENANCE AND OPERATION OF THE MONITORS. CAPCOG PROPOSES TO SUBAWARD APPROXIMATELY $24,114 TO HT AND $34,589.00 TO SEU FOR THE PROJECT PERIOD. THE SUBAWARD AMOUNTS WERE DEVELOPED IN CONSULTATION WITH SEU AND HT FACULTY AND THE OFFICES OF SPONSORED PROGRAMS TO ENSURE ACCURACY OF THE COST ESTIMATES. THE TOTAL SUBAWARD AMOUNT EQUALS $58,703.00.OUTCOMES:CAPITOL AREA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (CAPCOG): 
ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE NEAR-REAL-TIME CONTINUOUS MEASUREMENTS OF PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) CONCENTRATIONS IN THE METROPOLITAN STATISTICAL AREA STREAMED TO THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY'S AIRNOW SYSTEM ALONG WITH REPORTS DOCUMENTING MONITORING OPERATIONS AND DATA QUALITY.    

EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE TO IMPROVE UNDERSTANDING OF WHERE HIGH LEVELS OF PARTICULATE MATTERS (PM2.5) OCCUR IN THE REGION THAT MAY NOT CURRENTLY BE MEASURED BY EXISTING MONITORS, ESPECIALLY IN AREAS WITH UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. ADDITIONALLY, INCREASE ENHANCED MONITORING WHICH WILL PROVIDE MORE INFORMED LOCAL DECISION-MAKING, INCREASE TARGETED PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) EMISSION REDUCTION ACTIONS AND THE REDUCTION OF THE PUBLIC'S EXPOSURE TO SHORT-TERM PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) POLLUTION WHEN IT OCCURS. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO PROVIDE TRAINING IN PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) MONITORING EQUIPMENT WHICH WILL ALLOW THE COMMUNITY TO SUSTAIN THE OPERATION OF THE MONITORS AND EXPAND COMMUNITY CAPACITY FOR FUTURE MONITORING BEYOND THE GRANT PERIOD.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE CITIZENS OF THE STATE OF TEXAS (CENTRAL AREA) IN OR NEAR UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES SPECIFICALLY IN THE AUSTIN-ROUND ROCK-GEORGETOWN METROPOLITAN STATISTICAL AREA (BASTROP, CALDWELL, HAYS, TRAVIS AND WILLIAMSON COUNTY).

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER INFLATION REDUCTION ACT TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.

THE LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (LDEQ) IS REQUESTING FUNDING FOR THE SETUP AND OPERATION OF A POLYCYCLIC AROMATIC HYDROCARBONS (PAHS) AIR MONITORING SITE BETWEEN THE MCFARLAND CASCADE/STELLA-JONES IN PINEVILLE AND THE STELLA JONES WOOD TREATING FACILITY IN ALEXANDRIA. ONCE FUNDING IS RECEIVED, LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (LDEQ) WILL ORDER THE EQUIPMENT NEEDED TO OPERATE THE SITE. IT IS ESTIMATED THAT IT WILL TAKE 4 MONTHS TO OBTAIN THE EQUIPMENT. DURING THAT TIME, LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (LDEQ) PLANS ON HAVING THE LOCAL COMMUNITIES HELP SELECT THE LOCATION OF THE MONITORING SITE. ONCE THE SITE IS SELECTED, PROPER PERMITS WILL BE APPLIED FOR. ONCE ALL PERMITS ARE OBTAINED, THE SITE WILL BE SET UP. A PLATFORM WILL BE CONSTRUCTED AND ELECTRICITY WILL BE INSTALLED. A TISCH TE-1000 PUF SAMPLER WILL BE INSTALLED. A METEOROLOGICAL TOWER AND SENSOR WILL BE INSTALLED. THE METEOROLOGICAL DATA WILL PROVIDE ACCURATE LOCALIZED WIND CONDITIONS AT THE TIME OF AN ODOR COMPLAINTS AND HELP WITH POLLUTION SOURCE IDENTIFICATION. AS THE ODORS AND FEARS ARE ABATED THE COMMUNITIES WILL EXPERIENCE AN INCREASE TO THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE. IT IS ESTIMATED THAT IT WILL TAKE APPROXIMATELY 3-4 MONTHS TO GET THE SITE OPERATIONAL.  THE SITE WILL BE VISITED 1-2 TIMES PER WEEK BY LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (LDEQ) STAFF. SAMPLES WILL RUN FOR 24-HOURS, ON THE 6 DAY, EPA SAMPLING SCHEDULE. SAMPLES WILL BE COLLECTED, VERIFIED AND ANALYZED USING METHOD TO-13A. THE CONTRACTED LAB SGS NORTH AMERICA INC. WILL ANALYZER THE SAMPLES. THE SITE WILL RUN FOR APPROXIMATELY TWO YEARS. PROPER VERIFICATIONS AND CALIBRATION WILL BE CONDUCTED ON THE EQUIPMENT. A FINAL REPORT WILL BE AVAILABLE ON THE LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (LDEQ) PUBLIC WEB-PAGE. LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENNTAL QUALITY (LDEQ) WILL CONSULT WITH THE LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (LDH) AND THE LOUISIANA OFFICE OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT.ACTIVITIES: LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (LDEQ) WILL SETUP AND OPERATE A POLYCYCLIC AROMATIC HYDROCARBONS (PAH) AIR MONITORING SITE BETWEEN THE MCFARLAND CASCADE/STELLA-JONES IN PINEVILLE AND THE STELLA JONES WOOD TREATING FACILITY IN ALEXANDRIA, LOUISIANA.

THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE MONITORING POLYCYCLIC AROMATIC HYDROCARBONS (PAHS) IN AN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITY IN ALEXANDRIA-PINEVILLE. POLYCYCLIC AROMATIC HYDROCARBONS (PAH) DATA WILL BE AVAILABLE TO THE COMMUNITY AND ALL STAKEHOLDERS ONCE RECEIVED BACK AND FROM THE CONTRACTED LAB. MEETINGS WITH THE PUBLIC TO REVIEW DATA AND HEAR CONCERNS WILL BE CONDUCTED. CONFERENCE CALLS WITH PARTNERS WILL BE CONDUCTED TO REVIEW DATA. MEETINGS WITH OTHER LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENNTAL QUALITY (LDEQ) DIVISIONS WILL ALSO BE CONDUCTED TO REVIEW DATA AND ADDRESS ANY FACILITY ISSUES THAT MAY BE PRESENT.
