DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER INFLATION REDUCTION ACT TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.

THIS PROJECT IS TO ESTABLISH AND OPERATE A TEMPORARILY LOCATED COMMUNITY (TLC) AIR MONITORING SITE, THAT PROVIDES THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THEIR AIR QUALITY, TO THE DISPROPORTIONALLY OVERBURDENED AND UNDERSERVED AREA OF ST. JAMES PARISH LOCATED ON THE WEST BANK OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. AFTER COMMUNITY PARTNERS ASSIST IN DETERMINING WHAT POLLUTANTS TO MONITOR FOR AND WHERE TO PLACE THE SITE, THE DEPLOYMENT OF THE EQUIPMENT WILL ALLOW FOR NEAR REAL-TIME AIR QUALITY DATA AVAILABILITY FOR CERTAIN POLLUTANTS AND THE OPPORTUNITY FOR FURTHER COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT AS WE PROMOTE THE SITE AND HOW TO ACCESS THE DATA. TO FURTHER INCREASE COMMUNITY AWARENESS OUR LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (LDH) PARTNER THROUGH THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL PUBLIC HEALTH TRACKING (EPHT) ALSO PUBLICIZES THE DATA AND EDUCATES THE COMMUNITY CONCERNING HEALTH RISKS. 

TEMPORARILY LOCATED COMMUNITY (TLC) AIR MONITORS COLLECT AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA IN NEIGHBORHOODS USING ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) APPROVED METHODS AND PROTOCOLS, FOR AT LEAST ONE YEAR. TEMPORARILY LOCATED COMMUNITY (TLC) AIR MONITORS ARE AMBIENT AIR MONITORING TRAILERS/SHELTERS THAT ARE EQUIPPED TO MONITOR CONTINUOUSLY FOR 'AREA-SPECIFIC' REGULATED AIR POLLUTANTS. TWENTY-FOUR-HOUR CANISTERS WILL BE SET TO RUN ON THE EPA 6 DAY SAMPLING SCHEDULE. ALSO, 25 MINUTE TRIGGER CANISTERS WILL BE COLLECTED. THE DATA IS COLLECTED, ARCHIVED, MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC PRIOR TO DATA VALIDATION (HTTPS://AIRQUALITY.DEQ.LOUISIANA.GOV/DATA) AND PROVIDES TIMELY DATA ON THE EXTENT OF OUTDOOR POLLUTION AND AIR QUALITY POLLUTION TRENDS OF CERTAIN REGULATED POLLUTANTS. AFTER CONSULTATION WITH OUR COMMUNITY PARTNERS, LDH'S SECTION OF ENVIRONMENTAL EPIDEMIOLOGY AND TOXICOLOGY (SEET), AND OTHERS, THE FINAL LIST OF POLLUTANTS TO BE MONITORED AND AN INITIAL LIST OF PREFERRED SITES WILL BE DETERMINEDACTIVITIES:LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (LDEQ) WILL SETUP TEMPORARILY LOCATED COMMUNITY (TLC) AIR MONITORS COLLECT AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA IN NEIGHBORHOODS OF THE ST. JAMES PARISH WHO RESIDE ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER INCLUDING THE COMMUNITIES OF WELCOME, FREETOWN, ST. JAMES, MOONSHINE, AND VACHERIE, USING ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) APPROVED METHODS AND PROTOCOLS, FOR AT LEAST ONE YEAR. TLC AIR MONITORS ARE AMBIENT AIR MONITORING TRAILERS/SHELTERS THAT ARE EQUIPPED TO MONITOR CONTINUOUSLY FOR 'AREA-SPECIFIC' REGULATED AIR POLLUTANTS. TWENTY-FOUR-HOUR CANISTERS WILL BE SET TO RUN ON THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) 6 DAY SAMPLING SCHEDULE. ALSO, 25 MINUTE TRIGGER CANISTERS WILL BE COLLECTED. THE DATA IS COLLECTED, ARCHIVED, MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC PRIOR TO DATA VALIDATION (HTTPS://AIRQUALITY.DEQ.LOUISIANA.GOV/DATA) AND PROVIDES TIMELY DATA ON THE EXTENT OF OUTDOOR POLLUTION AND AIR QUALITY POLLUTION TRENDS OF CERTAIN REGULATED POLLUTANTS. AFTER CONSULTATION WITH OUR COMMUNITY PARTNERS, LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH'S (LDH'S) SECTION OF ENVIRONMENTAL EPIDEMIOLOGY AND TOXICOLOGY (SEET), AND OTHERS, THE FINAL LIST OF POLLUTANTS TO BE MONITORED AND AN INITIAL LIST OF PREFERRED SITES WILL BE DETERMINED

THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARD

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED GRANT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE COLLECTION OF VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS (VOC) MONITORING DATA USING LOW-COST SENSORS IN THE VICINITY OF AN EXISTING AIR MONITORING SITE, LOCATED NEAR THE CHEROKEE HEIGHTS COMMUNITY, TO ADDRESS A POTENTIAL CONCERN WITH ELEVATED VOC LEVELS EMITTED FROM THE NEARBY MIDAMERICA INDUSTRIAL PARK AND CONDUCT COMMUNITY OUTREACH.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PERFORM VOC MONITORING WITH LOW-COST SENSORS (TWO MODEL PHOTOCHEMICAL ASSESSMENT MONITORING STATIONS (PAMS)) IN THE VICINITY OF AN EXISTING AIR MONITORING SITE (LOCATED NEAR THE CHEROKEE HEIGHTS COMMUNITY) TO ADDRESS A POTENTIAL CONCERN WITH ELEVATED VOC LEVELS EMITTED FROM THE NEARBY MIDAMERICA INDUSTRIAL PARK.  A COMBINED OZONE + VOC SENSOR (CALLED AN AQLITE) WILL ALSO BE PURCHASED AND INSTALLED AT THE EXISTING STILWELL MONITORING SITE. SENSOR DATA WILL ALSO BE POSTED ON A PUBLIC WEBSITE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES: INCLUDE PURCHASING VOC MONITORING DATA OBTAINED USING LOW-COST SENSORS (TWO MODEL PAMS) IN THE VICINITY OF OUR EXISTING AIR MONITORING SITE (LOCATED NEAR THE CHEROKEE HEIGHTS COMMUNITY). A COMBINED OZONE + VOC SENSOR (CALLED AN AQLITE) WILL ALSO BE PURCHASED AND INSTALLED AT THE EXISTING STILWELL MONITORING SITE. SENSOR DATA WILL ALSO BE POSTED ON A PUBLIC WEBSITE.

EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PROJECT WILL ADDRESS A POTENTIAL CONCERN WITH ELEVATED VOC LEVELS EMITTED FROM THE NEARBY MIDAMERICA INDUSTRIAL PARK AND WILL BE COMPARED AGAINST THE EXISTING CONTINUOUS MONITORS TO BETTER CHARACTERIZE THEIR AIR SHED. DATA COLLECTED WILL ALSO BE USED FOR OUTREACH IN LOCAL SCHOOLS AS PART OF THE STEM CURRICULUM AND TO INCREASE AWARENESS OF LOW-COST SENSOR AVAILABILITY AND USE WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS PLANNING EFFORTS FOR DEVELOPING, ESTABLISHING, IMPROVING AND MAINTAINING ADEQUATE PROGRAMS FOR THE PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF AIR POLLUTION OR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF NATIONAL PRIMARY AND SECONDARY AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT WILL SUPPORT THE STATE'S ABILITY TO CONDUCT THE AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF AIR TOXICS IN THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA. THE OKLAHOMA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (NATTS) PROJECT SUPPORTS EPA'S NATIONAL AIR TOXICS ASSESSMENT (NATA) TO HELP CHARACTERIZE THE AIR TOXICS PROBLEM. PRINCIPAL NATA ACTIVITIES INCLUDE IDENTIFICATION OF AREAS OF CONCERN, CHARACTERIZING RISKS AND TRACKING PROGRESS.ACTIVITIES:THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS STATIONS NETWORK IS TRACKING TRENDS IN AMBIENT AIR TOXICS LEVELS TO FACILITATE MEASUREMENT PROGRESS, CHARACTERIZE AMBIENT LEVELS OF AIR TOXICS WITHIN COMMUNITIES, PROVIDE QUALITY ASSURED HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS DATA FOR TRENDS DETERMINING EMISSION AND RISK REDUCTION GOALS. THE MONITORING NETWORK IS INTENDED, OVER A MULTI-YEAR PERIOD, TO BE ABLE TO DETECT A 15% DIFFERENCE (TREND) BETWEEN SUCCESSIVE 3-YEAR ANNUAL MEAN CONCENTRATIONS WITHIN ACCEPTABLE LEVELS OF DECISION ERROR.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:TOXICS AIR QUALITY MONITORING ALLOWS THE RECIPIENT TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA DIRECTLY EVALUATING PUBLIC EXPOSURE AND ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS IN THE VICINITY OF MONITORS AND PROVIDES QUALITY ASSURED HAPS DATA FOR RISK CHARACTERIZATION. THE RECIPIENT WILL ASSESS THE EFFECTIVENESS OF SPECIFIC EMISSION REDUCTION ACTIVITIES, EVALUATE AIR TOXICS EMISSION INVENTORIES AND MODEL PERFORMANCE.
DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE#8239;COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE#8239;DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.#8239;#8239;

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS#8239;AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN (ARP) FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.ACTIVITIES:OKLAHOMA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (ODEQ) WILL REVIEW AND COMPARE U.S. ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) PROPOSED EQUIPMENT FOR PURCHASE AND DETERMINE IF ANY ADJUSTMENTS NEED TO BE MADE ON ENHANCEMENTS AT VARIOUS AIR MONITORING SITES BASED ON CURRENT NEEDS. CONSULT WITH EPA ABOUT PROPOSED CHANGES/UPDATES; PREPARE AND INITIATE PROCUREMENT REQUEST(S) FOR EQUIPMENT PURCHASE(S); PURCHASE EQUIPMENT; TAKE DELIVERY OF EQUIPMENT UPON VERIFICATION OF FUNCTIONALITY OF EQUIPMENT AND MOVE FORWARD WITH PAYMENT OF VENDOR INVOICES; PLAN FOR TIMELY SET-UP AND INSTALLATION OF EQUIPMENT CONSISTENT WITH THE GOAL OF ENHANCING AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES; SUBMIT QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS ELECTRONICALLY TO EPA PROJECT OFFICER WITHIN 30 DAYS OF END OF QUARTERLY REPORTING PERIOD AS OUTLINED IN THE ODEQ ARP WORKPLAN AND WILL TIMELY SUBMIT FINAL PROGRESS REPORT. THESE FUNDS WILL PRIMARILY BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS. FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. THE FUNDS MAY BE USED TO ADDRESS OTHER CONSIDERATIONS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ODEQ'S PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ENHANCE MONITORING OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARD (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES AROUND INDUSTRIAL SOURCES THAT MAY BE ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.
THESE FUNDS WILL PRIMARILY BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS. FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. THE FUNDS MAY BE USED TO ADDRESS OTHER CONSIDERATIONS IN AND NEAR UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS.
THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS EPA'S STRATEGIC PLAN GOAL 4 ENSURE CLEAN AND HEALTHY AIR FOR ALL COMMUNITIES (PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT FROM THE HARMFUL EFFECTS OF AIR POLLUTION) AND OBJECTIVE 4.1 IMPROVE AIR QUALITY AND REDUCE LOCALIZED POLLUTION AND HEALTH IMPACTS (REDUCE AIR POLLUTION ON LOCAL, REGIONAL, AND NATIONAL SCALES TO ACHIEVE HEALTHY AIR QUALITY FOR PEOPLE AND THE ENVIRONMENT). BY ENHANCING AIR MONITORING, THIS WILL ASSIST IN ACHIEVING AND MAINTAINING HEALTH-BASED AIR POLLUTION STANDARDS TO REDUCE THE DIRECT EMISSION OF PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER CRITERIA AIR POLLUTION FROM STATIONARY AND MOBILE SOURCES THAT ARE PROTECTIVE OF HUMAN HEALTH. THE ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOME WILL BE REDUCED INCIDENCES OF RESPIRATORY ILLNESSES INCLUDING ASTHMA AND LUNG CANCER AND IMPROVED VISIBILITY IN AND NEAR THESE COMMUNITIES.  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE#8239;COMMUNITY RESIDENTS

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS#8239;AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.ACTIVITIES:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19. 

THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS. SPECIFICALLY, THE ARKANSAS DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT (ADIEQ), WILL REVIEW AND COMPARE EPA PROPOSED EQUIPMENT FOR PURCHASE AND DETERMINE IF ANY ADJUSTMENTS NEED TO BE MADE ON ENHANCEMENTS AT VARIOUS AIR MONITORING SITES BASED ON CURRENT NEEDS. CONSULT WITH EPA ABOUT PROPOSED CHANGES/UPDATES; PREPARE AND INITIATE PROCUREMENT REQUEST(S) FOR EQUIPMENT PURCHASE(S); PURCHASE EQUIPMENT; TAKE DELIVERY OF EQUIPMENT UPON VERIFICATION OF FUNCTIONALITY OF EQUIPMENT AND MOVE FORWARD WITH PAYMENT OF VENDOR INVOICES; PLAN FOR TIMELY SET-UP AND INSTALLATION OF EQUIPMENT CONSISTENT WITH THE GOAL OF ENHANCING AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES IN EJ AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. 

AS A RECIPIENT OF THIS EPA GRANT, ARKANSAS DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT WILL:

1. REVIEW AND COMPARE EPA PROPOSED EQUIPMENT FOR PURCHASE AND DETERMINE IF ANY ADJUSTMENTS NEED TO BE MADE ON ENHANCEMENTS AT VARIOUS AIR MONITORING SITES BASED ON CURRENT NEEDS. CONSULT WITH EPA ABOUT PROPOSED CHANGES/UPDATES.

2. PREPARE AND INITIATE PROCUREMENT REQUEST(S) FOR EQUIPMENT PURCHASE(S).  

3. PURCHASE EQUIPMENT.

4.TAKE DELIVERY OF EQUIPMENT UPON VERIFICATION OF FUNCTIONALITY OF EQUIPMENT AND MOVE FORWARD WITH PAYMENT OF VENDOR INVOICES

5. PLAN FOR TIMELY SET-UP AND INSTALLATION OF EQUIPMENT CONSISTENT WITH THE GOAL OF ENHANCING AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES IN EJ AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.  

PLEASE REFER TO SECTION 103 ARP PM2.5 AND NAAQS SPREADSHEET FOR DEQ'S ESTIMATED PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION PLAN FOR NEW MONITORING EQUIPMENT 

6.	SUBMIT QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS ELECTRONICALLY TO EPA PROJECT OFFICER WITHIN 30 DAYS OF  END OF QUARTERLY REPORTING PERIOD.  REPORTS ARE DUE AS FOLLOWS:

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.   ACTIVITIES: THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ADDRESS PRIORITIES IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS.  SPECIFICALLY,  THESE FUNDS WILL PRIMARILY BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.
ACTIVITIES:AS A RECIPIENT OF THE EPA GRANT, CITY OF ALBUQUERQUE WILL REVIEW AND COMPARE EPA PROPOSED EQUIPMENT FOR PURCHASE AND DETERMINE IF ANY ADJUSTMENTS NEED TO BE MADE ON ENHANCEMENTS AT VARIOUS AIR MONITORING SITES BASED ON CURRENT NEEDS. CONSULT WITH EPA ABOUT PROPOSED CHANGES/UPDATES; PREPARE AND INITIATE PROCUREMENT REQUEST(S) FOR EQUIPMENT PURCHASE(S); PURCHASE EQUIPMENT; TAKE DELIVERY OF EQUIPMENT UPON VERIFICATION OF FUNCTIONALITY OF EQUIPMENT AND MOVE FORWARD WITH PAYMENT OF VENDOR INVOICES; PLAN FOR TIMELY SET-UP AND INSTALLATION OF EQUIPMENT CONSISTENT WITH THE GOAL OF ENHANCING AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES IN EJ AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES; SUBMIT QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS ELECTRONICALLY TO EPA PROJECT OFFICER WITHIN 30 DAYS OF END OF QUARTERLY REPORTING PERIOD AS OUTLINED IN THE COA ARP WORKPLAN AND WILL TIMELY SUBMIT FINAL PROGRESS REPORT.  

THESE FUNDS WILL PRIMARILY BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS.  FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS.  THE FUNDS MAY BE USED TO ADDRESS OTHER CONSIDERATIONS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS.  

OUTCOMES:COA WILL REPORT EXPENDITURES OF ARP FUNDS VIA COMPLETION OF PROCUREMENT OR TAKING DELIVERY OF AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT FOR ENHANCING AMBIENT AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARD (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS CONSISTENT WITH STATED GOALS AND OBJECTIVES FOR THE USE OF AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDING; REPORT ON STATUS OF SETTING UP AND INSTALLING OF EQUIPMENT TO BEGIN USE OF ACTUAL EQUIPMENT AS PART AIR MONITORING NETWORK SITES AND REPORT DRAW DOWN OF FEDERAL FUNDS UPON DELIVERY AND ACCEPTANCE OF ARP FUNDED EQUIPMENT.

FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.  

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO MAINTAIN FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) MONITORING NETWORKS.  THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED DATA ON AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF PM2.5 AS WELL AS CHEMICAL COMPOSITION AND PRECURSORS. DATA WILL BE USED FOR: (1) PROVIDING AIR POLLUTION DATA TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN A TIMELY MANNER, (2) PM2.5 NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) COMPARISONS, (3) DEVELOPMENT AND TRACKING OF IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, (4) ASSESSMENTS OF REGIONAL HAZE, AND (5) ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH STUDIES AND OTHER AMBIENT AEROSOL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. THE PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORK DESIGN ADDRESSES THESE FOUR PROGRAM OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMBINATION OF SITING AND INSTRUMENTATION STRATEGIES.  ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND SUBMIT RESULTS TO ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY'S NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED SHORT-TERM OUTCOME FOR THIS PROJECT IS AN INCREASE IN THE KNOWLEDGE REGARDING THE CHARACTER AND EXTENT OF PM2.5 IN THE AMBIENT AIR. THE LONG-TERM OUTCOME, THROUGH THE EVENTUAL DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THE STATE'S IMPLEMENTATION PLAN, IS REDUCED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH THE PM2.5 NAAQS AS SET FORTH IN THE CLEAN AIR ACT.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE STATE RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO MAINTAIN FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) MONITORING NETWORKS.  THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED DATA ON AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF PM2.5 AS WELL AS CHEMICAL COMPOSITION AND PRECURSORS. DATA WILL BE USED FOR: (1) PROVIDING AIR POLLUTION DATA TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN A TIMELY MANNER, (2) PM2.5 NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) COMPARISONS, (3) DEVELOPMENT AND TRACKING OF IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, (4) ASSESSMENTS OF REGIONAL HAZE, AND (5) ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH STUDIES AND OTHER AMBIENT AEROSOL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. THE PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORK DESIGN ADDRESSES THESE FOUR PROGRAM OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMBINATION OF SITING AND INSTRUMENTATION STRATEGIES.  
ACTIVITIES:
THE RECIPIENT WILL COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND SUBMIT RESULTS TO EPA'S NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE. 

1. PM2.5 MONITORING SITES WILL REPORT 75% OR GREATER DATA RETURN EACH QUARTER. IF LESS THAN THE REQUIRED 75% DATA RETURN IS ACHIEVED, EANDE WILL PROVIDE A REPORT BY LETTER OR E-MAIL, TO REGION 6 AIR MONITORING/GRANTS SECTION CHIEF THAT EXPLAINS THE REASONS FOR EXCESSIVE DATA LOSS AND ANY CORRECTIVE ACTION TAKEN.

2. EANDE WILL OPERATE IN ACCORDANCE WITH APPLICABLE REGULATIONS, QAPP, AND GRANT TERMS AND CONDITIONS A TOTAL OF 11 ROUTINE PM2.5 SITES; 10 OF THE 11 SITES WILL BE RUN ON EACH THIRD DAY AND THE OTHER 1 WILL RUN EACH DAY.
10 PM2.5 (REGULATORY, PARAMETER 88101) MONITORS WITH SAMPLING EVERY THIRD DAY:
05-001-0011 STUTTGART, 05-003-0005 CROSSETT, 05-035- 0005 MARION, 05-051-0003 POC 1 HOT SPRINGS, 05-067-0001 NEWPORT, 05-113-0002  MENA, 05-119-1008 DOYLE SPRINGS,
05-139-0006 EL DORADO, 05-143-0005 SPRINGDALE, 40-135-9021 ROLAND OK
1 PM2.5 (REGULATORY, PARAMETER 88101) MONITORS WITH DAILY SAMPLING: 05-119-0007 POC 1 PARR
2 PM2.5 (REGULATORY, PARAMETER 88101) MONITORS WITH SAMPLING EVERY 12TH DAY: 05-051 -0003 POC 2 HOT SPRINGS, 05-II9-0007 POC 2 PARR
1 PM2.5 SPECIATION OR CSN MONITOR: 05-II9-0007 POC  5 PARR
1 CONTINUOUS PM2.5 (88101) FEM 05-119-0007 POC 3 PARR
3 PM2.5 NON-REGULATORY AQI PARAMETER 88502 CONTINUOUS MONITORS.

3. AT THE END OF EACH CALENDAR YEAR, EANDE WILL PROVIDE TO REGION 6 AIR MONITORING/GRANTS SECTION CHIEF IN WRITING OR E-MAIL A LISTING OF PM2.5 SITES THAT HAD TWO OR MORE QUARTERS THAT DID NOT ATTAIN THE 75% QUARTERLY DATA COMPLETENESS CRITERIA. THIS REPORT SHOULD ALSO FULLY EXPLAIN THE CORRECTIVE ACTION TAKEN TO REMEDY THE PROBLEM AND THE EFFECTIVENESS OF SUCH ACTION.

4. EANDE WILL ENTER DATA FROM THE PM2.5 NETWORK INTO THE EPA AIR QUALITY SYSTEM (AQS) DATABASE WITHIN 90 DAYS AFTER THE END OF EACH CALENDAR QUARTER. THIS DATA INCLUDES PM2.5 DATA, FLAGS ASSOCIATED WITH AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA, AND PRECISION AND ACCURACY INFORMATION RESULTING FROM REQUIRED QA/QC ACTIVITIES. IF PM2.5 DATA SUBMISSION TO AQS WILL BE DELAYED BEYOND THE 90-DAY DEADLINE, THE EANDE WILL ADVISE THE REGION 6 AIR MONITORING/GRANTS SECTION CHIEF IN WRITING OR BY E-MAIL OF THE DELAY AND WHEN SUBMISSION IS EXPECTED.

5. EANDE WILL NOTIFY EPA REGION 6 IN WRITING OF ANY SITUATION (SUCH AS MONITOR MALFUNCTION OR DATA VALIDATION ISSUE) THAT RESULTS IN THE LOSS OF MORE THAN TWO CONSECUTIVE 24-HOUR PM2.5 SAMPLES OR I20 CONSECUTIVE HOURS OF CONTINUOUS PM2.5 DATA. IN THE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION, EANDE WILL IDENTIFY THE CORRECTIVE ACTION TO TAKE TO MINIMIZE THE DATA LOSS.

6. EANDE WILL MAINTAIN THE NCORE SITE SO THAT THE SITE STRUCTURE/S ARE SAFE FOR THE PHYSICAL OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE SAMPLERS. EANDE WILL PURCHASE
REPLACEMENT EQUIPMENT, AS NECESSARY, FOR THE CONTINUED
OPERATION OF THE NCO RE SITE.

7. EANDE WILL MAINTAIN, SERVICE, AND REPAIR THE EANDE AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT AND SUPPORT EQUIPMENT THAT IS UTILIZED IN THE PM2.5 NETWORK.

8. BY JULY 1, OF EACH YEAR, EANDE WILL SUBMIT THE ANNUAL MONITORING NETWORK REVIEW PLAN. THIS INCLUDES A 30-DAY PUBLIC INSPECTION FOR COMMENTS PRIOR TO EPA SUBMITTAL.

9. EXCEPTIONA

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO MAINTAIN FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) MONITORING NETWORKS.  THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED DATA ON AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF PM2.5 AS WELL AS CHEMICAL COMPOSITION AND PRECURSORS. DATA WILL BE USED FOR: (1) PROVIDING AIR POLLUTION DATA TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN A TIMELY MANNER, (2) PM2.5 NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) COMPARISONS, (3) DEVELOPMENT AND TRACKING OF IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, (4) ASSESSMENTS OF REGIONAL HAZE, AND (5) ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH STUDIES AND OTHER AMBIENT AEROSOL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. THE PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORK DESIGN ADDRESSES THESE FOUR PROGRAM OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMBINATION OF SITING AND INSTRUMENTATION STRATEGIES. THE RECIPIENT WILL COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND SUBMIT RESULTS TO EPA'S NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE.  THE ANTICIPATED SHORT-TERM OUTCOME FOR THIS PROJECT IS AN INCREASE IN THE KNOWLEDGE REGARDING THE CHARACTER AND EXTENT OF PM2.5 IN THE AMBIENT AIR. THE LONG-TERM OUTCOME, THROUGH THE EVENTUAL DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THE STATE'S IMPLEMENTATION PLAN, IS REDUCED PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH THE PM2.5 NAAQS AS SET FORTH IN THE CLEAN AIR ACT. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE STATE RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS. THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

OBJECTIVES
THE PM2.5 PROJECT CONSISTS OF THE FOLLOWING BASIC OBJECTIVES:
-	TO DETERMINE HIGHEST CONCENTRATIONS EXPECTED TO OCCUR IN AREAS OF HIGH POPULATION DENSITY
-	TO DETERMINE REPRESENTATIVE CONCENTRATIONS IN AREAS OF HIGH POPULATION DENSITY
-	TO DETERMINE GENERAL BACKGROUND CONCENTRATION LEVELS
-	TO DETERMINE THE EXTENT OF REGIONAL POLLUTANT TRANSPORT AMONG POPULATED AREAS, AND IN SUPPORT OF SECONDARY STANDARDS
-	TO DETERMINE WELFARE-RELATED IMPACTS IN MORE RURAL AND REMOTE AREAS (SUCH AS VISIBILITY IMPAIRMENT AND EFFECTS ON VEGETATION)
-	TO DETERMINE SPECIATED COMPOSITION OF PM2.5 MASS
-	TO MAKE PM2.5 DATA AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC THROUGH AIR QUALITY INDEX (AQI) REPORTS AND PM2.5 MAPPING APPLICATIONS.

DELIVERABLES
-	PM2.5 MONITORING SITES WILL REPORT 75% OR GREATER DATA RETURN EACH CALENDAR QUARTER.  IF LESS THAN THE REQUIRED 75% DATA RETURN IS ACHIEVED, THE GRANTEE WILL PROVIDE TO THE REGION 6 AIR QUALITY ANALYSIS SECTION CHIEF A REPORT BY LETTER OR E-MAIL WHICH EXPLAINS THE REASONS FOR EXCESSIVE DATA LOSS AND ANY CORRECTIVE ACTION.
-	AT THE END OF EACH CALENDAR YEAR, THE GRANTEE WILL PROVIDE TO THE REGION 6 AIR QUALITY ANALYSIS SECTION CHIEF IN WRITING OR E-MAIL A LISTING OF PM2.5 MONITORING SITES WHICH HAD TWO OR MORE QUARTERS WHICH DID NOT ATTAIN THE 75% QUARTERLY DATA COMPLETENESS CRITERIA.  THIS REPORT SHOULD ALSO FULLY EXPLAIN THE CORRECTIVE ACTION TAKEN TO REMEDY THE PROBLEM AND THE EFFECTIVENESS OF SUCH ACTION.
-	LDEQ WILL CONTINUE TO ENTER PM2.5 DATA INTO THE EPA'S AIRS AIR QUALITY SUBSYSTEM (AQS) DATABASE WITHIN 90 DAYS AFTER THE END OF EACH CALENDAR QUARTER.  THIS DATA INCLUDES PM2.5 24-HOUR OR HOURLY VALUES, DETAILED INFORMATION REQUIRED TO BE SUBMITTED BY THE PM2.5 FRM METHOD, FLAGS ASSOCIATED WITH AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA, AND PRECISION AND ACCURACY INFORMATION RESULTING FROM REQUIRED QA/QC ACTIVITIES.
-	LDEQ AND EPA WILL ASSESS THE PERFORMANCE OF THE PM2.5 MONITORING PROGRAM DURING A MID-YEAR PERFORMANCE REVIEW BY TELEPHONE CONFERENCE CALL, AND BY AN END-OF-YEAR CONFERENCE AT LDEQ'S OFFICES.
-	THE NUMBER OF PM2.5 SITES PER TYPE OF MONITOR FOR SLAMS LOCATIONS WILL BE IDENTIFIED.
-	THE NUMBER OF PM2.5 SITES PER TYPE OF MONITOR FOR SPMS LOCATIONS WILL BE IDENTIFIED.
-	STATE WILL NOTIFY EPA REGION 6 AIR QUALITY ANALYSIS SECTION CHIEF (6PD-Q), BY LETTER OR E-MAIL, AT LEAST 30 DAYS PRIOR TO ESTABLISHING, MODIFYING, RELOCATING, OR DISCONTINUING ANY AIR MONITOR AND/OR SITE.
-	LDEQ WILL OPERATE THE SPECIATION TRENDS NETWORK SAMPLER IN BATON ROUGE.  LDEQ WILL FORWARD

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES $67,340 IN FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE CITY OF JACKSONVILLE. THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ENHANCE MONITORING OF PM2.5 OR OTHER PARTICULATE MATTER POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS, AS WELL AS OTHER COMMUNITIES. THE RECIPIENT WILL REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS WITH CONTINUOUS FEDERAL EQUIVALENT METHOD (FEM) MONITORS TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS. FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES WITH FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE A BACKUP FEM CONTINUOUS PM MONITOR TO HELP ENSURE THAT DATA COMPLETENESS GOALS ARE MET, AND TO PARTIALLY FUND THE REPLACEMENT OF AGING PM2.5 MONITORS USED TO SOLELY FOR REPORTING REAL-TIME AIR QUALITY TO AIRNOW.GOV. ACTIVITIES:THE CITY OF JACKSONVILLE WILL: 1) REVIEW AND COMPARE EPA PROPOSED EQUIPMENT FOR PURCHASE AND DETERMINE IF ANY ADJUSTMENTS NEED TO BE MADE ON ENHANCEMENTS AT VARIOUS AIR MONITORING SITES BASED ON CURRENT NEEDS. CONSULT WITH EPA ABOUT PROPOSED CHANGES/UPDATES.  2)PREPARE AND INITIATE PROCUREMENT REQUEST(S) FOR EQUIPMENT PURCHASE(S).  3)PURCHASE EQUIPMENT.  4)TAKE DELIVERY OF EQUIPMENT UPON VERIFICATION OF FUNCTIONALITY OF EQUIPMENT AND MOVE FORWARD WITH PAYMENT OF VENDOR INVOICES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE ENHANCED AIR MONITORING AND MAINTAINING HEALTH-BASED AIR POLLUTION STANDARDS TO REDUCE THE DIRECT EMISSION OF PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER CRITERIA AIR POLLUTION FROM STATIONARY AND MOBILE SOURCES THAT ARE PROTECTIVE OF HUMAN HEALTH. THE EXPECTED ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOME WILL BE REDUCED INCIDENCES OF RESPIRATORY ILLNESSES INCLUDING ASTHMA AND LUNG CANCER AND IMPROVED VISIBILITY IN AND NEAR THESE COMMUNITIES. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE CITY OF JACKSONVILLE, FLORIDA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION AWARDS $60,008 IN FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO MIAMI-DADE COUNTY. THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ENHANCE MONITORING OF NITROGEN DIOXIDE (NO2) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARD (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS UNDER THE IRA OF THE CLEAN AIR ACT CAA SECTION 103. THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO REPLACE EXISTING MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS WITHIN OUR NETWORK AND TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF NO2 AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS. FULL AND CONTINUOUS AUTOMATION OF NO2 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE COMMUNITIES WITH HIGH QUALITY GASEOUS DATA AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. FUNDS MAY BE USED TO ADDRESS OTHER CONSIDERATIONS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS GASEOUS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE NO2 MONITORING INVESTMENTS.ACTIVITIES:MIAMI-DADE COUNTY AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT DIVISION WILL:  REVIEW AND COMPARE EPA PROPOSED EQUIPMENT FOR PURCHASE AND DETERMINE IF ANY ADJUSTMENTS NEED TO BE MADE ON ENHANCEMENTS AT VARIOUS AIR MONITORING SITES BASED ON CURRENT NEEDS. CONSULT WITH EPA ABOUT PROPOSED CHANGES/UPDATES. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:OUTPUTS/MILESTONES INCLUDE: 1) REPORTING OF EXPENDITURES OF IRA FUNDS VIA COMPLETION OF PROCUREMENT OR TAKING DELIVERY OF AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT FOR ENHANCING AMBIENT AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES OF NO2 OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARD (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS CONSISTENT WITH STATED GOALS AND OBJECTIVES FOR THE USE OF THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT FUNDING.  2) REPORTING OF STATUS OF SETTING UP AND INSTALLING OF EQUIPMENT TO BEGIN USE OF ACTUAL EQUIPMENT AS PART AIR MONITORING NETWORK SITES.  3) REPORTING OF DRAWDOWN OF FEDERAL FUNDS UPON DELIVERY AND ACCEPTANCE OF IRA FUNDED EQUIPMENT.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: OPERATION OF NO2 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF MIAMI-DADE COUNTY.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $377,295 TO GEORGIA ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION DIVISION UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO SUPPORT THE COORDINATION, ACCELERATION OF HEALTH AND WELFARE EFFECTS OF THE COMMUNITY. THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO PURCHASE EQUIPMENT TO HELP WITH ADMINISTRATION AND PROJECT NEEDS.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ADDRESS CONCERNS IN THE GEORGIA AIR MONITORING NETWORK INCLUDING UPGRADING NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARD (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS MONITORING SITES, HAVING SPARE EQUIPMENT TO PREVENT DATA LOSS ISSUES FOR PM2.5 AND DEVELOPING A PROCESS TO BETTER COLLECT HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS (HAPS) EMISSION DATA.  THESE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PURCHASING FOUR 2025I FRM SAMPLERS TO REPLACE AGING EQUIPMENT, TWO T640 MONITORS TO BE DEPLOYED AS SPARES, AN T640 ENCLOSURE TO ENSURE CONTINUOUS REPORTING TO AIR QUALITY INDEX, AN AMBIENT MONITORING SHELTER TO REPLACE THE CURRENT SHELTER IN AUGUSTA AND SIX FLOW STANDARDS TO PROVIDE BACKUP CALIBRATION GEAR FOR THEIR OPERATORS AND PREVENT DATA LOSS ISSUES. ALSO, AN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEER WILL BE HIRED TO ESTABLISH THE HAP INVENTORY AND DEVELOP QUALITY ASSURANCE PROCEDURES FOR THE DATA.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING PM2.5 FRM SAMPLERS, CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITORS, A SHELTER, AN ENCLOSURE, ADDITIONAL FLOW STANDARDS AND HIRING AN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEER. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE OPERATION AND UPDATING OF PM2.5 AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT AND ACCESSORIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA AND PREVENTION OF FUTURE DATA LOSS ISSUES. ADDITIONALLY, THE ENGINEERING POSITION WILL ESTABLISH THE HAP INVENTORY AND DEVELOP QUALITY ASSURANCE PROCEDURES FOR THE DATA. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO LIVE IN THE STATE OF GEORGIA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $64,825 TO THE METROPOLITAN GOVERNMENT OF NASHVILLE AND DAVIDSON COUNTY, TENNESSEE. THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA).ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE UPDATING OUTDATED, UNSUPPORTED EMISSION INVENTORY SOFTWARE WITH NEWER SOFTWARE CAPABLE OF BETTER UTILIZING NEW HARDWARE AND WORKING ON NEWER OPERATING SYSTEMS DEPLOYED THROUGHOUT THE AGENCY. THE PURCHASE OF THE SLEIS (STATE AND LOCAL EMISSION INVENTORY SYSTEM) WILL REPLACE CURRENT SOFTWARE AND HARDWARE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE BETTER INTEGRATION INTO ACTIVITIES PRIMARILY INVOLVING DOCUMENTATION SUBMITTALS, AS THIS IS CRITICAL FUNCTION WITHIN THIS ORGANIZATION. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED SUPPORT FOR PROCESSING THESE SUBMITTALS. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE DAVIDSON COUNTY RESIDENT AND SURROUNDING AREAS WITHIN THE NASHVILLE METROPOLITAN STATISTICAL AREA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $63,478 TO THE CHATTANOOGA-HAMILTON COUNTY AIR POLLUTION CONTROL BUREAU. THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA), AND THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONTINUE TO COLLECT VALID DATA ON AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5).ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE, THE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF PM2.5 AND OZONE MONITORING NETWORKS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) REQUIREMENTS; REVIEWING AND UPDATING THE QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN AND STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES; MEETING THE EPA'S MONITORING DATA COMPLETION REQUIREMENTS; CERTIFYING MONITORING DATA FOR 2023 BY THE DEADLINE; PARTICIPATING IN THE STATE OF TENNESSEE'S AIR MONITORING PLAN; PARTICIPATING IN AIRNOW BY REPORTING CONTINUOUS DATA FOR MAPPING PURPOSES; SUBMITTING AN ANNUAL PERFORMANCE PLAN FOR 2023; PURCHASING AND INSTALLING AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT; OPERATING A MICROSCOPE FOR USE IN PARTICLE IDENTIFICATION AND EMISSIONS COMPLAINTS; PURCHASING A REPLACEMENT ROTOROD SAMPLER FOR MOLD AND POLLEN COUNTING AND PARTICLE CHARACTERIZATION; PURCHASING RODS FOR THE ROTOROD SAMPLER; PURCHASING AN ALICAT FLOW CALIBRATION DEVICE FOR LOCAL AUDITS; AND PURCHASING A LABORATORY GRADE SECURE REFRIGERATOR/FREEZER FOR PM2.5 FILTER SAMPLE STORAGE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE REPLACING OZONE MONITORS AND A MICROSCOPE. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE OBTAINING AN INCREASE IN KNOWLEDGE REGARDING THE CHARACTER AND EXTENT OF POLLUTION IN THE AMBIENT AIR OF HAMILTON COUNTY, TENNESSEE. INCREASING KNOWLEDGE CONTRIBUTES TO THE ABILITY TO LOWER POLLUTION AND ASSISTS IN DECISION MAKING. THE LONG TERM OUTCOME, THROUGH THE EVENTUAL DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF TENNESSEE'S IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, IS TO COMPLY WITH THE NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS AS SET FORTH BY THE CLEAN AIR ACT AND TO PROVIDE HEALTHIER AIR FOR ITS INTENDED BENEFICIARIES, WHICH ARE THE CITIZENS OF HAMILTON COUNTY, TENNESSEE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION PROVIDES FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $35,889 IN FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO PINELLAS COUNTY, FLORIDA. THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO CONTINUE TO COLLECT VALID DATA ON AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS FOR THE BLACK CARBON COMPONENT OF FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5).  SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL IMPLEMENT A VARIETY OF MONITORING ACTIVITIES THAT WILL ASSIST IN ACHIEVING AND MAINTAINING HEALTH-BASED AIR POLLUTION STANDARDS TO REDUCE THE DIRECT EMISSION OF PARTICULATE MATTER FROM STATIONARY AND MOBILE SOURCES THAT ARE PROTECTIVE OF HUMAN HEALTH. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE DEVELOPMENT AND TRACKING OF IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, (3) ASSESSMENTS OF REGIONAL HAZE, AND (4) ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH STUDIES AND OTHER AMBIENT AEROSOL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. THE PM2.5 MONITORING NETWORK DESIGN ADDRESSES THESE FOUR PROGRAM OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMBINATION OF SITING AND INSTRUMENTATION STRATEGIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE OUTPUTS/MILESTONES INCLUDE: 1) REPORTING OF EXPENDITURES OF IRA FUNDS VIA COMPLETION OF PROCUREMENT OR TAKING DELIVERY OF AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT FOR AMBIENT AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES OF PM2.5 CONSISTENT WITH STATED GOALS AND OBJECTIVES FOR THE USE OF IRA FUNDING. 2) REPORTING OF STATUS OF SETTING UP AND INSTALLING OF EQUIPMENT TO BEGIN USE OF ACTUAL EQUIPMENT AS PART AIR MONITORING NETWORK SITES. 3) REPORTING OF DRAW-DOWN OF FEDERAL FUNDS UPON DELIVERY AND ACCEPTANCE OF IRA FUNDED EQUIPMENT.  OUTCOMES INCLUDE: 1) CONTINUE TO ACQUIRE DATA THAT INCREASES THE KNOWLEDGE REGARDING THE CHARACTER AND EXTENT OF PM2.5 IN THE AMBIENT AIR. 2) CONTINUE TO MAKE DATA AVAILABLE TO EVALUATE LOCAL TRENDS OF BLACK CARBON CONCENTRATIONS AS A SPECIATION OF PM2.5. 3) PROVIDE AIR MONITORING DATA THAT SUPPORTS DECISION-MAKING BY LOCAL/STATE AGENCIES. 4) OPERATION OF THE AETHALOMETER (WITH OPTIONAL PM2.5 INLET) IN ACCORDANCE WITH STATEWIDE STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURE AND THE MANUFACTURER'S USER MANUAL TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE CITIZENS OF PINELLAS COUNTY.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $209,006 UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION.  THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONTINUE TO COLLECT VALID DATA ON AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5).  SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COORDINATE AND ACCELERATE RESEARCH, INVESTIGATIONS, EXPERIMENTS, DEMONSTRATIONS, SURVEYS, AND STUDIES RELATING TO THE CAUSES, EFFECTS (INCLUDING HEALTH AND WELFARE EFFECTS), EXTENT, PREVENTION, AND CONTROL OF AIR POLLUTION.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE (1) ASSIST IN DEVELOPING AND MAINTAINING AMBIENT AIR POLLUTION STANDARDS, (2) BETTER TRACK INDUSTRY EMISSIONS AND MALFUNCTIONS, (3) MONITOR CRITERIA POLLUTANTS, (4) LOWER POLLUTION LEVELS TO MEET OR EXCEED THE STANDARDS (5) REDUCE ASTHMA AND LUNG CANCER RATES (5) PROVIDE A HEALTHIER AMBIENT ENVIRONMENT FOR AT RISK INDIVIDUALS AND (6) INCREASE VISIBILITY IN CITIES, SCENIC PARKS, AND WILDERNESS AREAS.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE TO CONTRACT WITH A LABORATORY TO CONDUCT PM2.5 FILTER ANALYSIS AND TO CONTRACT WITH A VENDOR TO INSTALL THREE NEW MONITORING SHELTERS.  THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE AN INCREASE IN THE KNOWLEDGE REGARDING THE CHARACTER AND EXTENT OF POLLUTION IN THE AMBIENT AIR IN STATE OF FLORIDA.  INCREASING KNOWLEDGE CONTRIBUTES TO THE ABILITY TO LOWER POLLUTION AND ASSISTS IN DECISION MAKING. THE LONG-TERM OUTCOME, THROUGH THE EVENTUAL DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF FLORIDA'S IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, IS TO COMPLY WITH THE NAAQS AS SET FORTH IN THE CLEAN AIR ACT AND PROVIDE HEALTHIER AIR FOR FLORIDA.  THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF THE STATE OF FLORIDA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $233,660 TO SUPPORT THE ALABAMA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (ADEM) IN THEIR EFFORTS IN MODERNIZING THEIR PERMITTING, COMPLIANCE, AND INVENTORY PROCESSES. ALSO, TO PROVIDE CONTRACTOR SUPPORT FOR THE NEW SOFTWARE (NVIRO) TO BE INSTALLED FOR ADEM'S AIR DIVISION. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE CONTRACTUAL SERVICES WILL PROVIDE ADEM AIR DIVISION THE SUPPORT FOR THE NVIRO INSTALL, CONFIGURATION, IMPLEMENTATION, AND ANY TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO ENSURE SYSTEMS AND DATABASE INTEGRATION. WINDSOR SOLUTIONS' WILL WORK WITH ADEM AIR DIVISION STAFF TO CONFIGURE THEIR NVIRO SOFTWARE SPECIFICALLY TO PROGRAMS ACROSS THE AIR DIVISION. AIR PERMITTING, AIR STACK TESTING, AIR EMISSIONS INVENTORY, AIR ASBESTOS, AND AIR BULK GAS PROGRAMS WILL BE IMPLEMENTED DURING THE ITERATION. THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE A MORE EFFICIENT AND MODERNIZED METHOD TO SUBMIT AND PROCESS THE REQUIRED PERMIT APPLICATIONS, ASSOCIATED FEES, EMISSIONS INVENTORIES AND REPORTS BY CREATING A STREAMLINED, USER-FRIENDLY INTERFACE. THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE THE PUBLIC WITH MORE TIMELY ACCESS TO SUBMITTED DATA. THE ANTICIPATED OUTPUTS: FACILITIES MIGRATED INTO ONE CENTRAL DATA REPOSITORY. ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES ARE: REPLACES AGING LEGACY DATABASES WITH A SYSTEM CAPABLE OF ACCEPTING A GREATER QUANTITY AND DIVERSITY OF DATA, IMPROVED DATA QUALITY. PROVIDES A CENTRAL LOCATION FOR FACILITIES TO SUBMIT INFORMATION, INCLUDING REQUIRED REPORTS, STACK TEST PROTOCOLS, STACK TEST REPORTS, ANNUAL EMISSIONS INVENTORIES, PERMITTING APPLICATIONS AND RESPONSES TO ENFORCEMENT TO THE DEPARTMENT. PROVIDES A WAY TO KEEP ABREAST OF ALL ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH A PARTICULAR FACILITY ACROSS THE DIVISION AND ALLOWS FOR BETTER TRACKING OF COMPLIANCE ACTIVITIES AS PERFORMED BY ADEM INTERNAL USERS, INCLUDING STACK TESTS, INSPECTIONS, PERMITTING, FINANCIALS, AND ENFORCEMENT. INTEGRATES DATA ACROSS PROGRAMS TO SUPPORT MORE EFFICIENT PERMIT-WRITING, COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS, AND ANALYSES AND ALLOW FOR BETTER TRACKING OF COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT. PROVIDES ENGINEERING STAFF AND THE REGULATED COMMUNITY WITH THE ABILITY TO BETTER TRACK FACILITY DELIVERABLES (REPORTS AND APPLICATIONS). ENSURES GREATER TRANSPARENCY WITH THE PUBLIC BY ENSURING THAT ALL DOCUMENTS ARE LOADED INTO THE CURRENT ELECTRONIC FILING SYSTEM. CREATES A FACILITY INVENTORY WHICH WILL BE DIRECTLY PROVIDED BY THE REGULATED COMMUNITY, CREATING MORE ACCURATE FACILITY AND EMISSIONS INVENTORIES. AN IMPROVED DATABASE AND MANAGEMENT SYSTEM. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF ALABAMA.ACTIVITIES:.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO SOUTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL.  SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL UPDATE TWO MONITORING SHELTERS, MONITOR FOR ETHYLENE OXIDE (ETO) AT NATIONAL AIR TOXIC TRENDS STATION (NATTS) SITES AND PURCHASE LAPTOP AND DOCKING STATIONS TO HELP WITH ADMINISTRATION AND COORDINATION NEEDS.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE UPDATING 2 MONITORING SHELTERS AND MONITORING FOR ETO  AND THE PURCHASE OF LAPTOPS AND DOCKING STATIONS TO HELP WITH ADMINISTRATION AND COORDINATION NEEDS.SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARD FOR AIR MONITORING SAMPLE ANALYSIS CONDUCTED 65 TIMES PER YEAR FOR 3 YEARS AT $185 PER SAMPLE.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE. UPGRADE TWO MONITORING SHELTERS. UPGRADE 53 DESKTOPS AND LAPTOPS WITH MORE POWERFUL LAPTOPS TO IMPROVE REMOTE ACCESS TO ENVIRONMENTAL SYSTEM (EPERMITTING) AND NETWORK SECURITY. SUBMIT TO ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA )GRANT PERFORMANCE AND BUDGET STATUS REPORTS ON TIME, ACCORDING TO GRANT GUIDANCE DOCUMENTS, OR AS OTHERWISE SPECIFIED. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE PROVIDE REAL-TIME AND ACCURATE UPDATES TO THE PUBLIC ON AIRNOW.GOV.  COLLECT MONITORING DATA TO COMPARE WITH THE NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARD (NAAQS). COLLECT DATA AS PART OF THE NATIONAL EFFORT TO BETTER UNDERSTAND ETO AMBIENT CONCENTRATIONS. ENHANCE ACCESS TO EMISSIONS INVENTORY DATA, MODELING INFORMATION, ENFORCEMENT CASES, AND COMPLIANCE REPORTS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH THE NAAQS AND TO PROMPTLY RESPOND TO REQUESTS FROM COMMUNITIES, REGULATED INDUSTRIES, AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE CITIZEN OF THE STATE OF SOUTH CAROLINA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $491,171 TO THE ENTERPRISE CENTER, INCORPORATED. THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF THE GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE TO CONDUCT SITE ASSESSMENT FOR MONITOR DEPLOYMENT; DEVELOP A QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN AND STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY'S (EPA) POLICIES; CONDUCT ONGOING QUALITY ASSURANCE AND MAINTENANCE FOR THE MONITOR NETWORK; DEVELOP A PUBLIC-FACING WEBSITE WITH ACCESS TO NETWORK DATA VISUALIZATIONS AND RESIDENT RESOURCES; DEVELOP AND PROVIDE OPEN ACCESS TO MONITOR NETWORK DATASETS; ESTABLISH AN AIR QUALITY MONITORING FELLOWSHIP IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF TENNESSEE AT CHATTANOOGA (UTC), CENTER FOR URBAN INFORMATICS AND PROGRESS AND UTC RESEARCH INSTITUTE; AND CONDUCT COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ACTIVITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:THROUGH THE SUBAWARD, THE UNIVERSITY OF TENNESSEE WILL CREATE A POSITION TO BRING ON AN AIR QUALITY MONITORING STAFF MEMBER TO SUPPORT THE WORK OF CLEEAN MONITOR NETWORK HEALTH, DEVELOP REPORTING MATERIALS, UPLOAD AND SHARE DATA, CONDUCT COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND SUPPORT PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS AND GRANT GOALSOUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE INSTALLING 100 FIXED LOW-COST PM2.5 AND 30 PM10 MONITORS ACROSS CHATTANOOGA AND HAMILTON COUNTY, WITH A FOCUS ON COMMUNITY CENTERS, PUBLIC SCHOOLS, CITY AND COUNTY GOVERNMENT PROPERTIES, AND OTHER COMMUNITY PARTNER LOCATIONS WITHIN DISTRESSED COMMUNITIES OF HIGH RATES OF HEALTH DISPARITIES, MINORITY AND LOW-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS, OR HOUSEHOLDS AT GREATER RISK FOR ADVERSE HEALTH OUTCOMES. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES FOR THIS PROJECT ARE INCREASED MONITORING CAPACITY, ACCURACY AND RESILIENCY, AS WELL AS AN INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF AND ACCESS TO DATA. ADDITIONAL OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVED COMMUNITY HEALTH AND IMPROVEMENTS TO THE SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH FOR RESIDENTS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE RESIDENTS OF THE CHATTANOOGA-HAMILTON COUNTY, TENNESSEE AREA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $365,368 TO PROVIDE FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT TO BLUE RIDGE ENVIRONMENTAL DEFENSE LEAGUE TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO BLUE RIDGE ENVIRONMENTAL DEFENSE LEAGUE TO CONDUCT MONITORING OF AIR POLLUTION AT 8 TO 12 SITES THROUGHOUT TENNESSEE, NORTH CAROLINA, SOUTH CAROLINA, GEORGIA, AND VIRGINIA.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE MEASUREMENTS AND ANALYSIS OF AIR POLLUTION AT UP TO 12 DIFFERENT SITES. BREDL AND THE 12 CHAPTERS PARTICIPATING IN CARE-4-AIR WILL STIMULATE COMMUNICATION AMONG THE MEMBERS OF THE PARTICIPATING CHAPTERS AND THE COMMUNITY IN WHICH THE AIR MONITORING WILL OCCUR. THE PUBLIC INFORMATION CAMPAIGNS WILL INCREASE PUBLIC AWARENESS OF THE AIR POLLUTION ISSUE IN EACH COMMUNITY. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE REDUCTION OF AIR POLLUTANT EMISSIONS, REDUCTION OF AMBIENT CONCENTRATIONS OF AIR POLLUTION IDENTIFIED AS SIGNIFICANT, AND REDUCTION OF HUMAN EXPOSURE TO AIR POLLUTANTS IDENTIFIED. THE BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS IN TENNESSEE, NORTH CAROLINA, SOUTH CAROLINA, GEORGIA, AND VIRGINIA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $499,929 TO RESEARCH TRIANGLE INSTITUTE OF NORTH CAROLINA. THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES PERFORMED WILL BE USED TO MONITOR AIR QUALITY DATA, TO PROPOSE TO MONITOR PM2.5, O3, AND  THEIR PRECURSORS (NOX, NO2, AND SO2) AT TWENTY CHILD CARE FACILITIES. THE PROJECT WILL COLLECT REAL TIME, CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MEASUREMENT DATA AND TIME WEIGHTED AVERAGES OF NOX, NO2, AND SO2 AND O3. THE INSTALLATION AND MONITORING DEVICES WILL INCLUDE PASSIVE AND ACTIVE SAMPLING IN ADDITION TO PURPLE AIR PA-II-SD.SUBRECIPIENT:THE SUBAWARDS IS FOR THE NORTH CAROLINA CENTRAL UNIVERSITY IN THE AMOUNT OF $86,461 TO SUPPORT RTI IN SAMPLING AND MONITORING AIR QUALITY.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE COLLECTING SPATIAL AND TEMPORAL DISTRIBUTION OF AIR POLLUTION EXPERIENCED BY YOUNG CHILDREN, WHICH WILL PROVIDE A COMPARISON TO THE NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE STATISTICAL ANALYSIS OF EXPOSURE RESULTS, COMMUNITY OUTREACH ACTIVITIES (INCLUDING SUMMARIZING AND DISSEMINATING FINDINGS), THE HOSTING OF WEBINARS TO CREATE AND UPDATE THE PUBLIC PROJECT WEBSITE, DISSEMINATING RESULTS AND RECOMMENDATIONS TO INDIVIDUAL FACILITIES, DISSEMINATING AGGREGATED FINDINGS AND RECOMMENDATIONS TO STAKEHOLDERS AND DECISION MAKERS, TRAINING ENROLLED CHILDCARE FACILITIES IN THE CONTINUED USE OF THE PURPLE AIR SENSOR. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE TWENTY CHILD CARE FACILITIES IN THE STATE OF NORTH CAROLINA.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDES SUPPORTING THE COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL ESTABLISH AN AIR MONITORING NETWORK IN SAMPSON COUNTY TO ADDRESS LONG-STANDING HEALTH INEQUITIES AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE IMPLICATIONS CAUSED BY CUMULATIVE AIR POLLUTION IMPACTS. THE EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDES MEASURING PARTICULATE MATTER LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO 2.5 MICRONS IN AERODYNAMIC DIAMETER (PM2.5), VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS (VOCS), SPECIATED VOCS, AND HYDROGEN SULFIDE (H2S) EMITTED FROM SWINE AND POULTRY CONCENTRATED ANIMAL FEEDING OPERATIONS (CAFOS), SAMPSON COUNTY LANDFILL, AND ENVIVA SAMPSON WOOD PELLET FACILITY. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDES THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE THE BASIS FOR DEVELOPING AND SCALING THE INITIATIVE AS A STATE AND NATIONAL, EVIDENCE-BASED MODEL OF AN AIR QUALITY MONITORING PROJECT BASED ON THE PRINCIPLES AND PRACTICES OF COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, QUALITY DATA COLLECTION AND CONTROL, AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE CITIZENS OF SAMPSON COUNTY, NORTH CAROLINA. THERE ARE NO SUBAWARDS INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL ESTABLISH AN AIR MONITORING NETWORK IN SAMPSON COUNTY TO ADDRESS LONG-STANDING HEALTH INEQUITIES AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE IMPLICATIONS CAUSED BY CUMULATIVE AIR POLLUTION IMPACTS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES: CLEAN AIRE CAROLINA WILL MEASURE PARTICULATE MATTER LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO 2.5 MICRONS IN AERODYNAMIC DIAMETER (PM2.5), VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS (VOCS), SPECIATED VOCS, AND HYDROGEN SULFIDE (H2S) EMITTED FROM SWINE AND POULTRY CONCENTRATED ANIMAL FEEDING OPERATIONS (CAFOS), SAMPSON COUNTY LANDFILL, AND ENVIVA SAMPSON WOOD PELLET FACILITY. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE THE BASIS FOR DEVELOPING AND SCALING THE INITIATIVE AS A STATE AND NATIONAL, EVIDENCE-BASED MODEL OF AN AIR QUALITY MONITORING PROJECT BASED ON THE PRINCIPLES AND PRACTICES OF COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, QUALITY DATA COLLECTION AND CONTROL, AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE.
INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE CITIZENS OF SAMPSON COUNTY, NC.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $500,000 TO MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AT PUBLIC MEETINGS, SITE SETUP, AND LAB ANALYSIS USING A COMPENDIUM METHOD. ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PERSONNEL TRAVELING TO THE DEVELOPING LOCATION SITE,AND ESTABLISH 5 COMMUNITY MEETINGS TO BUILD PUBLIC TRUST IN PASCAGOULA COUNTY TO MONITOR PM10 POLLUTANT ON A CONTINUAL FREQUENCY AND VOLATILE ORGANIC DATA, 24-HOUR SAMPLE COLLECTED EVERY 1 IN 6 DAYS, UP TO 25 ADDITIONAL RANDOM/RESPONSE SAMPLES, CREATING COMMUNITY-SPECIFIC AIR POLLUTION DATA SUMMARIES AND MAKING THEM AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE PROVIDING ADDITIONAL DATA THAT ASSIST COMMUNITY MEMBERS IDENTIFY THE TYPE OF POLLUTANTS THAT ARE IMPACTING, INCREASING COMMUNITY UNDERSTANDING OF AIR POLLUTION HAZARDS IN PASCAGOULA COUNTY THAT ARE CURRENTLY UNMONITORED, INCREASING COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF THE RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH AIR POLLUTANTS IN THEIR COMMUNITIES, INCREASING ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND TOOLS THAT WILL HELP COMMUNITY MEMBERS DECREASE THE RISKS OF THESE POLLUTANTS ON THE ENVIRONMENT AND ON THEIR HEALTH. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO LIVE IN UNMONITORED AREAS OF PASCAGOULA COUNTY, MS WHICH IS DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED BY AIR POLLUTION AND LOW INCOME.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $498,401 UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND.SUBRECIPIENT:TWO SUBCONTRACTS TOTALING $198,448 OVER THE 3-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD WILL BE MADE TO THE GEORGIA TECH, WHICH CONSISTS OF THE GEORGIA TECH RESEARCH CORPORATION (GTRC) AND THE GEORGIA TECH APPLIED RESEARCH CORPORATION (GTARC). WHILE SEPARATE SUBCONTRACTS ARE REQUIRED FOR THE INCLUSION OF THESE TWO SEPARATE DIVISIONS OF GEORGIA TECH, THEY WILL BE MANAGED AS A SINGLE ENTITY. $74,796 OF THE SUBAWARD WILL FUND THE EFFORTS OF THE MAP-USA TEAM MEMBERS THAT WORK UNDER THE GTRC. THE REMAINING $123,652 OF THE SUBAWARD WILL FUND THE EFFORTS OF THE MAP-USA TEAM THAT WORK UNDER THE GTARC. (NOTE: GEORGIA TECH CONSISTS OF THE TRADITIONAL UNIVERSITY KNOWN AS 'GEORGIA TECH' AND THE APPLIED RESEARCH ARM KNOWN AS THE 'GEORGIA TECH RESEARCH INSTITUTE.' FOR THE PURPOSES OF MAP-USA, THE TWO ENTITIES WILL OPERATE AS A SINGLE ORGANIZATION AND IS REFERENCED THROUGHOUT THIS PROPOSAL AS 'GEORGIA TECH', HOWEVER THE SEPARATE SUBCONTRACTS ARE REQUIRED FOR ACCOUNTING PURPOSES SINCE THE TWO ENTITIES HAVE DIFFERENT COST RECOVERY RATES AND MODELS.)
FOR THE $74,796 THAT WILL REMAIN IN GTRC, $18,056 IS ALLOCATED FOR SR. PERSONNEL COSTS FOR PROFESSORS BREWER AND DENCH FOR ~1-WEEK EQUIVALENT EFFORT PER YEAR TO ENSURE THE QUALITY OF THE MONITORING DATA, ADVISE ON THE WRITING OF ANNUAL REPORTS, AND TO SUPERVISE THE PHD STUDENT CONDUCTING THE WORK. THEIR TIME ALSO INCURS FRINGE BENEFITS AT A TOTAL COST OF $5724 (31.7% OF SR. PERSONNEL COSTS). THE PHD STUDENT WILL BE EMPLOYED FOR 3 SUMMER MONTHS PER YEAR AT A RATE OF $2500/MONTH FOR 3 YEARS ($22,500 TOTAL). OTHER DIRECT COSTS INCLUDE $1000 FOR MILEAGE REIMBURSEMENTS AT A RATE OF 58.5 CENTS PER MILE. MODIFIED TOTAL DIRECT COSTS ARE $47,279. INDIRECT COSTS ARE CALCULATED AT THE RATE OF 58.2%% OF MODIFIED TOTAL DIRECT COSTS OR $$27,517. THIS RATE IS BASED ON US EPA AS THE PRIME SPONSOR, AND GEORGIA TECH'S FEDERAL FACILITIES AND ADMINISTRATIVE (FANDA) RATE THAT WAS ESTABLISHED AND APPROVED BY THE OFFICE OF NAVAL RESEARCH FOR FISCAL YEARS 2021, 2022 AND 2023. NOTE: PROFESSOR LAURA TAYLOR AND DR. MICHAEL CHANG WILL CONSULT AND PROVIDE ADVICE ON AIR QUALITY MONITORING AND DATA ANALYSES AT RATE OF ~1-WEEK PER YEAR. THEIR PARTICIPATION WILL NOT INCUR CHARGES TO THE PROJECT, HOWEVER. FOR THE $123,652 THAT WILL PASS THROUGH TO THE GTARC, $39,878 IS ALLOCATED FOR SR. PERSONNEL COSTS ACROSS ALL THREE YEARS FOR MR. MATTHEW SWARTS (1-WEEK/YR) AND A RESEARCH ENGINEER (~3-WEEKS/YR) TO WORK WITH THE CSC AND THE TEACHER FELLOWS TO DEVELOP THE GIS TOOLS AND LESSON PLANS. THEIR WORK WILL BE COORDINATED BY MR. KEVIN CARAVATI (~2-DAYS/YR). THEIR TIME ALSO INCLUDES CHARGES FOR COMPENSATED ABSENCES AT A RATE OF 19.8% OF PERSONNEL COSTS ($7092), AND FRINGE BENEFITS AT A RATE OF 27.2297% OF PERSONNEL COSTS + COMPENSATED ABSENCES ($12,790). OVERHEAD ON LABOR IS CHARGED AT 75.95% O

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AND AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $475,912, TO THE ENVIRONMENTAL COMMUNITY ACTION INC. TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND.  SUBRECIPIENT:THE SUBAWARD GRANTEES OF EMORY UNIVERSITY DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE (ENVS) STAFF AND INTERNS WILL LEAD THE AIR MONITORING EFFORTS AND WILL SUPPORT DATA SHARING ACTIVITIES.  ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE OVERSEEING THE INSTALLATION AND VISUALIZATION OF THE DATA, WORKING WITH AIR MONITORING CO-LEAD AND THE STUDENT INTERN AND WILL PROVIDE TRAINING TO AFFECT COMMUNITIES ON TOPICS RELATED TO AIR POLLUTION AND HEALTH.  PARTNERS WILL ALSO PURCHASE PM 10 AIR MONITORS THAT WILL BE WILL BE USED TO INSTALLED  4 PM 2.5 INLETS.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE DEPLOYING 7 AIR QUALITY MONITORS (THREE OF WHICH WILL BE PURCHASED USING EPA FUNDS) IN FIVE UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES TO COLLECT DATA OVER A ONE-YEAR PERIOD, MAKING NEAR REAL-TIME AIR QUALITY DATA AVAILABILITY FOR FIVE COMMUNITIES AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS, CREATING COMMUNITY-SPECIFIC AIR POLLUTION DATA SUMMARIES AND MAKING THEM AVAILABLE TO FIVE COMMUNITIES, PROVIDING 8-10 TRAINING SESSIONS TO 5 GROUPS EACH OF 15 PEOPLE AND DEVELOPING FIVE SPECIFIC STRATEGIES TO REDUCE THE IMPACTS OF AIR POLLUTANT ON THEIR HEALTH. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE PROVIDING ADDITIONAL DATA THAT HELP COMMUNITY MEMBERS IDENTIFY THE TYPE AND EXTENT OF THE PROBLEMS THEY ARE CONFRONTING, INCREASING COMMUNITY UNDERSTANDING OF AIR POLLUTION HAZARDS IN METRO-ATLANTA LOCATIONS THAT ARE CURRENTLY UNMONITORED, INCREASING COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF THE RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH AIR POLLUTANTS IN THEIR COMMUNITIES, INCREASING ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND TOOLS THAT WILL HELP COMMUNITY MEMBERS DECREASE THE RISKS OF THESE POLLUTANTS ON THE ENVIRONMENT AND ON THEIR HEALTH.THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO LIVE IN UNMONITORED AREAS OF ATLANTA, GA WHO ARE DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED BY AIR POLLUTION AND LOW INCOME. THESE COMMUNITIES INCLUDE BRUCE STREET IN LITHONIA, CHAPEL HILL IN DECATUR, PEOPLESTOWN IN ATLANTA, PITTSBURGH IN ATLANTA AND CITY OF SOUTH FULTON IN FULTON.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER INFLATION REDUCTION ACT TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $499,988 TO MIAMI-DADE COUNTY TO EXPAND AND STRENGTHEN PARTNERSHIPS, ENGAGE COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN DESIGN AND PERFORMANCE ASSESSMENT OF A NEW MIAMI-DADE COUNTY CLEAN AIR COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP PROGRAM: WHAT'S YOUR 305 AIR QUALITY TO ENSURE THAT ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE (EJ) COMMUNITIES ARE INCLUDED AS THE CENTRAL FRAMEWORK TO HELP GUIDE EQUITABLE AND EFFECTIVE AIR QUALITY MITIGATION ACTIONS THROUGHOUT MIAMI-DADE COUNTY.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. THE RECIPIENT WILL IMPLEMENT ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE SCOPE OF THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT, COMMUNITY SCALES GRANT PROGRAM INCLUDING: 1) ESTABLISH THE WHAT'S YOUR 305 AIR QUALITY? MIAMI DADE CLEAN AIR COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP PROGRAM AS PART OF OFFICE OF RESILIENCE'S RESILIENT305 PROGRAM AND HEAT HEALTH WORK 2) DEPLOY INSTRUMENTS IN A MULTI-SENSOR NETWORK (OZONE, PM2.5, TEMPERATURE AND HUMIDITY) FOCUSING ON MONITORING GAPS AND CUMULATIVE STRESSORS. 3) EVALUATE AIR QUALITY DATA AT STATIONS CO-LOCATED WITH REGULATORY GRADE INSTRUMENTS MANAGED BY THE MIAMI-DADE COUNTY AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT DIVISION FOR COMPARABILITY AND APPROPRIATE USE OF THESE DATA. 4) CO-DEVELOP AND LAUNCH THE WHAT'S YOUR 305 AIR QUALITY? COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES, POLICY ACTIONS AND COMMUNICATION STRATEGY THAT INTEGRATES ADDITIONAL AIR QUALITY DATA AND POTENTIAL DISPROPORTIONATE AND ADVERSE IMPACTS OF POLLUTANTS AND CUMULATIVE MULTIPLE STRESSORS AT THE CENSUS BLOCK GROUP LEVEL.SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARD GRANTEES WILL WORK WITH MIAMI-DADE COUNTY STAFF TO SUBMIT QUARTERLY REPORTS AS REQUIRED AND ON TIME. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE LEADING FIELD DEPLOYMENT AND OVERSEEING FIELD MANAGEMENT OF THE MONITORING STATION NETWORK, MENTORING A POSTDOCTORAL ASSOCIATE, WHO WILL CO-LEAD PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT AND THE WHAT'S YOUR 305 AIR QUALITY PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND SUPPORT SUCCESSFUL IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROJECT. A PROJECT PARTNER COORDINATOR WILL PREPARE DOCUMENTATION AND PRODUCTS TO ENSURE TIMELY DELIVERY OF PRODUCTS AND REPORTING MATERIALS TO SUPPORT THE PROGRAM MANAGER. A FIELD MANAGER WILL MANAGE FIELD MAINTENANCE AND DATA MANAGEMENT. STAFF WILL DEVELOP SPATIAL PRODUCTS AND ANALYSES. THERE WILL ALSO BE A CO-LEAD FOR PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT AND WHAT'S YOUR 305 AIR QUALITY PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND SUPPORT SUCCESSFUL IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROJECT. AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE CONTRIBUTIONS WILL BE MADE TOWARDS PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT AND WHAT'S YOUR 305 AIR QUALITY PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, AND CO-MENTORING OF PROJECT STAFF. A SECOND POSTDOCTORAL ASSOCIATE  WILL SUPPORT FIELD MANAGEMENT AND PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT. THERE WILL ALSO BE A LEAD FOR COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT. OUTCOMES:THE PROPOSED RESEARCH WILL BENEFIT UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, RESULTING IN SHORT-TERM AS WELL AS LONG TERM POSITIVE IMPACTS. SHORT-TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE PROBLEM IDENTIFICATION (HIGHLIGHTING THE SPATIAL ATTRIBUTES OF AIR POLLUTION) AND INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS (THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF WORKSHOPS AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES THAT EDUCATE THE PUBLIC OF THE HEALTH IMPACTS OF AIR POLLUTION). LONG-TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE REDUCTION OF CONTAMINANTS, AND HUMAN EXPOSURE THROUGH DIRECTED POLICIES AND PROGRAMS AIMED AT LIMITING AND REDUCING PARTICU

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $388,375 TO HILLSBOROUGH COUNTY, FL TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE PROJECT INTENDS TO CREATE A COMMUNITY NETWORKS MONITORING DISTRIBUTED AIR QUALITY ALONG INTERSTATE (I)-275, I-4, AND I-75 FOCUSING ON COMMUNITIES OF CONCERN TO PROVIDE DATA-BASED INFORMATION FOR FUTURE PROJECT PLANNING. THE PROJECT WILL MEASURE KNOWN HEALTH-IMPACTING AIR POLLUTANTS FROM VEHICULAR TRAFFIC WITH THE INTENT FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND SCHOOL CHILDREN TO LEARN, PARTICIPATE AND HELP REPORT ABOUT LOCALIZED AIR QUALITY. THE GOAL IS TO ASSIST THE COMMUNITIES AND THE HILLSBOROUGH COUNTY METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION  TO DEVELOP FUTURE PLANNING APPROACHES THAT IMPROVE AIR QUALITY NEAR ROADWAYS AND IMPROVE THE EQUITY OUTCOMES OF TRANSPORTATION DECISION MAKING.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY HILLSBOROUGH COUNTY METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION WILL PURCHASE 25 PURPLE AIR FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM 2.5) MONITORS TO MEASURE PM 2.5 ALONG THE I-275 AND I-4 CORRIDORS. THEY WILL ALSO GO TO PURCHASE APPROXIMATELY 5 CLARITY NODES TO MEASURE PM AND NITROGEN DIOXIDE (NO2) ALONG THIS SAME CORRIDOR. THIS GRANT WILL BE USED FOR COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION AS WELL AS DATA COLLECTION.  



SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON MONITORING FINE PM 2.5 AND NO2 AT COMMUNITY SITES ALONG THE I-275/I-4/I-75 CORRIDORS. BOTH PM2.5 AND NO2 ARE CRITERIA AIR POLLUTANTS WITH NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) REFLECTIVE OF THEIR KNOWN CARDIOVASCULAR AND RESPIRATORY HEALTH IMPACTS.  EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR(S) TO REPLACE FILTER-BASED PM2.5 MONITOR(S). HILLSBOROUGH COUNTY METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION EXPECTED OUTCOMES PROVIDE EDUCATION BY PROMOTING AN INCREASED AWARENESS OF VEHICLE EMISSIONS IN SELECTED HILLSBOROUGH COUNTY COMMUNITIES, AN ANNUAL COMMUNITY NETWORK SUMMIT TO SHARE DATA AND ACTIONABLE ITEMS TO DECREASE CURRENT VEHICULAR POLLUTANTS OR INFLUENCE FUTURE PLANNING TO MITIGATE VEHICULAR POLLUTANTS, AND TO ESTABLISH ONGOING COLLABORATION WITH THE CITY AND COUNTY PLANNERS TO MITIGATE POLLUTANTS ALONG THE CORRIDOR.  EXPECTED BENEFICIARIES ARE LOCAL RESIDENTS WHO LIVE IN HILLSBOROUGH COUNTY, FLORIDA.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19. THIS ACTION APPROVES AN ARP AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $31,100 TO THE CHATTANOOGA-HAMILTON COUNTY AIR POLLUTION CONTROL BUREAU.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ADDRESS PRIORITIES IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL UPGRADE A CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR, AN AUDIT DEVICE, AND INTERNET SETUP EQUIPMENT.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING A CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR TO REPLACE AN UNDERPERFORMING PM2.5 CONTINUOUS MONITOR; PURCHASING AN AUDIT DEVICE AND INTERNET SETUP AT MONITORING SITES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WHICH WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES WITH FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. THE OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA HELPS TO ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. INTENDED AND DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF TENNESSEE WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.THIS ACTION APPROVES AN ARP AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $60,000 TO SARASOTA COUNTY.   ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ADDRESS PRIORITIES IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS.  SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PURCHASE A CAS AIR MONITORING SHELTER TO INSTALL A NEW SITE OR UPGRADE EXISTING INFRASTRUCTURE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING A CAS AIR MONITORING SHELTER. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: INSTALLING OR UPGRADING THIS TYPE OF INFRASTRUCTURE WILL ASSIST THE RECIPIENT IN PROVIDING ALL COMMUNITIES MORE RELIABLE DATA FOR VARIOUS NAAQS POLLUTANTS AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19. THIS ACTION APPROVES AN ARP AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $72,000 TO THE EASTERN BAND OF CHEROKEE INDIANS (EBCI). ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE REPLACING EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PURCHASE NEW OZONE EQUIPMENT TO REPLACE AGING EQUIPMENT -  NEW OZONE ANALYZER AND CALIBRATOR. THESE SPECIFIC PROJECT FUNDS WILL BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING OZONE MEASUREMENT EQUIPMENT AT AN EXISTING EBCI AIR MONITORING SITE THAT HAS A MONITORING OBJECTIVE OF POPULATION EXPOSURE IN CHEROKEE, NC .EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING EQUIPMENT TO UPGRADE EXISTING MONITORING SITES FOR VARIOUS NAAQS POLLUTANTS. QUARTERLY AND FINAL REPORTS, AND QUALITY ASSURED OZONE DATA MEETING EPA REQUIREMENTS UTILIZING NEW EQUIPMENT. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE EBCI TRIBAL MEMBERS AND OTHERS LIVING ON TRIBAL LAND WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE EQUIPMENT UPGRADES FOR OZONE MONITORING. OUTCOMES INCLUDES OPERATION OF NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS.

THESE FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO ADDRESS PRIORITIES IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS. SPECIFICALLY, FLORIDA DEP WILL PURCHASE NEW PM2.5 MONITORING EQUIPMENT AND AIR MONITORING SITE SHELTERS TO UPGRADE AGING EQUIPMENT IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.   
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR(S) TO REPLACE FILTER-BASED PM2.5 MONITOR(S) AND REPLACEMENT SHELTERS FOR AIR MONITORING SITES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.
