THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $162,000 TO GEORGIA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES TO SUPPORT THE STATE OF GEORGIA&RSQUO;S EFFORTS TO CONDUCT AIR TOXICS MONITORING TO MEASURE VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS, SEMI-VOLATILES, CARBONYLS AND METALS. THIS PROJECT REPRESENTS A CONTINUATION OF A NATIONAL ONGOING EFFORT TO CHARACTERIZE AIR TOXICS AND ASSESS TRENDS IN AMBIENT LEVELS BY CONDUCTING PRIMARY AND COLLOCATED MONITORING IN URBAN AND RURAL AREAS. THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THIS MONITORING IS TRACKING TRENDS IN AMBIENT AIR TOXICS LEVELS TO FACILITATE MEASURING PROGRESS TOWARD EMISSION AND RISK REDUCTION GOALS. DATA RESULTING FROM THE PROJECT WILL BE SUBMITTED INTO THE AIR QUALITY SYSTEM DATABASE.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $50,244 IN FEDERAL DOLLARS AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) IN-KIND DOLLARS IN THE AMOUNT OF $111,756 UTILIZING THE EASTERN RESEARCH GROUP, CONTRACT NUMBER EPD14030, EXTENDED TO 9/30/2021 TO SUPPORT THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKYS EFFORTS TO CONDUCT AIR TOXICS MONITORING TO MEASURE VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS, SEMI-VOLATILES, CARBONYLS AND METALS. THE OUTCOME OF THIS GRANT WILL AID THE COMMONWEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY IN CHARACTERIZING AMBIENT LEVELS OF AIR TOXICS WITHIN COMMUNITIES, PROVIDING QUALITY ASSURED HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANT DATA FOR TRENDS DETERMINATION, EVALUATING PUBLIC EXPOSURE AND ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS IN THE VICINITY OF MONITORS, PROVIDING QUALITY ASSURED DATA FOR RISK CHARACTERIZATION, ASSESSING THE EFFECTIVENESS OF SPECIFIC EMISSION REDUCTION ACTIVITIES, AND EVALUATING AND SUBSEQUENTLY IMPROVING AIR TOXICS EMISSION INVENTORIES AND MODEL PERFORMANCE. DELIVERABLES WILL INCLUDE DATA SUBMITTED INTO THE AIR QUALITY SYSTEM DATABASE. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM THAT WILL BENEFIT FROM THE GRANT INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY AND THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $162,000 TO HILLSBOROUGH COUNTY, TO SUPPORT THEIR ONGOING NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TREND SITE AIR MONITORING PROGRAM, $139,178 IN FEDERAL DOLLARS AND $22,822 IN EPA IN-KIND SERVICES. THE EPA IN-KIND SERVICES ARE PROVIDED BY EASTERN RESEARCH GROUP, THE CONTRACT NUMBER IS EP-D-14-030 AND EXPIRES ON 09/30/2021.

THIS ACTION APPROVES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $157,049 TO THE STATE OF SOUTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL TO SUPPORT THEIR ON GOING NATIONAL AIR TOXIC TREND SITE MONITORING PROGRAM IN THE STATE. IT ALSO REFLECTS $4,951 IN EPA IN-KIND SERVICES. THE EPA IN-KIND SERVICES ARE PROVIDED BY EASTERN RESEARCH GROUP, UNDER CONTRACT NUMBER EP-D-14-030 AND EXPIRES ON 09/30/2021.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $162,000 TO PINELLAS COUNTY BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS, TO SUPPORT THEIR ONGOING NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TREND SITE AIR MONITORING PROGRAM, $100,416 IN FEDERAL DOLLARS AND $61,584 IN EPA IN-KIND SERVICES. THE EPA IN-KIND SERVICES ARE PROVIDED BY EASTERN RESEARCH GROUP, THE CONTRACT NUMBER IS EP-D-14-030 AND EXPIRES ON 09/30/2021.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $200,000 TO MECKLENBURG COUNTY TO SUPPORT THEIR COMPLIANCE WITH NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS BY ASSISTING WITH IMPLEMENTING A PERMANENT NEAR-ROAD NITROGEN DIOXIDE (NO2) MONITORING STATION THAT WILL MEET NETWORK DESIGN AND SITING CRITERIA REQUIREMENTS UNDER 40 CFR PART 58.

THE TULALIP TRIBES WILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP THEIR AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES AND PROGRAM THROUGH EDUCATION AND OUTREACH, TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, INDOOR AIR QUALITY SCIENCE AND PRACTICE RESEARCH, PARTNERSHIPS AND COLLABORATIONS, AND RESIDENT EDUCATION ON HOW TO MAINTAIN THEIR HOMES AND AVOID ACTIVITIES TO PREVENT CONDITIONS THAT ADVERSELY IMPACT INDOOR AIR QUALITY AND HEALTH. IMPLEMENTATION OF THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BENEFIT AND PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH AND AIR QUALITY ON THE RESERVATION.

FUNDING IS FOR THE CONTINUED OPERATION OF OREGON DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY&RSQUOANDS (ODEQ) NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS SITES (NATTS) AT LA GRANDE (ASH ST.) AND PORTLAND (NORTH ROSELAWN). SPECIFICALLY, THE GRANT RECIPIENT WILL OPERATE AIR TOXICS MONITORING SITES TO COLLECT DATA THAT WILL BE THE BASIS FOR FUTURE EMISSION CONTROL ACTIONS THAT WILL HELP MORE PEOPLE BREATH CLEANER AIR IN THEIR STATE. THE ANTICIPATED SHORT TERM OUTCOMES FOR THIS PROJECT IS TO DETERMINE AMBIENT CONCENTRATIONS OF AIR TOXICS IN THE PORTLAND AND LA GRANDE AREAS. THE LONG TERM OUTCOME WOULD BE TO USE THESE MONITORING DATA TO IDENTIFY RESIDUAL HEALTH RISKS DUE TO AMBIENT AIR TOXICS, AND TAKE APPROPRIATE CONTROL ACTIONS, TO REDUCE HEALTH RISKS DUE TO ACCEPTABLE LEVELS.

PUGET SOUND CLEAN AIR AGENCY (PSCAA) WILL PERFORM A STUDY TO ASSESS AIR TOXICS TRENDS AND RISK IN SEATTLE AND TACOMA. THE STUDY WILL FOCUS ON CHANGES IN AIR TOXICS CONCENTRATIONS FROM DIESEL EXHAUST SOURCES, WOOD SMOKE, ETHYLENE OXIDE, AND INDUSTRIAL SOURCE METAL EMISSIONS FROM PREVIOUS STUDY CONDUCTED 10 YEARS AGO. PSCAA WILL MONITOR AIR TOXICS AND PRODUCE NEW ESTIMATES OF POTENTIAL CANCER RISK, THEN COMPARE THESE TO PAST VALUES AND TO THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS ASSESSMENT.  ADDITIONALLY, PSCAA WILL PERFORM AN ANALYSIS OF AIR TOXICS RISKS USING MONITORING THAT HAS BEEN DIRECTED BY THE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES IN ORDER TO ASSESS IF THERE ARE ADDITIONAL EQUITY GAPS.  NOTE: THE INDIRECT COST RATE AGREEMENT ON FILE WITH EPA EXPIRED 6/30/2017, YOU MAY NOT DRAW DOWN FUNDS FOR INDIRECT COSTS WITHOUT A CURRENT, APPROVED RATE IN PLACE.

THE BURNS PAIUTE TRIBE IS REQUESTING CLEAN AIR ACT 103 FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE TRIBE'S ENVIRONMENTAL DEPARTMENT IN BUILDING CAPACITY TO START AN AIR QUALITY PROGRAM. FOR 2020-2021, THE TRIBE WILL ATTEND TWO AIR QUALITY CLASSES TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE ISSUES WITH AIR QUALITY AND BUILD PARTNERSHIPS AND CONNECTIONS IN THE TRIBAL AIR QUALITY COMMUNITY. THE TRIBE PLANS TO BUILD A LEARNING PLAN WITH THE KNOWLEDGE GAINED ' TO STRATEGICLY MAP OUT NEXT STEPS AND FUTURE TRAINING NEEDS.  NOTE: THE INDIRECT COST RATE AGREEMENT ON FILE WITH EPA EXPIRES 12/31/2020, YOU MAY NOT DRAW DOWN FUNDS FOR INDIRECT COSTS WITHOUT A CURRENT, APPROVED RATE IN PLACE.

IMPLEMENTATION OF THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BENEFIT AND PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH AND AIR QUALITY ON THE RESERVATION.

THE TULALIP TRIBES ARE REQUESTING CLEAN AIR ACT 103 FUNDS TO HOST THE TRIBAL HEALTHY HOMES NETWORK (THHN). FOR 2020-2021, THHN WILL CONTINUE ITS FOCUS TOWARDS ITS PRIMARY MISSION: PREVENTING HOUSEHOLD AIR POLLUTION AND ADVERSE HEALTH OUTCOMES IN AMERICAN INDIAN AND ALASKA NATIVE COMMUNITIES.  THHN WORKS TOWARDS THIS THROUGH THREE CORE SERVICES: OUTREACH AND EDUCATION (DELIVERING KNOWLEDGE), TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (BUILDING CAPACITY), AND DEVELOPING RESOURCES (MODEL PROGRAMS, POLICIES, AND PRACTICES).

THE KALISPEL TRIBE WILL BEGIN TO DEVELOP THEIR AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES AND PROGRAM BY RESEARCHING AND BUILDING CAPACITY TO CONDUCT THE TREATMENT AS A STATE PROCESS UNDER THE CLEAN AIR ACT. THIS WORK WILL HELP THE TRIBE RETAIN A LARGER ROLE IN THE GOVERNANCE OF THE CLEAN AIR ACT ON THE RESERVATION, WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR OTHER CLEAN AIR ACT PROGRAM IMPLEMENTATION IN THE FUTURE, WHICH WILL BENEFIT AND PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH AND AIR QUALITY ON THE RESERVATION.

THE ALASKA NATIVE TRIBAL HEALTH CONSORTIUM WILL CONTINUE TO HELP ALASKA TRIBES DEVELOP THEIR AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES AND PROGRAMS THROUGH AIR QUALITY TECHNICAL SUPPORT, CAPACITY BUILDING, CONDUCTING ASSESSMENTS, AND ADMINISTERING SUB-AWARDS FOR AIR QUALITY PROJECTS DEVELOPED COLLABORATIVELY WITH ALASKA TRIBES FOR THEIR COMMUNITIES. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BENEFIT AND PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH AND AIR QUALITY IN ALASKA NATIVE VILLAGES.

FUNDING IS FOR THE CONTINUED OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM)2.5 MONITORING NETWORK IN THE STATE OF IDAHO.  THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS COMPLIANCE WITH NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS BY CONTINUING THE ONGOING COLLECTION OF DATA ON THE AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF FINE PARTICULATE MATTER.

THE PROPOSED PROJECT, 'IMPROVING DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER EXPOSURE ASSESSMENT FOR VULNERABLE POPULATIONS IN THE PORTLAND METROPOLITAN AREA,' WILL STUDY THE PUBLIC HEALTH IMPACTS OF POORLY CHARACTERIZED DIESEL EMISSION SOURCES, WITH PARTICULAR ATTENTION TO THE POTENTIALLY SIGNIFICANT ADVERSE EXPOSURE EFFECTS FOR VULNERABLE POPULATIONS, E.G., LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS, COMMUNITIES OF COLOR, YOUTH, AND SENIORS. AS NOTED IN OREGON HEALTH AUTHORITY HEALTH IMPACT ASSESSMENTS (2013, 2014), THESE GROUPS ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE AFFECTED BY AIR POLLUTION AND LIMITED TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS THAT CONTRIBUTE TO CHRONIC HEALTH DISEASES SUCH AS ASTHMA, CANCER, HEART DISEASE, DIABETES, AND STROKE.

THE OLYMPIC REGION CLEAN AIR AGENCY (ORCAA) WILL MONITOR HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS (HAPS) ASSOCIATED WITH WOOD COMBUSTION IN THURSTON COUNTY. THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON 5 MAJOR AIR POLLUTANTS WHICH ARE CARCINOGENIC OR POTENTIAL CARCINOGEN, CAUSE RESPIRATORY DISTRESS AND INCREASE ASTHMA RISK. ORCAA WILL  ANALYZE DATA, ASSESS HEATH RISKS AND REPORT FINDINGS FROM THIS STUDY.  THIS PROJECT WILL ASSESS THE CONCENTRATON OF HAPS IN RELATION TO ELEVATED PARTICULATE MATTER OR PM2.5 LEVELS, DETERMINE IF AMBIENT LEVELS EXCEED THE REFERENCE CONCENTRATIONS (RFC) FOR AMBIENT AIR, IDENTIFY ADDITIONAL SOURCES THAT CONTRIBUTE SIGNIFICANTLY TO HAPS, AND EVALUATE/IMPROVE MEASUREMENT METHODS FOR ACROLEIN.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS FOR  WASHINGTON DEPARTMENT OF ECOLOGY TO CONTINUE TO COLLECT AND ANALYZE AIR TOXICS DATA AT THE BEACON HILL SITE FOR THE PURPOSE OF DETERMINING LONG-TERM TRENDS OF VARIOUS CATEGORIES OF AIR TOXICS.

THIS PROJECT WILL IDENTIFY SOURCES OF ELEVATED CARBONYLS FOUND IN THE YEAR LONG COMMUNITY MONITORING ASSESSMENT THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE (NPT) CONDUCTED I

PROVIDE REGIONAL AIR QUALITY PROGRAM SUPPORT AND TRAINING TO THE ARKANSAS, IOWA, KANSAS, LOUISIANA, MISSOURI, NEBRASKA, OKLAHOMA, AND TEXAS AIR QUALITY PROGRAMS.  AT THE DIRECTION OF THESE STATES, CENSARA TEAMS WITH FEDERAL/STATE/LOCAL AGENCY STAFF AND CONTRACTORS AS NEEDED TO DEVELOP TECHNICAL AND/OR POLICY WORK PRODUCTS USED TO SUPPORT COMMENTS ON EPA REGULATORY DEVELOPMENTS AND PROGRAM UPDATES; TO ASSIST STATES AS THEY DEVELOP TECHNICAL AND REGULATORY PROGRAM OPTIONS; TO HELP THE MEMBERS IDENTIFY, UNDERSTAND, AND ADDRESS REGIONAL AIR QUALITY CHALLENGES; AND, TO DEVELOP TRAINING COURSES RELEVANT TO MEMBERS' NEEDS.  THROUGH THESE TYPES OF ACTIVITIES THAT ASSIST STATE/LOCAL AIR QUALITY PROGRAMS IN THEIR EFFORTS TO PREVENT AND/OR REDUCE AMBIENT AIR QUALITY POLLUTANTS, CENSARA CARRIES OUT THE MISSION OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA).

THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS PLANNING EFFORTS FOR DEVELOPING, ESTABLISHING, IMPROVING AND MAINTAINING ADEQUATE PROGRAMS FOR THE PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF AIR POLLUTION OR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF NATIONAL PRIMARY AND SECONDARY AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. THIS GRANT AGREEMENT WILL SUPPORT THE STATE'S ABILITY TO CONDUCT THE AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF AIR TOXICS IN THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA. THE ODEQ NATTS PROJECT SUPPORTS EPA'S NATIONAL AIR TOXICS ASSESSMENT (NATA) TO HELP CHARACTERIZE THE AIR TOXICS PROBLEM. PRINCIPAL NATA ACTIVITIES INCLUDE IDENTIFICATION OF AREAS OF CONCERN, CHARACTERIZING RISKS AND TRACKING PROGRESS.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. ADAMS COUNTY WILL MONITOR FOR FINE PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 MICRONS OR LESS IN DIAMETER (PM2.5).  THE COUNTY, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH EIGHT COMMUNITY PARTNERS HAS DEVELOPED A COMMUNITY AIR MONITORING NETWORK CONSISTING OF PARTICULATE MATTER SENSORS THAT DISPLAY REAL-TIME, PUBLIC FACING DATA ACROSS ADAMS AND ARAPAHOE COUNTIES. THIS PROJECT WILL BUILD ON THAT ESTABLISHED COMMUNITY AIR MONITORING NETWORK, EXPAND OPPORTUNITIES FOR COMMUNITY VOICES IN AIR QUALITY CONVERSATIONS AND POLICY, INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR COMMUNITY CAPACITY BUILDING, CONTINUE TO BUILD TRUST AMONG PARTNERS AND WITH COMMUNITY, AND IDENTIFY POLICY, SYSTEMS AND ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGES TO PROMOTE PUBLIC HEALTH AND REDUCE AIR POLLUTANTS WHILE LEVERAGING EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE. THE KEY COMPONENTS OF THE PROJECT ARE A COMMUNITY AIR MONITORING NETWORK, COMMUNITY PARTNER LEARNING COHORT, COMMUNITY-DRIVEN PROJECTS THAT LEVERAGE DATA FOR EDUCATIONAL AND ADVOCACY PURPOSES.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND.  

SPECIFICALLY, ADAMS COUNTY WILL CONTINUE THE EXPANSION AND EVOLUTION OF A LEARNING COHORT OF ENGAGED PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS. THEY WILL CONDUCT COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT TO GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN MONITORING EFFORTS AND ENHANCE PARTNERS UNDERSTANDING OF COMMUNITY-DRIVEN SOLUTIONS TO AIR POLLUTION. COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION EFFORTS WILL BE IMPLEMENTED TO CREATE AWARENESS OF AIR QUALITY ISSUES THAT WILL PROMOTE BEHAVIOR CHANGE AND PUBLIC HEALTH. THROUGH THE USE OF AIR SENSORS THAT WILL DISPLAY REAL-TIME, PUBLIC DATA, THE COUNTY WILL BE ABLE TO ANSWER COMMUNITY QUESTIONS REGARDING AIR QUALITY AND ALLOW FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS MAKE BEHAVIORAL DECISIONS THAT ARE BEST FOR THEMSELVES AND THEIR HEALTH. THE DATA WILL BE FOUND ON A PUBLIC WEBSITE.
SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS TO COHORT PARTNERS FOR PROGRAMMING SUPPLIES. OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE DEPLOYMENT OF PM 2.5 SENSORS, DEVELOPMENT OF A PUBLIC-FACING REAL TIME DATA DASHBOARD, A SHARED REPOSITORY OF AIR QUALITY RESOURCES, AN AIR QUALITY COHORT OF PARTNERS, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND OUTREACH ACTIVITIES THAT WILL CREATE AN INCREASED VOICE IN DECISION MAKING.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND TOOLS. IDENTIFICATION OF ACTIONS TO MITIGATE AIR POLLUTANTS, INCREASED TRUST BETWEEN COHORT PARTNERS. INCREASED COLLABORATION WITH PROJECT PARTNERS AND AN INCREASED COMMUNITY VOICE IN AIR QUALITY TOPICS AT A LOCAL AND REGIONAL LEVEL. LONG TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE REDUCED EXPOSURE TO AIR POLLUTANTS AND IMPROVED PUBLIC HEALTH OUTCOMES.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE RESIDENTS IN THE COMMUNITIES OF ADAMS AND ARAPAHOE COUNTIES OF COLORADO.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER INFLATION REDUCTION ACT TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.

SALT LAKE COUNTY OFFICE OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES (OES) IS CURRENTLY OPERATING A DEMONSTRATION PROJECT OF THE PROPOSED ELECTRIC BUS (EBUS) AIR QUALITY MONITORING (EAQM) PROJECT WITH THREE UTAH TRANSIT AUTHORITY (UTA) EBUSES IN SALT LAKE COUNTY, UTAH. SALT LAKE COUNTY WILL USE THIS FUNDING TO SCALE THE PROJECT TO INSTALL EIGHT ADDITIONAL AIR QUALITY MONITORS ON ELECTRIC BUSES. THE ADDITIONAL MONITORING CAPACITY WILL INFORM SALT LAKE COUNTY'S EFFORTS IN IMPROVING AIR QUALITY, PARTICULARLY IN DIVERSE AND UNDERSERVED WEST SIDE SALT LAKE COUNTY COMMUNITIES, TO CREATE ONE OF THE MOST DETAILED POLLUTION MAPPING SYSTEMS IN THE WORLD.

PRELIMINARY DATA INDICATES THE WEST SIDE OF SALT LAKE COUNTY AIR QUALITY IS WORSE THAN THE EAST SIDE. THE WEST SIDE IS NOTABLY MORE INDUSTRIAL, CONSISTS OF COMMUNITIES OF LOWER INCOME AND GREATER DIVERSITY, AND IS IN CLOSE PROXIMITY TO MORE MAJOR HIGHWAYS AND PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION ROUTES. IT IS THE INTENT OF THIS PROJECT TO INSTALL EIGHT ELECTRIC BUS AIR QUALITY MONITORS, EXPAND THE EXISTING DEMONSTRATION PROJECT, COLLECT REAL-TIME AIR QUALITY DATA, AND MAKE TARGETED IMPROVEMENTS IN SALT LAKE COUNTY AIR QUALITY.
THE MONITORS ARE INSTALLED ON EBUSES BY THE UNIVERSITY OF UTAH, IN COLLABORATION WITH UTAH TRANSIT AUTHORITY. EIGHT EBUS ROUTES ARE PROPOSED FOR EAQM DATA COLLECTION. IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT THE DATA WILL SHOW INCREASED AIR POLLUTION ON THE WEST SIDE OF SALT LAKE COUNTY, PARTICULARLY THE DIVERSE AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES OF THE NORTHWEST QUADRANT.

ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT WILL:   1) ACCURATELY CAPTURE REAL-TIME SALT LAKE COUNTY AIR QUALITY DATA TO INFORM POLICY AND INCENTIVE ACTIVITIES THAT LEAD TO IMPROVED AIR QUALITY; 2) ACCURATELY CAPTURE REAL-TIME SALT LAKE COUNTY AIR QUALITY DATA TO INFORM AND CHANGE RESIDENTS' BEHAVIORS TO IMPROVE AIR QUALITY; AND 3) EDUCATE AFFECTED COMMUNITIES IN AIR QUALITY MITIGATION, SPECIFICALLY ADDRESSING UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.

SUBRECIPIENT:8 AIR QUALITY MONITOR SYSTEMS FOR EBUS INSTALLATION;  INSTALLATION SERVICES AND SUPPLIES FOR 8 MONITOR SYSTEMS;  DATA ACQUISITIONOUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE:  1) PROVIDE REAL-TIME NEIGHBORHOOD-LEVEL AIR QUALITY DATA FROM A GREATER NUMBER OF COMMUNITIES, INCLUDING DIVERSE AND UNDERSERVED AREAS; 2) PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE REGIONAL DATA TO IDENTIFY AIR QUALITY DISCREPANCIES; AND 3) PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE REGIONAL DATA ANALYSIS TO ACCURATELY INFORM SALT LAKE COUNTY POLICY INITIATIVES AND/OR INCENTIVES.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE:  PROBLEM IDENTIFICATION ASSOCIATED TO PM2.5, OZONE, AND NO2; PROBLEM IDENTIFICATION ASSOCIATED TO DIVERSE AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES; INCREASED ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND TOOLS THAT INCREASE UNDERSTANDING AND REDUCTION OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND HUMAN HEALTH RISKS; INCREASED ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND TOOLS THAT INCREASE UNDERSTANDING AND REDUCTION OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND HUMAN HEALTH RISKS; EXPANSION OF AIR QUALITY DATA COLLECTION CAPABILITY, ESTABLISHMENT OF DATA COLLECTION PROCEDURES, AND INCREASED KNOWLEDGE REGARDING AIR QUALITY IN DIVERSE AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES; INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS; SUCCESSFUL INTEGRATION AND DISTRIBUTION OF COLLECTED REAL-TIME NEIGHBORHOOD-LEVEL DATA INTO PUBLIC WEBSITE; COMMUNITY ACTION TO MITIGATE NO2, OZONE, AND PM2.5; REDUCTION OF PM2.5, OZONE, AND NO2; REDUCTION OF AMBIENT CONCENTRATIONS OF NO2, OZONE, AND PM2.5; REDUCTION OF HUMAN EXPOSURE TO NO2, OZONE, AND PM2.5; REDUCTION OF HUMAN EXPOSURE TO CERTAIN AIR POLLUTANT(S).

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN (PARTICULATE MATTER, OZONE, AND VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS) IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. SAN JUAN BASIN PUBLIC HEALTH AND ITS PARTNERS PROPOSE TO ENHANCE MONITORING OF OZONE AND PARTICULATE MATTER IN ARCHULETA, LA PLATA AND SAN JUAN COUNTIES BY LEVERAGING THE AMBIENT AIR QUALITY MONITORING EXPERTISE OF FORT LEWIS COLLEGE WITH THE COMMUNICATIONS AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT CAPACITY OF SAN JUAN BASIN PUBLIC HEALTH. THIS PROJECT WILL ENGAGE AND INFORM AT-RISK COMMUNITIES AND NEIGHBORHOODS NEAR KNOW EMITTERS OF AIR POLLUTION. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THE AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE AT-RISK AND UNDERSERVED NEIGHBORHOODS A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND.

THE MONITORING APPROACH IS A COMBINATION OF STATIONARY AND MOVABLE SENSORS THAT PROVIDE NEAR-REAL-TIME DATA TO SUPPORT SHORT-TERM DEPLOYMENTS IN A VARIETY OF LOCATIONS, PLUS LABORATORY-GRADE AIR CANISTER SAMPLERS FOR SPECIATION AND QUANTIFICATION TO FURTHER INVESTIGATE VOC-RELATED AIR QUALITY PROBLEMS.

THE PROJECT WILL ALLOW INDIVIDUAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND NEIGHBORHOOD REPRESENTATIVES TO SET UP AND USE A PM SENSOR AT A LOCATION OF THEIR CHOOSING FOR ONE TO TWO WEEKS IN RESPONSE TO AN OBSERVED AIR QUALITY CONCERN.

FIXED SENSORS, MOVABLE EQUIPMENT AND THE COMMUNITY CHECKOUT PROGRAM WILL ALL BE GUIDED BY CONTINUOUS COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND COMMUNICATION ABOUT THE PROJECT.

SUBRECIPIENT:FORT LEWIS COLLEGE WILL USE THESE FUNDS TO SUPPORT A STUDENT WORKER TO PERFORM BASIC DATA ANALYSIS AND FIELD WORK. COSTS ARE BASED ON FORT LEWIS COLLEGE'S STANDARD STUDENT WORKER RATES AT 320 HOURS PER YEAR.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE DEPLOYMENT OF EQUIPMENT TO CONDUCT AIR QUALITY MONITORING NEAR UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, NEAR-REAL-TIME AIR QUALITY DATA AVAILABLE FOR COMMUNITIES, POLICYMAKERS, AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS, ASSESSMENTS OF AIR POLLUTION DATA, NEW PARTNERSHIPS AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENTS, AND QUARTERLY AND FINAL PROGRESS REPORTS.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE AIR QUALITY PROBLEM IDENTIFICATION, INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND USE OF PROTECTIVE BEHAVIORS, INCREASED ACCESS TO INFORMATION FOR POLICYMAKERS AND THE PUBLIC, AND REDUCTIONS IN AIR QUALITY HEALTH RISKS OVER TIME.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE AT-RISK AND UNDERSERVED NEIGHBORHOODS IN THE SAN JUAN COUNTIES, THE CITY OF DURANGO, SILVERTON, PAGOSA SPRINGS, BAYFIELD, IGNACIO, ARBOLES, CHROMO, HESPERUS, AND THE SOUTHERN UTE INDIAN TRIBE.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER INFLATION REDUCTION ACT TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. 

THE UTAH DIVISION OF AIR QUALITY PLANS ON ENHANCING VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUND MONITORING IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES THROUGH MOBILE VOC MONITORING AND COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS. COMMUNITIES WILL BE ENGAGED THROUGH THE FORMATION OF A COMMUNITY STEERING COMMITTEE, COMMUNITY MEETINGS, SURVEYS AND LISTENING SESSIONS, AND DEVELOPMENT OF EDUCATIONAL MODULES. WORK WILL HELP STRENGTHEN RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN IMPACTED COMMUNITIES AND REGULATORY AGENCIES, LEADING TO INCREASED TRUST AND SHARED DECISION-MAKING POWER BETWEEN THESE GROUPS.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES FROM THE UTAH DEPARTMENT OF AIR QUALITY WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THE VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS IN THE AIR AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. 

THE OBJECTIVE IS TO ENHANCE HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANT/VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUND MONITORING IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES ALONG UTAH'S NORTHERN WASATCH FRONT. MOBILE VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUND MONITORING AT THE NEIGHBORHOOD-LEVEL WILL BE CONDUCTED FOR THAT PURPOSE. TO BETTER ADDRESS COMMUNITY CONCERNS, MEASUREMENTS WILL BE PERFORMED IN CLOSE PARTNERSHIP WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:UTAH CLEAN AIR PARTNERSHIP WILL CONDUCT COMMUNITY MEETINGS AND LISTENING SESSIONS, DESIGNING AND DISTRIBUTING THE SURVEY, LIAISON BETWEEN DATA GATHERING TEAM AND COMMUNITIES, FACILITATING CONNECTIONS WITH LOCAL LEADERS AND COMMUNITY GROUPS, ASSISTING WITH EDUCATIONAL MODULES, SERVING ON COMMUNITY STEERING COMMITTEE AND HELPING RECRUIT ADDITIONAL MEMBERS.

DAVIS COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT WILL CONNECT WITH LOCAL COMMUNITY COUNCILS, ASSISTING WITH PUBLIC MESSAGING, DISSEMINATING FINDINGS, SERVING ON THE COMMUNITY STEERING COMMITTEE, FACILITATING SURVEY DISTRIBUTION.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE NEIGHBORHOOD-LEVEL VOC MONITORING, COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. 

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF VOC EMISSION SOURCES AND THEIR SPACIAL VARIATION, INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS, CLEAR, TRANSPARENT, AND INCREASED ACCESS TO AIR QUALITY INFORMATION, COMMUNITY AND INDIVIDUAL ACTION TO REDUCE SOURCE EMISSIONS AND PERSONAL EXPOSURE TO HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS, STATE ACTION TO MITIGATE HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANT EMISSIONS AND ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS, REDUCTION IN EMISSIONS AND AMBIENT LEVELS IF VOCS, AND REDUCTION IN HUMAN EXPOSURE TO HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS. 

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE NEIGHBORHOODS WITHIN UTAH'S NORTHERN WASATCH FRONT.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE UTAH DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY'S PROJECT WILL ENHANCE MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER WITH A DIAMETER OF 10 MICRONS OR LESS (PM10) AND FINE PARTICULATE MATTER THAT IS LESS THAN 2.5 MICRONS IN DIAMETER (PM2.5) IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES BY INTEGRATING LOW-COST PARTICLE MEASUREMENTS WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS. THE STATE WILL ENGAGE COMMUNITIES THROUGH THEIR COMMUNITY STEERING COMMITTEE, COMMUNITY MEETINGS, LISTENING SESSIONS, OUTREACH MODULES AND AIR QUALITY VISUALIZATIONS. THIS WORK WILL HELP STRENGTHEN RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN IMPACTED COMMUNITIES AND REGULATORY AGENCIES, LEADING TO INCREASED TRUST, EFFECTIVE COLLABORATION, SHARED DECISION--MAKING AND DEVELOPMENT OF MITIGATION STRATEGIES.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND.  

SPECIFICALLY, THIS PROJECT WILL ENHANCE PM2.5 AND PM10 MONITORING IN THE UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES ON THE NORTHWEST SIDE OF THE SALT LAKE VALLEY WHO ARE DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED BY PARTICLE POLLUTION BECAUSE OF THEIR PROXIMITY TO GRAVEL OPERATIONS, A MINE TAILING POND, HEAVY-DUTY DIESEL TRAFFIC AND THE GREAT SALT LAKE'S EXPOSED LAKEBED. THE STATE WILL LEVERAGE EXISTING STATE AND COMMUNITY AIR QUALITY MONITORING NETWORKS AND EXPERTISE TO UNDERSTAND THE PM2.5 AND PM10 LEVELS AND SOURCES IN THESE COMMUNITIES. IT WILL ADDRESS MEASUREMENT GAPS BY PROVIDING ACCURATE, NEAR REAL-TIME MEASUREMENTS THROUGHOUT THIS AREA BY ADDING MORE PM2.5 SENSORS AND LOW-COST PM10 MONITORING TO COMPLEMENT THE EXTREMELY LIMITED EXISTING MEASUREMENTS. CLOSE COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS WILL ENSURE THAT THE PROJECT ADDRESSES COMMUNITY NEEDS. LOCAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND GROUPS WILL GUIDE THE PROJECT DESIGN, SENSOR SITING, DATA COLLECTION AND PRESENTATION RESULTS AS WELL AS OUTREACH AND MITIGATION STRATEGIES.
SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARD TO THE UNIVERSITY OF UTAH FOR SURVEY SERVICES, INCLUDING TRANSLATION, SENSOR CALIBRATION AND DEPLOYMENT, DATA QA AND ANALYSIS, OUTREACH ACTIVITIES, MANAGING PROJECT WEBSITE AND AIR QUALITY  NOTIFICATIONS. SUBAWARD TO UTAH CLEAN CITIES FOR COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT. SUBAWARD TO FRIENDS OF THE GREAT SALT LAKE FOR OUTREACH AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE DEPLOYMENT OF AIR SENSORS AND AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT TO DEVELOP COMMUNITY-SPECIFIC ASSESSMENTS OF PM2.5 AND PM10 AIR POLLUTION LEVELS, ENHANCING PM2.5 AND PM10 MONITORING IN UNDERSERVED AREAS, IDENTIFYING AIR POLLUTION HOTSPOTS, PROVIDING COMMUNITIES WITH RELIABLE, MEANINGFUL, LOCALIZED, REAL-TIME PM2.5 AND PM10 MEASUREMENTS, BUILDING A SUSTAINABLE FOUNDATION OF TRUST BETWEEN CONCERNED COMMUNITIES AND A REGULATORY AGENCY AND TRANSLATING FINDINGS INTO MITIGATION ACTION THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND DECISION MAKERS, DEVELOPMENT OF OUTREACH MATERIALS AND TEACHING MODULES.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE AN IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF THE IMPACT OF PM EMISSION SOURCES ON LOCAL AIR QUALITY AND A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE AIR QUALITY CHALLENGES AT A COMMUNITY LEVEL. INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND CLEAR, TRANSPARENT ACCESS TO AIR QUALITY INFORMATION. ACTIONS TO MITIGATE PM EMISSIONS AND ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS. IN ADDITION, A REDUCTION IN EMISSIONS AND HUMAN EXPOSURE, CREATING IMPROVED HEALTH OUTCOMES IN THE COMMUNITY.
