DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER INFLATION REDUCTION ACT TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.

THE KEYA FOUNDATION LOOKS TO ACCOMPLISH THEIR GOAL THROUGH RESEARCH TO GENERATE AMBIENT AIR POLLUTION INFORMATION FOR THE CHEYENNE RIVER SIOUX TRIBAL COMMUNITIES IN SOUTH DAKOTA. THEY WILL MEASURE AMBIENT AIR LEVELS INCLUDING BOTH PARTICULATE MATTER WITH A DIAMETER LESS THAN 2.5 MICROMETERS (PM2.5), MERCURY (HG) VAPOR, AND OTHER PARTICULATE METALS, INCLUDING LEAD (PB), ARSENIC (AS), SELENIUM (SE), NICKEL (NI), AND CADMIUM (CD). ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT THE CHEYENNE RIVER SIOUX TRIBAL COMMUNITY TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN THE LAKOTA COMMUNITY AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. 

THE GOALS ARE TO COLLECT, PROCESS, AND SHARE DATA ON EXPOSURES TO AMBIENT AIR METALS IN THE LAKOTA NATION USING A CAPACITY-BUILDING PARTICIPATORY RESEARCH DESIGN THAT LOCATES SAMPLING STATIONS IN AND AROUND EAGLE BUTTE, SD, EMPLOYING LOCAL, CRST TRIBAL MEMBER STUDENTS TO COLLECT SAMPLES ON A WEEKLY BASIS FOR SUBSEQUENT ANALYSIS; AND DELIVER TO THE LAKOTA COMMUNITY RESOURCES AND VALUABLE CULTURALLY TRANSLATED INFORMATION ABOUT THEIR AIRBORNE METAL LEVELS AND POTENTIAL EXPOSURES THAT CAN BE LEVERAGED TO PROMOTE POLICIES ADDRESSING COMMUNITY RISKS AND CONCERNS RELATED TO AIR POLLUTION, HEALTH, AND QUALITY OF LIFE.SUBRECIPIENT:THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY OF SCHOOL OF MEDICINE (NYUSOM) WILL HELP CONDUCT FIELD SAMPLING BY TEACHING LOCAL NATIVE AMERICAN STUDENT INTERNS THE PROCESS. NYUSOM WILL THEN BEGIN CONDUCTING WEEK LONG SAMPLE COLLECTIONS WHICH WILL PROVIDE A GREATER SAMPLING VOLUME THAN USUAL 24-HOUR SAMPLE PERIODS. AFTER NYUSOM COMPLETES THEIR SAMPLE ANALYSES AND INTERIM DATA ANALYSES, THE AIR MONITORING COMMUNITY ADVISORY BOARD (CAB) AT THE CHEYENNE RIVER SIOUX TRIBE HEALTH BOARD WILL BE UPDATED OF INTERIM RESULTS.

THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW MEXICO HEALTH SCIENCES CENTER WILL HELP IN ORGANIZING AND EXECUTING THE COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING DATA DISSEMINATION. OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE DATA ON THE AMBIENT AIR QUALITY LEVELS OF PM2.5 AND MERCURY (HG).

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE CREATING A COMPREHENSIVE REPORT OF THE RESULTS, COMPARING KNOWN AMBIENT STANDARDS AND GUIDANCE LEVELS. FROM THERE, THE DATA WILL SERVE AS A STRONG, SCIENTIFIC BASIS FOR CRAFTING THE CHEYENNE RIVER SIOUX TRIBAL COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION ACTION PLAN WHICH WILL IDENTIFY FEASIBLE APPROACHES TO TARGETED DECREASES OF PARTICULATE MATTER AND AIRBORNE METAL EXPOSURES. IT WILL THEN BE USED AS AN EDUCATIONAL AND COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION MONITORING SUSTAINABILITY OUTCOME, ENABLING POTENTIAL EXPANSIONS TO OTHER LAKOTA TRIBES.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CHEYENNE RIVER SIOUX TRIBE AND LAKOTA TRIBES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE SOUTH DAKOTA DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE AND NATURAL RESOURCES.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT THE ONGOING NEEDS OF THE STATE'S AIR MONITORING PROGRAM THROUGH THE PURCHASE OF EQUIPMENT.

SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PURCHASE VISIBLE EMISSIONS TRAINING EQUIPMENT AND AIR MONITORS.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE PURCHASE OF A SMOKE MACHINE IN ORDER TO TRAIN AND CERTIFY PERMITTING STAFF AND INDUSTRY PROFESSIONALS. THE ENTITIES WILL BE TRAINED AND CERTIFIED SO THEY CAN EVALUATE VISIBLE EMISSIONS AT PERMITTED FACILITIES TO BE SURE THEY ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH THEIR PERMIT REQUIREMENTS. IN ADDITION, THE STATE WILL PURCHASE ADDITIONAL PM2.5 AIR MONITORS TO ENHANCE THE SUITE OF CONTINUOUS AND FILTER BASED AIR SAMPLERS CURRENTLY IN USE. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE PURCHASE OF VISIBLE EMISSIONS EQUIPMENT TO TRAIN AND CERTIFY THE STATE PERMITTING STAFF IN ADDITION TO OUTSIDE ENTITIES, TWICE A YEAR. TITLE V PERMITTED FACILITIES IN THE STATE ARE REQUIRED TO RETAIN SOMEONE CERTIFIED TO EVALUATE EMISSIONS TO ENSURE THE FACILITY IS NOT EXCEEDING ITS PERMITTED LIMITS. IN ADDITION THE STATE WILL PURCHASE ADDITIONAL PM2.5 AIR MONITORS THAT WILL BE UTILIZED AT THE SIOUX FALLS AIR MONITORING SITE. LASTLY, THE STATE WILL PURCHASE LAPTOPS THAT SUPPORTS THE MONITORS. THE MONITORS REQUIRE LAPTOPS SO THAT DATA CAN BE MANUALLY DOWNLOADED. THIS DATA IS USED FOR THE QUARTERLY DATA VERIFICATION IN INSTANCES WHERE THE DATA FROM THE DATALOGGER IS INACCURATE. THE COMPUTER IS ALSO NECESSARY TO UPLOAD NEW SOFTWARE UPDATES TO THE AIR MONITORS WHEN NEEDED.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE TRAINING AND CERTIFICATION OF APPROXIMATELY 10 STATE AIR QUALITY PERMITTING STAFF AND 150 INDUSTRY PROFESSIONALS, SO THEY CAN EVALUATE VISIBLE EMISSION AT PERMITTED FACILITIES TO BE SURE THEY ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH PERMIT REGULATIONS. IN ADDITION THE STATE WILL PROVIDE AIR POLLUTION DATA TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN A TIMELY MANNER VIA THEIR WEBSITE TO DEMONSTRATE COMPLIANCE WITH THE NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS.
  
THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE MONTANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT ON-GOING MONITORING OF FINE PARTICULATES OF PM2.5, WHICH ARE 2.5 MICRONS OR LESS IN WIDTH AND OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARD POLLUTANTS IN MONTANA. IN ADDITION, THIS PROJECT AIMS TO EXPAND MONTANA'S MONITORING NETWORK INTO COMMUNITIES WITH LITTLE OR NO AIR QUALITY INFORMATION.

SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL USE THE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE OPERATION OF EXISTING AIR MONITORS TO PROVIDE REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR POLLUTANT CONCENTRATIONS. IN ADDITION THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR THE PURCHASE OF LOW COST AIR SENSORS.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE PURCHASE OF AIR SENSORS AND THE OPERATION OF EXISTING MONITORS TO PROVIDE REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR POLLUTANT CONCENTRATIONS. DATA WILL BE PROVIDED TO COMMUNITIES AND ENABLE THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. THE DATA SHARED WILL ALLOW FOR INFORMED DECISION MAKING REQUIRED TO ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN HEALTH-BASED AIR POLLUTION STANDS THAT ARE PROTECTIVE OF HUMAN HEALTH AND TO REDUCE EMISSIONS OF PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER CRITERIA POLLUTION FROM STATIONARY AND MOBILE SOURCES. 

THROUGH THE USE OF THE AIR SENSORS THE STATE, IN COLLABORATION WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF MONTANA CENTER FOR POPULATIONS HEALTH RESEARCH, WILL INVESTIGATE THE EXTENT OF AND EXPOSURE FROM SMOKE INFILTRATION DURING WILDFIRE SEASON AND OTHER HIGH PM2.5 CONCENTRATION EVENTS THAT AFFECT HIGH SCHOOLS IN THE STATE. 

IN ADDITION, THE STATE WILL DEVELOP A MONTANA CORRECTION FOR PM2.5 DATA COLLECTED FROM THESE SENSORS. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY COLLOCATING THE SENSORS AT EACH OF THE STATE'S CURRENT AND FUTURE FEDERAL EQUIVALENT METHOD (FEM) PM2.5 SITES. DATA FROM THE FEM NETWORK REPRESENTS THE MOST AUTHORITATIVE LEVEL OF PARTICULATE DATA STATEWIDE. THE DATA FROM THE COLLOCATED MONITOR AND SENSOR WILL ADD AN ADDITIONAL LEVEL OF CONFIDENCE TO DATA DERIVED FROM THE SENSORS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE CONTINUED USE OF EXISTING PM2.5 EQUIPMENT AND THE EXPANSION OF THE STATE'S MONITORING NETWORK INTO ADDITIONAL COMMUNITIES WITH LITTLE TO NO AIR QUALITY INFORMATION. IN ADDITION, AIR SENSORS WILL BE PURCHASED FOR USE IN THE STATE MONITORING PROGRAM.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE ENHANCEMENT OF STATEWIDE AIR MONITORING TO PROVIDE EMPIRICAL DATA ESSENTIAL TO INFORMING DECISION MAKING. THE OUTCOME OF HAVING ADDITIONAL NEAR REAL-TIME AIR QUALITY DATA PUBLICLY AVAILABLE WILL BE REDUCED INCIDENCES OF RESPIRATORY ILLNESSES, INCLUDING ASTHMA AND LUNG CANCER AND IMPROVED VISIBILITY IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES. ANOTHER KEY ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOME WILL BE THE IDENTIFICATION OF AREAS WITH LOCALIZED AIR QUALITY ISSUES AND EVENTS WHERE DATA WAS PREVIOUSLY UNAVAILABLE. 

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF MONTANA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE UTAH DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT THE ONGOING NEEDS OF THE STATES AIR MONITORING PROGRAM THROUGH THE PURCHASE OF EQUIPMENT THAT WILL COMPLEMENT AND  REPLACE EXISTING PM2.5 MONITORING EQUIPMENT.

SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PURCHASE TEN AIR MONITORS IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TO OPERATE NEAR REAL TIME PM2.5 SAMPLERS THROUGHOUT THE STATE.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE PURCHASE OF TEN PM2.5 AIR MONITORS THAT WILL REPLACE OLD EQUIPMENT IN VARIOUS AREAS THROUGHOUT THE STATE. COSTS FOR ASSOCIATED SUPPLIES FOR THE OPERATION OF THE MONITORS AND PERSONNEL TIME FOR THEIR OPERATION ARE INCLUDED AS WELL. THE STATE WILL CONTINUE TO OPERATE REAL TIME PARTICULATE MONITORING PROGRAM TO MEET STATE AGENCY NEEDS AND THE CODE OF FEDERAL REGULATIONS. THE STATE WILL SUBMIT A NETWORK MODIFICATION REQUESTS PRIOR TO SAMPLER INSTALLATION AND WILL REPORT NEAR TIME DATE TO STATE WEB PAGES, UTAH AIR MOBILE APPS AND AIR NOW. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE PURCHASE AND REPLACEMENT OF TEN NEAR REAL TIME AIR MONITORS THROUGHOUT THE STATE. DATA WILL BE REPORTED TO STATE WEB PAGES, MOBILE APPS AND AIR NOW. THE STATE WILL SUBMIT PM2.5 DATA (INCLUDING QA) QUARTERLY TO THE EPA AIR QUALITY SYSTEMS DATABASE, 90 DAYS AFTER THE REPORTING PERIOD. PM2.5 DATA TRENDS WILL BE EVALUATED AND IF ELEVATED CONCENTRATIONS ARE DISCOVERED, THEY WILL BE INVESTIGATED.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE OPERATION OF REAL TIME PARTICULATE MATTER AIR MONITORING PROGRAM THAT MEETS STATES NEEDS AND FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS, BY COLLECTING VALID DATA AS IDENTIFIED IN THE ANNUAL NETWORK PLAN.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF UTAH.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE WYOMING DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY.  THE FUNDS ARE TO USED FOR ELIGIBLE ACTIVITIES UNDER CLEAN AIR ACT SECTION 103. THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE PURCHASE OF EQUIPMENT TO CONDUCT AND QUANTIFY APPROACHES FOR THE CONTROL OF AIR POLLUTION, INCLUDING PARTICULATE MATTER AND GREENHOUSE GASES. IN ADDITION, ALLOWING THE STATE TO USE NEW TECHNOLOGY AND APPROACHES FOR THE CONTROL OF AIR POLLUTION.

SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PURCHASE EQUIPMENT FOR A PORTABLE GAS DETECTION CAMERA AND SENSING DEVICES FOR USE THROUGHOUT THE STATE.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE PURCHASE OF EQUIPMENT TO CONDUCT, QUANTIFY THE CAUSES, EFFECTS, EXTENT AND PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF AIR POLLUTION. THE EQUIPMENT WILL BE USED FOR THE DETECTION OF GREENHOUSE GASES, INCLUDING METHANE, ALONG WITH PARTICULATE MATTER, WITHIN THE STATE'S EXISTING AIR MONITORING PROGRAM.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING THE PORTABLE GAS DETECTION CAMERA AND SENSING DEVICES..

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IDENTIFICATION OF AREAS EXPERIENCING AIR QUALITY ISSUES WHERE DATA HAS BEEN PREVIOUSLY UNAVAILABLE AND INFORMED POLICY MAKING. 

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF WYOMING.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO CONDUCT AIR MONITORING IN PUEBLO, COLORADO, TARGETING A DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED COMMUNITY. 

SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL EMPLOY COMMUNITY LEVEL MONITORING THAT WILL PROVIDE REAL-TIME HIGH-QUALITY AIR MONITORING DATA WHILE INVOLVING THE COMMUNITY IN A CITIZEN SCIENCE CAPACITY.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE DEPLOYMENT OF A SINGLE STATION THAT WILL HOUSE ONE DESIGNATED FEDERAL EQUIVALENT METHOD (FEM) MONITOR AND SEVERAL SATELLITE MONITORS PLACED IN DIFFERENT LOCATIONS THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY. THE SATELLITE MONITORS WILL CONTAIN SENSOR-BASED TECHNOLOGY TO PROVIDE LOW-COST ANALYSIS OF AIR POLLUTANTS TO COMPARE DIRECTLY WITH STATION MONITORS. INITIALLY, THE STATION WILL MEASURE FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5), OXIDES OF NITROGEN AND BASIC METEOROLOGY. SPACE WILL BE AVAILABLE TO INCLUDE NEW TECHNOLOGIES AND MAY INCLUDE MEASURE OF VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS (VOCS). DATA WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE STATE, THE COMMUNITY AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS IN AS NEAR REAL TIME AS IS REASONABLE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE DEPLOYMENT AND OPERATION OF AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT. ENGAGEMENT OF THE COMMUNITY FOR THE PROPER SELECTION OF LOCATION FOR THE MONITORS. UPLOADING OF DATA IN REAL-TIME TO A PUBLIC-FACING WEBSITE THAT USES DIGITAL ACCESSIBILITY BEST PRACTICES AND IS AVAILABLE IN BOTH ENGLISH AND SPANISH.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE COLLECTION OF ONE YEAR OF AIR MONITORING DATE FOR PM2.5, NITROGEN DIOXIDE, TOTAL VOCS AND OTHER SPECIATED VOCS IN A DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED COMMUNITY TO EVALUATE POTENTIAL HEALTH CONCERNS AND TO EVALUATE A STATION-SATELLITE PROOF OF CONCEPT APPROACH.   IN ADDITION, INCREASED TRUST AND COLLABORATION BETWEEN THE STATE AND DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED COMMUNITY IN PUEBLO, COLORADO AND INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND ENGAGEMENT WITH AI QUALITY INFORMATION, HEALTH INFORMATION AND RELATED RESOURCES. 

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF PUEBLO, COLORADO.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. JEFFERSON COUNTY PUBLIC HEALTH WILL CREATE LOCAL CAPACITY FOR UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES IN JEFFERSON COUNTY TO MONITOR AND ADDRESS THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY.  THEY WILL MONITOR FOR FINE PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 MICRONS IN DIAMETER OR SMALLER (PM2.5). THEY WILL PARTNER WITH JEFFERSON COUNTY PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO REPLICATE AND EXPAND ON DENVER DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT'S HIGHLY SUCCESSFUL LOVE MY AIR PROGRAM. THE PROGRAM WILL PLACE LOW-COST, HIGH-QUALITY MONITORING EQUIPMENT AT PARTNER SITES, PROVIDING REAL-TIME, PARTICULATE MATTER MEASUREMENTS ON EASY TO UNDERSTAND, PUBLIC-FACING DASHBOARDS. JEFFERSON COUNTY WILL SUPPORT PARTNER GRASSROOTS OUTREACH AND EDUCATION EFFORTS. DATA WILL BE SHARED WITH COUNTY AND STATE ORGANIZATIONS THAT PROVIDE HEALTH ADVOCACY, RESEARCH AND REPORTING TO THE COMMUNITY.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND.

SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL USE LOW-COST AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT TO MONITOR PM2.5 IN JEFFERSON COUNTY. THEY WILL IDENTIFY HOST SITE PARTNERS, PARTICIPATE IN TRAINING ON THE USE OF THE MONITORING SENSORS, INSTALL MONITORING EQUIPMENT AND THE DATA INTERFACE, ENGAGE IN OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ACTIVITIES, CREATE AND DISTRIBUTE QUARTERLY DATA SUMMARIES. THE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO EXPAND THE OUTREACH OF THE PROGRAM BY ADDING OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS AS PARTNERS, INCLUDING SUSTAINABLE NEIGHBORHOODS AND PUBLIC LIBRARIES. THEY INTEND TO FORM A SENSOR HOST COMMITTEE TO ENSURE AN INCLUSIVE AND COLLABORATIVE PROCESS. THEY WILL HOLD COMMUNITY-WIDE TRAINING TO THE HOST SITE COMMUNITIES TO INCREASE THE COMMUNITIES CAPACITY TO ADDRESS AIR POLLUTION LOCALLY.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE SELECTION OF HOST SITES AND THE DEPLOYMENT OF LOW-COST AIR MONITORING SENSORS THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY. THE DATA OBTAINED WILL BE AGGREGATED AND ANALYZED AND FINDINGS WILL BE SHARED WITH THE HOST SITES ON A QUARTERLY BASIS. THIS DATA WILL ALSO BE SHARED WITH COMMUNITY MONITORING ADVISORY GROUPS. RESULTS WILL BE SHARED WITH THE JEFFERSON COUNTY SUSTAINABILITY COMMISSION FOR PURPOSES OF SUPPORTING THE AIR QUALITY PORTION OF THE COUNTY CLIMATE ACTION PLAN. THE COUNTY WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND GUIDANCE TO HOST SITES.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE ABOUT LOCAL AIR QUALITY AND HEALTH BEHAVIOR CHANGES. INCREASED COLLABORATION WITH PROJECT PARTNERS AND AN INCREASED COMMUNITY VOICE IN AIR QUALITY TOPICS AT A LOCAL AND REGIONAL LEVEL. LONG TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE REDUCED EXPOSURE TO AIR POLLUTANTS AND IMPROVED PUBLIC HEALTH OUTCOMES. 

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE RESIDENTS OF JEFFERSON COUNTY, COLORADO.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THIS GRANT FOCUSES ON THE INCREASING DURATION AND SEVERITY OF WILDFIRES AND THE RISING NUMBER OF SMOKE-IMPACTED DAYS. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IMPROVE MONTANA'S STATEWIDE MONITORING NETWORK OF PARTICULATE MATTER WITH A DIAMETER OF LESS THAN 2.5 MICROMETERS (PM2.5) THROUGH THE INSTALLATION OF ADDITIONAL AIR MONITORING STATIONS AND SENSORS IN KEY LOCATIONS. THE LOCATION OF THESE SENSORS WILL INCLUDE COMMUNITIES WHERE AIR QUALITY INFORMATION IS NOT CURRENTLY AVAILABLE. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. 

SPECIFICALLY, THE AWARDED FUNDS WILL BE USED TO EXPAND MONTANA'S EXISTING STATEWIDE AIR MONITORING NETWORK WITH AN EMPHASIS ON INCREASING COVERAGE FOR UNDER-REPRESENTED AND VULNERABLE POPULATIONS; FOSTER LASTING PARTNERSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS WHILE WORKING TO ESTABLISH NEW PARTNERSHIPS, AND ENHANCE COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION; INCREASE COMMUNITY AIR QUALITY AWARENESS AND CREATE RESOURCES AND TOOLS THAT ENABLE INTERESTED INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS TO USE LOW-COST AIR QUALITY SENSORS IN SUPPORT OF CITIZEN SCIENCE. 

TO DO SO, MONTANA DEQ WILL DEPLOY 183 ADDITIONAL SENSORS AND MONITORS ACROSS MONTANA. 164 LOCATIONS WILL BE PROVIDED PURPLEAIR SENSORS WHICH WILL BE USED FOR OUTREACH AND EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. FROM THERE, THE SENSORS WILL MONITOR AMBIENT AIR QUALITY AND WILL BE RECORDED STATE-WIDE. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE INTERMEDIATE OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE: MONTANA HIGH SCHOOL ASSOCIATION (MHSA) WILL TAKE ACTION TO ADJUST SPORTING EVENTS AND PRACTICES AT HIGH SCHOOLS DEPENDING ON AIR QUALITY THAT DAY, IT WILL INSPIRE CITIZEN ACTION TO MITIGATE EXPOSURE, IT WILL INFORM POLICY AND DECISION-MAKING BY DEQ, THE ADDITIONAL MONITORING DATA WILL INFORM THE TIMING OF PRESCRIBED BURNING, AND MORE OF MONTANA'S STUDENTS WILL BE INSPIRED TO PURSUE SCIENTIFIC CAREERS. 

THE LONG-TERM OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE: REDUCED HEALTH IMPACTS FROM LOCALIZED EXPOSURE TO SMOKE AND PM2.5, IT WILL PROVIDE THE IDENTIFICATION OF AREAS WITH LOCALIZED AIR QUALITY ISSUES AND EVENTS WHERE DATA WAS PREVIOUSLY UNAVAILABLE, AND IT WILL MAINTAIN A ROBUST NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARD (NAAQS) - COMPLIANT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING NETWORK THAT ALSO ACHIEVES THE GOALS OF BEING COMMUNITY-FOCUSED, SMOKE-READY, HEALTH-IMPACT DRIVEN, AND BUILDABLE FOR THE FUTURE. 

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE CITIZENS OF MONTANA WHERE THIS WORK WILL BE CONDUCTED.

THE LITTLE RIVER BAND OF OTTAWA INDIANS (LRBOI) WILL COLLECT AND ANALYZE PARTICULATE MATTER AND OZONE DATA USED TO ASSESS THE EFFECTIVENESS OF POLLUTION CONTROL PROGRAMS AND POLLUTANT TRANSPORT ACROSS LAKE MICHIGAN. OTHER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE MANAGING THE AIR QUALITY PROGRAM, TITLE V PERMIT REVIEW, TRAINING, EDUCATION AND OUTREACH, PARTICIPATION IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL WORKGROUPS, INDOOR AIR QUALITY SUPPLIES, EMISSIONS INVENTORIES UPDATES, NATIONAL EMISSIONS INVENTORIES REVIEW WITH THE INSTITUTE FOR TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONALS, AND PEP/NPAP AUDITS AS WELL AS UPDATING THE TRIBAL RESERVATION AREA SPECIFIC EMISSION INVENTORIES, AND REVIEW AND REVISING THE INDOOR AIR QUALITY MONITORING PROGRAM.

THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (WDNR) WILL OPERATE AN AIR TOXICS MONITORING SITE IN HORICON, WISCONSIN AS PART OF THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS STATION (NATTS) MONITORING NETWORK.  THE PROJECT INCLUDES THE COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS OF SAMPLES TO DETERMINE AIR TOXICS LEVELS IN THE HORICON AREA. WDNR WILL USE THIS INFORMATION TO DETECT CONCENTRATION CHANGES AND DEFINE BACKGROUND CONCENTRATION LEVELS FOR POLLUTANTS.

THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (WDNR) WILL CONTINUE TO OPERATE AN AIR TOXICS MONITORING SITE IN HORICON, WISCONSIN AS PART OF THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS SYSTEM (NATTS) MONITORING NETWORK.  THE PROJECT INCLUDES THE COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS OF SAMPLES TO DETERMINE AIR TOXICS LEVELS IN THE HORICON AREA. WDNR WILL USE THIS INFORMATION TO DETECT CONCENTRATION CHANGES AND DEFINE BACKGROUND CONCENTRATION LEVELS FOR POLLUTANTS.

THE ILLINOIS ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (IEPA) WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TREND STATION (NATTS) PROGRAM THROUGH OPERATION OF AN AIR MONITORING SITE IN NORTHBROOK, ILLINOIS.  IEPA WILL COLLECT SAMPLES AT THE SITE AND PERFORM ANALYSIS ON THE SAMPLES TO DETERMINE AIR TOXICS LEVELS.  GOALS OF THE PROJECT ARE TO CHARACTERIZE THE AIR TOXICS PROBLEM AND PROVIDE QUALITY ASSURED DATA FOR RISK CHARACTERIZATION.

THE ILLINOIS ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (IEPA) WILL CONTINUE TO PARTICIPATE IN THE NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TREND SYSTEM NETWORK BY OPERATING AN AIR TOXICS MONITORING SITE AT THE NORTHBROOK WATER TREATMENT PLANT.  IEPA WILL COLLECT SAMPLES AT THE SITE AND PERFORM ANALYSIS ON THE SAMPLES TO DETERMINE AIR TOXICS LEVELS.  THE ULTIMATE GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO FACILITATE AIR TOXICS EMISSIONS AND RISK REDUCTIONS.

DESCRIPTION:WITH THESE FUNDS, MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT, GREAT LAKES, AND ENERGY (MEGLE) WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR FOR HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS (HAPS) THAT ARE ASSOCIATED WITH A WIDE VARIETY OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS. USING THE COLLECTED DATA, THEY WILL TRACK TRENDS OF EMISSIONS IN POPULATED AREAS. MEGLE WILL CONTINUE TO PURSUE OPTIONS TO REDUCE EMISSIONS AND RISK TO THE PUBLIC. ACTIVITIES:MEGLE WILL USE THE FUNDS FROM THE NATTS AWARD TO PROVIDE MAINTENANCE ON THE CONTINUOUS AIR MONITORS AND COLLECT DATA TO DETERMINE AIR TOXIC TRENDS THAT WILL BE VITAL TO EMISSION AND RISK REDUCTION. THE DATA COLLECTION WILL INVOLVE RISK CHARACTERIZATION, AS WELL AS IMPROVING EMISSION INVENTORIES AND MODEL PERFORMANCE. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:MEGLE WILL USE THE COLLECTED DATA IN EMISSIONS MODELING THAT WILL BE USED TO BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS OF DEARBORN AND THEIR WELL-BEING. MEGLE WILL ALSO BENEFIT BY EXPANDING THEIR KNOWLEDGE OF HAP EMISSIONS AND CREATING MORE CONCISE RISK TRENDS.

THE MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT, GREAT LAKES, AND ENERGY (MI DEGLE) WILL CONTINUE TO OPERATE A NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS STATION (NATTS) SITE COLLECTING QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR TOXICS MEASUREMENTS AT THE DEARBORN, MICHIGAN SITE. MI DEGLE WILL COLLECT SELECTED HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS DATA AND SUBMIT THE DATA TO THE NATIONAL AIR QUALITY SYSTEM DATABASE.   .

THE MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (MDEQ) WILL OPERATE A NATIONAL AIR TOXICS TRENDS STATION (NATTS) SITE FOR COLLECTING QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR TOXICS MEASUREMENTS AT THE DEARBORN, MICHIGAN SITE. MDEQ WILL COLLECT SELECTED HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS DATA AND SUBMIT THE DATA TO THE NATIONAL AIR QUALITY SYSTEM DATABASE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO REGIONAL AIR POLLUTION CONTROL AGENCY (RAPCA). THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT RAPCA'S MONITORING PROGRAM. SPECIFICALLY, RAPCA WILL UTILIZE THE FUNDS FOR PERSONNEL COSTS AND TO PURCHASE A PIECE OF MONITORING EQUIPMENT. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE FUNDING SUPERVISOR WHO WILL OVERSEE STAFF MEMBERS RESPONSIBLE FOR DATA REVIEW, REPORTING, AND PURCHASING REQUESTS. AN EQUIPMENT SPECIALIST WILL ALSO BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH THIS GRANT. THE SPECIALIST WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR PERFORMING AIR MONITORING, REPAIRING EQUIPMENT, AND DATA REVIEW. ADDITIONALLY, A HANDHELD  VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUND (VOC) MONITOR WILL BE PURCHASED TO BE USED DURING FACILITY INSPECTIONS AND COMPLAINTS INVESTIGATIONS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE MONITORING DATA AND A VOC HANDHELD MONITOR. A  QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN (QAPP) WILL BE DEVELOPED AS NEEDED. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE DATA REPORTS FROM THE RESULTS OF AIR MONITORING. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF THE AREA AROUND DAYTON AND MONTGOMERY COUNTIES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (WDNR). THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO COORDINATE IRA RELATED WORK INCLUDING AIR SENSOR RESEARCH, POLICY AND DATA ANALYSIS, AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE HIRING A STAFF-LEVEL POLICY ADVISOR TO COORDINATE IRA FUNCTIONS; RESEARCHING NEW AIR SENSOR TECHNOLOGY; IMPLEMENTING TRANSLATION SERVICES FOR MEANINGFUL ENGAGEMENT WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITH LIMITED ENGLISH PROFICIENCY; AND DIGITIZING PAPER RECORDS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PLANNING AND PREPARATION FOR IRA PROGRAMS; PROCUREMENT AND INSTALLATION OF AIR SENSORS TO IMPROVE UNDERSTANDING OF CUMULATIVE HEALTH IMPACTS IN DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES IN MILWAUKEE, WI; PROCUREMENT OF TRANSLATION SERVICES FOR PUBLIC MEETINGS, NOTICES AND SUMMARY DOCUMENTS; AND COLLECTING, CONSOLIDATING AND DIGITIZING HISTORICAL DOCUMENTS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVED COORDINATION ACROSS THE WDNR AIR PROGRAM FOR IRA-RELATED ACTIVITIES; GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF PERFORMANCE OF QUANTQA SENSORS AND EXTENT OF POLLUTION ON DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES IN MILWAUKEE, WI; TIMELY TRANSLATION OF PUBLIC NOTICES AND DOCUMENTS; AND INCREASED TRANSPARENCY. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF WISCONSIN.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE LEECH LAKE BAND OF OJIBWE.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IS TO DEVELOP A GREENHOUSE GAS (GHG) INVENTORY/UPDATED EMISSIONS INVENTORY FOR THE GEOGRAPHIC AREA BOTH WITHIN AND AROUND THE EXTERIOR BOUNDARIES OF THE LEECH LAKE RESERVATION.  SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COORDINATE WITH AIR RESOURCES SPECIALISTS, INC., TO OBTAIN TRAINING AND ASSISTANCE IN THE HANDLING OF TRIBAL DATASETS AND OVERALL INVENTORY DEVELOPMENT.  HAVING A COMPLETE GHG WILL ALSO HELP IDENTIFY REDUCTION OPPORTUNITIES AND FORMULATE REDUCTION STRATEGIES ON THE RESERVATION, WHILE FACILITATING PLANNING AND PREPARATION FOR IMPLEMENTING OTHER IRA PROVISIONS.    
ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COORDINATING WITH AIR RESOURCES SPECIALISTS, INC., ON TRAINING TO DEVELOP A QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN (QAPP) AND STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES FOR HANDLING SOURCE AND TRIBAL DATA SETS AND MAKING THE NECESSARY CALCULATIONS TO DEVELOP A GREENHOUSE GAS (GHG) INVENTORY/UPDATED EMISSIONS INVENTORY FOR THE GEOGRAPHIC AREA BOTH WITHIN AND AROUND THE EXTERIOR BOUNDARIES OF THE LEECH LAKE RESERVATION.  THE RESULTS OF THESE CALCULATIONS AND THE RESULTING GHG/UPDATED EMISSIONS INVENTORY WILL BE USED TO ESTIMATE THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN AREA SOURCES AND THEIR EFFECTS ON AMBIENT AIR QUALITY IMPACTS IN THE LEECH LAKE RESERVATION AIRSHED, WHICH WILL ALSO INFORM DECISION-MAKING FOR FUTURE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT AND CLIMATE POLLUTION REDUCTION GRANT OPPORTUNITIES.  THESE DATA WILL ALSO FACILITATE BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF CUMULATIVE HEALTH IMPACTS OF THESE POLLUTANTS IN DISADVANTAGED/ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES AND ENABLE THE TRIBE TO PROVIDE IMPACTFUL COMMENTS ON STATE AND FEDERAL AIR PERMITS AND RELATED POLICIES.       SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE LEECH LAKE ENVIRONMENTAL DEPARTMENT STAFF TRAINED IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLANS AND RELATED COMPUTATIONS FOR GENERATING GREENHOUSE GAS (GHG)/EMISSIONS INVENTORIES (EI), AND A COMPLETED GHG AND UPDATED EI FOR THE LEECH LAKE RESERVATION.  THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE BETTER TRIBAL UNDERSTANDING OF THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN AREA SOURCES AND THEIR EFFECTS ON AMBIENT AIR QUALITY IN THE RESERVATION AIRSHED, INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF THE CUMULATIVE HEALTH IMPACTS OF THESE POLLUTANTS, AND INFORMED DECISION-MAKING FOR FUTURE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT AND CLIMATE POLLUTION REDUCTION GRANT OPPORTUNITIES.  THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE DISADVANTAGED/ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES AND RESIDENTS OF THE LEECH LAKE RESERVATION.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE MINNESOTA POLLUTION CONTROL AGENCY (MPCA).  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO BUILD A NEW DATABASE AND WEB PORTAL TO HOST HISTORICAL AIR QUALITY INFORMATION AND DISPLAY NEAR REAL-TIME AIR QUALITY OBSERVATIONS FROM NON-REGULATORY AIR QUALITY SENSORS.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT OF THE AIR SENSOR DATABASE AND WEB PORTAL WITH INPUT AND MAINTENANCE UP-KEEP FROM MINNESOTA INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY (MNIT).SUBRECIPIENT:THE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO ISSUE SUBAWARD AGREEMENTS TO ITS PARTNERS IN COMPLIANCE WITH APPENDIX A OF EPA'S SUBAWARD POLICY. OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE IMPROVED DECISION-MAKING BASED OFF OF RESEARCH AND ANALYSIS OF THE SPATIAL AND TEMPORAL SPECS OF NEW AIR QUALITY OBSERVATIONS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE HOSTING HISTORICAL AIR QUALITY INFORMATION AND IDENTIFYING PREVIOUSLY UNKNOWN AREAS OF POOR AIR QUALITY. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS WITHIN THE STATE OF MINNESOTA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT, GREAT LAKES, AND ENERGY (MEGLE).  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO RESEARCH AND MODEL VARIOUS AIR POLLUTANTS AROUND MICHIGAN, WITH SPECIAL ATTENTION TO INDUSTRIAL FACILITIES AND LOW-INCOME AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES.  ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE APPLYING A PREVIOUSLY DEVELOPED GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEM (GIS) TO SHOW INDUSTRIAL FACILITIES VISUALLY AND 3 DIMENSIONALLY, THEIR EMISSION SOURCES, EMISSIONS DATA, AND PERMIT INFORMATION. THERE WILL ALSO BE A CONTINUATION OF ANALYSIS OF DATA COLLECTED DURING THE MICHIGAN-ONTARIO OZONE SOURCE EXPERIMENT (MOOSE) TO ACCELERATE STUDIES ON CAUSES, EFFECTS, EXTENT, PREVENTION, AND CONTROL OF AIR POLLUTION. THE GRANTEE WILL MODEL, INVESTIGATE, SAMPLE AND DEVELOP RESOURCES ON AIR POLLUTION FOR VARIOUS SPECIFIC POLLUTANTS SUCH AS PM2.5, ALDEHYDES, METHANE, CARBONYLS, AND VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS. LASTLY, THEY WILL BE ESTABLISHING A NEW AIR MONITORING SITE IN AN EJ COMMUNITY IN NORTH DETROIT.SUBRECIPIENT:MEGLE WILL BE AWARDING SUBAWARDS TO MICHIGAN STATE UNIVERSITY TO ASSIST WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE PILOT GIS SYSTEM TO VISUALLY AND THREE DIMENSIONALLY SHOW EMISSIONS IN INDUSTRIAL AREAS, MODELING OF AIR POLLUTION FROM LOCAL INDUSTRIAL SITES, AND INVESTIGATING METHODS FOR THE CONTROL OF OZONE PRECURSORS, AIR TOXICS, AND GREENHOUSE GASES. OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE FOUR SEMI-ANNUAL REPORTS, INCLUDING A FINAL PROJECT REPORT, STRATEGIES TO ACHIEVE OZONE ATTAINMENT, MITIGATE CLIMATE CHANGE, AND REDUCE AIR TOXICS EXPOSURE IN SOUTHEAST MICHIGAN. DATA WILL BE REVIEWED, VALIDATED, AND REPORTED TO THE EPA'S AIR QUALITY SYSTEM DATABASE ON THE SAME QUARTERLY SCHEDULE AS THE CRITERIA POLLUTANT DATA.
THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVED ACCESS TO INDUSTRIAL FACILITY INFORMATION FOR AIR QUALITY DIVISION STAFF AND THE PUBLIC, UTILIZE COLLECTED DATA TO FURTHER EVALUATE CONTROL STRATEGIES FOR THE PURPOSES OF FUTURE STATE IMPLEMENTATION PLAN (SIP) DEVELOPMENT, IMPROVED DECISION-MAKING BASED ON INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF POLLUTION SOURCES AND EMISSIONS INVENTORIES, IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF AIR TOXICS, OZONE, AND PM2.5, EVALUATE POTENTIAL HEALTH IMPACTS, AND INCREASE EFFECTIVENESS OF PLANNING TO MEET THE NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS.
THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE ENTIRETY OF THE POPULATION OF THE STATE OF MICHIGAN WITH SPECIFIC TARGETS TOWARD EJ COMMUNITIES IN DETROIT, MI.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS INFLATION REDUCTION ACT FUNDED GRANT IS TO ALLOW THE INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (IDEM) TO UPGRADE SEVERAL AREAS OF MONITORING AND FIELD INSPECTIONS WITH NEW EQUIPMENT.  FUNDS FROM THIS GRANT WILL ALSO BE USED TO CONTINUE ONGOING OPERATIONS BY CONTRIBUTING TO THE SALARIES OF KEY PERSONNEL. TAKEN TOGETHER, THESE UPGRADES AND STAFFING COMPENSATION WILL ALLOW IDEM TO BROADLY IMPROVE ITS AIR PROGRAM AND PROVIDE GREATER SERVICE TO THE STATE OF INDIANA.ACTIVITIES:THIS AWARD WILL FOCUS ON PROJECTS IN THREE MAIN AREAS: AIR TOXICS ANALYSIS, FIELD DATA COLLECTION, AND SOURCE INSPECTIONS. FOR AIR TOXICS, IDEM WILL PURCHASE A NEW GAS CHROMATOGRAPH/MASS SPECTROMETER TO MEASURE VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS AND HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS. FOR FIELD DATA COLLECTION, IDEM WILL REPLACE TWO FIELD DATA LOGGERS AND UPGRADE LAPTOPS FOR FIELD STAFF. FOR SOURCE INSPECTIONS, IDEM WILL PURCHASE A GAS DETECTION CAMERA TO IMPROVE COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES OF THIS AWARD ARE UPDATES TO IDEM'S AIR TOXICS ANALYSIS, FIELD DATA COLLECTION, AND SOURCE INSPECTIONS, ALONG WITH SECURING KEY PERSONNEL COMPENSATION, WHICH WILL IMPROVE IDEM'S AIR PROGRAM EFFECTIVENESS AND CAPACITY. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE IDEM AND THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF INDIANA.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE THE COOK COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND SUSTAINABILITY'S (CCDES) ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.   ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS. SPECIFICALLY, CCDES WILL ACQUIRE SIX T640 MONITORS, ONE T640X MONITOR, AND THREE T703 MONITORS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITORS TO REPLACE FILTER-BASED MONITORS, QUARTERLY REPORTS AND A FINAL REPORT SUBMITTED TO THE EPA. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS, WHICH WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS, AND OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS OF COOK COUNTY, ILLINOIS, WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY ARP SELECTED GRANT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.  THE RED LAKE BAND OF CHIPPEWA WILL PURCHASE, INSTALL, AND BEGIN OPERATING AN OZONE MONITOR ON THE RED LAKE RESERVATION, FILLING A GAP IN MONITORING THAT EXISTS IN THE REGION.  THIS MONITORING WILL PRODUCE NEAR REAL-TIME OZONE AIR QUALITY INDEX DATA, WHICH WILL BE UTILIZED TO PROVIDE AIR QUALITY S TO THE RED LAKE NATION AND OTHERS VIA AIRNOW.GOV, SMOGWATCH.COM, AND ENVIROFLASH.INFO.  THIS PROJECT WILL STRENGTHEN TRIBAL-STATE RELATIONSHIPS, INCREASE AWARENESS OF GROUND-LEVEL OZONE IN THE ENVIRONMENT, AND REDUCE HUMAN EXPOSURE TO OZONE RESULTING IN IMPROVED RESPIRATORY HEALTH.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND.  SPECIFICALLY, BY OPERATING A REGULATORY OZONE MONITOR AT THIS LOCATION, THE RED LAKE BAND WILL IMPROVE MODELING AND FORECASTING OF OZONE LEVELS AND REPORTING FOR THE AIR QUALITY INDEX IN THE REGION.  THIS WILL ALLOW THE TRIBE AND THE STATE TO BETTER COMMUNICATE POLLUTION AND RELATED RISKS TO THE CITIZENS OF THE RED LAKE NATION AND MINNESOTA.  THIS PROJECT OFFERS BOTH THE TRIBE AND MINNESOTA POLLUTION CONTROL AGENCY AN OPPORTUNITY TO COLLABORATE AND EXTEND THEIR REACH AND IMPACT AND EDUCATE CONCERNED RESIDENTS ABOUT THE DATA COLLECTED AND OPPORTUNITIES TO IMPROVE AIR QUALITY AND HEALTH.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE NEAR REAL-TIME OZONE MONITORING DATA AND AIR QUALITY INDEX (AQI) S AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC, ACCESSED VIA AIRNOW.GOV, SMOGWATCH.COM, AND ENVIROFLASH.INFO.  ADDITIONALLY, A SUMMARY OF DATA WILL BE PROVIDED IN THE RED LAKE DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES NEWSLETTER TO ENSURE EVERYONE IN THE COMMUNITY HAS ACCESS TO THESE DATA.  THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO IMPROVE AQI DATA/MAPS BY FILLING EXISTING DATA GAPS AND WILL IMPROVE THE REGIONAL OZONE NETWORK ALLOWING FOR MORE ACCURATE MODELING, FORECASTING, AND AIR QUALITY S.  THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT ARE STRENGTHENED TRIBAL RELATIONSHIP/INVOLVEMENT WITH THE MINNESOTA POLLUTION CONTROL AGENCY; INCREASED AWARENESS OF OZONE IN THE ENVIRONMENT AND POTENTIAL HEALTH EFFECTS; AND A REDUCTION OF HUMAN EXPOSURE TO OZONE RESULTING IN IMPROVED RESPIRATORY HEALTH.  THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL AND NON-TRIBAL RESIDENTS OF RED LAKE, MINNESOTA.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE HISPANIC ACCESS FOUNDATION (HAF) WILL COLLABORATE WITH PROJECT PARTNERS TO MEASURE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5) AT 12 HEAVILY POPULATED LATINO SITES ACROSS THE COUNTRY. ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES. BY USING A CITIZEN SCIENCE APPROACH, THE ACTIVITIES WILL GIVE COMMUNITIES A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, HAF WILL: 1) MEASURE AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF PM2.5, AND 2) ENGAGE, EDUCATE, AND INFORM CONCERNED CITIZENS ABOUT THE DATA COLLECTED, PROVIDING THEM THE INFORMATION NEEDED TO ADJUST THEIR DAILY LIVES.SUBRECIPIENT:ACTIVITIES IMPLEMENTED THROUGH SUBAWARDS INCLUDE: 1) SETTING UP THE SENSORS; 2) CONNECTING THE SENSORS TO THE MAP AND DISSEMINATING THE URL; 3) COLLECTING DATA ONCE OR TWICE PER MONTH; AND 4) REACHING OUT TO LOCAL GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS TO NOTIFY THEM OF TRENDS IN AIR QUALITY.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: 1) INSTALLATION OF PM2.5 SENSORS; 2) NEAR REAL-TIME AVAILABILITY OF PM2.5 DATA; 3) BILINGUAL POSTING OF TRENDS IN PM2.5 POLLUTION ON HAF'S WEBSITE; AND 4) DELIVERY OF AIR QUALITY PUBLIC EDUCATION TO LATINO COMMUNITIES. 

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: 1) INCREASED LATINO COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF PM2.5 LEVELS; 2) INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF THE NEGATIVE EFFECTS OF PM2.5 IN LATINO COMMUNITIES; AND 3) CHANGES IN BEHAVIORS AMONG LATINO COMMUNITIES.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE CITIZENS OF COMMUNITIES FOUND AT AND NEAR THE 12 SITES ACROSS THE COUNTRY, WHICH INCLUDE: BLUE ISLAND, IL; CALDWELL, ID; COMMERCE, CA; EL PASO, TX; INDIO, CA;, LA MIRADA, CA; LAS VEGAS, NV; PHARR, TX; SAN BERNARDINO, CA; SAN JACINTO, CA; THERMAL, CA; AND WESLACO, TX.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED GRANT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THIS PROJECT AIMS TO EXPAND GROUNDWORK OHIO RIVER VALLEY'S (GORV) CURRENT AIR QUALITY, EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND MONITORING PROGRAM FOR YOUTH EMPLOYEES AND NEIGHBORHOOD RESIDENTS ON AIR QUALITY MONITORING TECHNIQUES AND AIR POLLUTION HEALTH EDUCATION. THIS COMMUNITY-DRIVEN MONITORING PROJECT COMPILES NEIGHBORHOOD AND INDIVIDUAL-LEVEL AIR TOXIN EXPOSURE RATES AND USES THIS DATA TO ADVOCATE FOR MITIGATION EFFORTS. FUNDING FROM THIS GRANT WOULD EXPAND GROUNDWORK'S NEWLY ESTABLISHED AIR QUALITY MONITORING PROGRAM BY INVESTING IN THE TECHNOLOGY NECESSARY FOR EFFECTIVE AIR QUALITY MONITORING AND COMPENSATING COMMUNITY MEMBERS FOR THEIR TIME.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, GORV WILL DEPLOY AIR MONITORS AND TRAIN COMMUNITY MEMBERS ON THEIR USE, COLLECT AND EVALUATE 12 MONTHS OF AIR QUALITY DATA, THEN PRESENT THAT DATA TO THE COMMUNITY TO EDUCATE MEMBERS AND GENERATE BUY-IN FOR FUTURE GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE AND POLLUTION REDUCTION EFFORTS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE 50 RESIDENTS AND 320 GREEN TEAM EMPLOYEES BEING TRAINED ON AIR QUALITY MONITORING AND POLLUTION HEALTH HAZARDS, 12 MONTHS OF DATA EVALUATING RATES OF EXPOSURE IN RESIDENTIAL AREAS, A PUBLIC REPORT OF THE AIR POLLUTION FINDINGS OVER THE 12-MONTH STUDY, AND COMMUNITY WORKSHOPS TO EXPLAIN THE DATA. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED AWARENESS AND ENGAGEMENT FROM COMMUNITY MEMBERS ABOUT AIR POLLUTION, INCREASED BUY-IN FOR FUTURE POLLUTION REDUCTION PROJECTS, ESTABLISHMENT OF PROGRAMS TO ASSIST WITH POLLUTION MITIGATION, AND ADVOCATING FOR POLICY CHANGE. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS IN THE GREATER CINCINNATI, OHIO AREA.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY ARP SELECTED GRANT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE MINNEAPOLIS HEALTH DEPARTMENT (MHD) WILL COLLABORATE WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS FROM GREEN ZONES ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE NEIGHBORHOODS, COMMUNITY#8208;BASED ORGANIZATIONS, RESIDENTS, AND EDUCATORS TO: 1) MONITOR FOR EXPOSURES TO VOCS AND OTHER POLLUTANTS FROM INDUSTRIAL AND RESIDENTIAL ACTIVITIES AS WELL AS TRAFFIC, 2) DEVELOP AIR QUALITY CURRICULUM, OUTREACH MATERIALS, AND HANDS ON ACTIVITIES WITH AIR SENSORS AS WELL AS UNDERSTANDING AND INTERPRETING AIR SENSOR DATA, AND 3) INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF HYPER LOCAL AIR POLLUTION SOURCES AND STRATEGIES TO MITIGATE AIR POLLUTION IN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES.  ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, MHD WILL: 1) CHARACTERIZE AMBIENT AIR CONCENTRATIONS OF VOCS OF CONCERN USING A COMBINATION OF SENSOR TECHNOLOGY AS WELL AS PASSIVE SAMPLING METHODOLOGY USING SUMMA CANISTERS AND 2) ENGAGE AND EDUCATE CONCERNED RESIDENTS ABOUT THE DATA COLLECTED AND OPPORTUNITIES TO IMPROVE AIR QUALITY.  
SUBRECIPIENT:ACTIVITIES IMPLEMENTED THROUGH SUBAWARDS INCLUDE DEVELOPMENT OF EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT THROUGH MEETINGS. OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE MONTHLY OR BIMONTHLY MEETINGS WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS, COLLECTION OF SPECIATED VOCS FROM 30 SITES USING TO-15 SENSORS AND SUMMA CANISTERS, PUBLIC DISPLAY OF DATA ONLINE, SUBAWARDS TO COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS REGARDING AIR POLLUTION AND HEALTH RISKS, AND QUARTERLY REPORTS SUBMITTED TO THE EPA.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED AWARENESS AND KNOWLEDGE OF SENSORS FOR COMMUNITY SCIENCE, IDENTIFICATION OF HOT SPOTS AND POTENTIAL SOURCE CONTRIBUTIONS, AN INCREASE IN TRUST AND ACCOUNTABILITY THROUGH TRANSPARENT DATA SHARING AND AVAILABILITY, AGENCY FOR RESIDENTS AND COMMUNITY REGARDING LOCAL AIR QUALITY AND EXPOSURES TO AIR POLLUTION THAT IS OFTEN INACCESSIBLE, AND EDUCATING COMMUNITIES TO UNDERSTAND AND INTERPRET AIR QUALITY DATA.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES IN GREEN ZONES AND RESIDENTS OF MINNEAPOLIS, MINNESOTA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANTEE WILL CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. ASTHMA AND ALLERGY FOUNDATION OF AMERICA - MICHIGAN CHAPTER SEEKS TO REDUCE HEALTH DISPARITIES RELATED TO PM2.5 EXPOSURE IN AN OLDER ADULT MINORITY POPULATION THAT HAS EXPERIENCED GREATER COVID-19 PANDEMIC IMPACTS SUCH AS INCREASED RISK FOR COVID EXPOSURE AND DISEASE, AS WELL AS POORER HEALTH OUTCOMES DUE TO A COMPLEX INTERACTION OF FACTORS RELATED TO AGE AND RACE.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND.  EPA FUNDING WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE TWO SETS OF SENSORS; BOTH WILL PROVIDE READINGS OF PM2.5. EPA FUNDING WILL ALSO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES DESIGNED TO BETTER ENGAGE THE COMMUNITY DIRECTLY IN MONITORING THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY. COMMUNITY PARTICIPANTS AGES 60 AND OLDER WILL RECEIVE: A HOME SAFETY ASSESSMENT; PROVISION OF EVIDENCE-BASED PRODUCTS RELATED TO NEEDED INTERVENTIONS; CONNECTION TO OTHER AVAILABLE RESOURCES THAT PARTICIPANT AND/OR PARTICIPANT HOUSEHOLD MEMBERS MAY BENEFIT FROM/BE ELIGIBLE FOR; DETAILED MAPS/DIRECTORIES; EDUCATION, CONNECTION/COORDINATION ASSISTANCE AS NEEDED; AND ONGOING FOLLOW-UP.  SUBRECIPIENT: SUBAWARD COSTS TO WAYNE STATE UNIVERSITY ARE INCLUDED IN THIS AGREEMENT TO ASSIST COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITH MONITORING THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE IDENTIFICATION OF PM2.5 POLLUTANTS; 31 COMMUNITY MEMBERS ENGAGED AS CITIZEN SCIENTISTS; DEPLOYMENT OF OUTDOOR AND PERSONAL/INDOOR PM2.5 MONITORS; NEAR REAL-TIME PM2.5 DATA AVAILABLE ON PURPLEAIR PUBLICLY ACCESSIBLE MAPS; DEVELOPMENT OF DASHBOARD DATA INTERFACE AND PROGRESS REPORTS AND A FINAL REPORT.  BENEFICIARIES ARE THE COMMUNITY MEMBERS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED ARP FUNDED GRANT AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE MID-OHIO REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION (MORPC) THE ABILITY TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. MORPC WILL FOCUS ON UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES IMPACTED BY EMISSIONS FROM MOBILE AND STATIONARY SOURCES USING A PHOTOCHEMICAL MODEL TO INCLUDE METEOROLOGICAL AND EMISSION DATA AND IDENTIFY NEAR REAL-TIME PARTICLE POLLUTION LEVELS AND SOURCE APPORTIONMENT AT SELECTED COMMUNITY SITES. ACTIVITIES:MORCP WILL CHOOSE MONITORING SITES BASED ON MULTIPLE LEVELS OF SOCIAL AND HEALTH VULNERABILITY DATA, INCLUDING COVID-19 MORTALITY AND MORBIDITY DATA. RESULTING DATA FROM 18 MONTHS' WORTH OF AIR QUALITY MONITORING AND MODELING WILL BE USED BY MORPC AND FRANKLIN COUNTY PUBLIC HEALTH (FCPH) TO IDENTIFY AND UNDERSTAND THE DISTRIBUTION AND CAUSES OF PARTICULATE MATTER (PM) POLLUTION AND CREATE INTERVENTIONS BASED ON DISPROPORTIONATE IMPACTS AND SOURCE DRIVERS. THE INFORMATION GATHERED FROM THIS MODELING WILL BE SHARED WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES TO HELP GAIN FUTURE INTEREST AND BUY-IN ON PM POLLUTION RELATED ISSUES. THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND.
SUBRECIPIENT:FRANKLIN COUNTY PUBLIC HEALTH (FCPH) WILL BE THE SUB-AWARDEE AND SUPPORT COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT ALONG WITH OTHER CRITICAL PROJECT NEEDS, INCLUDING GATHERING AND PRESENTING HEALTH DATA, ENGAGING PARTNERS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS, PLANNING OUTREACH ACTIVITIES, SUPPORTING MONITOR PLACEMENT AND MAINTENANCE, AND INFORMING INITIATIVES TO ADDRESS DISPARITIES.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE DEPLOYMENT OF LOW-COST PM MONITORS IN/NEAR UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, ANALYSIS OF 18 MONTHS OF PM MONITORING DATA, FORMATION OF COMMUNITY ADVISORY BOARDS (CAB), INFORMING THE PUBLIC OF FINDINGS THROUGH DIGITAL AIR QUALITY SCREENS, AND THE DEVELOPMENT AND DISTRIBUTION OF EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE NEAR REAL-TIME AIR QUALITY DATA AVAILABILITY FOR COMMUNITIES AND STAKEHOLDERS, IDENTIFICATION OF AIR POLLUTION HOTSPOTS AND SPATIAL PATTERNS, A STRENGTHENED NETWORK OF PARTNERS ENGAGED IN AIR QUALITY AND PUBLIC HEALTH, INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF LOCAL AIR POLLUTION LEVELS, AND INCREASED COMMUNITY BUY-IN FOR FUTURE INITIATIVES RESULTING FROM THE PROJECT.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE COMMUNITIES IN AND ROUND FRANKLIN COUNTY, OHIO, INCLUSIVE OF THE CITY OF COLUMBUS AND SURROUNDING SUBURBAN COMMUNITIES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN (ARP) SELECTED AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE THE COMMUNITY LEVERAGED EXPANDED AIR NETWORK IN CLEVELAND (CLEANINCLE) THE ABILITY TO IMPLEMENT A PROJECT THAT WILL EXPAND CLEVELAND'S AIR MONITORING NETWORK INTO HISTORICALLY REDLINED CLEVELAND NEIGHBORHOODS THAT ARE EXPERIENCING NEGATIVE HEALTH OUTCOMES. COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE MEANINGFUL DESIGN OF AN EXPANDED AIR MONITORING NETWORK THROUGH PUBLIC FORUMS, THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A RESIDENT ADVISORY COMMITTEE, AND THROUGH A SERIES OF RESIDENTIAL INTERVIEWS. CLEVELAND DIVISION OF AIR QUALITY (CDAQ) WILL EXPAND CLEVELAND'S AMBIENT AIR MONITORING NETWORK IN NEIGHBORHOODS THAT ARE EXPERIENCING ADVERSE HEALTH OUTCOMES DUE TO AIR POLLUTION EXPOSURE. THESE COMMUNITIES PRESENT WITH POORER HEALTH OUTCOMES, INCLUDING DIABETES, HYPERTENSION AND PEDIATRIC ASTHMA, AND HAVE BEEN DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED BY COVID-19. ACTIVITIES:THE EXPANDED AIR MONITORING NETWORK WILL INCLUDE A FEDERAL EQUIVALENT METHOD (FEM) PARTICULATE MATTER MONITOR, AN AUTOMATED EQUIVALENT METHOD (AEM) OZONE ANALYZER, AND A NETWORK OF LOW-COST AIR QUALITY SENSORS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE AIR POLLUTION EXPOSURE RATES WITHIN THE CLEVELAND CRESCENT. IN ADDITION, CDAQ WILL DEPLOY 30 LOW-COST AIR SENSORS, COLLECT AND MAP 17 RESIDENT HEALTH NARRATIVES, ESTABLISH A RESIDENT ADVISORY COMMITTEE, SURVEY 100 MEDICAL PROVIDERS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND ASTHMA MANAGEMENT AND AIR POLLUTION CONCERNS, AND COORDINATE NINE PUBLIC FORUMS. THE QUALITATIVE AND QUANTITATIVE DATA OBTAINED IN THIS PROJECT WILL BE USED TO INFORM LOCAL MEDICAL PROVIDERS ON THE BARRIERS RESIDENTS ARE EXPERIENCING TO ASTHMA MANAGEMENT, WHICH WILL ENABLE THE DEVELOPMENT OF NEIGHBORHOOD SPECIFIC COMMUNICATIONS TO ASTHMA MANAGEMENT. SUBRECIPIENT:CLEVELAND NEIGHBORHOOD PROGRESS (CNP) - CNP WILL SERVE AS THE ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGER FOR THE RESIDENT ADVISORY COMMITTEE AND WILL OVERSEE LOGISTICAL COORDINATION OF THE PUBLIC FORUMS. CNP WILL SECURE SUPPORT SERVICES THAT REDUCE BARRIERS TO PUBLIC PARTICIPATION AT THE NEIGHBORHOOD FORUMS INCLUDING CHILDCARE, TRANSLATORS, AND TRANSCRIBERS. CNP WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR ADMINISTERING STIPENDS AND MANAGING OTHER ADMINISTRATIVE PROCESSES FOR THE MEMBERS OF THE RESIDENT ADVISORY BOARD.

CASE WESTERN RESERVE UNIVERSITY (CWRU) - CASE WESTERN RESERVE UNIVERSITY'S ROLE WILL BE A JOINT EFFORT BETWEEN THE INSTITUTE FOR SMART, SECURE AND CONNECTED CITIES (ISSACS) AND THE POPULATION AND QUANTITATIVE HEALTH SCIENCES DEPARTMENT (PQHS) GIS HEALTH AND HAZARDS LAB (GHH) IN THE SCHOOL OF MEDICINE (SOM).ISSACS FACULTY AND STAFF HAVE OVER A HALF A CENTURY OF COMBINED EXPERIENCE IN BUILDING, DEPLOYING AND MANAGING DATA COLLECTION NETWORKS FOR A WIDE RANGE OF USES. ISSACS PROVIDES DEEP EXPERIENCE IN THE DATA SENSING, COLLECTION, STORAGE, ANALYSIS AND VISUALIZATION PIPELINES THAT LEVERAGE EMBEDDED DEVICES, CLOUD SERVICES AND LOW POWER WIDE AREA NETWORKS (LPWAN) INCLUDING LORAWAN.

BETTER HEALTH PARTNERSHIP (BHP) - CDAQ IS CURRENTLY COLLABORATING WITH BETTER HEALTH PARTNERSHIP (BHP) TO DEVELOP A REFERRAL SERVICE FOR INDIVIDUALS DIAGNOSED WITH ASTHMA TO CDAQ'S INDOOR AIR QUALITY PROGRAM. THIS SERVICE WILL OFFER IN-HOME ASSESSMENTS AND EDUCATION FOR INDIVIDUALS DIAGNOSED WITH ASTHMA.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE A COMMUNITY DESIGNED EXPANDED AIR NETWORK, PUBLICLY AVAILABLE MONITORING DATA, AIR POLLUTION 'HOT SPOT MAPS', AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF A RESIDENT ADVISORY COMMITTEE.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IDENTIFICATION OF NEIGHBORHOODS WITH ELEVATED AIR POLLUTION LEVELS, INCREASED USE OF CDAQ SERVICES BY COMMUNITY MEMBERS, IMPROVED AIR QUALITY DATA ACCESS, IMPROVED ASTHMA CARE IN HIGH-RISK NEIGHBORHOODS, UTILIZATION OF COMMUNITY FORUMS FOR AIR QUALITY ISSUES, AND SPONSORED RESEARCH AND PUBLICATIONS.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CLEVELAND COMMUNITY THAT IS LOCALLY REFERRED TO AS THE 'CLEVELAND CRESCENT.' THE

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY ARP SELECTED AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE CANTON CITY PUBLIC HEALTH (CCPH) THE ABILITY TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. CCPH AND RESIDENTS WILL WORK TOGETHER TO IDENTIFY AND QUANTIFY POLLUTANTS IN THE COMMUNITIES CLOSEST TO A STEEL MANUFACTURER IN CANTON, OHIO. USING FEM (FEDERAL EQUIVALENT METHODS) TECHNOLOGY AND SENSORS, CONCENTRATIONS OF TARGET AIR POLLUTANTS WILL BE COLLECTED, ASSESSED, AND SHARED ON A ROUTINE AND FREQUENT BASIS. THIS PROJECT WILL FOSTER A RELATIONSHIP OF TRUST WITH THIS OVERBURDENED COMMUNITY.ACTIVITIES:THE TWO-YEAR STUDY WILL INVOLVE THE USE OF FEM AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT AND SMALLER, LESS COSTLY SENSORS THAT WOULD BE PLACED WITH COMMUNITY OPERATORS (COS) CHOSEN BY THE COMMUNITY. THE FEM EQUIPMENT WILL BE ADDED TO THE REPUBLIC STEEL COMMUNITY SITE AND WILL BE OPERATED AND MAINTAINED BY STAFF OF CCPH. SENSORS WILL MONITOR PM10, PM2.5, SO2, AND VOCS AND DATA WILL BE SHARED WITH THE COMMUNITY TO INFORM AND EDUCATE MEMBERS ABOUT POTENTIAL AIR POLLUTION. THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE IDENTIFICATION OF AIR POLLUTION IN THE AREA NEAR REPUBLIC STEEL, AIR QUALITY DATA BEING DISSEMINATED TO COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND INTERESTED STAKEHOLDERS, AND COMMUNITY MEETINGS TO EDUCATE PEOPLE ABOUT THE INFORMATION COLLECTED.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND TOOLS THAT INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF POLLUTANTS THAT MAY OR MAY NOT BE PRESENT IN THE COMMUNITY, THE COMMUNITY WILL HAVE ACCESS TO DATA TO MAKE EDUCATED DECISIONS ABOUT ALLEVIATING THE BURDENS OF LIVING NEAR THIS FACILITY, WHETHER IT'S BY LEGAL MEANS, RELOCATION, OR WAITING FOR ISSUES TO BE RESOLVED, AND DEPENDING ON THE COMPLIANCE OF THE DATA, OHIO EPA, LOCAL GOVERNMENT, AND/OR RESPONSIBLE PARTY MAY TAKE ACTION TO MITIGATE THE SOURCE OF POLLUTANTS.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS NEAR REPUBLIC STEEL.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO ENGAGE A WIDE VARIETY OF GREAT LAKES REGIONAL PARTNERS, SUCH AS CORPORATIONS, EDUCATIONAL COALITIONS, INDIVIDUAL EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND COMMUNITY CENTERS. PARTNERS WILL COLLABORATE TO MONITOR AND IMPROVE AIR QUALITY IN HIGHLY IMPACTED AND UNDER-RESOURCED NEIGHBORHOODS OF DETROIT, MI, AND THE CALUMET WATERSHED OF SOUTH CHICAGO, ILLINOIS. THIS WORK WILL EXPAND ON COMMUNITY CAPACITY TO MONITOR AIR QUALITY, QUANTIFY THE EFFECTS OF CORPORATE-IMPLEMENTED GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE AND OTHER NATURE-BASED SOLUTIONS ON LOCAL AIR QUALITY, AND ENGAGE HIGH SCHOOL AND COLLEGE STUDENTS IN DATA INTERPRETATION TO FACILITATE LONG TERM TRANSFER OF SKILLS FROM TECHNICAL PARTNERS TO INTERESTED RESIDENTS.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, WILDLIFE HABITAT COUNCIL WILL INSTALL AIR SENSORS TO MEASURE PM 2.5 AND PM 10 IN A VARIETY OF COMMUNITY CHOSEN SITES. THESE SITES WILL BE USED TO ENGAGE, TRAIN, AND EDUCATE COMMUNITY MEMBERS ON MONITORING AIR QUALITY. INFORMATION GATHERED FROM THESE SITES WILL BE DISSEMINATED TO HELP INFORM FUTURE GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS.
SUBRECIPIENT:1. ALKEBU-LAN VILLAGE - SUBAWARD FUNDS WILL ALLOW TO RE-START A AFTER-SCHOOL AIR QUALITY PROGRAM AS WELL AS FUND THEIR OPERATIONAL SUPPORT WITH THE LOGISTICS OF A COMMUNITY OUTREACH EVENTS BRINGING THE DATA TO RESIDENTS OF THEIR NEIGHBORHOOD.

2. CANFIELD CONSORTIUM - . SUBAWARD FUNDS WILL SUPPORT THE OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTS OF OUTREACH DELIVERY TO THEIR NEIGHBORHOOD.

3.SOUTHEAST MICHIGAN STEWARDSHIP COALITION - SUBAWARD FUNDS WILL FACILITATE THE DEPLOYMENT OF SEMIS EXPERTISE IN WEAVING THE SENSOR INSTALLATION AND MONITORING PROCESS INTO THEIR ANNUAL TEACHER LEARNING SERIES TO ALLOW STUDENTS ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION TO ACCESS THE DATA, REGARDLESS OF THEIR STATUS AS A SENSOR HOST, THROUGH A LENS OF STEWARDSHIP. ALL TEACHERS ARE PAID A STIPEND TO PARTICIPATE, WHICH SEMIS WILL ALSO DISBURSE FROM THEIR SUBAWARD FUNDING. 

4. COMMUNITREE SUPPORT - SUBAWARD FUNDS (TO NORTHWEST INDIANA REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION, AN ADMINISTRATIVE BODY) WILL FUND OPERATIONAL SUPPORT WITH THE LOGISTICS OF A SERIES OF 3 COMMUNITY OUTREACH EVENTS (1/CALENDAR YEAR OF THIS PROJECT) BRINGING THE INFORMATION TO THE RESIDENTS OF THE OPERATING AREA ACROSS THE CALUMET WATERSHED.

5. NORTHWEST INDIANA, NEO (NEIGHBORS' EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY) ACADEMY  - SUBAWARD FUNDS WILL PAY STAFF FOR TIME SPENT EMBEDDING DATA-DRIVEN CURRICULUM INTO THEIR SPECIALIZED SUITE OF NONTRADITIONAL EDUCATIONAL OFFERINGS. NEO ACADEMY IS ALSO COLLABORATING WITH WHC ON A 20-ACRE ECOLOGICAL RESTORATION PROJECT ENGAGING THEIR STUDENTS IN REGENERATING AND STEWARDING NATURAL SPACES ON SCHOOL PROPERTY.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE INSTALLING AN ESTIMATED 84 AIR SENSORS, MULTIPLE COMMUNITY WORKSHOPS, TRAINING OF STUDENTS ON AIR QUALITY, INITIATING GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE AND FORESTRY PROJECTS IN COMMUNITY DESIGNATED AREAS (INFORMED BY THE AIR QUALITY DATA COLLECTED), AND REGULAR SUBMISSION OF PROGRESS REPORTS TO THE EPA. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASING AIR QUALITY UNDERSTANDING AND INFORMATION ACCESS IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, MITIGATION OF AIR POLLUTANTS VIA GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE AND FORESTRY PROJECTS, AND LONG-LASTING COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT FOR AIR QUALITY PROJECTS. DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED GRANT IS TO DETERMINE LOCAL HOTSPOTS AND EMISSION SOURCES USING COMMUNITY SCALE MONITORING COMBINED WITH MICROSCALE EMISSIONS. THIS DATA WILL BE USED TO DETERMINE AREAS OF DISCREPANCY AND MITIGATION OPTIONS IN THOSE AREAS.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY DATA IN MILWAUKEE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND MICROSCALE MONITORING AND EMISSIONS INVENTORY TO DETERMINE SOURCE APPORTIONMENT, AND DETERMINE MITIGATION TECHNIQUES TO MANAGE CONTROLS ON LOCAL POLLUTION SOURCES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDED PURCHASING NEW AIR SAMPLING EQUIPMENT, CONDUCTING INITIAL AND LONG-TERM MONITORING, AND PERFORMING COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE AIR QUALITY DATA SHOWING POSSIBLE IMPACT OF INDUSTRIES AND INCREASED COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE AND UNDERSTANDING OF THE IMPACTS OF CRITERIA POLLUTANTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED GRANT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF PM 2.5 IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES, STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY-BASED NETWORK OF NEIGHBORHOOD LEVEL AIR SENSOR STATIONS IN MILWAUKEE, WISCONSIN. COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL ALSO RECEIVE EDUCATION ON HOW TO ACCESS THE AIR QUALITY DATA, AND ACTION STEPS TO RESPOND TO AIR QUALITY RELATED RISK FACTORS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE INSTALLING PURPLEAIR SENSORS AND USING PORTABLE AIRBEAM SENSORS AT SELECT MILWAUKEE PUBLIC SCHOOLS, DEVELOPING EDUCATION MATERIALS FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS, AND SHARING AIR QUALITY DATA THROUGH VARIOUS DATABASES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE OF AIR QUALITY RISKS AND HEALTH, DOCUMENTED AIR QUALITY TRENDS, AND REDUCTION OF ASTHMA RELATED EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT VISITS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE RESIDENTS OF ASTHMA BURDENED COMMUNITIES IN MILWAUKEE, WISCONSIN.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED AND COMPETITIVELY SELECTED GRANT IS TO CONDUCT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND THE CITY OF MADISON THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL INSTALL A CITY-WIDE NETWORK OF AIR QUALITY SENSORS TO PROVIDE PUBLICLY ACCESSIBLE INFORMATION ON PARTICULATE MATTER POLLUTION AT THE NEIGHBORHOOD SCALE.SUBRECIPIENT:THE CITY OF MADISON WILL ISSUE A SUBAWARDS TO THE UNIVERSITY OF WISCONSIN-MADISON, FOUNDATION FOR BLACK WOMEN'S WELLNESS, LATINO HEALTH COUNCIL, AND THE HMONG INSTITUTE. THE UNIVERSITY OF WISCONSIN-MADISON WILL HELP DESIGN THE AIR SENSOR NETWORK, PERFORM QUALITY ASSURANCE ACTIVITIES, AND INTERPRET DATA FROM THE AIR SENSOR NETWORK. THE FOUNDATION FOR BLACK WOMEN'S WELLNESS, LATINO HEALTH COUNCIL, AND THE HMONG INSTITUTE WILL ASSIST WITH COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT. OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE CHARACTERIZING THE SPATIAL DISTRIBUTION OF PARTICULATE MATTER ACROSS THE CITY, IDENTIFYING NEIGHBORHOODS EXPERIENCING THE GREATEST LEVELS OF PARTICULATE MATTER POLLUTION AND WORKING WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO DETERMINE NEXT STEPS FOR IMPROVING AIR QUALITY. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF MADISON, WISCONSIN.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS, SUCH AS OZONE, IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO REPLACE AN EXISTING OZONE ANALYZER OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING A NEW OZONE ANALYZER TO REPLACE THE EXISTING OZONE MONITOR, WHICH WILL ALSO ENABLE THE TRIBE TO REMAIN PART OF THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES' NETWORK AND PRIMARY QUALITY ASSURANCE ORGANIZATION.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES.  ENHANCED OZONE MONITORING WILL PROVIDE THE FOREST COUNTY POTAWATOMI (FCP) COMMUNITY WITH OZONE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THE TRIBE TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS.  OPERATION OF OZONE MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS.  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE RESIDENTS OF THE FCP TRIBAL COMMUNITY WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:INTERVENTIONS WILL BE COMPLETED IN AND AROUND 15 HOMES, LOCATED IN THE JEFFERSON-CHALMERS NEIGHBORHOOD IN DETROIT (ZIP CODE 48215), IN WHICH SURVEYS WERE PREVIOUSLY COMPLETED THAT DEMONSTRATED REPEATED SEVERE FLOODING AND ASSOCIATED BASEMENT MOLD. THROUGH THESE INTERVENTIONS, FACTORS WILL BE MITIGATED THAT CAUSE EXCESSIVE MOISTURE IN THE HOME AND THAT CONTRIBUTE TO UNHEALTHY AIR EXPOSURE RISK. ACTIVITIES:PARTICIPATING RESIDENTS OF 15 HOMES WILL WALK THROUGH THEIR HOME WITH EXPERIENCED READY AMERICORPS MEMBERS TO IDENTIFY WHAT INTERVENTIONS WILL INCREASE RESILIENCE AND ADAPTATION TO CLIMATE CHANGE. THE PROPOSED OBJECTIVES FOR THESE HOUSES WILL INCLUDE: MEASURES THAT REDUCE AND MITIGATE HOUSEHOLD MOLD, INCLUDING INSTALLING A DEHUMIDIFIER IN THE BASEMENT; INSTALLING AN AIR PURIFIER WHERE PEOPLE IN THE HOME SPEND THE MOST TIME; SEALING AIR DUCT LEAKS THAT TRANSMIT BASEMENT MOLD TO THE REST OF THE HOUSE; INCREASING AIR FLOW AROUND POROUS BASEMENT OBJECTS THAT COULD HARBOR MOLD; AND REDUCING SOURCES OF HOME WATER INCURSION AND FLOODING.  STRATEGIES FOR REDUCING HOME WATER INCURSION INCLUDE PERMANENTLY REPAIRING HOME FOUNDATION AND WINDOW/DOOR CRACKS, GRADING SOIL AROUND THE FOUNDATION TO DRAIN WATER AWAY FROM THE HOUSE, EXTENDING RAIN GUTTER DOWNSPOUTS TO OUTLET AWAY FROM THE FOUNDATION, REMOVING TREE ROOTS THAT THREATEN THE FOUNDATION, INSTALLING GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE TO INFILTRATE SURFACE WATER INTO THE GROUND INSTEAD OF POOLING WHERE IT CAN FLOOD THE HOME, AND OTHER INTERVENTIONS AS DETERMINED BY READY AMERICORPS MEMBERS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:BELOW ARE A LIST OF DELIVERABLES.

15 PARTICIPATING HOUSEHOLDS' RESIDENTS WILL BECOME MORE AWARE OF AND RESILIENT TO CLIMATE CHANGE IMPACTS RELATING TO FLOODING AND INDOOR AIR QUALITY.  ASSOCIATED RESIDENT AWARENESS OF METHODS OF ADAPTATION TO AND MITIGATION OF THESE CLIMATE CHANGE IMPACTS WILL ALSO INCREASE, ALONG WITH PROFICIENCY IN MANAGING AND MAINTAINING THE PROVIDED INTERVENTIONS.  
15 HOMES WILL HAVE IMPROVEMENTS TO INDOOR AIR INSTALLED, IN ACCORDANCE WITH SPECIFIC NEEDS IDENTIFIED DURING THE HOME HAZARD WALK THROUGH IN AGREEMENT WITH THE RESIDENT.
3 READY MEMBERS WILL PARTICIPATE IN TRAINING RELATING TO INDOOR AIR QUALITY AND THE INSTALLATION AND MAINTENANCE OF METHODS FOR MAINTAINING INDOOR AIR QUALITY, INCLUDING MEASURES BOTH INSIDE AND OUTSIDE THE HOME.

THE PHYSICAL RESILIENCE AND ADAPTATION OF 15 HOMES TO CLIMATE CHANGE AND RELATED INDOOR AIR QUALITY CONCERNS WILL INCREASE IN THE 48215 ZIP CODE, AN AREA IMPACTED BY REPEATED FLOODING AND RELATED INDOOR AIR QUALITY PROBLEMS.  THE RESIDENTS OF THESE HOMES IN A DETROIT NEIGHBORHOOD WITH AN EXCESSIVE AND DEVASTATING HISTORY OF FLOODING WILL BEHAVIORALLY BE MORE EMPOWERED, RESILIENT AND CAPABLE OF ADAPTING TO ADVERSE CLIMATE EVENTS.  AS A RESULT OF THE PROPOSED INTERVENTIONS, INDOOR AIR QUALITY WILL IMPROVE IN 15 HOMES.  IN PARTICULAR, MOLD- AND FUNGAL-RELATED AIR QUALITY PROBLEMS WILL BE REDUCED THROUGH: (1) THE REDUCTION OF INDOOR MOISTURE AND FLOODING, AND (2) THE IMPROVEMENT OF INDOOR SYSTEMS FOR REDUCING EXPOSURE RISK. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE THE RESIDENTS OF THE 15 PARTICIPATING HOUSEHOLDS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS FOR THE BENEFICIAL ELECTRIFICATION LEAGUE TO CONDUCT OUTREACH TO RURAL COMMUNITIES IN THE MIDWEST AND PROMOTE THE BENEFITS OF ELECTRIC SCHOOL BUSES. ACTIVITIES:THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: ORGANIZE IN PERSON EVENTS IN ILLINOIS, INDIANA, OHIO, MICHIGAN, MINNESOTA, AND WISCONSIN TO EDUCATE PARTICIPANTS ABOUT THE CLEAN SCHOOL BUS PROGRAM AND THE BENEFITS OF ELECTRIC BUSES; FACILITATE PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN SCHOOLS PURSUING FLEET ELECTRIFICATION AND THEIR ELECTRIC PROVIDERS; BUILD A NETWORK OF STAKEHOLDERS INVESTED IN FLEET ELECTRIFICATION FOR RURAL COMMUNITIES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE INCREASED AWARENESS ABOUT SCHOOL BUS ELECTRIFICATION AND ADOPTION OF THESE TECHNOLOGIES IN RURAL COMMUNITIES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE STUDENTS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN RURAL AREAS OF ILLINOIS, INDIANA, OHIO, MICHIGAN, MINNESOTA, AND WISCONSIN.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE CITY OF CINCINNATI IN ITS EFFORTS TO EMPOWER RESIDENTS TO TAKE STEPS TOWARD HOME ELECTRIFICATION AND TRAIN TECHNICAL EXPERTS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND, PRIORITIZE, DESIGN AND INSTALL THE MOST BENEFICIAL ELECTRIC HOME APPLIANCES WITH AN EMPHASIS ON HEAT PUMP TECHNOLOGY. ACTIVITIES:THE CITY OF CINCINNATI WILL DEVELOP ELECTRIFICATION READINESS EDUCATION MATERIALS AND DISSEMINATE MATERIALS TO RESIDENTS OF CINCINNATI. THE CITY OF CINCINNATI WILL ALSO PARTNER WITH LOCAL STAKEHOLDERS TO TRAIN THE ENGINEERING AND INSTALLATION COMMUNITY ON HOME ELECTRIFICATION, SPECIFICALLY AIR SOURCE HEAT PUMPS, AND DEVELOP AN APPROVED ELECTRIFICATION DESIGNATION FOR PARTICIPANTS IN THE TRAINING SERIES. SUBRECIPIENT:GROUNDWORK OHIO RIVER VALLEY WILL RESEARCH BEST PRACTICES FOR EDUCATION MATERIALS AND WORK WITH LOCAL STAKEHOLDERS TO DISSEMINATE MATERIALS TO CITIZENS OF CINCINNATI. OUTCOMES:EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE AN INCREASE IN COMMUNITY MEMBERS AWARE OF THE BENEFITS OF HOME ELECTRIFICATION, INCREASED NUMBER OF CERTIFIED EXPERTS AVAILABLE TO PROVIDE HOME ELECTRIFICATION ADVICE AND INSTALLATION, AND AN INCREASED NUMBER OF INSTALLERS OFFERING HEAT PUMPS AS HVAC SOLUTION.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.   ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ADDRESS PRIORITIES IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, AND CERTAIN NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PURCHASE 3 TELEDYNE OZONE ANALYZERS, 3 TELEDYNE PHOTOMETRIC CALIBRATIONS, 3-6 LAMP REPLACEMENT/FACTORY REPAIRS, AND USE 40 NEW ROUTERS FOR DATA TELEMETRY. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING OZONE ANALYZERS AND PHOTOMETRIC CALIBRATORS TO UPGRADE OZONE MONITORING EQUIPMENT AND PURCHASING . EXPECTED OUTCOMES: HIGH QUALITY AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES IS OBTAINED TO SUPPORT THE AIR MONITORING PROGRAM AND GOALS, AND ARP FUNDED EQUIPMENT IS LOCATED NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS. OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE RESIDENTS THE STATE OF WISCONSIN WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19. THE FUNDS MAY BE USED TO ADDRESS OTHER CONSIDERATIONS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS. THE ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOME WILL BE REDUCED INCIDENCES OF RESPIRATORY ILLNESSES INCLUDING ASTHMA AND LUNG CANCER AND IMPROVED VISIBILITY IN AND NEAR THESE COMMUNITIES

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES OF MINNESOTA WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19. ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS. SPECIFICALLY, MINNESOTA POLLUTION CONTROL AGENCY WILL USE THESE FUNDS TO ADDRESS PRIORITIES IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS INCLUDING UPGRADING OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANT MONITORING SITES, UPGRADING CERTAIN NAAQS GAS MONITORS AND/OR EQUIPMENT NOT MEETING PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS, AND OTHER POSSIBLE PM MONITORING INVESTMENTS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR(S) TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER BASED PM2.5 MONITORS. FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS OF MINNESOTA WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.
