DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE THE CENTER FOR ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT IN ITS EFFORTS TO ASSESS THE FEASIBILITY OF AIR SOURCE HEAT PUMPS IN PARTNERSHIP WITH TWIN CITIES HABITAT FOR HUMANITY, ASSIST WITH TECHNICAL SUPPORT FOR IMPLEMENTING AIR SOURCE HEAT PUMPS, AND DISSEMINATE FINDINGS THROUGH TRADE NETWORKS AND OTHER MEDIA CHANNELS. ACTIVITIES:THE CENTER FOR ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT WILL CONDUCT ENERGY MODELING TO ESTIMATE HOMEOWNER COSTS FOR AIR SOURCE HEAT PUMPS, PERFORM FIELD TESTING OF AIR SOURCE HEAT PUMPS ON A DEMONSTRATION HOME IN PARTNERSHIP WITH TWIN CITIES HABITAT FOR HUMANITY AND DISSEMINATE RESULTS TO CONTRACTORS AND FUTURE HOMEOWNERS. SUBRECIPIENT:THIS SUBAWARD WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO TWIN CITIES HABITAT FOR HUMANITY TO INSTALL AIR SOURCE HEAT PUMPS INTO THEIR BUILDING DESIGNS, TRAIN ITS STAFF ON AIR SOURCE HEAT PUMPS AND ITS MAINTENANCE, AND CREATING AIR SOURCE HEAT PUMPS EDUCATION DOCUMENTS FOR FUTURE HOMEBUYERS. OUTCOMES:EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A REDUCTION OF GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS FROM ONE DEMONSTRATION HOME, 20 CONTRACTORS EDUCATED ON HOME ELECTRIFICATION, AND 5000 IMPRESSIONS FROM THE AIR SOURCE HEAT PUMP CASE STUDY. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE CITY OF MINNEAPOLIS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE CITY OF MILWAUKEE IN ITS EFFORTS TO DEVELOP A PUBLIC-PRIVATE PARTNERSHIP THAT WILL BE BUILD NEW AFFORDABLE, DURABLE, AND NET ZERO ENERGY HOUSING IN A NEW FACTORY IN MILWAUKEE&RSQUOANDS CENTURY CITY BUSINESS PARK. THE RECIPIENT WILL DEVELOP A PLAN TO COMBINE TRADITIONAL HOME MORTGAGES, ENERGY EFFICIENCY FINANCE, AND OTHER AFFORDABLE FINANCING TOOLS SO THAT ENOUGH LOW-TO-MODERATE INCOME FAMILIES CAN AFFORD NEW HOUSING. THE RECIPIENT WILL ALSO PARTNER WITH TAKE ROOT MILWAUKEE TO DISSEMINATE INFORMATION ABOUT THE PROGRAM TO THE PUBLIC THROUGH OUTREACH EVENTS, NEWSLETTERS, AND SOCIAL MEDIA. THE RECIPIENT WILL ALSO DEVELOP AN ENERGY EFFICIENCY PLANNING TEAM TO REFINE DESIGNS AND ENERGY MODELING FOR THE NET ZERO ENERGY HOMES. THESE HOMES WILL AID IN IMPROVING INDOOR AND AMBIENT AIR QUALITY, ADDRESSING CLIMATE CHANGE AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE ISSUES IN MILWAUKEE. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE LOW-TO-MODERATE INCOME RESIDENTS OF THE CITY OF MILWAUKEE.

THIS PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO UTILIZE A COMMUNITY CREATED HOME ENERGY ASSESSMENT TOOL IN THE MAJORITY LOW-INCOME BRYANT NEIGHBORHOOD OF ANN ARBOR, MICHIGAN TO IDENTIFY SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES THAT WILL IMPROVE INDOOR AIR QUALITY AND RESIDENT HEALTH, SAFETY, COMFORT, AND OVERALL WELLBEING, ALL WHILE MAKING SIGNIFICANT PROGRESS TOWARDS NEIGHBORHOOD DECARBONIZATION. THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN RESIDENTS OF THE BRYANT NEIGHBORHOOD RECEIVING A HOME ENERGY PRESCRIPTION THAT DETAILS THEIR HOMES CURRENT PERFORMANCE AND OPPORTUNITIES TO IMPROVE THEIR INDOOR AIR QUALITY, COMFORT, HEALTH, AND SAFETY. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE THE RESIDENTS OF THE BRYANT NEIGHBORHOOD IN ANN ARBOR.

THIS PROJECT INTENDS TO CONDUCT MOBILE MONITORING IN SOUTHEAST MICHIGAN TO DELINEATE LOCAL SCALE HAP CONCENTRATION GRADIENTS AND GENERATE POLLUTION PROFILES AND EMISSION SOURCE SIGNATURES OF TARGET SOURCES. THE PROJECT NARRATIVE LISTED EIGHT FACILITIES WHICH WILL BE INCLUDED IN THE CHARACTERIZATION EFFORT. PLANS ARE TO ASSESS THE RELATIVE CONTRIBUTIONS OF THE TARGET SOURCES TO AMBIENT CONCENTRATIONS OF HAPS AND DISTINGUISH THEIR CONTRIBUTIONS TO AMBIENT EXPOSURE FROM OTHER PRIMARY AND SECONDARY SOURCES (SUCH AS CANADIAN EMISSIONS). LONGER TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE CONTROL STRATEGIES FOR HAP EMISSION REDUCTIONS, AND SPECIFIC EJ COMMUNITIES ARE NOTED. SECONDARY BENEFITS ARE SUPPORTING OZONE ATTAINMENT EFFORTS. THIS PROJECT HAS STRONG COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, THROUGH USE OF UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN AS SUB-AWARDEE, WHERE COMMUNITY INTERACTIONS WILL AFFECT SOME OF THE FINAL STUDY DESIGN AND ALLOW FOR EASY TRANSFER OF STUDY RESULTS TO COMMUNITY. TARGET HAPS INCLUDE ETO, BENZENE, 1,3-BUTADIENE, CHLOR

PURDUE UNIVERSITY PROPOSES TO FORM A WORKGROUP CONSISTING OF HEALTH OFFICIALS AND CURED-IN-PLACE-PIPE (CIPP) EXPERTS TO IDENTIFY BEST PUBLIC HEALTH PRACTICES AND RESPONSE EFFORTS. INDIVIDUALS IN THE WORKGROUP WILL PARTICIPATE IN STRUCTURED AND FOCUSED DISCUSSIONS ON TOPICS MEANT TO FORMULATE BEST PRACTICES TO PREVENT AND RESPOND TO CIPP AIR INCIDENTS.

THE METROPOLITAN MAYORS CAUCUS GRANT PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE MISSION OF IMPROVING ENERGY LITERACY AND BUILDING CAPACITY FOR SUSTAINABILITY PLANNING AND PROGRAMMING IN UNDER-SERVED COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE CHICAGO REGION.

THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE ONE WOOD STOVE CHANGEOUT IN EACH OF FOUR TRIBAL COMMUNITIES IN MICHIGAN ALONG WITH PROVIDING EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH AND FOSTERING TRIBAL RELATIONSHIP DEVELOPMENT TO CREATE THE FOUNDATION FOR POTENTIAL FUTURE LARGER CHANGEOUT PROGRAMS OR EDUCATION COLLABORATIVES FOR ADDRESSING LUNG HEALTH. THESE CHANGEOUTS WILL REDUCE HARMFUL POLLUTANTS BY REPLACING EXISTING HIGHLY-POLLUTING WOOD STOVES, INSERTS, FURNACES AND WOOD BOILERS WITH EPA-CERTIFIED WOOD OR ENERGY STAR CERTIFIED GAS STOVES, FURNACES AND INSERTS WHILE HELPING TRIBAL MEMBERS SECURE HEALTHY, STABLE, AND RELIABLE HEAT.

THE GOAL OF THE ASTHMA HOME ASSESSMENT PROGRAM IS TO ELIMINATE THE NEGATIVE EFFECTS OF COMMON CHRONIC CONDITIONS IN CHILDREN (COSTLY HOSPITALIZATIONS AND MISSED SCHOOL DAYS) BY INCREASING ACCESS TO AND QUALITY OF PREVENTATIVE CARE SERVICES, AS WELL AS REMEDIATION FOR AIR QUALITY ISSUES WITHIN THE HOME.

THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH TO TRIBAL COMMUNITIES IN NORTHERN WISCONSIN REGARDING THE BENEFITS OF REPLACING NON-EPA CERTIFIED WOOD STOVES WITH EPA-CERTIFIED WOOD STOVES AND FACILITATE THE CREATION OF AN INVENTORY OF NON-EPA CERTIFIED WOOD STOVES IN THOSE COMMUNITIES. AS PART OF THIS PROJECT, FOUR WOOD STOVES ON RESERVATIONS IN NORTHERN WISCONSIN WILL BE REPLACED TO DEMONSTRATE THE BENEFITS OF WOOD STOVE REPLACEMENT TO COMMUNITY MEMBERS. THIS WILL ACHIEVE A MEASURABLE REDUCTION IN PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER HARMFUL AIR POLLUTION EMISSIONS IN INDIAN COUNTRY, WHILE HELPING TRIBAL MEMBERS SECURE HEALTHY, STABLE, AND RELIABLE HEAT.

THE AMERICAN LUNG ASSOCIATION (ALA) WILL CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENTS FOR ASTHMA TRIGGERS IN THE HOMES OF 30 CHILDREN WITH POORLY CONTROLLED ASTHMA IN EAST ST. LOUIS, ILLINOIS. ALA WILL PROVIDE IN-HOME ASTHMA EDUCATION AND REMEDIATION TO IMPROVE INDOOR AIR QUALITY.

WAYNE STATE UNIVERSITY WILL CONDUCT IN-HOME ASTHMA TRIGGER ASSESSMENTS FOR 56 FAMILIES WITH CLINICALLY DIAGNOSED ASTHMA IN SOUTHWEST DETROIT, MICHIGAN. THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE HOUSEHOLD INDOOR AIR QUALITY AND ASTHMA OUTCOMES FOR SOUTHWEST DETROIT RESIDENTS THROUGH THE REDUCTION OF AIRBORNE PARTICULATE MATTER AND VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS.

THIS GRANT AGREEMENT TO THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE THE IMPLEMENTING LESS HAZARDOUS DEGREASING PROCESSES PROGRAM IN LEECH LAKE BAND OF OJIBWE COMMUNITY. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (CTDEEP). THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IS TO ENHANCE MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS SUBJECT TO NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) WITHIN CONNECTICUT'S AIR MONITORING NETWORK. THE SECONDARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT CTDEEP'S ONGOING EFFORTS TO ADVANCE JUSTICE AND EQUITY IN CONNECTICUT'S OVERBURDENED AND FRONT-LINE COMMUNITIES.

SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL UTILIZE THESE FUNDS TO REPLACE EXISTING MONITORING EQUIPMENT AT A TOTAL OF 14 SITES.ACTIVITIES:AS A RECIPIENT OF THIS EPA GRANT, THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (CTDEEP) WILL:

1. PREPARE AND INITIATE PROCUREMENT REQUEST(S) FOR EQUIPMENT PURCHASE(S).
2. PURCHASE EQUIPMENT.
3. TAKE DELIVERY OF EQUIPMENT UPON VERIFICATION OF FUNCTIONALITY OF EQUIPMENT AND MOVE FORWARD WITH PAYMENT OF VENDOR INVOICES.
4. PLAN FOR TIMELY SET-UP AND INSTALLATION OF EQUIPMENT, CONSISTENT WITH THE GOAL OF ENHANCING AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF CONNECTICUT.
5. INCORPORATE SMALL SENSORS INTO ONGOING EFFORTS TO SUPPORT CITIZEN SCIENTISTS IN RESEARCHING AIR POLLUTION IN OVERBURDENED FRONT-LINE COMMUNITIES AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES AND TO COMMUNICATE AND ENGAGE WITH THESE COMMUNITIES THROUGH EXISTING CHANNELS, INCLUDING THE CONNECTICUT EQUITY AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE ADVISORY COUNCIL (CEEJAC).
6. SUBMIT SEMI-ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS TO EPA. THE SCHEDULE FOR SUBMISSION OF SEMI-ANNUAL REPORTS WILL BE ESTABLISHED BY EPA, AFTER THE GRANT IS AWARDED.
7. SUBMIT A FINAL PROGRESS REPORT TO EPA WITHIN 120 CALENDAR DAYS OF THE COMPLETION OF THE PERIOD OF
PERFORMANCE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES AND DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE SUCCESSFUL PROCUREMENT AND INSTALLATION OF THE FOLLOWING AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT:

TELEDYNE API MODEL N400 (UV ABSORPTION OZONE ANALYZER) 
TELEDYNE API MODEL T703(PHOTOMETRIC OZONE CALIBRATOR)
108,500 TELEDYNE API MODEL T700 (DYNAMIC DILUTION CALIBRATOR) 
TELEDYNE API MODEL T753U(PORTABLE TRACE-LEVEL OZONE CALIBRATOR)
TELEDYNE API MODEL N500

BY ENHANCING AIR MONITORING ON BOTH STATEWIDE AND HYPER-LOCAL LEVELS, THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (CTDEEP) WILL BE POSITIONED TO MOVE EFFORTS FORWARD IN ACHIEVING AND MAINTAINING HEALTH-BASED AIR POLLUTION STANDARDS TO REDUCE THE DIRECT EMISSION OF CRITERIA AIR POLLUTION FROM STATIONARY AND MOBILE SOURCES, THEREBY PROTECTING HUMAN HEALTH IN THE ENCOMPASSING COMMUNITIES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION. THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IS TO ACCOMPLISH A COMBINATION OF AIR QUALITY TRAINING, PM2.5 AND BLACK CARBON DATA ANALYSIS, WOOD MOISTURE CONTENT RESEARCH, AIR PLANNING RELATED TO VISIBILITY AND THE PURCHASE AND POTENTIAL DEPLOYMENT OF AIR QUALITY MONITORING EQUIPMENT.

SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL WORK TOWARDS THE COORDINATION AND ACCELERATION OF, RESEARCH, INVESTIGATIONS, EXPERIMENTS, DEMONSTRATIONS, SURVEYS, AND STUDIES RELATING TO THE CAUSES, EFFECTS (INCLUDING HEALTH AND WELFARE EFFECTS), EXTENT, PREVENTION, AND CONTROL OF AIR POLLUTION IN THE STATE.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THREE SEPARATE AIR QUALITY TRAINING COURSES FOR INVOLVING AIR QUALITY PERSONNEL. THE GRANTEE WILL ALSO CONTRACT WITH AN ENTITY TO CONDUCT DATA ANALYSIS OF PARTICULATE MATTER2.5 AND BLACK CARBON DATA THAT HAS BEEN COLLECTED OVER THE PAST FEW YEARS. THE RECIPIENT ALSO PLANS TO EXPAND ON THEIR MOISTURE METER LOAN PROGRAM WITH PARTICIPATING LIBRARIES FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO MEASURE THE MOISTURE CONTENT OF THEIR CUT, CORDWOOD FOR HOME HEATING. VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION PLANS TO DEVELOP A PUBLIC PLATFORM WEBSITE TO TRACK THIS DATA COLLECTED BY COMMUNITY MEMBERS ON THE MOISTURE CONTENT OF COLLECTED WOOD. ADDITIONALLY, THE GRANTEE PLANS TO DEVELOP COMMUNICATION, EDUCATIONAL AND OUTREACH MATERIALS FOR THE PUBLIC TO INCREASE AWARENESS ABOUT VISIBILITY AND IMPACTS TO VISIBILITY IN VERMONT. LASTLY, VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION PLANS TO PURCHASE SEVERAL DIFFERENT TYPES OF AIR QUALITY MONITORING EQUIPMENT. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THREE SEPARATE AIR QUALITY TRAINING COURSES FOR ENVIRONMENTAL ANALYSTS IN THE AIR QUALITY AND CLIMATE DIVISION OF THE DEPARTMENT.

THE DEPARTMENT WILL ALSO CONTACT WITH AN ENTITY TO COMPLETE THE DATA ANALYSIS, AND TO SUMMARIZE THE DATA IN A REPORT TO PROVIDE THE DEPARTMENT WITH THE INFORMATION FOR IMPROVED DECISION MAKING AND PLANNING TO REDUCE PARTICULATEMATTER2.5 AND OTHER WOOD SMOKE RELATED EMISSIONS IN VERMONT.

ADDITIONALLY, AS PART OF THE PARTICULATE MATTER ADVANCE WORK, THE DEPARTMENT HAS INITIATED A MOISTURE METER LOAN PROGRAM WITH PARTICIPATING LIBRARIES FOR VERMONTERS TO MEASURE THE MOISTURE CONTENT OF THEIR CUT, CORDWOOD FOR HOME HEATING. TO EXPAND ON THIS WORK AND TO COLLECT AND SHARE DATA WITH THE PUBLIC ON WOOD MOISTURE CONTENT, THE GRANTEE WILL DEVELOP A PUBLIC PLATFORM WEBSITE TO TRACK DATA COLLECTED BY VERMONTERS ON THE MOISTURE CONTENT OF WOOD.

ALONG WITH THE ABOVE DELIVERABLES, THE RECIPIENT WILL PURCHASE SEVERAL DIFFERENT TYPES OF AIR QUALITY MONITORING EQUIPMENT, INCLUDING:
-METHANE LANDFILL GAS MONITOR (GEM 5000, WITH ACCESSORIES). THIS MONITOR WILL PROVIDE COMPLIANCE STAFF WITH THE ABILITY TO SAMPLE AND ANALYZE METHANE, CARBON DIOXIDE AND OXYGEN CONTENT OF LANDFILL GAS ON THE LANDFILL SURFACE DURING COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS. THIS MONITOR WILL ASSIST WITH THE IDENTIFICATION OF LEAKS IN THE COVERAGE OF THE LANDFILL AS WELL.
-PORTABLE WOODSMOKE KITS. TWO WOODSMOKE ANALYSIS KITS, WHICH ARE EASILY DEPLOYABLE, OUTDOOR, WITH CELLULAR DATA CONNECTIVITY TO MONITOR PM2.5 DURING THE WINTER HEATING MONTHS, OR OTHER NECESSARY TIMES.
-METEOROLOGICAL EQUIPMENT. VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION PROPOSED TO PURCHASE 4 NEW METEOROLOGICAL STATIONS TO INSTALL AT OUR PERMANENT MONITORING LOCATIONS IN VERMONT TO REPLACE OUTDATED EQUIPMENT.
-PARTICULATEMATTER2.5 SENSORS. THE DEPARTMENT PROPOSES TO PURCHASE 25 PORTABLE PARTICULATE MATTER2.5 AIR QUALITY SENSORS (LIKELY PURPLE AIR MONITORS). THESE SENSORS WILL BE USED IN SUPPORT OF PARTICULATE MATTER ADVANCE WORK TO MONITOR PARTICULATE MATTER2.5 CONCENTRATIONS IN SELECTED MOUNTAIN VALLEY LOCATIONS DURING THE WINTER HEATING MONTH

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (MASSDEP).  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ENHANCE PROTECTION OF ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE POPULATIONS IN MASSACHUSETTS THROUGH AIR MONITORING AND CUMULATIVE IMPACT ANALYSIS.

SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL ENHANCE AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF PARTICLE POLLUTION (ULTRAFINE PARTICLES) IN AND NEAR MASSACHUSETTS ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE (EJ) POPULATIONS AND FURTHER DEVELOP CUMULATIVE IMPACT ANALYSIS (CIA) REGULATIONS, GUIDANCE, AND TOOLS THAT WILL RESULT IN FURTHER PROTECTION OF EJ POPULATIONS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO AIR POLLUTANTS THAT INCREASE HEALTH RISKS.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PURCHASING AND MAINTAINING FOUR ULTRAFINE PARTICLE (UFP) MONITORS, INSTALLING THEM AT MONITORING STATIONS IN FOUR STRATEGIC LOCATIONS, AND GATHERING DATA ON THIS AIR POLLUTANT IN OVERBURDENED COMMUNITIES THAT ARE DISPROPORTIONALLY AFFECTED BY VEHICLE EMISSIONS.  TWO OF THE MONITORS WILL BE DEPLOYED AT 'NEAR-ROAD' AIR MONITORING STATIONS IN CHELMSFORD AND BOSTON-DORCHESTER WHILE THE OTHER TWO WILL BE DEPLOYED AT AIR MONITORING STATIONS IN BOSTON- CHINATOWN AND SPRINGFIELD, WHICH ALREADY OPERATE CONTINUOUS FINE PARTICULATE (PM2.5) MONITORS.  

ADDITIONALLY, MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO HIRE ONE OR MORE CONTRACTOR(S) TO ASSIST WITH FURTHER POLICY AND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT FOR CONDUCTING COMPREHENSIVE IMPACT ANALYSIS (CIA) FOR AIR PERMITS IN THE COMMONWEALTH FOR FACILITIES LOCATED IN OR NEAR AN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE (EJ) POPULATION.  ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS SECOND COMMITMENT INCLUDE: 1) THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF TRAINING FOR CONDUCTING A CIA, INCLUDING ASSESSMENT OF EXISTING COMMUNITY CONDITIONS USING A DRAFT GEOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION SYSTEM APPLICATION MAPPING TOOL AND CHARACTERIZING CUMULATIVE AIR TOXICS RISKS USING THE MASSACHUSETTS AIR TOXICS RISK SCREENING (MATRIST) TOOL; 2) THE DEVELOPMENT OF AN APPROACH FOR IDENTIFYING AT-RISK EJ POPULATIONS AND SETTING MORE PROTECTIVE AIR LIMITS, INCLUDING STATISTICAL ANALYSES OF AIR POLLUTION AND HEALTH INDICATORS, RESEARCH AND DOCUMENTATION OF HEALTH EFFECTS BELOW EXISTING AIR STANDARDS AND GUIDELINES, AND IMPLEMENTATION, AND 3) DEVELOPMENT OF METHODS TO ACCOUNT FOR EXISTING LOCAL TRAFFIC EMISSION WHEN EVALUATING CUMULATIVE IMPACTS, INCLUDING RESEARCH AND ANALYSIS OF TRAFFIC EMISSIONS DATA, MODELING APPROACHES, HEALTH EFFECTS, AND MITIGATION OPPORTUNITIES, WITH POSSIBLE INCORPORATION OF VEHICLE EMISSIONS DATA RISKS INTO THE MATRIST TOOL.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE 1) THE PROCUREMENT, INSTALLATION, AND OPERATION OF ULTRAFINE PARTICLE INSTRUMENTS AT 4 MONITORING STATIONS; 2) THE DEVELOPMENT OF TRAINING MODULES AND IMPLEMENTATION OF TRAINING SESSIONS FOR PERMIT APPLICANTS, CONSULTANTS AND MASSDEP STAFF ON HOW TO CONDUCT A CIA AND USE THE GUIDANCE AND TOOLS THAT HAVE BEEN CREATED, 3) STATISTICAL ANALYSES OF AIR POLLUTION AND HEALTH INDICATORS; IDENTIFICATION OF VULNERABLE EJ POPULATIONS AND MORE PROTECTIVE AIR STANDARD, AND 4) THE DEVELOPMENT OF A STANDARD PROTOCOL FOR ADDRESSING TRAFFIC EMISSIONS IN CUMULATIVE IMPACT ANALYSIS.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE 1) THE PROVISION OF ULTRAFINE ARTICLE (UFP) MONITORING DATA TO THE PUBLIC, 2) IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF CUMULATIVE IMPACT ANALYSIS GUIDANCE AND IMPLEMENTATION TOOLS, 3) IDENTIFICATION OF AND INCREASED PROTECTION OF VULNERABLE EJ POPULATIONS IN CERTAIN AIR PERMITS, AND 4) CONSIDERATION OF TRAFFIC EMISSIONS IN CUMULATIVE IMPACTS ANALYSIS.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS IN THE COMMONWEALTH OF MASSACHUSETTS, ESPECIALLY ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE POPULATIONS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE MAINE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO OBTAIN AIR QUALITY DATA IN AT LEAST TWO LOCAL MAINE COMMUNITIES, NAMELY RUMFORD AND OLD TOWN .  RESIDENTS IN THESE COMMUNITIES HAVE FREQUENTLY EXPRESSED CONCERNS ON THE ODORS AND HEALTH IMPACTS, ALLEGEDLY FROM AIR POLLUTION EMISSIONS EMANATING FROM MILLS IN EACH COMMUNITY. . 

SPECIFICALLY, STAFF FROM THE MAINE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL SAMPLE AND ANALYZE THE HYDROGEN SULFIDE CONCENTRATIONS AT SELECT LOCAL COMMUNITY LOCATIONS IN ORDER TO CHARACTERIZE THE SPATIAL AND TEMPORAL ASPECTS OF THIS AIR POLLUTANT PARAMETER.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE INCLUDE PURCHASING A SOPHISTICATED PIECE OF AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT (MOBILE TRACE LEVEL ANALYZER), MAINTAINING AND DEPLOYING THE SPECIALIZED AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT AT A REPRESENTATIVE MONITORING SITE LOCATION IN EACH SELECTED COMMUNITY; SAMPLING THE HYDROGEN SULFIDE CONCENTRATIONS IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE THE NECESSARY MINIMUM DATA COMPLETENESS CRITERIA; AND ANALYZING THE RESULTS BY COMPARING TO MAINE'S HEALTH-BASED AMBIENT AIR GUIDELINE (AAG) VALUE.  AS TIME AND RESOURCES ALLOW, EFFORTS WILL BE MADE TO COLLECT SIMILAR MEASUREMENTS IN OTHER MAINE LOCATIONS, WHERE HAVING AIR QUALITY DATA ABOUT H2S PRESENT IS ALSO OF INTEREST.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE SAMPLING AND ANALYSIS RESULTS FOR HYDROGEN SULFIDE CONCENTRATIONS FROM SELECT COMMUNITIES TO COMPARE TO MAINE'S HEALTH-BASED AMBIENT AIR GUIDELINE (AAG) VALUE.  THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE CHARACTERIZATION, SPATIALLY AND TEMPORALLY, OF LOCAL COMMUNITY AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS FOR HYDROGEN SULFIDE (H2S) INITIALLY.  THERE'S THE POTENTIAL TO EXPAND TO OTHER AIR TOXIC POLLUTANTS OF CONCERN AT A LATER TIME.  BY ESTABLISHING THIS BASELINE DATA ON HYDROGEN SULFIDE CONCENTRATIONS IN LOCAL MAINE COMMUNITIES, THIS WILL ALSO EXPAND MEDEP STAFF'S KNOWLEDGE OF POTENTIAL AIR POLLUTION EFFECTS AND HUMAN HEALTH IMPACTS FROM NEARBY POINT SOURCES.  THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF MAINE, ESPECIALLY THOSE RESIDENTS OF THE LOCAL COMMUNITIES IN MAINE (RUMFORD AND OLD TOWN) WHERE THE AIR MONITORING IS BEING CONDUCTED, AND STAFF AT THE MAINE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE WAMPANOAG TRIBE AT GAY HEAD, AQUINNAH (REFERRED TO AS 'AQUINNAH WAMPANOAG.')  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IS TO TO CONDUCT A REGIONAL AIR QUALITY AND DATA STUDY.  SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT A STUDY LOOKING AT TRENDS IN AIR QUALITY OVER TIME THAT MAY DIRECTLY AFFECT CONDITIONS THAT LEAD TO OCEAN ACIDIFICATION, HABITAT DEGRADATION, DECLINE IN SPECIES DIVERSITY AND SUSTENANCE FISHING, AND CAN BE TIED DIRECTLY TO RESPIRATORY HEALTH ISSUES IN THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITY. THE GOAL OF THIS PROPOSED ANALYSIS IS TO CHARACTERIZE CURRENT LEVELS OF, AND TRENDS IN, PM CONCENTRATIONS, UNDERSTAND THE SOURCES OF PM, AND CHARACTERIZE CURRENT LEVELS OF, AND TRENDS IN NITROGEN POLLUTION ON (DEPOSITION) AT AQUINNAH AND OTHER NEARBY TRIBAL LOCATIONS, AND COMPARE THESE TO REGIONAL TRENDS. THE NATURAL RESOURCES DEPARTMENT RECOGNIZES THE NEED TO HAVE AN UPDATED AIR QUALITY ANALYSIS THAT INCORPORATES THE DATA COLLECTED AT THE TRIBAL AIR STATION OVER THE LAST 15 YEARS AND HOW IT RELATES TO DATA COLLECTED FROM REGIONAL TRIBAL LOCATIONS IN THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. 
ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ADDRESSES CAPACITY BUILDING AND KNOWLEDGE ENHANCEMENT OF LOCAL AND REGIONAL SCALE REAL-TIME AIR QUALITY, BY LOOKING AT TRENDS IN AIR QUALITY, LARGELY PARTICULATE, NITROGEN AND OTHER ELEMENTS PRESENT IN THE SURROUNDING ATMOSPHERE. THESE TRENDS MAY DIRECTLY AFFECT CONDITIONS THAT LEAD TO OCEAN ACIDIFICATION, HABITAT DEGRADATION, DECLINE IN SPECIES DIVERSITY AND SUSTENANCE FISHING. THESE TRENDS ALSO CAN BE USED DIRECTLY TO RESPIRATORY HEALTH ISSUES WITHIN THE TRIBE AND IN THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITY.  THIS IS A PROJECT THAT HAS GAINED THE INPUT AND SUPPORT OF TRIBES THROUGHOUT EPA REGION 1 AND HAS BEEN DISCUSSED IN SESSION WITH TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL DIRECTORS. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE AN ANALYSIS OF AIR QUALITY TRENDS OVER SEVERAL YEARS IN THE REGION.  THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A BETTER INFORMED TRIBAL AND GENERAL POPULATION ON AIR POLLUTION TRENDS. THE OUTCOME OF THE PROJECT WILL BE COMMUNICATED TO EPA AND TO THE INTERESTED PUBLIC IN A REPORT THAT IS EASILY UNDERSTOOD AND CAN BE DISSEMINATED TO THE COMMUNITY. WITH THIS INFORMATION, TRIBES AND SURROUNDING TOWNS CAN MAKE MORE INFORMED DECISIONS ABOUT HOW TO DEAL WITH PROBLEMS AND INTELLIGENTLY FORMULATE SOLUTIONS REGARDING AIR QUALITY IN THE REGION. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE REGIONAL TRIBAL MEMBERS, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC THAT LIVES IN THE AREA.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE QUANTIFYING LOCALIZED AIR QUALITY DISPARITIES AND IMPACTS, LEADING COMMUNITY ASSESSMENTS OF AIR QUALITY, BUILDING LOCAL CAPACITY, STRENGTHENING PARTNERSHIPS, AND ULTIMATELY REDUCING AIR QUALITY AND HEALTH DISPARITIES THROUGH DEVELOPING AND FACILITATING A COMMUNITY ADVISORY BOARD TO HELP GUIDE STUDY DESIGN, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, AND MITIGATION STRATEGIES, IMPLEMENTING A LONG-TERM AIR MONITORING NETWORK AND CONDUCTING COMMUNITY-SCALE MONITORING PROJECTS, DEVELOPING A GREATER UNDERSTANDING ABOUT AIR QUALITY ISSUES WITH RESIDENTS, AND DEVELOPING MITIGATION STRATEGIES FOR EACH OF 4 COMMUNITIES.
SUBRECIPIENT:AIR, INC. WILL LEAD COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT IN EAST BOSTON, CONDUCT DATA ANALYSIS, AND CONTRIBUTE TO COMMUNITY EDUCATION BY TRANSLATING SCIENTIFIC DATA INTO UNDERSTANDABLE LANGUAGE. 
CAMBRIDGE HEALTH ALLIANCE WILL LEAD EFFORTS TO CONNECT AIR QUALITY AND PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUES (MESSAGING AND POTENTIAL BEHAVIOR CHANGE OPPORTUNITIES) AND LEAD COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT IN MALDEN AND EVERETT. SOMERVILLE TRANSPORTATION EQUITY PARTNERSHIP WILL CONDUCT STUDY DESIGN, OUTREACH AND RECRUITMENT STRATEGY, DATA ANALYSIS, AND CONTRIBUTE TO DEVELOPING COMMUNITY EDUCATION BY TRANSLATING SCIENTIFIC DATA INTO UNDERSTANDABLE LANGUAGE. DR. NEELAKSHI HUDDA OF TUFTS UNIVERSITY WILL LEAD MOBILE MONITORING TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY PROJECTS; (2) ASSIST WITH SET-UP AND MAINTENANCE OF MONITORING SITES, COLLOCATION WITH REGULATORY SITES AND SIDE BY SIDE TESTS IN THE LAB; (3) ASSIST WITH DATA INTERPRETATION AND QUALITY CONTROL; (4) ASSIST WITH TROUBLESHOOTING OF EQUIPMENT; (5) ASSIST WITH MANUSCRIPT PREPARATION AND PUBLICATION. 
OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE 4 LONG-TERM MONITORING NETWORK SITES DEPLOYED, UP TO 24 ADDITIONAL SHORT-TERM MONITORING SITES DEPLOYED, 1-2 LISTENING SESSIONS AND 1 REPORT BACK-SESSION COMPLETED IN 4 COMMUNITIES, A WEBSITE FOR PUBLIC DATA ACCESS, AIR QUALITY INFORMATION DISSEMINATED TO 1000 RESIDENTS (VIA A PROJECT WEBSITE, SOCIAL MEDIA, PUBLIC EVENTS, MEETINGS, AND PRINTED MATERIALS), 1 MEETING WITH REGIONAL ORGANIZATIONS AND LOCAL MUNICIPALITIES TO SHARE FINDINGS, AND ACCESSIBLE WRITTEN REPORTS ON DATA INTERPRETATION METHODS AND BEST-PRACTICES FOR CO-PRODUCTION OF ACTIONABLE DATA TO SUPPORT LOCAL DECISION MAKING ON TRAFFIC EMISSIONS-RELATED AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT. 

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE (1) SHORT-TERM OUTCOMES: INCREASED ACCESS TO ACTIONABLE AIR QUALITY DATA AND INFORMATION ON TRAFFIC IMPACTS THROUGH ROBUST AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENTS AVAILABLE TO RESIDENTS AND STAKEHOLDERS, WIDER USE OF BEST PRACTICES FROM CO-PRODUCTION OF RESPONSIVE AND ACTIONABLE AIR QUALITY INFORMATION WITH COMMUNITIES, INCREASED AWARENESS AMONG RESIDENTS ABOUT DRIVERS OF AIR QUALITY ISSUES IN THEIR MUNICIPALITY AND REGION, AND GREATER COORDINATION AMONG MUNICIPALITIES, RESEARCHERS, AND COMMUNITY GROUPS AROUND AIR QUALITY ISSUES AND PRIORITY PROJECTS; (2) INTERMEDIATE OUTCOMES: MUNICIPAL PLANNING AND REGIONAL TRANSIT DECISIONS INFORMED BY AIR QUALITY DATA NEEDS OF 4 COMMUNITIES, AT LEAST 1 MITIGATION FOR BUILT ENVIRONMENT, TRAFFIC FLOW CHANGES, AND/OR MUNICIPAL OR STATE POLICIES PRIORITIZED PER COMMUNITY, RESIDENTS HAVING RESOURCES TO MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS TO PROTECT THEIR HEALTH, RESIDENTS HAVING GREATER UNDERSTANDING ABOUT MITIGATIONS FOR ADDRESSING AIR QUALITY, AND LOCAL AND REGIONAL BODIES GETTING NEW ACTIONABLE INFORMATION; (3) LONG-TERM OUTCOMES: REDUCTION OF HUMAN EXPOSURE TO TRAFFIC-ORIGIN AIR POLLUTANTS DUE TO MITIGATION EFFORTS, A COHORT OF RESIDENTS HAVING KNOWLEDGE, TOOLS, AND RELATIONSHIPS TO CONTINUE MAKING IMPROVEMENTS TO AIR QUALITY AND OTHER MITIGATION EFFORTS, AND LOCAL AND REGIONAL BODIES CHANGING POLICIES AND REPORTING THOSE CHANGES TO COMMUNITIES. 

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES I

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER INFLATION REDUCTION ACT TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MONITORING AIR QUALITY AROUND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE NEIGHBORHOODS, CITY SCHOOLS, AND NEAR POINT SOURCES OF POLLUTION IN PITTSFIELD MASSACHUSETTS. THIS PROJECT WILL COMPILE NEIGHBORHOOD-LEVEL AIR QUALITY DATA TO COMPARE WITH LOCATION AND WEATHER DATA AND CONDUCT A PUBLIC HEALTH SURVEY TO IDENTIFY HEALTH CONCERNS AND INCREASES AND DECREASES IN SEVERITY, CHRONOLOGICALLY PAIRING THIS DATA WITH AIR QUALITY MONITORING RESULTS TO LOOK FOR CORRELATION. THIS DATA WILL BE SHARED WITH LOCAL, REGIONAL AND STATE AGENCIES AS WELL AS ENVIRONMENTAL AND COMMUNITY ACTION ORGANIZATIONS TO ADVOCATE FOR CHANGES IN POLICY TO LOWER ENVIRONMENTAL POLLUTION WITH THE GOAL OF ADDRESSING CLIMATE IMPACTS AND PUBLIC HEALTH, ESPECIALLY IN VULNERABLE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE NEIGHBORHOODS. 

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE IDENTIFICATION OF AIR POLLUTION, COMMUNITY-SPECIFIC ASSESSMENTS OF AIR POLLUTION DATA, DEPLOYMENT OF EQUIPMENT TO CONDUCT AIR QUALITY MONITORING IN OR NEAR UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, INCREASED PUBLIC AWARENESS OF AIR QUALITY AND USE OF CITIZEN SCIENCE THROUGH DEMONSTRATION OF HAND-HELD MONITORING AT PUBLIC EVENTS IN THE COMMUNITY, NEAR REAL-TIME AIR QUALITY DATA AVAILABILITY FOR COMMUNITIES AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS, STRENGTHENING OF EXISTING AND PROMOTION OF NEW PARTNERSHIPS AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT THROUGH VARIOUS ACTIVITIES AND INFORMATION EXCHANGES, AND DATA-INFORMED ADVOCACY FOR BETTER PUBLIC HEALTH, HOUSING, TRANSPORTATION, AND LAND USE REFORM.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED PARTICIPATION BY LOCAL BUSINESS AND INDUSTRY IN EMISSIONS REDUCTION, DEMAND RESPONSE PROGRAMS, AND ADOPTION OF RENEWABLES TO LOWER EMISSIONS, CHANGES IN TRAFFIC PATTERNS AND ELECTRIFICATION OF PUBLIC TRANSIT AND SCHOOL BUSES, ENERGY EFFICIENCY UPGRADES AND ELECTRIFICATION OF BUILDINGS AND VEHICLES TO REDUCE EMISSIONS, IMPROVED CONDITIONS IN HOUSING AND PUBLIC BUILDINGS (ALLOWING FOR IMPROVED HEALTH OUTCOMES), NO FOSSIL-FUELED OR TRASH BURNING ELECTRIC GENERATION WITHIN THE CITY, INCREASED ACCESS TO CLINICS AND HEALTHCARE MEASURES, AND IMPROVED ACCESS TO GREEN SPACE.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES IN PITTSFIELD, MASSACHUSETTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED AND COMPETITIVELY SELECTED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.  
ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT: LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE RECIPIENT WILL DISSEMINATE INTRODUCTORY EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS AND A COMMUNITY-WIDE SURVEY IN EACH TOWN; WORK WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES TO ASSEMBLE A STEERING COMMITTEE IN EACH JURISDICTION; MEET TO REVIEW SURVEY FEEDBACK, BRAINSTORM AND INVESTIGATE LOCATIONS, AND RECEIVE TRAINING ON HOW TO USE MOBILE SENSORS; CONDUCT WALKING AUDITS IN THE COMMUNITY USING MOBILE SENSORS WHICH MEASURE PM2.5 TO INVESTIGATE LOCATIONS AND TIMES OF DAY WHERE POLLUTION LEVELS MAY BE ELEVATED; REVIEW RESULTS USING THE DEVICE'S OPEN-SOURCE MAP; HELP COMMUNITIES TO POST MONITORING DATA ON THE PROJECT'S WEBSITE; HOST A SERIES OF WEBINARS FOR BERKSHIRE COUNTY RESIDENTS INTRODUCING THE SENSORS, DISCUSSING HOW TO INTERPRET AND USE DATA FOR PERSONAL PROTECTION AND TO MAKE THE AIR IN THEIR HOMES AND NEIGHBORHOODS CLEANER; CONDUCT TARGETED OUTREACH TO SPECIFIC GROUPS; DOWNLOAD DATA FROM EACH SENSOR TWICE A YEAR, ANALYZE DATA AND PREPARE REPORTS FOR EACH COMMUNITY THAT WILL BE PRESENTED TO THE STEERING COMMITTEES AND MADE AVAILABLE TO THE BROADER COMMUNITY. EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING 300 IQAR AIR VISUAL PRO INDOOR AIR SENSORS MEASURING PARTICULATE MATTER (PM1.0, PM2.5, PM10), CARBON DIOXIDE (CO2) AND DISPERSING THEM TO LOW-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS AND SCHOOLS IN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE (EJ) COMMUNITIES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF AVAILABILITY OF THE DATA, HEALTH IMPACTS, PERSONAL PROTECTIVE MEASURES, AND HOW TO IMPROVE THEIR INDOOR AND OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY. RESIDENTS AND MUNICIPALITIES WILL RECEIVE THE DATA NEEDED TO IMPLEMENT AND ADVOCATE FOR LOCAL AND STATE POLICY CHANGES, IMPLORE POLLUTERS TO CURB EMISSIONS, AND IMPLEMENT PROJECTS THAT DERIVE THE MOST BENEFITS FOR AIR QUALITY IN AN EQUITABLE WAY. AN OVERALL DECREASE IN PREMATURE DEATH, CANCERS, AND RESPIRATORY DISEASES IS EXPECTED FOR BERKSHIRE COUNTY RESIDENTS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE ALL BERKSHIRE COUNTY RESIDENTS, ESPECIALLY THE COUNTY'S MOST VULNERABLE POPULATIONS.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THIS PROJECT WILL IDENTIFY DISPARITIES RELATIVE TO HEALTH AND CORRESPONDING AIR QUALITY AMONG ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES TO INFORM PUBLIC POLICY AND REALIZE EQUITABLE HEALTH OUTCOMES. ACTIVITIES:THIS COMMUNITY AIR MONITORING GRANT WILL PROVIDE EQUIPMENT AND EXPERTISE TO GATHER AIR QUALITY DATA AND TO DOCUMENT AND UNDERSTAND DISPARITIES WITHIN THE CITY THAT CREATE OR EXACERBATE NEGATIVE HEALTH OUTCOMES. THIS INFORMATION WILL PROVIDE THE COMMUNITY-BASED PARTNER, GROUNDWORK SOUTHCOAST1 (GWSC), WITH THE DATA TO LEAD OUTREACH AND EDUCATION EFFORTS WITHIN EACH NEIGHBORHOOD BASED ON SITE-SPECIFIC RESULTS. THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND.  
SUBRECIPIENT:GROUNDWORK SOUTHCOAST (GWSC) WILL BE A KEY PROJECT PARTNER IN THIS ENHANCED AIR QUALITY MONITORING FOR COMMUNITIES GRANT PROJECT. THE CITY WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH GWSC TO COLLECT AND EVALUATE DATA. THIS PARTNERSHIP GWSC WILL NOT ONLY EXPAND PROJECT TEAM CAPACITY BUT IS AN INVALUABLE OPPORTUNITY FOR GWSC YOUTH TO HAVE A HANDS-ON LEARNING EXPERIENCE
WITH MONITORING EQUIPMENT TO GATHER INFORMATION ABOUT THEIR OWN NEIGHBORHOOD ENVIRONMENTS, SHARE IT WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITIES, AND HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO AFFECT POSITIVE CHANGE.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: DEPLOYING A NETWORK OF CONTINUOUS AIR MONITORS AT LOCATIONS THAT PROVIDE ACCURATE REPRESENTATION OF UNDERSERVED ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES; IDENTIFYING PREVALENCE OF AIR POLLUTANTS IN EACH AREA OF THE CITY; IDENTIFYING SOURCE(S) OF POLLUTANTS; EVALUATING CORRELATIONS BETWEEN HEALTH STATISTICS, DEMOGRAPHIC/GEOGRAPHIC GROUPINGS, AND QUALITY DATA. CREATING NEW AND STRENGTHEN EXISTING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS THROUGH INFORMATION SHARING AND DIALOGUE ABOUT POTENTIAL CORRELATIONS AND ACTIONS; AND EDUCATING THE COMMUNITY, PARTICULARLY YOUTH, ABOUT POTENTIAL BEHAVIORAL MODIFICATIONS TOWARD HEALTH OUTCOMES.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: INCREASE ACCESS TO AIR QUALITY DATA ON PUBLIC PLATFORM; INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF AIR QUALITY COMPONENTS AND HEALTH IMPLICATIONS; INCREASE HEALTH SCREENINGS AND AWARENESS OF SUPPORT NETWORKS AND PROGRAMS; IMPLEMENT AND ADVOCATE FOR ACTIONS AND POLICIES THAT WILL REDUCE AIR POLLUTANTS; INCREASE POSITIVE SELF-HEALTH BEHAVIORS; DOCUMENT REDUCTION IN POLLUTANTS FOLLOWING PRIORITY ACTION IMPLEMENTATION; REDUCTION OF CHILDHOOD ASTHMA AND NEIGHBORHOOD DISPARITIES IN SAME; AND REDUCTION OF PULMONARY-RELATED PREMATURE DEATHS AND NEIGHBORHOOD DISPARITIES IN SAME.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF NEW BEDFORD, WHICH IS HOME TO A DISPROPORTIONATE NUMBER OF CHILDREN WITH ASTHMA.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS PROJECT WILL BUILD CAPACITY AND KNOWLEDGE FOR MONITORING OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY (FINE PARTICULATE MATTER, PM2.5; OZONE, O3) IN REAL-TIME AND AT A HYPERLOCAL-SCALE BY: ESTABLISHING LOCAL AIR MONITORING NETWORKS IN DERBY AND ANTONIA, CT, DISSEMINATING AIR QUALITY INFORMATION ACCESSIBLY THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY, INCREASING THE CAPACITY FOR CITIZENS TO MONITOR AND UNDERSTAND LOCAL AIR QUALITY, AND STRENGTHENING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE 1) ENHANCING AND EXPANDING COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE THROUGH ACTIVITIES AND INFORMATION EXCHANGES, 2) COMMUNITY SPECIFIC ASSESSMENTS OF AIR POLLUTION DATA (PROBLEM IDENTIFICATION), 3) IDENTIFYING, USING, AND DISSEMINATING LESSONS LEARNED ON THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THE PUBLIC EDUCATION TOOLBOX THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP (CONTAINING COMMUNITY TAILORED ENGAGEMENT MATERIALS, AIR QUALITY MONITORING NETWORK PROGRAM DEPLOYMENT GUIDANCE AND STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES FOR SENSOR PLACEMENT, INSTALLATION AND MAINTENANCE, OPTIONS FOR REDUCING EXPOSURE TO AIR POLLUTION), AND 4) AN AIR QUALITY MONITORING NETWORK PROVIDING NEAR REAL TIME AIR QUALITY DATA AVAILABILITY FOR COMMUNITIES AND STAKEHOLDERS.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE 1) SHORT-TERM OUTCOMES: INCREASED STAKEHOLDER AND COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE OF POLLUTION HAZARDS, HEALTH EFFECTS, VULNERABILITIES, AND AVAILABLE TOOLS FOR REDUCING NEGATIVE HEALTH OUTCOMES, COMMUNITY INPUT AND INVOLVEMENT IN TOOLBOX DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION, PROBLEM IDENTIFICATION THROUGH DEPLOYMENT OF SENSORS, NEAR REAL-TIME DATA, WEB-BASED DASHBOARD, INCREASED ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND TOOLS THAT INCREASE UNDERSTANDING AND REDUCTION OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND HUMAN HEALTH RISKS, ROUTINE QUALITY IMPROVEMENT AND INCREASED EFFECTIVENESS OF TOOLBOX, IMPLEMENTATION OF PARTNERS USE OF PROCESS EVALUATION RESULTS TO IMPROVE/INFORM TOOLBOX ADAPTATION IN COMMUNITIES; 2) INTERMEDIATE OUTCOMES: REDUCED ADVERSE HEALTH OUTCOMES DUE TO AIR POLLUTION AMONG COMMUNITY MEMBERS, LOCAL POLICY ACTION: IMPLEMENTING AIR MONITORING EDUCATION IN SCHOOLS, INCORPORATING THE FLAG PROGRAM AND LOCALIZED MESSAGING REGARDING AIR QUALITY INDEX, CREATING AN ENHANCED EVIDENCE BASE FOR EFFECTIVE AIR POLLUTION AWARENESS, COMMUNITY ACTION TO MITIGATE CERTAIN AIR POLLUTANT(S) (POP-UP PARKS, GREEN SPACE INSTALLATIONS, INFORMATIONAL KIOSKS), COMMUNITY BASED IDENTIFICATION OF GOOD, FAIR, AND POOR AIR QUALITY DAYS BASED ON LOCAL THRESHOLDS; 3) LONG-TERM OUTCOMES: WIDESPREAD ADOPTION, REPLICATION, AND EXPANSION OF MONITORING INFRASTRUCTURE AND TOOLBOX USE, REDUCED NEGATIVE HEALTH OUTCOMES IN REGIONS AND AMONG POPULATIONS VULNERABLE TO THE ADVERSE EFFECTS OF AIR POLLUTION, MATURE AIR POLLUTANT MONITORING INFRASTRUCTURE, COMMUNITY LONG-TERM AIR SENSOR MAINTENANCE PLAN.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE DISTRESSED COMMUNITIES OF ANSONIA AND DERBY, CT.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED AND COMPETITIVELY SELECTED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.  ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL ORGANIZE AN AIR QUALITY MONITORING WORKING GROUP, CONDUCT COMMUNITY MEETINGS, INSTALL AIR QUALITY MONITORS, DEVELOP AN AIR QUALITY MONITORING WEB SITE, AND CONDUCT OUTREACH AND PROMOTION.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:A WORKING GROUP COMPOSED OF NEIGHBORHOOD ASSOCIATION REPRESENTATIVES, COMMUNITY LEADERS, AND OTHER KEY STAKEHOLDERS WILL BE FORMED TO STEER THE PROJECT. THE CITY OF STAMFORD WILL HOST A SERIES OF THREE (3) COMMUNITY MEETINGS TO ROLL OUT ITS AIR QUALITY MONITORING PROGRAM, INCLUDING VIRTUAL SESSIONS AS NEEDED. LOCAL OUTREACH ACTIVITIES WILL TARGET RESIDENTS OF THE SOUTH END AND WEST SIDE NEIGHBORHOODS, PARTICULARLY SENSITIVE POPULATIONS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS ENGAGEMENT IS TO SHARE INFORMATION, COLLECT FEEDBACK, AND DESCRIBE NEXT STEPS. THE CITY OF STAMFORD WILL CONDUCT ROBUST MARKETING EFFORTS TO PROMOTE THE AVAILABILITY OF LOCAL AIR QUALITY INFORMATION. OUTREACH WILL INCLUDE FLYERS, PRESENTATIONS, ARTICLES, VIDEOS, SOCIAL MEDIA, AND OTHER COMMUNICATION TOOLS. THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE INSTALLING 3 AIR QUALITY MONITORS IN COMMUNITY CENTERS, SCHOOLS, FIRE STATIONS, LIBRARIES, AND OTHER KEY LOCATIONS TO MEASURE NITROGEN DIOXIDE (NO2), PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5), AND OZONE (O3); DEVELOPING A WEBSITE TO PRESENT RESIDENTS WITH REAL-TIME AIR QUALITY INFORMATION THROUGH A USER-FRIENDLY DASHBOARD; AND OUTREACH AND PROMOTIONAL EFFORTS TO RAISE AWARENESS IN STAMFORD OF AIR QUALITY CHALLENGES AND PRESENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO CHANGE BEHAVIORS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED AWARENESS OF COMMUNITY AIR QUALITY CHALLENGES, REAL-TIME ACCESS TO NO2, PM2.5, AND O3 AIR QUALITY DATA, EDUCATION ON THE IMPACTS OF AIR QUALITY ON HEALTH; IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF WHEN TO AVOID OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES DURING POOR AIR QUALITY INDEX (AQI) DAYS, LOCAL/STATE POLICY ACTIONS THAT MITIGATE AIR POLLUTION HOT SPOTS; LOWER NO2, PM2.5, AND O3 EMISSIONS, REDUCED ASTHMA HOSPITALIZATIONS AND EMERGENCY ROOM VISITS, FEWER NEW CASES OF ASTHMA, LESS PREVALENCE OF CHRONIC HEART/LUNG DISEASE, DIMINISHED RISK OF MENTAL HEALTH DISORDERS AND IMPAIRED COGNITIVE DEVELOPMENT, AND DECREASED RATE OF PREMATURE DEATHS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE STAMFORD RESIDENTS OF THE SOUTH END AND WEST SIDE NEIGHBORHOODS, PARTICULARLY SENSITIVE POPULATIONS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19. 
  
    ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS. FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL: REVIEW AND COMPARE EPA PROPOSED EQUIPMENT FOR PURCHASE AND DETERMINE IF ANY ADJUSTMENTS NEED TO BE MADE ON ENHANCEMENTS AT VARIOUS AIR MONITORING SITES BASED ON CURRENT NEED; CONSULT WITH EPA ABOUT PROPOSED CHANGES/UPDATES; PREPARE AND INITIATE PROCUREMENT REQUEST(S) FOR EQUIPMENT PURCHASE(S); PURCHASE EQUIPMENT; TAKE DELIVERY OF EQUIPMENT UPON VERIFICATION OF FUNCTIONALITY OF EQUIPMENT AND MOVE FORWARD WITH PAYMENT OF VENDOR INVOICES; PLAN FOR TIMELY SET-UP AND INSTALLATION OF EQUIPMENT CONSISTENT WITH THE GOAL OF ENHANCING AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES IN EJ AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR(S) TO REPLACE FILTER-BASED PM2.5 MONITOR(S). EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES WITH FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO NEW HAMPSHIRE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES (NHDES). THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO FUND A POSITION WHICH WILL SUPPORT EFFORTS BY NHDES TO PARTNER WITH EPA TO DELIVER CLEANER AIR THROUGH PROGRAMS THAT ADDRESS AIR QUALITY, TRANSPORTATION, INDOOR AIR, AND CLIMATE CHANGE.

SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL FUND A FULL-TIME STAFF POSITION. THIS POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES WILL BE EXCLUSIVELY DEDICATED TO THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF IRA FUNDED PROGRAMS TARGETING CLIMATE POLLUTION REDUCTION AND GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSION REDUCTION PROJECTS. AN INCIDENTAL AMOUNT OF FUNDING MAY BE USED FOR 103 ELIGIBLE EQUIPMENT PURCHASES TO REPLACE, EXPAND, OR OTHERWISE IMPROVE AIR MONITORING PROGRAM EQUIPMENT.ACTIVITIES:SPECIFIC PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PLANNING, RECRUITING, AND HIRING A FULL-TIME STAFF MEMBERS TO FOCUS ON SUPPORTING EFFORTS TO ORGANIZE AND MANAGE PROJECTS IN SUPPORT CLIMATE RELATED PROGRAMS IN NEW HAMPSHIRE.  ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES WILL FOCUS ON ENSURING THE EFFICIENCY OF AIR MONITORING PROGRAM EQUIPMENT AND PURCHASING REPLACEMENTS DETERMINED NECESSARY.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE 1 CPRG GRANTS PROGRAM MANAGER HIRED AND TRAINED TO BE EXCLUSIVELY DEDICATED TO THE PLANNING, DEVELOPMENT, AND IMPLEMENTATION OF IRA FUNDED PROGRAMS TARGETING CLIMATE POLLUTION REDUCTION AND GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSION REDUCTION PROJECTS. ADDITIONAL DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE REPLACEMENT, EXPANSION, OR OTHERWISE IMPROVEMENT OF AIR MONITORING PROGRAM EQUIPMENT. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE ADDITIONAL STAFF RESOURCES RESULTING IN THE ADVANCED KNOWLEDGE OF AIR POLLUTION CONTROL TECHNOLOGIES AND STRATEGIES, IMPROVED DECISION MAKING BASED ON INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF POLLUTION SOURCES AND EMISSIONS INVENTORIES, AND IMPROVED DECISION MAKING BASED ON A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF CUMULATIVE HEALTH IMPACTS IN DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE NEW HAMPSHIRE RESIDENTS, INCLUDING LOW-INCOME AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE AIR POLLUTION CONTROL AGENCY'S JURISDICTION.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA).  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IS TO OBTAIN AIR MONITORING DATA IN AREAS THEY CURRENTLY DO NOT HAVE DATA FOR AND USE THIS DATA TO MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS THAT WILL ULTIMATELY REDUCE EXPOSURES TO BOTH CRITERIA AND TOXIC AIR POLLUTANTS IN RHODE ISLAND.

SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL INSTALL A PERMANENT MONITORING SITE IN THE PORT OF PROVIDENCE, IMPLEMENT A MOBILE MONITORING PROGRAM USING VARIOUS MOBILE AND HANDHELD TECHNOLOGY, USE AIR QUALITY SENSORS TO STUDY EMISSIONS IN AREAS OF INTEREST, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO SCHOOLS OPERATING NON-CERTIFIED WOOD BOILERS, QUARRIES, AND ASPHALT PLANTS, AND EVALUATE CREMATORY HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANT EMISSIONS.  ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE INSTALLATION OF A PERMANENT MONITORING SITE IN THE PORT OF PROVIDENCE; CONDUCTING MOBILE MONITORING STUDIES WHERE DATA ACQUISITION IN REAL TIME TOOLS (DART), AS WELL AS HANDHELD MONITORING EQUIPMENT, WILL BE USED TO DETERMINE VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUND (VOC) EMISSIONS LEVELS. WHEN ELEVATED LEVELS OF ARE NOTED WITH THE MONITORING EQUIPMENT, SUMMA CANISTERS WILL USED TO TAKE VOC SAMPLES THAT WILL BE ANALYZED AT THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AIR POLLUTION LAB FOR SPECIATION. THIS DATA WILL HELP INFORM INSPECTORS OF SUSPECTED VIOLATIONS, AS WELL AS VALIDATE A FACILITY'S REPORTED EMISSION'S INVENTORY DATA.  COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS WILL BE PERFORMED BASED ON DATA COLLECTED. STUDIES WILL BE CONDUCTED IN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE FOCUS AREAS THROUGHOUT THE STATE, AS WELL AS ANY OTHER IDENTIFIED AREA OF INTEREST. SENSORS WILL BE PURCHASED TO MONITOR AIR QUALITY IN AREAS OF INTEREST INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, SCHOOLS WITH RECENTLY INSTALLED NON-CERTIFIED WOOD BOILERS, QUARRIES, AND ASPHALT PLANTS.  DATA WILL BE USED TO DETERMINE IF FURTHER COMPLIANCE ACTION IS NECESSARY. INSPECTORS WILL FOLLOW UP WITH ANY SOURCES POTENTIALLY LINKED TO ELEVATED DATA. STUDY OF CREMATORIES IN THE STATE TO DETERMINE MORE ACCURATE PARTICULATE EMISSIONS LEVELS, AS WELL AS EMISSIONS LEVELS OF VARIOUS HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANT METALS.  THE STUDY WILL INCLUDE STACK TESTING AT ONE OR MORE FACILITIES.  DATA WILL BE USED ACROSS ALL SIMILAR FACILITIES TO CHARACTERIZE EMISSIONS FROM CREMATORIES FOR USE IN DECISION MAKING IN REGARD TO REGULATION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: ALL RELEVANT POLLUTANT MEASUREMENTS AND METEOROLOGICAL DATA WILL BE UPLOADED TO AN EXCEL WORKBOOK WHICH WILL BE USED FOR DATA ANALYSIS AND WILL BE AVAILABLE TO RESEARCHERS AND OTHER INTERESTED PARTIES; FOR MOBILE MONITORING, ROUTE TRAVELLED WILL BE DOCUMENTED WITH RESULTS OF MOBILE MONITORING DATA AND SOURCES IDENTIFIED ALONG WITH COMPLIANCE ACTIONS TAKEN AS A RESULT OF SAMPLING.  ANY SPIKES DETECTED RESULTING IN FURTHER SAMPLING WITH SUMMA CANISTERS WILL BE DOCUMENTED WITH LOCATION DATA AND VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUND (VOC) ANALYSIS BY THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AIR POLLUTION LAB. THIS DATA WILL BE STORED IN AN EXCEL DATABASE; SENSOR DATA WILL BE AVAILABLE IN REAL TIME ON RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT OFFICE OF AIR RESOURCES WEBSITE. A PROFILE WILL BE PRODUCED FOR EACH SENSOR SAMPLING LOCATION, INCLUDING A SITE DESCRIPTION, POLLUTANT INFORMATION, AND AN ANALYSIS OF THE CONDITIONS THAT AFFECT AIR POLLUTANT LEVELS AT THAT LOCATION; DATA OBTAINED FROM CREMATORY STUDY WILL BE USED TO CHARACTERIZE CREMATORY EMISSIONS FROM ALL CREMATORIES IN THE STATE; SEMI-ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS WILL BE SUBMITTED TO EPA SUMMARIZING TECHNICAL PROGRESS, PLANNED ACTIVITIES FOR THE NEXT SIX MONTHS, AND A SUMMARY OF EXPENDITURES ON A SCHEDULE TO BE DETERMINED BY EPA; A FINAL REPORT SHALL BE SUBMITTED TO EPA WITHIN 120 CALENDAR DAYS OF THE COMPLETION OF THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE. THE FINAL REPORT WILL INCLUDE A SUMMARY OF THE PROJECT, COSTS OF THE PROJECT DISCUSSION OF ANY PROBLEMS, SUCCESSES, AND LESSONS LEARNED FROM TH

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO CONDUCT AMBIENT AIR MONITORING OF POLLUTANTS OF GREATEST CONCERN IN COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH OUTCOME DISPARITIES STEMMING FROM POLLUTION AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE RHODE ISLAND ASTHMA CONTROL PROGRAM (RIACP) IS PROPOSING TO MEASURE THE IMPACT OF AIR QUALITY ON ASTHMA OUTCOMES AMONG UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES LIVING IN CENTRAL, SOUTH, AND WEST ELMWOOD COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE CITY OF PROVIDENCE, RHODE ISLAND. RIACP WILL CONDUCT AIR QUALITY MONITORING BY INSTALLING AIR QUALITY SENSORS AT PUBLIC HOUSING DEVELOPMENTS AND ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THESE COMMUNITIES AND WILL MEASURE BOTH INDOOR AND OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY.ACTIVITIES:THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO MONITOR THEIR OWN AIR QUALITY AND TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY MONITORING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT:  LEVERAGE EXISTING AIR QUALITY EXPERTISE, EXPAND USE OF COMMUNITY MONITORING GROUPS AND OTHER APPROACHES THAT GIVE THE COMMUNITY A VOICE IN THE MONITORING OF THE AIR QUALITY, AND BUILD A FOUNDATION OF TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING FROM WHICH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY AIR POLLUTION PROBLEMS CAN BE FOUND. SPECIFICALLY, THE RHODE ISLAND ASTHMA CONTROL PROGRAM (RIACP) IS PROPOSING TO MEASURE THE IMPACT OF AIR QUALITY ON ASTHMA OUTCOMES AMONG UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES LIVING IN CENTRAL, SOUTH, AND WEST ELMWOOD COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE CITY OF PROVIDENCE, RHODE ISLAND. RIACP WILL CONDUCT AIR QUALITY MONITORING BY INSTALLING AIR QUALITY SENSORS AT PUBLIC HOUSING DEVELOPMENTS AND ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THESE COMMUNITIES AND WILL MEASURE BOTH INDOOR AND OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY. RESULTS FROM THE AIR QUALITY MONITORING WILL BE WIDELY DISSEMINATED, ACROSS COMMUNITY SETTINGS.SUBRECIPIENT:PROVIDENCE HOUSING AUTHORITY WILL ASSIST RIACP WITH PARTICIPANT RECRUITMENT AND INSTALLATION OF AIR QUALITY MONITORS.  WEST ELMWOOD HOUSING DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION WILL WORK WITH RIACP TO ASSIST IN THE PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROJECT, AS WELL AS THE DISSEMINATION OF FINDINGS FROM THE PROJECT TO THE 02907 COMMUNITY. THE CENTRAL PROVIDENCE HEZ WILL WORK WITH RIACP TO ASSIST IN THE PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROJECT, AS WELL AS THE DISSEMINATION OF FINDINGS FROM THE PROJECT TO THE 02909 COMMUNITY. THE SOUTH PROVIDENCE HEZ WILL WORK WITH RIACP TO ASSIST IN THE PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROJECT, AS WELL AS THE DISSEMINATION OF FINDINGS FROM THE PROJECT TO THE 02905 COMMUNITY. YALE SCHOOL OF PUBLIC HEALTH WILL INCLUDE CALIBRATION OF 110 PURPLE AIR SENSORS, DEVELOPING A SENSOR HEALTH DASHBOARD THAT WILL INCLUDE ALL OF THE PURPLE AIR SENSORS, AS WELL AS DEVELOPMENT OF AN INTERACTIVE MAP THAT WILL VISUALIZE SENSOR DATA, AIR QUALITY, AND METEOROLOGICAL INFORMATION. HOUSINGWORKS RI'S CONTRACT WILL INCLUDE FUNDING A STAFF PERSON TO DEVELOP AND PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL TRAININGS ON ASTHMA, AIR QUALITY AND HEALTHY HOUSING TO COMMUNITIES. THE COMMUNITY ASTHMA PROGRAM CONTRACT WILL INVOLVE CONDUCTING THE ASTHMA CONTROL TEST (ACT) FOR PARTICIPANTS AND OTHER ASTHMA PROGRAM REFERRALS. OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE INSTALLING 40 AMBIENT OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY SENSORS AND IDENTIFYING PM2.5 AIR POLLUTION FROM THE OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY SENSORS.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND KNOWLEDGE ABOUT PM2.5 AIR POLLUTION AND ITS IMPACT ON ASTHMA, INCREASED ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND TOOLS THAT INCREASE UNDERSTANDING AND REDUCTION OF ENVIRONMENTAL TRIGGERS THAT CAN EXACERBATE ASTHMA, AND INCREASED USE OF ASTHMA ACTION PLANS FOR ALL PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS IDENTIFIED AS HAVING ASTHMA.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES LIVING IN CENTRAL, SOUTH, AND WEST ELMWOOD COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE CITY OF PROVIDENCE, RHODE ISLAND, WHICH ARE LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE AT GREATEST RISK FOR ENVIRONMENTAL EXPOSURES TO AIR POLLUTION, AND FOR DEVELOPING AS

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO THE AROOSTOOK BAND OF MICMACS (MI'KMAQ NATION). THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IS TO ACCOMPLISH AIR QUALITY TRAINING AND PROCUREMENT OF NEW AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT IN ORDER TO PRESERVE AND MAINTAIN THE TRIBE'S AIR MONITORING EFFORTS.

SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL SUPPORT EPA STRATEGIC PLAN GOAL 4 (ENSURE CLEAN AND HEALTHY AIR FOR ALL COMMUNITIES); OBJECTIVE 4.1 (IMPROVE AIR QUALITY AND REDUCE LOCALIZED POLLUTION AND HEALTH IMPACTS) BY TRAINING EMPLOYEES AND ACQUIRING AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT INSTRUMENTAL TO PROVIDING REAL TIME, CONTINUING DATA THAT CAN BE USED TO IDENTIFY AIR QUALITY STATUS AND RELAYING THAT INFORMATION TO TRIBAL MEMBERS AND AIR QUALITY PARTNERS.ACTIVITIES:AS A RECIPIENT OF THIS GRANT, THE TRIBE AGREES TO ENGAGE IN THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:

1. PREPARE AND INITIATE PROCUREMENT REQUEST(S) FOR EQUIPMENT PURCHASE(S).
2. PURCHASE EQUIPMENT.
3. TAKE DELIVERY OF EQUIPMENT UPON VERIFICATION OF FUNCTIONALITY OF EQUIPMENT AND MOVE FORWARD WITH PAYMENT OF VENDOR INVOICES.
4. PLAN FOR TIMELY SET-UP AND INSTALLATION OF EQUIPMENT, CONSISTENT WITH THE GOAL OF ENHANCING AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES THROUGHOUT TRIBAL LANDS.
5. SUBMIT SEMI-ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS TO EPA. THE SCHEDULE FOR SUBMISSION OF SEMI-ANNUAL REPORTS WILL BE ESTABLISHED BY EPA, AFTER THE GRANT IS AWARDED.
6. SUBMIT A FINAL PROGRESS REPORT TO EPA WITHIN 120 CALENDAR DAYS OF THE COMPLETION OF THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE:

A SUCCESSION PLAN TO TRANSFER THE KNOWLEDGE GAINED TO ANOTHER INDIVIDUAL IS MUCH NEEDED TO PRESERVE AND MAINTAIN OUR AIR MONITORING EFFORTS; HIRE ONE ADDITIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL SPECIALIST TO FOCUS ON OUR AIR MONITORING EFFORTS.
TRAINING THAT INCLUDES ATTENDING AN ACCREDITED AIR MONITORING COURSE; ENVIRONMENTAL SPECIALIST ATTENDING A WEEKLONG AIR MONITORING COURSE IN ARIZONA.
TRAINING THAT INCLUDES ONE-ON-ONE JOB SHADOWING WITH THE TRIBE'S VETERAN AIR MONITORING SPECIALIST OVER A TIME FRAME OF TWELVE WEEKS; ENVIRONMENTAL SPECIALIST COMPLETES 12 WEEKS OF ON-THE-JOB TRAINING.
DEVELOPMENT OF PERFORMANCE REPORTS AND SUBMISSION TO EPA; SUBMIT TO EPA MID-YEAR, END-OF-YEAR, AND FINAL GRANT PERFORMANCE AND BUDGET STATUS SUMMARY REPORTS ON TIME, ACCORDING TO PUBLISHED GUIDANCE DOCUMENTS, OR AS OTHERWISE AGREED THROUGH WRITTEN COMMUNICATION.

TO PROMOTE THE COORDINATION AND ACCELERATION OF RESEARCH FOR PURPOSES OF EDUCATING AND MINIMIZING ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS IN THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY, NEW EQUIPMENT IS NEEDED TO STAY UP TO DATE WITH RESEARCH TRENDS; UPGRADING TO A POLLEN SENSE POLLEN MONITOR WHICH UTILIZES AI TO IDENTIFY POLLEN SPECIES WILL PROVIDE MUCH MORE ACCURATE INFORMATION. 
THE ABSENCE OF AN ANEMOMETER WITH WEATHERVANE HAS CREATED A GAP IN THE TRIBE'S DATA COLLECTION; REPLACE BROKEN ANEMOMETER WITH A NEW ONE. THE IMPORTANCE OF REAL TIME, CONTINUING DATA IS NOT ONLY IMPORTANT TO THE MI'KMAQ NATION BUT THOSE PARTNERS THAT ALSO RELY ON THE INFORMATION WE PROVIDE SUCH AS OUR LOCAL NEWS CHANNEL AND MAINE DEP.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) TO PENOBSCOT INDIAN NATION.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO EXPAND UPON CURRENT AIR MONITORING IN ORDER TO SAMPLE FOR HAZARDOUS AIR TOXICS. THE TRIBE WILL BE SAMPLING FOR 67 AIR TOXICS THAT WILL INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO BENZENE, CARBON DISULFIDE AND ETHYL ACETATE. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL BE MONITORING FOR HAZARDOUS AIR TOXICS ON THE PENOBSCOT INDIAN NATION RESERVATION TO INVESTIGATE ANY ELEVATED LEVELS OF TOXICS.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDES: 1)MONITORING FOR HAZARDOUS AIR TOXICS 2) CONDUCTING SAMPLING FOR HAZARDOUS AIR TOXICS; 3) TRAINING ADDITIONAL STAFF PERSON TO ADVANCE THE KNOWLEDGE OF AIR POLLUTION SOURCES; 4) WORKING WITH A CONTRACTOR TO ANALYZE FINDINGS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE MONITORING FOR HAZARDOUS AIR TOXICS, DEVELOPMENT OR UPDATING OF POLLUTION SOURCE INFORMATION AND/OR EMISSIONS INVENTORIES INCLUDING GREEN HOUSE GAS INVENTORIES. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVED DECISION-MAKING BASED ON INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF POLLUTION SOURCES AND EMISSIONS INVENTORIES AND IMPROVED DECISION MAKING BASED ON BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE ROLE OF CONTROL TECHNOLOGIES IN GREENHOUSE GASES IN LOCALIZED POLLUTION AND HEALTH IMPACTS. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF PENOBSCOT INDIAN NATION.

FUNDING IS PROVIDED TO THE VERMONT STATE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION TO MAINTAIN AND OPERATE SPECIAL AIR TOXICS MONITORING THAT ARE PART OF EPA'S NATIONAL TRENDS NETWORK THAT COLLECTS AND ANALYZES VARIOUS TOXIC POLLUTANTS IN THE ATMOSPHERE AT VARIOUS LOCATIONS WITHIN VERMONT.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES CONTINUED ASSISTANCE TO THE VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION TO OPERATE AND MAINTAIN ITS AIR QUALITY MONITORING NETWORK AND TO MEASURE THE LEVELS OF VERY FINE PARTICULATE MATTER. THIS WORK WILL INVOLVE AIR QUALITY SAMPLING AND GENERATION OF REPRESENTATIVE AIR QUALITY DATA.

FUNDING IS PROVIDED TO THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT TO CHARACTERIZE LEVELS OF VOLATILE ORGANIC AIR TOXIC COMPOUNDS IN THE VICINITY OF SCHOOLS, HOSPITALS, RESIDENCES AND RECREATIONAL FACILITIES LOCATED ADJACENT TO THE PORT OF PROVIDENCE AS PART OF A COMPREHENSIVE STUDY OF AIR POLLUTION IN THE PORT AREA. AIR QUALITY NEAR THE PORT IS IMPACTED BY AIR POLLUTION GENERATED FROM DIESEL TRUCKS, MARINE VESSELS, OIL AND GAS STORAGE AND DISTRIBUTION, ASPHALT AND CEMENT PROCESSING, METALS RECYCLING, NATURAL GAS AND UTILITY SERVICE, AND LARGE HEATING PLANTS.

FUNDING IS PROVIDED TO THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT TO MAINTAIN AND OPERATE SPECIAL AIR TOXICS MONITORING THAT ARE PART OF EPA'S NATIONAL TRENDS NETWORK THAT COLLECTS AND ANALYZES VARIOUS TOXIC POLLUTANTS IN THE ATMOSPHERE AT VARIOUS LOCATIONS WITHIN RHODE ISLAND.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES CONTINUED ASSISTANCE TO THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT TO OPERATE AND MAINTAIN ITS AIR QUALITY MONITORING NETWORK AND TO MEASURE THE LEVELS OF VERY FINE PARTICULATE MATTER. THIS WORK WILL INVOLVE AIR QUALITY SAMPLING AND GENERATION OF REPRESENTATIVE AIR QUALITY DATA.

NORTHEAST STATES FOR COORDINATED AIR USE MANAGEMENT (NESCAUM) WILL WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH ITS CONSTITUENT MEMBER STATES (CT, MA, ME, NH, NJ, NY, RI, VT) ON AIR QUALITY CONTROL AND MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES. NESCAUM WILL CONDUCT TECHNICAL STUDIES, DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS, EXCHANGE OF INFORMATION, OUTREACH, AND AIR QUALITY TRAINING PROGRAMS FOR ITS MEMBER STATES TO MORE EFFICIENTLY PERFORM THEIR PRIMARY DUTIES IMPLEMENTING THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE CLEAN AIR ACT. THESE TECHNICAL AND PROGRAM EFFORTS ARE DESIGNED TO ASSIST THE MEMBER STATES IN ADDRESSING ONGOING AND EMERGING TECHNICAL AND POLICY ISSUES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 AND/OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARD (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS ON TRIBAL LANDS OF MI'KMAQ NATION, A COMMUNITY WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS THAT FACES DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.

ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL PRIMARILY BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THIS COMMUNITY TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS. 

AS A RECIPIENT OF THIS EPA GRANT, MI'KMAQ NATION WILL:

REVIEW AND COMPARE EPA PROPOSED EQUIPMENT FOR PURCHASE AND DETERMINE IF ANY ADJUSTMENTS NEED TO BE MADE ON ENHANCEMENTS AT VARIOUS AIR MONITORING SITES BASED ON CURRENT NEEDS. 

PREPARE AND INITIATE PROCUREMENT REQUEST(S) FOR EQUIPMENT PURCHASE(S).

PURCHASE EQUIPMENT.

TAKE DELIVERY OF EQUIPMENT UPON VERIFICATION OF FUNCTIONALITY OF EQUIPMENT AND MOVE FORWARD WITH PAYMENT OF VENDOR INVOICES.

PLAN FOR TIMELY SET-UP AND INSTALLATION OF EQUIPMENT CONSISTENT WITH THE GOAL OF ENHANCING AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOME WILL BE REDUCED INCIDENCES OF RESPIRATORY ILLNESSES INCLUDING ASTHMA AND LUNG CANCER AND IMPROVED VISIBILITY IN AND NEAR THE MI'KMAQ NATION.

OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE TRIBAL MEMBERS AND AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL BE INSTALLING A BAM 1020 TO MEASURE AND MONITOR PM2.5, AND CONDUCT AQM STATION SHELTER REPAIRS.

THIS WORK WILL INVOLVE AIR QUALITY SAMPLING AND GENERATION OF REPRESENTATIVE AIR QUALITY DATA.

THIS WORK WILL INVOLVE AIR QUALITY SAMPLING AND GENERATION OF REPRESENTATIVE AIR QUALITY DATA.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE ENHANCED MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5) OR OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WHO FACE DISPROPORTIONATE EXPOSURE TO THESE POLLUTANTS AND HEALTH RISKS WHICH ARE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED VULNERABILITY TO COVID-19.   ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO REPLACE EXISTING FILTER-BASED MONITORS OR OTHERWISE ENHANCE EXISTING MONITORS IN AND NEAR THOSE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE 24/7, REAL-TIME REPORTING OF AIR QUALITY CONCENTRATIONS. THE NEW OZONE MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES WITH OZONE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS.  THE NEW OZONE MONITORS WILL HELP CT DEEP MEET CURRENT AND FUTURE PERFORMANCE OR COMPLETENESS GOALS FOR OZONE MONITORING. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL: REVIEW AND COMPARE EPA PROPOSED EQUIPMENT FOR PURCHASE AND DETERMINE IF ANY ADJUSTMENTS NEED TO BE MADE ON ENHANCEMENTS AT VARIOUS AIR MONITORING SITES BASED ON CURRENT NEEDS; CONSULT WITH EPA ABOUT PROPOSED CHANGES/UPDATES; PREPARE AND INITIATE PROCUREMENT REQUEST(S) FOR EQUIPMENT PURCHASE(S); PURCHASE EQUIPMENT; TAKE DELIVERY OF EQUIPMENT UPON VERIFICATION OF FUNCTIONALITY OF EQUIPMENT AND MOVE FORWARD WITH PAYMENT OF VENDOR INVOICES; PLAN FOR TIMELY SET-UP AND INSTALLATION OF EQUIPMENT CONSISTENT WITH THE GOAL OF ENHANCING AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES IN AND NEAR ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE/OVERBURDENED COMMUNITIES.  

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASING CONTINUOUS PM2.5 MONITOR(S) TO REPLACE FILTER-BASED PM2.5 MONITOR(S). EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF FULL AUTOMATION OF PM2.5 MONITORS WILL PROVIDE ALL COMMUNITIES WITH FINE PARTICULATE DATA OF THE SAME QUALITY AND ALLOW THEM TO COMPARE CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS IN NEARBY AREAS. OPERATION OF PM2.5 OR OTHER NAAQS POLLUTANTS AIR MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL EPA REQUIREMENTS LEADING TO COLLECTION OF QUALITY ASSURED AMBIENT AIR QUALITY DATA TO HELP ENSURE THAT MORE AMERICANS ARE LIVING AND WORKING IN AREAS THAT MEET HIGH AIR QUALITY STANDARDS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS, INCLUDING CANCER AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.
